Aarakocra.name: Aarakocra
Aarakocra.description: The creature is a humanoid with large feathery wings on its back and a head that resembles that of an eagle, with black eyes and a large beak. It stands about 5 feet tall and has a wingspan of 20 feet. It's arms extend from the shoulders, and each ends in a hand with three human-sized fingers and an opposable thumb. It's powerful legs end in four sharp talons. Plumage color varies, but males generally have red, orange, and yellow coloration, while females tend towards brown and gray.

items.name: Aarakocra Feathers (small pouch)
items.description: Large ostentatious feathers of the Aarakocra, used in various items of clothing and accessories. Fletchers also use the feathers for making arrows.

items.name: Aarakocra Beak
items.description: The hardened beak of an Aarakocra can be used to make various tools.

Aartuk Elder.name: Aartuk Elder
Aartuk Elder.description: A large plant-like creature, with a body shaped like a five-pointed star (12 feet in diameter).  Its body is covered with thick, flexible bark, often covered in spikes. Its head, located at the center of the "star" has a long tongue that it uses as a weapon. Aartuks are typically found in the Astral Plane.

items.name: Aartuk Sap (3 vials)
items.description: Aartuk sap is an extremely thick, reddish brown fluid that smells of fresh cut grass. Adept farmers can use the sap to create a rich fertilizer.

items.name: Aartuk Bark
items.description: Aartuk bark is the hard, outer covering of the creature. The bark can be removed in small plates, which can then be crafted into wooden armor.

items.name: Aartuk Tongue
items.description: An aartuk's tongue is a long, rough, spongy slab of flesh. The tongue can be dried out, stretched, treated and used to make rope or whips.

items.name: Aartuk Pearl
items.description: Aartuk's produce pellets of radiant energy that they can spit at their enemies. These pellets are produced in a fleshy sac in its torso. While rare, grains inside this sac can form a large white radiant pearl, about 2 inches in diameter.

Aartuk Priest.name: Aartuk Priest
Aartuk Priest.description: A medium-sized plant-like creature, with a body shaped like a five-pointed star.  Its body is covered with thick, flexible bark, often covered in spikes. Its head, located at the center of the "star" has a long tongue that it uses as a weapon. Aartuks are typically found in the Astral Plane.

items.name: Aartuk Sap (3 vials)
items.description: Aartuk sap is an extremely thick, reddish brown fluid that smells of fresh cut grass. Adept farmers can use the sap to create a rich fertilizer.

items.name: Aartuk Bark
items.description: Aartuk bark is the hard, outer covering of the creature. The bark can be removed in small plates, which can then be crafted into wooden armor.

items.name: Aartuk Tongue
items.description: An aartuk's tongue is a long, rough, spongy slab of flesh. The tongue can be dried out, stretched, treated and used to make rope or whips.

items.name: Aartuk Stone
items.description: Aartuk's produce pellets of radiant energy that they can spit at their enemies. These pellets are produced in a fleshy sac in its torso. While rare, grains inside this sack can form a finely polished stone, about 1 inch in diameter.  In Aartuk Elders, these stones can become large pearls.

Aartuk Warrior.name: Aartuk Warrior
Aartuk Warrior.description: A medium-sized plant-like creature, with a body shaped like a five-pointed star.  Its body is covered with thick, flexible bark, often covered in spikes. Its head, located at the center of the "star" has a long tongue that it uses as a weapon. Aartuks are typically found in the Astral Plane.

items.name: Aartuk Sap (3 vials)
items.description: Aartuk sap is an extremely thick, reddish brown fluid that smells of fresh cut grass. Adept farmers can use the sap to create a rich fertilizer.

items.name: Aartuk Bark
items.description: Aartuk bark is the hard, outer covering of the creature. The bark can be removed in small plates, which can then be crafted into wooden armor.

items.name: Aartuk Tongue
items.description: An aartuk's tongue is a long, rough, spongy slab of flesh. The tongue can be dried out, stretched, treated and used to make rope or whips.

Aboleth.name: Aboleth
Aboleth.description: A bizarre, eel-like creature with a round, lamprey-like mouth full of razor sharp teeth. Its has an oval head with three eyes, one atop another, and several small tentacles at it's base. The tubular body extends downward about 20 feet, splitting into several finned tails.

items.name: Aboleth Teeth (large bag)
items.description: Aboleth's teeth can be used to craft exotic weapons, decorations and trinkets.

items.name: Aboleth Mucus (3 vials)
items.description: Aboleths mucus can be quickly harvested for use in various alchemy concoctions.

items.name: Aboleth Eye
items.description: The large orb is valued by scholars and magic users, especially from the school of divination.

items.name: Aboleth Brain
items.description: The aboleth's brain is prized by both alchemists and magic users.

items.name: Raw Dragon Meat
items.description:
Dragon meat is a delicacy and is considered one of the finest meats you can eat. The meat spoils fast, but gourmet chefs will pay dearly for the meat.

Dragon Jerky: If the meat is dried and smoked, an adult dragon can yield about [[/r 4d6]] days worth of dragon jerky. Dragon jerky is extremely filling, and a days worth weighs only a quarter of a regular ration (0.5 lbs.). It costs 2gp per ration.

items.name: Adult Dragon Blood (7 vials)
items.description: Dragon blood is a valued commodity, used by spellcasters, alchemists and others. It can be used as a spell reagent and an ingredient for potions.

items.name: Adult Dragon Tooth (10x)
items.description: An adult dragon's tooth can reach over 2 feet in length. They are long, conical and have a serrated edge. A dragon's tooth has a degree of elemental protection, after years of constant exposure to the dragon's breath. The tooth can be used to make weapons, crafts and are prized trophies.

items.name: Adult Dragon Bone (x6)
items.description: Dragon bones are infused with arcane and elemental magic, and tend to get harder as the dragon ages. Armorers and weaponsmiths that know how to work dragon bone tend to be masters of their craft.

items.name: Adult Type Dragon Horn
items.description:
Harvested from: Black, Blue, Red, Bronze, Copper, and Gold Dragons

Depending on the type of dragon, a horn or a prominent protrusion may adorn their head. These horns often retain a piece of the dragon's power, and make wonderful conduits for arcane magic. The horns make great trophies and can be crafted into various instruments and items, which tend to absorb magic enchantments fairly easily. Magic users create staves using the horns, as they make a perfect arcane focus.

items.name: Adult Type Dragon Breath Pouch
items.description:
The dragon's breath weapon is caused by two glands secreting a mix of chemicals together as the dragon exhales. The two glands are wrapped together in a thin membrane or pouch, which can be harvested if careful. Alchemists prize the membrane for the unique mix of chemicals it contains. Magic users prize it for the magic it holds. Artificers prize it for what they can make from it.

Use: The membrane may be thrown up to 20 feet and the pouch explodes upon impact. Any creature within 15 feet of impact must roll a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or suffer 20 ([[/r 5d8]]) damage (damage type depends on the dragon the membrane was harvested from).

items.name: Adult Type Dragon Scales
items.description: A dragon's scales are hard as steel. The scales are difficult to manipulate and fashion, but an expert armorer may be able to create an amazing piece of armor.

items.name: Adult Type Dragon Wing (x2)
items.description: The large wings of a dragon are prized for their leather, which still retains some of the dragon's magical essence.

Adult Kruthik.name: Adult Kruthik
Adult Kruthik.description: The kruthik vaguely resembles a repilian canine, with insect-like features. Its body is covered in plates of thick, purple chitin, with bristles of thick hair growing in patches. It has six limbs composed of bone, chitin, and steely scales; all ending in long scythes that can hew through stone. Its reptilian head has two black beady eyes and a large mouth filled with sharp teeth, and flanked by serrated mandibles.

items.name: Kruthik Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Kruthik blood is a warm, red fluid. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in potions and elixirs.

items.name: Kruthik Leg (x6)
items.description: A kruthik's leg is composed of bone, chitin, and steely scales; all ending in long scythes. The scythes are extremely sharp and can dig through stone. The creature's scythes can be used to make sharp weapons.

Adult Oblex.name: Adult Oblex
Adult Oblex.description: A pool of gelatinous ooze, smelling of sulfur, typically swimming with the remains of other creatures. Adult oblexes can form duplicates of the creatures they have devoured, sending these copies off to lure prey into their clutches while remaining tethered to the slime by long tendrils of goo.

items.name: Oblex Ooze (3x vials)
items.description: The gelatinous form of an oblex smells of sulfur. Before the ooze disperses and evaporates, it is possible to collect a sample. The ooze has many transformative properties, and is an ingredient in some polymorph potions. Some craftsmen use the ooze to create acidic baths, to dispose of trash and wasted materials.

Air Elemental.name: Air Elemental
Air Elemental.description: The creature is an amorphous, ever-shifting cloud of air.

items.name: Elemental Air Essence (vial)
items.description:
An air elemental can stir up dust and debris that carry trace amounts of the elementals energy. It is possible to harness this energy using an enchanted bottle to collect the air elementals essence. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the air elemental disperses over 20 feet above the ground (spreading its essence into a wider area, making it more difficult to find).

Air Elemental Myrmidon.name: Air Elemental Myrmidon
Air Elemental Myrmidon.description: An air elemental, composed of swirling gusts of air and wind, bound by magic into a ritually created suit of plate armor.

items.name: Elemental Air Essence (vial)
items.description:
An air elemental myrmidon can stir up dust and debris that carry trace amounts of the elementals energy. It is possible to harness this energy using an enchanted bottle to collect the air elemental's essence. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the air elemental disperses over 20 feet above the ground (spreading its essence into a wider area, making it more difficult to find).

items.name: Myymidon Armor Plates
items.description: The magical armor that binds the elemental Mymidon may be salvageable and retain some of its arcane power. These magically infused plates can sold to blacksmiths for the soft glowing metal. Alternatively, spellcasters, especially conjurers and elemental wizards, seek the plates for the residual binding magic.

Alhoon.name: Alhoon
Alhoon.description: The alien-like humanoid has rubbery, leprous skin with a pale, greenish-violet color. Its large, bald, octopus-like head has two milky white eyes and four tentacles snaking from down from where it's nose should be. It excretes a thin film of slimy, glistening mucus and gives off a faint onion and garlic odor. It wears a long robe, and has thin, lengthy fingers ending in sharp talons.

items.name: Alhoon Skin
items.description: The necrotic, leprous skin of an alhoon has various arcane and alchemical properties. The skin is difficult to harvest, as it breaks apart quickly. However, if large enough patches can be collected, they can be dried and mashed into dust, which can be used in various potions and magical incantations.

items.name: Alhoon Tentacle (x4)
items.description: The flesh inside an alhoon's tentacles has long ago withered and rotted away, leaving behind a hollow shell. Without the alhoon's arcane power, the tentacles become rigid husks. The hard, dry tentacles must be harvested carefully, or they turn to dust. The husks can be ground down and used by alchemists, spellcasters and those studying lichdom.

items.name: Alhoon Ichor (vial)
items.description: The heart of an alhoon secretes a vile black ichor. The heart doesn't need to be harvested, but a sample of the ichor can be harvested before it dispersing into a misty vapor. The ichor is valued by necromancers, but can also be researched by other spellcasters and used in potions.

items.name: Alhoon Brain
items.description: An illithid's brain is larger than a human brain, and contains many more ridges. An alhoon's brain is grey and secretes a clear black fluid, for several days after the alhoon's death. The brain of all illithids are prized by the arcane community, and the fluid is highly valued with alchemists, healers and witches.

Alkilith.name: Alkilith
Alkilith.description: An alkilith resembles a dark fungel growth, usually growing around windows and archways.

items.name: Alkilith Mold (vial)
items.description: A creeping gray mold can often be found growing on the dark fungal-like skin of an Alkilith. This mold can be used for healing or harm. Alchemists can create either poisons or healing salves from the mold.

items.name: Alkilith Nerve Cluster (vial)
items.description: Inside the amorphous form of an Alkilith is a bundle of nerves that resonates with arcane power (and some say, reach into other planes). These nerves are valued by conjurers and any spellcaster interested in portals and travel. Requires a container of some kind, such as a flask, bottle or jug.

Allip.name: Allip
Allip.description: The creature is a spectral form and appears as a swirling dark mist, with a vague human form.

items.name: Allip Dust
items.description: When an allip is killed, its form disperses into a fine mist, often scattering tiny motes of dust. The dust is difficult to see, but resonates with dark necrotic energy. Spellcasters, especially necromancers, can use the dust in spells and rituals. The dust is also a useful alchemical ingredient.

Allosaurus.name: Allosaurus
Allosaurus.description: The creature looks like a relative to the T-Rex, standing on its hind legs, with a small torso and small arms. It is just under 30 feet in length. It has sharp teeth and hook-shaped claws. Allosaurus is derived from the Greek allos ("different" or "other") and sauros ("lizard").

items.name: Allosaurus Teeth
items.description: An Allosaurs teeth are up to 3 inches long and serrated like steak knives for cutting flesh. Sometimes used for small tools and crafting, the teeth can also be used to line blades and decorate hilts.

items.name: Allosaurus Claws
items.description: An allosaurs claws are hooked, allowing the beast to grab and pull prey into their mouth. The hooked claws average around 7 inches long. The claws can be used for crafts and decoration, but also for curved daggers.

items.name: Allosaurus Skin
items.description: The skin of an allosaurus is a large reptilian hide. The skin is highly durable, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, and furniture.

Alpha Grick.name: Alpha Grick
Alpha Grick.description: The wormlike creature ends in a head with a tiny pair of eyes and four barbed tentacles unfurling to reveal a hungry, snapping beak. The main body is about 6 feet long, 8 feet with the tentacles.

items.name: Grick Tentacle (x4)
items.description: The grick has 4 thick, rubbery tentacles with sharp barbs near the end. Some Underdark societies hunt gricks for the tentacle meat. When cooked, its texture resembles large calamari, but the meat is much oilier with a sharp acidic taste. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips.

items.name: Grick Skin
items.description: A grick has a thick, snake-like skin. The skin can be used to create all kinds of aparrel and accessories.

items.name: Grick Pearl
items.description: Larger, older and bigger gricks sometimes swallow the jewelry and gems of their prey. In some cases, these items get caught in a gricks digestive system. Over time, the gricks natural enzymes coat the item, which hardens. This process happens over-and-over again, layer-after-layer. In rare cases, a shiny pink pearl forms.

Amnizu.name: Amnizu
Amnizu.description: Amnizus are green, gruesome humanoids with short, squat bodies and stubby limbs. They are usually 4‒5 feet tall and weigh around 200 lbs., although older amnizu can grow past 10 ft and can weigh over 700 lbs. Sprouting from their backs are a pair of large, leathery wings. Their bald heads host porcine eyes, a pug-nose, and a mouth full of jagged teeth. Amnizus often dress in the opulent robes, signifying their rank and office.

items.name: Amnuzi Ash (3 small pouches)
items.description: Once an Amnizu is defeated, it combusts and often leaves behind a pile of ash. The dark gray ash smells of sulfur. Spellcasters can use the ash to summon lesser demons. Artificers and alchemists may be able to craft explosive substances with the ash.

items.name: Raw Dragon Meat
items.description:
Dragon meat is a delicacy and is considered one of the finest meats you can eat. The meat spoils fast, but gourmet chefs will pay dearly for the meat.

Dragon Jerky: If the meat is dried and smoked, an ancient dragon can yield about [[/r 10d6]] days worth of dragon jerky. Dragon jerky is extremely filling, and a days worth weighs only a quarter of a regular ration (0.5 lbs.). It costs 2gp per ration.

items.name: Ancient Dragon Blood (9 vials)
items.description: Dragon blood is a valued commodity, used by spellcasters, alchemists and others. It can be used as a spell reagent and an ingredient for potions.

items.name: Ancient Dragon Tooth (15x)
items.description: An ancient dragon's tooth can range from 2 to 3 feet in length. They are long, conical and have a serrated edge. A dragon's tooth has a degree of elemental protection, after years of constant exposure to the dragon's breath. The tooth can be used to make weapons, crafts and are prized trophies.

items.name: Ancient Dragon Bone (x6)
items.description: Dragon bones are infused with arcane and elemental magic, and tend to get harder as the dragon ages. Armorers and weaponsmiths that know how to work dragon bone tend to be masters of their craft.

items.name: Ancient Type Dragon Horn
items.description:
Harvested from: Black, Blue, Red, Bronze, Copper, and Gold Dragons

Depending on the type of dragon, a horn or a prominent protrusion may adorn their head. These horns often retain a piece of the dragon's power, and make wonderful conduits for arcane magic. The horns make great trophies and can be crafted into various instruments and items, which tend to absorb magic enchantments fairly easily. Magic users create staves using the horns, as they make a perfect arcane focus.

items.name: Ancient Type Dragon Breath Pouch
items.description:
The dragon's breath weapon is caused by two glands secreting a mix of chemicals together as the dragon exhales. The two glands are wrapped together in a thin membrane or pouch, which can be harvested if careful. Alchemists prize the membrane for the unique mix of chemicals it contains. Magic users prize it for the magic it holds. Artificers prize it for what they can make from it.

Use: The ancient dragons membrane may be thrown up to 20 feet and the pouch explodes upon impact. Any creature within 15 feet of impact must roll a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or suffer 24 ([[/r 6d8]]) damage (damage type depends on the dragon the membrane was harvested from).

items.name: Ancient Type Dragon Scales
items.description: A dragon's scales are hard as steel. The scales are difficult to manipulate and fashion, but an expert armorer may be able to create an amazing piece of armor.

items.name: Ancient Type Dragon Wing (x2)
items.description: The large wings of a dragon are prized for their leather, which still retains some of the dragon's magical essence.

items.name: Ancient Type Dragon Heart
items.description: The dragons heart holds a great deal of power, but only retains that power for a short time. Although rare, some magic users may be able to capture that power, transforming the heart into an arcane relic.

Ancient Sea Serpent.name: Ancient Sea Serpent
Ancient Sea Serpent.description: Ancient sea serpents are gargantuan sea creatures characterized by long serpentine bodies with strong, webbed fins that propel them through water at an impressive speed.

items.name: Sea Serpent Blood (9 vials)
items.description: A sea serpent's blood is reddish-purple, and smells like salt water. The blood has some alchemical properties, but is often used to flavor certain seafood dishes.

items.name: Ancient Sea Serpent Scales (3 sacks)
items.description: An ancient sea serpent's scales are thick yet flexible, with a slightly metallic shine. The scales can be used to make armor, apparel and jewelry.

items.name: Ancient Sea Serpent Teeth (2 sacks)
items.description: An ancient sea serpent has rows of sharp, shark-like teeth. The teeth can be carved into jewelry, but can also be made into weapons. A sack of ancient sea serpent teeth contains [[/r 2d20]]+30 teeth. Most of the teeth are about a foot long, with two large fangs about 3 feet long.

items.name: Sea Serpent Fins (x10)
items.description: The fins of a young sea serpent have a variety of uses. Expert leatherworkers can create waterproof tarps, sails and clothing from the large fins. The fins are also used as an ingredient in various dishes, especially in oceanside villages and sea communities. The fins are also coated in a waxy substance that alchemists can use in potions and elixirs.

items.name: Sea Serpent Blubber (x8)
items.description: Similar to whales, sea serpent blubber has value. The blubber requires cutting out long strips of fat from the creature's belly. Failure occurs when the strips are cut too thin, or the fat is spoiled by hitting a major artery or organ. Sea serpent blubber is primarily used to make oil and soap by boiling the fat for several hours. Alchemists and healers often use the fat in various concoctions as well.

Androsphinx.name: Androsphinx
Androsphinx.description: The creature has the body of a muscular lion with a luscious mane of hair, and a face that resembles a humanoid male more than a lion. It has two large wings on its back.

items.name: Sphinx Claws (large pouch)
items.description: The claws of a sphinx resemble the claws of a lion, but are larger and infused with arcane energy. Spellcasters can tap into the claws arcane power, using that power in rituals or spells.

items.name: Sphinx Mane/Hair (large pouch)
items.description: A sphinx often has a lush main of hair, similar to that of a lions. It is composed of soft, long strands that shimmer in the light, and are often braided and decorated with jewelry. The hair is valued among weavers and tailors. Spellcasters may be able to harness the hair's arcane energy when creating robes and hats.

items.name: Sphinx Feathers (large pouch)
items.description: A sphinx has two large wings with light, soft feathers. The feathers are infused with ancient arcane energy, allowing them to carry a large amount of weight. The feathers can be used in mundane items, like apparel and bedding, but hold more value with spellcasters and artificers.

items.name: Sphinx Hide
items.description: A sphinx has a soft hide of short fur (usually golden in color). The beautiful hide swirls with protective magic, and is valued among leatherworkers, tailors and spellcasters.

items.name: Sphinx Roar
items.description: Once a sphinx falls, the creature's roar still reverberates in the air as an aura of arcane energy. A spellcasters can perform a quick ritual to contain this roar to be used in spells and magical creations. Requires an enchanted flask/vial.

Angry Sorrowsworn.name: Angry Sorrowsworn
Angry Sorrowsworn.description: Angry sorrowsworn are humanoid monstrosities with ashen gray skin, hooks for hands, and two heads that are constantly bickering with each other.

items.name: Sorrowsworn Saliva (vial)
items.description: The saliva of sorrowsworn is a thick, sticky, transparent fluid. The saliva is believed to be an ingredient in elixirs that treat depression. It is also studied by anyone interested in the Shadowfell.

items.name: Angry Sorrowsworn Hooks
items.description: Angry sorrowsworn have bone hooks instead of hands. These hooks are as strong as steel, and highly valued amongst craftsmen. Others file the hooks down, and use the dust for potions and spells.

Animated Armor.name: Animated Armor
Animated Armor.description: A suit of armor that appears to move on its own, walking on shaking armored legs. No skin or flesh can be seen between the armors plates.

items.name: Animated Sigil Material
items.description: Magical dust, ash and powder, the salvaged remains of a magical rune, often used to animate certain constructs.

Animated Breath.name: Animated Breath
Animated Breath.description: An animated breath is a bipedal creature formed from the same energy as the breath weapon of the dragon that created it.

items.name: Dragon Breath (vial)
items.description: When an animated breath is slain, its form disperses. If quick, it may be possible to collect some of this energy before it fades. Requires an enchanted vial.

Ankheg.name: Ankheg
Ankheg.description: An ankheg resembles an enormous many-legged insect, its long antennae twitching in response to any movement around it. Its legs end in sharp hooks adapted for burrowing and grasping its prey, and its powerful mandibles can snap a small tree in half.

items.name: Ankheg Chitin
items.description: Hard and thick sheets of chitin, often used to make armor.

items.name: Ankheg Stomach
items.description: The thick walls of an Ankheg's stomach can be used by magic users to create hardy bags, sacks and pouches.

items.name: Ankheg Bile (2 vials)
items.description: Alchemists use ankheg bile to create various acidic concoctions.Use: As an action, you can splash the contents of the vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a target creature, treating the vial as an Improvised Weapon. On a successful hit, the target takes [[/r 1d6]] acid damage.

Ankylosaurus.name: Ankylosaurus
Ankylosaurus.description: The large creature is a quadrupedal giant reptile. Its skin is adorned with a thick coating of spikes, bony plates, and fused bone. The head has plentiful spikes, as well as a beak at the tip of the mouth and enlarged nasals. It is relatively low to the ground with short legs and a low head. It wields a wicked mace-like club on the end of its muscular tail. The only region not covered with body armor is the belly.

items.name: Ankylosaurus Plates
items.description: An ankylosaurus is covered in thick bony plates, spikes and fused bone. These plates can be harvested to create shields and armor.

items.name: Ankylosaurus Mace-like Tail
items.description: The end of an ankylosaurs tail is a thick "club" of bone. This mace-like club can be harvested and used to create various bludgeoning weapons. Alternatively, the bone can be used for various crafts, sculptures and decorations.

items.name: Ankylosaurus Skull
items.description: An Ankylosaurs head has plentiful spikes, as well as a beak at the tip of the mouth and enlarged nasals. The skull makes a fantastic trophy, but can also be fashioned into a helm by a skilled armorsmith.

Annis Hag.name: Annis Hag
Annis Hag.description: This hag defies the stereotype of a withered crone and stands over 7 feet tall and is covered in muscles. She is hunchbacked and hump-shouldered, and her stretched skin is covered in scars and blemishes. She has a blue-black complexion as if her flesh has been deeply bruise. Her 3-inch long nails are actually made of magically grown iron. She also has sharpened metal teeth, and filthy hair with a similar luster. Above her dull, greenish-yellow eyes are a small pair of black, upward-arching horns barely longer than a human thumb.

items.name: Annis Hag's Hair (small pouch)
items.description: An annis hag has a tangled mane of dark hair with a metallic sheen. Due to the hag's abilities, the hair retains trace amounts of magic. Alchemists may find the hair useful in certain potions.

items.name: Annis Hag's Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A hag's blood is a black, viscous fluid that smells like decaying matter. The blood has arcane properties that can be harnessed by certain spellcasters and alchemists.

items.name: Annis Hag's Nails (pouch)
items.description: The nails of an annis hag are sharp as blades, made of iron that magically grew like the keratin. After years of wielding magic, the nails become a conduit for the hag's power. They must be carefully extracted during a complex ritual in order to retain their usefulness. Alchemists, magic users and other hags find value in this item.

items.name: Annis Hag's Eyeball
items.description: Harvesting the hag's eyeball intact is a delicate task. The eye is useful to those that practice divination. It can also be used by alchemists.

Ape.name: Ape
Ape.description: An animal like a large monkey with no tail, having a muscular upper body, long arms and short legs. It has a dark coat of fur on most of its body, with dark exposed skin on its chest and underbelly, hands and feet.

items.name: Ape Hide
items.description: An adult ape's hide can provide an adequate source of dark leather. Once removed from the corpse, typically with a skinning knife, the hide ranges from 4-6 feet long.

Ape, Giant.name: Ape, Giant
Ape, Giant.description: An huge creature that looks like a large monkey with no tail. It has a muscular upper body, long arms and short legs. It has a dark coat of fur on most of its body, with dark exposed skin on its chest and underbelly, hands and feet.

items.name: Giant Ape Hide
items.description: A giant ape's hide can provide a good source of soft, black leather. Once removed from the corpse, typically with a skinning knife, the hide ranges from 8-10 feet long.

Arcanaloth.name: Arcanaloth
Arcanaloth.description: A sly-looking, jackal-headed being with a fur-covered humanoid body.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Arcanaloth Venom (vial)
items.description:
The claws of an arcanaloth are coated with a thin layer of venom. Some of this venom may be salvaged before it dries.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's venom. The venom must be refined before producing 1 dose of Arcanaloth Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's venom.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Arcanaloth Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Arcanaloth Poison (Injury): Arcanaloth Poison is the exact equivalent of Serpent Venom (DMG p258). The poison can coat up to 3 pieces of ammunition or 1 melee weapon for 1 minute. Applying the poison takes 1 action. Any creature successfully hit must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking [[/r 3d6]] poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Arcanaloth Hide
items.description: When in its true form, an arcanaloth has a well-groomed coat of soft fur (usually reddish-brown) covering its jackal-headed humanoid form. As an arcanaloth can take the shape of other humanoids, the fur is swirling with transformative arcane magic. Because the fur is so well taken care of, the hide is valued by most leatherworkers. Artificers may be able to capture the furs magical essence and use it to create unique items.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Armanite.name: Armanite
Armanite.description: The Armanite looks like a 10-foot tall centaur with ram or bull horns sticking out from its brows. Its tail is long, serrated, and covered in the same stiff bristles and spines that constitute its mane. Curved claws and spiked hooves make them all the more terrifying.

items.name: Armanite Blood (7 vials)
items.description: Armanite blood is a thick, dark red substance. Some alchemists and healers make use of the blood in potions.

items.name: Armanite Hoof (x2)
items.description: An Armanite's hooves are strong enough to mash stone to dust. A skilled weaponsmith may be able to use the hooved to create powerful bludgeoning weapons. The hooves are also used to create crafts and jewelry.

items.name: Armanite Horn (x2)
items.description: The horns of an armanite are strong as steel. Like most horns, they can be reshaped into musical instruments or large drinking horns. They can also be ground into a fine dust, which can be refined and used to strengthen weapons and armor.

items.name: Armanite Serrated Tail
items.description: An armanite has a whiplike tail that ends in a sharp serrated blade. Harvesting can be difficult, as the blade may crack when it is removed from the body. The tail can be used to create sharp weapons and tools.

Astral Blight.name: Astral Blight
Astral Blight.description: A vaguely humanoid-shaped mass of crystalline vines that shed a dim light (10 feet)

items.name: Blight Pollen (small pouch)
items.description: Astral blight's use their pollen to communicate with other blights and plants. As such, alchemists and druids often use the pollen for potions that aid in talking to plants.

items.name: Blight Seeds (x5)
items.description: These hard, dry, wrinkled seeds, about the size of a walnut, can often be found on dead blights. Once a seed is unnaturally plucked from a blight's body, the seed become sterile. Alchemists often use the seeds to create oils and potions. Some farmers can repurpose the seeds as a unique fertilizer.

Astral Dreadnought.name: Astral Dreadnought
Astral Dreadnought.description: The Astral dreadnought is a massive creature. It has a single, large eye above a large mouth filled with sharp teeth. Instead of hands, it has crab-like pincers, which are incredibly strong and lined with sharp, serrated edges. Its entire body is protected by a layer of strong, spiked armor plates, and the lower half of its body is serpentine.

items.name: Astral Dreadnought Plates (x6)
items.description: An Astral Dreadnought is covered in thick, spiked plates. These large plates can be harvested to create shields and armor.

items.name: Astral Dreadnought Tooth (x10)
items.description: The sharp teeth of an Astral Dreadnought are several feet long. They are covered in a steel-hard enamel. The teeth are valued by weaponsmiths and collectors.

items.name: Astral Dreadnought Horns (4)
items.description: An Astral Dreadnought's head is covered in many hard, bone-like protrusions. These large bones are difficult to harvest, considering their size. Cutting into the bone is difficult, and can fracture the item, making it useless. Expert craftsmen can carve the horns down into many shapes and sizes, including weapons and armor.

items.name: Astral Dreadnought Eye
items.description: The single eye of an Astral Dreadnought is a dark orb, with depths that swirl with bright constellations. The eye is believed to hold the secrets tied to multidimensional travel and teleportaion, and is often sought by mighty spellcasters. Alchemists can extract liquids from the eye for potions and elixirs.

items.name: Astral Dreadnought Stomach Lining
items.description: The stomach lining of an Astral Dreadnought is lined with nerve endings radiating with arcane magic, and is believed to allow for teleportation. Alchemists can extract arcane fluids from this item for potions and elixirs. Spellcasters may be able to craft a shroud, aiding in teleportation to other planes.

Auroch.name: Auroch
Auroch.description: A large, fierce bovine with jutting horns.

items.name: Auroch Horns (x2)
items.description: An auroch's horns can be used to create weapon handles, simple tools (hoes, rakes,etc.), decorations, and to craft jewelry.

items.name: Auroch Hide
items.description: An auroch's hide can be crafted into soft, supple leather, which is used to create armor and apparel.

Autognome.name: Autognome
Autognome.description: A robotic construct, resembling a gnome. This small mechanical creature has a metallic outer casting, walks with a stiff gait, and often makes buzzing, clanking, whirring and wheezing noises.

items.name: Autognome Scrap Metal
items.description: When destroyed, an autognome often leaves behind various pieces of scrap metal. This magically infused metal can be often be forged into trinkets and jewelry.  Option: To determine the metal that the creature was made of, roll a d8. 1-4: iron (1 gp); 5-6: steel (2 gp); 7: silver (5 gp); 8: gold (10 gp)

items.name: Autognome Shock Coil
items.description: A gold metal coil may be found within the torso of the autognome. This 3-inch spring-like strand of metal is used by the autognome to help generate an electrical charge.

Autumn Eladrin.name: Autumn Eladrin
Autumn Eladrin.description: Eladrin are a subrace of elves who adopted the Feywild as their home. After centuries of exposure to Feywild magic, they acquired supernatural abilities and were effectively transformed into fey. Autumn Eladrin have orange-tinted skin, with hair that ranged from red to yellow. Their pointy ears are slightly longer than their Prime Material kin.

items.name: Autumn Eladrin Hair
items.description: The hair of an autumn eladrin is red, silky, and smells like freshly fallen leaves. The hair retains magic from the Feywild, and is often used is potions and elixirs. The hair can also be used as decorations and trinkets.

items.name: Eladrin Ear (x2)
items.description: Eladrin ears are similar to elven ears, but slightly longer. Most people considering killing an eladrin an evil act, and are suspicious of those selling such items. However, some evil communities, or those having trouble with Eladrin (such as lumbermills), may pay a bounty for such ears.

Axe Beak.name: Axe Beak
Axe Beak.description: A large, stout flightless bird standing upon two long, taloned legs. The creatures most noticeable feature is its axe-shaped beak.

items.name: Axe Beak Pelt (cold climates)
items.description: Axe beaks in cold climates tend to have a lush coat of soft fur, which can be used in apparel and bedding.

items.name: Axe Beak Feathers (warm climates)
items.description: Axe beaks in warm climates often have a coat of large feathers (colors depend on the breed). These feathers can be fashioned into quills, combs, dusters, apparel and more.

items.name: Axe Beak Beak
items.description: An axe beak's beak is a hard chitinous snout covered in a layer of keratin. In many breeds, the beak is shaped like the head of an axe. The beak is often used to make tools and weapons.

Azer.name: Azer
Azer.description: The creature bears a resemblance to a dwarf, but with brass-colored skin. It has a head and beard made of flames. Immense heat is radiating from the creatures body.

items.name: Azer Ash
items.description: Often found on an azer's corpse. The ash is sometimes used as a minor ingredient by alchemists and poisoners.

items.name: Azer Skin
items.description: An azer's skin is hardened bronze, often user by blacksmiths and armorers.

items.name: Smoldering Heart
items.description: The smoldering heart of an azer can be used in the creation of orbs of light, or when creating magical forges.

B'rohg.name: B'rohg
B'rohg.description: Huge, 15-foot tall, four-armed giants with burnt orange skin.

items.name: B'rohg Fingernails (sack of 20)
items.description: A B'rohg has hard, yellow fingernails. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the nails to create various concoctions.

items.name: B'rohg Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A B'rohg's blood is a thick, reddish-orange liquid. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: B'rohg Skin
items.description: The skin of a B'rohg begins to dry and fade as soon as it dies. If quick, an adventurer can carve off several thin strips. The unique pigment of the skin makes it valued by alchemists, dyers and painters.

Babau.name: Babau
Babau.description: The creature stands about 6 to 7 feet tall and weighs around 140 lbs., its height accentuated by its elongated form. Its body is so gaunt that it appears skeletal, covered in form fitting, black, leathery skin. A thick, dark red paste is secreted from its odorous pores that is both slippery and acidic. Its talons are often coated in blood, filth, and rotten flesh, resulting in its terrible stench. Contrasting its emaciated form are its oversized extremities, as its hands, feet, and head are more appropriately scaled for a hill giant.

items.name: Babau Horn
items.description: A demon's horn is strengthened by the fires of the Abyss. The horns are stronger than steel and can be crafted into deadly weapons by expert weaponsmiths.

items.name: Babau Eye (x2)
items.description: The babau's gaze has a debilitating effect on their enemies. Their eyes are often used to enhance curses and weaken people.

items.name: Babau Skin
items.description: A babau's skin is surprisingly strong, yet extremely thin, making it very difficult to harvest. If properly treated, the skin can be crafted into magical sheets of vellum, prized by magic users.

Baboon.name: Baboon
Baboon.description: The large monkey-like has bushy tufts of hair on both sides of its face and a large, red, hairless bottom. Unlike monkeys, it does not have a tail.

items.name: Baboon Hide
items.description: The baboon hide, while small, can be fashioned into small leather items.

Badger.name: Badger
Badger.description: A small creature with a flat, wedge-shape body, broad feet with long claws and coarse black hair on its body. It has a hairy white face, with two black streaks running down over its eyes. It looks related to ferrets, minks, otters, weasels and wolverines.

items.name: Badger Pelt
items.description: Badger are valued for their pelts, which can be used to make small apparel items. In addition, their hair can be used to make shaving brushes, owing to its high water retention.

Badger, Giant.name: Badger, Giant
Badger, Giant.description: A 6 foot long creature with a flat, wedge-shape body, broad feet with long claws and coarse black hair on its body. It has a hairy white face, with two black streaks running down over its eyes. It looks related to ferrets, minks, otters, weasels and wolverines.

items.name: Giant Badger Claws
items.description: The giant badger primarily uses it's claws to dig burrows and find food underground. These giant claws can be fashioned into small tools and decorations.

items.name: Giant Badger Pelt
items.description: Badger are valued for their pelts, which can be used to make small apparel items. In addition, their hair can be used to make shaving brushes, owing to its high water retention.

Bael.name: Bael
Bael.description: Bael is a muscular, golden-skinned humanoid standing over 8 feet tall. He has a generally bovine appearance, with a long head, a long, broad nose, and two small, forward-curling bull horns. Above his horns are two large, round, watery eyes, which matches his skin in hue, and a pair of large, pointed ears that protrude from an impressive mane of red hair. Unlike an ordinary bull, however, the archdevil's wide mouth conceals a series of pointed teeth.

items.name: Bael's Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Bael's blood is a scalding red fluid, that bubbles with the fiery heat of hell. Skilled alchemists can cool and refine the blood using a variety of alchemic processes, and use the resulting liquid as a component in various potions.

items.name: Bael's Hooves (x2)
items.description: Bael's hooves are strong enough to mash stone to dust. A skilled weaponsmith may be able to use the hooves to create powerful bludgeoning weapons. The hooves may also be used to create crafts and jewelry.

items.name: Bael's Horns (x2)
items.description: The horns of Bael are stronger than steel. Like most horns, they can be reshaped into musical instruments or large drinking horns. They can also be ground into a fine dust, which can be refined and used to strengthen weapons and armor.

Balhannoth.name: Balhannoth
Balhannoth.description: A balhannoth has an ovoid body, six tentacles, and a large mouth of jagged teeth.

items.name: Balhannoth Teeth (large bag)
items.description: Balhannoth's teeth can be used to craft exotic weapons, decorations and trinkets.

items.name: Balhannoth Mucus (3 vials)
items.description: Balhannoth mucus can be quickly harvested for use in various alchemy concoctions.

items.name: Balhannoth Tentacles (x6)
items.description: A balhannoth has 6 thick, rubbery tentacles with sharp barbs near the end. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips.

items.name: Balhannoth Heart
items.description: A balhannoth's heart beats with soft harmonic rhythm that hypnotically lures creatures to its lair. The tissue of the heart can be stretched into thin fibrous strings, which are valued by instrument makers and craftmen.

Balor.name: Balor
Balor.description: An imposing humanoid figure that stands around 12 feet tall and weighs about 4,500 pounds. A powerful aura of darkness envelops its grotesque form, and its deep red skin is wrapped in glaring flames. A pair of massive bat-like wings allow it to soar through the air with unnatural agility. Although it is naturally armed with venom-dripping fangs and fearsome claws, it is usually armed with a sword of lightning and a multi-tailed whip of flame.

items.name: Balor Ash (3 small pouches)
items.description: Once a balor is defeated, it combusts and often leaves behind enough ash to be collected. The dark gray ash smells of sulfur. Spellcasters can use the ash to summon lesser demons. Artificers and alchemists may be able to craft explosive substances with the ash.

Banderhobb.name: Banderhobb
Banderhobb.description: This large creature resembles a giant bipedal toad. It has a bulky ogre-sized frame, with a set of scrawny limbs ending in long keen claws. Their massive frog-like mouth has two rows of saw-like fangs and a long tongue. A pair of huge, bulbous eyes sit atop its amphibious head.

items.name: Banderhobb Slime (vial)
items.description: A moderate amount of slime can be extracted from a Banderhobb's corpse.Use: Using an action, the vial can be poured onto a Medium sized reptile (frog, lizard, snake, toad) or smaller. That creature immediately grows into the giant version of itself (see Monster Manual) for 1 hour. It returns to its normal size at the end of the hour, or if it drops to 0 hit points. While under the effect of this item, the creature becomes violent and attempts to attack the nearest creature it can see whenever possible.

items.name: Shadow Essence (vial)
items.description: Requires an enchanted vial in order to extract.Use: You may spend an action to pour the contents of this vial over yourself, merging with the shadows within for the next hour. During this time, whenever you are in dim light or darkness, you may take the Hide action as a bonus action, and you may spend an action to teleport, along with whatever you are wearing and carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space of dim light or darkness that you can see.

Banshee.name: Banshee
Banshee.description: The ghostly creature doesn't have a defined shape, but rather a misty form with vague and flowing features that resemble a female figure.

items.name: Banshee Ectoplasm
items.description: The opaque viscous liquid is often left behind by banshees. Ectoplasm is valued by enchanters and magic users. Requires a magical pouch, jar or similar container.

items.name: Banshee Echo
items.description:
It is possible to capture a banshee's wail before it disperses.  Requires a magical jar or similar container..

Use: You may spend an action to open this flask and release the banshee wail kept within. All creatures within 30 feet of you that can hear must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes [[/r 3d6]] psychic damage. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead.

Baphomet.name: Baphomet
Baphomet.description: Baphomet is a great, 20‑foot-tall, black-furred minotaur with six dark iron horns. He has digitigrade legs ending in iron hooves.

items.name: Baphomet's Hide
items.description: Baphomet's hide is similar to bovine hides, such as cows and bulls, but much stronger, thicker and more durable. The hide can be used to make harnesses, bags, shoes and rugs.

items.name: Baphomet's Horn (x2)
items.description: The iron, pointed horns of Baphomet have many uses. Craftsmen can use the item to create drinking horns, musical instruments, decorations and weapons. The horns may be used to create a powerful helm.

items.name: Baphomet's Pineal Gland
items.description: Baphomet can visualize every route it might take to reach its prey. This ability to coordinate its senses, and possible tie into a psionic "third eye", is a result of the creature's pineal gland. The gland is a small pea-shape ball of flesh located in the center of the brain. The gland is useful to many researchers (especially those studying demonology or Baphomet). Alchemist, artificers and spellcasters may also be interested in the gland.

Barbed Devil (Hamatula).name: Barbed Devil (Hamatula)
Barbed Devil (Hamatula).description: The creature is a lithe, 7 foot tall humanoid with 250 lb bodies completely covered in barbs. Its horned hands end in lengthy claws and their long tail is coated in spikes. Its gleaming eyes vigilantly scan the room.

items.name: Barbed Devil Barb (x10)
items.description: A barbed devil is covered in hard, sharp barbs. These spikes are often crafted into nails, pitons and arrows.

items.name: Barbed Hide
items.description: Due to being covered in barbs, the skin of a barbed devil is very difficult to harvest. If the harvester fails the attempt by 5 or more, they accidentally get stabbed by one of the barbs, taking [[/r 1d8]] damage. While any leatherworker can create apparel from the leather, some artificers may be able to craft magically infused apparel.

items.name: Barbed Devil Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Barbed devils have the ability to hurl fire, an arcane power that runs through their very blood. Alchemists use the blood in the creation of various concoctions.

items.name: Barbed Devil Tail
items.description: The tail of the barbed devil has a powerful lashing effect, made even deadlier as it is covered in spikes. An expert leatherworker can treat and repurpose the skin of the tail into a whip, and the barbed spikes reinforced for additional damage.

Barghest.name: Barghest
Barghest.description: A monstrous goblin–wolf hybrid with snapping jaws and razor sharp claws. Its intelligent eyes give off a hateful, orange glow.

items.name: Barghest Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Barghest's blood is known for it's transformative properties.Use: Spending an action to drink a vial immediately polymorphs you into a goblin for 1 hour. Game statistics remain the same in the new form, except your size changes to Small. You revert to your normal form at the end of the hour, or if you die.

items.name: Barghest Fur (small bag)
items.description: Barghest fur has various uses. It is often used by tailors to create fur trimmed apparel, but also used in the creation of portals to Gehenna. Goblins often use the hair in effigy's. Use: If a small bag of barghest fur is thrown into a fire larger than 10 feet high or wide, the fur is instantly disintegrated and the fire transforms into a portal to a random location on the plane of Gehenna (for 1 minute or until the fire is extinguished). Anything entering the portal automatically suffers [[/r 4d8]] fire damage from the heat of the original flame.

items.name: Barghest Fang (x2)
items.description: Barghest fangs are often used to create weapons that fight incorporeal undead.

items.name: Barghest Stomach Acid (vial)
items.description: Barghest stomach acid can be used to separate a soul from it's body.  Requires enchanted vial.Use: If you pour this vial onto a humanoid that has died within the past 10 minutes, that humanoid's soul will begin to be destroyed instead of passing into the afterlife. It takes 24 hours for a soul to be completely destroyed, after which no mortal magic may return that humanoid to life. If a resurrection attempt is made during those 24 hours, the attempt only has a 50 per cent chance of success. Removing the acid from the body of the humanoid before the 24 hours is over halts the destruction of the soul. This item has enough stomach acid to destroy one soul.

Barlgura.name: Barlgura
Barlgura.description: The creature stands just under 8 feet tall and weighs around 650 lbs. It is visually similar to an orangutan, possessing broad shoulders, long forelimbs, and short legs. While capable of standing upright, it shambles across the ground on all fours like an ape. Where its exposed skin is bluish-gray, most of its body is covered in matted reddish-brown fur.

items.name: Barlgura Fang (x2)
items.description: Two large fangs portrude from the lower jaw of the Balgura's mouth. The teeth can be crafted into daggers or hilts.

items.name: Barlgura Knucklebones (x2)
items.description: The enormous hands of the barlgura can pound a boulder to dust. A character can harvest the hands for their extremely strong knucklebones, which can be used to make powerful bludgeoning weapons.

items.name: Barlgura Bile (2 vials)
items.description: A balgura's rage-induced bile is a sticky, orange fluid that smells putrid. It is difficult to harvest, but is highly valued by alchemists.

Basilisk.name: Basilisk
Basilisk.description: A 7 foot long gigantic lizard with eight legs and a long tail extending another 7 feet. It has a dull brown body with a yellowish underbelly although their colors also include dark gray and dark orange. It possesses a single row of bony spines that line its back and a few curved horns atop its nose. Its eyes glow with a pale green light.

items.name: Basilisk Tooth (small pouch)
items.description: Basilisk use their teeth to crunch and grind stone. As such, their teeth are extremely hard and sharp. Basilisk teeth are prized for use in tools and weapons.

items.name: Basilisk Eye (x2)
items.description: Basilisk eyes, which cause petrification, are highly desired by both alchemists and magic users. The eyes can be used to make potions related to petrification, or to aid in the enchantment of armor and weapons.

items.name: Basilisk Bile (2 vials)
items.description: Basilisk bile is often used by alchemists to cure petrification.

Bat.name: Bat
Bat.description: The bat is a small, winged creature with a small furry body, sharp little teeth and large pointy ears.

items.name: Bat Carcass
items.description: If the bat's carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's wings, tongue, eyes, and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Bat, Giant.name: Bat, Giant
Bat, Giant.description: A giant bat has large black leathery wings and a hulking body covered in dark fur. It has long sharp fangs, beady eyes and and large pointy ears.

items.name: Giant Bat Hide
items.description: Unlike their smaller kin, the giant bat's hide is large enough to be valued, mainly because it can be made into dark leather.

items.name: Giant Bat Wings
items.description: The large black wings of a giant bat can be harvested for their leather.

Bats, Swarm of.name: Bats, Swarm of
Bats, Swarm of.description: The bat is a small, winged creature with a small furry body, sharp little teeth and large pointy ears.

items.name: Bat Carcass (x[[/r 1d8]])
items.description: If the bat's carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's wings, tongue, eyes, and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Bearded Devil (Barbazu).name: Bearded Devil (Barbazu)
Bearded Devil (Barbazu).description: The creature is a tall, muscular, green-skinned humanoid standing 6 feet tall, weighing roughly 225 lbs. It has a thick and wiry, barbed beard. It has pointed ears and long tails. Its gray-purple skin is moist and covered in scales. Despite having clawed hands and feet, it carries a massive saw-toothed glaive.

items.name: Bearded Devil Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A bearded devil's blood is infused with the fires of the Nine Hells, giving it a tenacious ferocity. A skilled alchemist can harvest that ferocity to use in potions.

items.name: Beard Lashes
items.description: The thick, wiry barbs of a bearded devil can be stretched, treated and cured by a skilled weaponsmiths. Local tailors and leatherworkers may be able to create more common items (strong threads, belts, sashes, etc.)

items.name: Beared Devil Poison Gland (vial)
items.description:
Within the bearded devil's chin is a small, purple veiny bulb, which allows the devil to secrete a venom that coats it's oily beard. A skilled harvester can attempt to remove the gland.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this gland. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's poison gland that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Bearded Devil Oil (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the poison gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the gland is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend  12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Bearded Devil Oil (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Bearded Devil Oil (Injury): The poison can be used to coat up to 3 pieces of ammunition or one slashing/piercing weapon. Applying the poison takes 1 action. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 150gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Behir.name: Behir
Behir.description: The huge, serpentine creature resembles a combination of centipede and crocodile. It has a long tubular body with six pairs of legs. Each leg has three sharp talons. It has the head of a snake with two glowing light blue eyes. It's wide mouth crackles with electricity. Its scaled hide has a deep blue color, fading to pale blue on its underside.

items.name: Behir Scales (large bag)
items.description: Behir scaled are used by tailors and armorers, as they are lighter, smoother and more flexible than dragon scales.

items.name: Behir Horn
items.description: As Behir's were created to fight dragons, their horn magically resonates when a dragon is nearby. Once a behir dies, the power is diminished significantly, but the horn is still effective.Use: The behir's horn will begin to vibrate when it comes within 1 mile of a dragon (whether in its true form or polymorphed), but does not point in any direction. The vibrations become more pronounced as it gets closer to the dragon.

items.name: Lightning Sac
items.description:
Harvested from the Behir's mouth, this light leathery sac contains caustic chemicals that continually crackle and pop. The sac is prized by alchemists, armorers and weaponsmiths.Use: The lightning sack can be thrown up to a range of 20 feet. If thrown, the
sack explodes on impact, dealing [[/r 4d10]] lightning damage to all creatures in a 10 foot radius, or half that on a successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw.

Beholder.name: Beholder
Beholder.description: A floating head with one single, cyclops-like eye surrounded by ten smaller eye stalks. Beneath it's main eye is a massive, gaping maw with razor sharp teeth.

items.name: Beholder Membrane
items.description: A large rubbery balloon that holds many of the Beholder's internal organs. Often prized by scholars and magic users.

items.name: Beholder Eye Stalk
items.description: The magical eye stalks of the beholder each have unique magical properties, and are prized by magic users and artificers. Once successfully harvested, roll [[/r 1d10]] for the type of eyestalk received (1. Charm, 2. Paralyzing, 3. Fear, 4. Slow, 5. Enervation, 6. Telekinetic, 7. Sleep, 8. Petrification, 9. Disintegration, 10. Death). see MM p28 for more details on the Beholder

items.name: Large Beholder Eye
items.description: The main beholder's eye is prized for it's nullifying properties. Skilled magic users  will pay a hefty sum for their acquisition.

Beholder Zombie.name: Beholder Zombie
Beholder Zombie.description: A floating, leprous ball of decaying flesh with a large maw full of sharp teeth and a giant milky white eye, with no pupil. Several eyestalks branch off the round body, each ending in a small milky white eye.

items.name: Zombie Fluid
items.description: A zombie's saliva and blood are both a thick, black fluid that smells of rotting meat. The fluid is a disease-ridden substance that necromancers often use in dark rituals and spells. Alchemists may be able to repurpose the blood for use in certain potions.

Berbalang.name: Berbalang
Berbalang.description: The berbalang is gaunt and lanky bipedal creature, resembling an imp. It has leathery, black skin and a pair of broad, bat-like wings on its back. It has glowing white eyes, pointy ears and needle-like teeth.

items.name: Berbalang Blood (vial)
items.description: Berbalangs have dark-red, almost black, blood. The blood can be used by alchemists, but is highly valued by divination wizards.

items.name: Berbalang Brain Fluid (vial)
items.description:
The brain fluid of a berbalang must be carefully collected from a berbalang's brain before it spoils from the toxins and bacteria of its dead body. The fluid has alchemical uses, but is highly valued by divination wizards and clerics.

Use: When used as a material component, the brain fluid will double the duration of the following spells: speak with dead, borrowed knowledge or tongues. The brain fluid quickly dries after the spell is cast, and can not be reused.

Bheur Hag.name: Bheur Hag
Bheur Hag.description: This hag has pallid, blue-white skin, as if they had died of hypothermia, and pale hair as white as snow. She has a gaunt, emaciated frame. Her voice howls like the winter winds. She is wearing a ragged, grey-blue shawl and carries a gnarled, wooden staff.

items.name: Bheur Hag's Hair (small pouch)
items.description: A bheur hag has a tangled mane of vine-like white hair. Due to the hag's abilities, the hair retains trace amounts of magic. Alchemists may find the hair useful in certain potions.

items.name: Bheur Hag's Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A hag's blood is a black, viscous fluid that radiates cold. The blood has arcane properties that can be harnessed by certain spellcasters and alchemists.

items.name: Bheur Hag's Nails (pouch)
items.description: The nails of a hag are long, filthy, and sharp. After years of wielding magic, the nails become a conduit for the hags power. They must be carefully extracted during a complex ritual in order to retain their usefulness. Alchemists, magic users and other hags find value in this item.

items.name: Bheur Hag's Eyeball
items.description: Harvesting the hag's eyeball intact is a delicate task. The eye is useful to those that practice divination. It can also be used by alchemists.

Black Abishai.name: Black Abishai
Black Abishai.description: Draconic humanoids, with scaled black skin, large wings on their back and a long tail.

items.name: Black Abishai Scales
items.description: The scales of an abishai are tough and immediately become brittle once the creature dies. As such, each scale must be carefully extracted one-by-one, and then treated with special oils in order to strengthen them again. The scales are highly decorative, and often used in jewelry. Smiths prize the scales for use in scale armor (the scales from 4 abishai are required to create a single set of scale mail).

items.name: Black Abishai Wing (x2)
items.description: The wings of an abishai produce a durable scaly leather. Once the creature is killed, the wings can rip easily, and must be removed with care. The leather can be used in tents, backpacks, clothing and other items.

Black Bear.name: Black Bear
Black Bear.description: The bear has a large body and walks on all fours, but has the ability to stand on it's rear legs. Each of its stocky legs has a paw with five long claws. It has a short tail, shaggy black hair, a long snout and small rounded ears.

items.name: Bear Claws/Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: The claws of the bear, and sometimes the teeth, can be used in decorations and jewelry.

items.name: Bear Pelt
items.description: A bear's pelt can be made into anything from rugs to coats to bedspreads. Once removed from the corpse, typically with a skinning knife, the hide ranges from 5-7 feet long.

Black Pudding.name: Black Pudding
Black Pudding.description: A bubbling, heaping pile of thick black goo.

items.name: Black Pudding Sludge
items.description: A black pudding is a heaving mound of sticky black sludge. The sludge is acidic and dissolved flesh, wood, metal, and bone. Samples of this ooze are often bought by alchemists and most merchants.

Blackguard.name: Blackguard
Blackguard.description: Blackguards are paladins who broke their sacred oaths and now indulge in their own villainous ambitions. Their armor and weapons are adorned with dread accoutrements or are marked by eerie phenomena.

Blood Hawk.name: Blood Hawk
Blood Hawk.description: The large bird is about the same size as a hawk, but with a large wingspan and crimson feathers. Its beak and talons are strong and extremely sharp.

items.name: Blood Hawks Feathers
items.description: A blood hawk has small crimson feather which can be used in jewelry or decorations. If ample feathers are available, they can be used in apparel. Since blood hawks hunt alone, finding large sources of blood hawk feathers is very difficult. If 10 batches of feathers are sold together, tailors will often pay 10x as much.

Blue Abishai.name: Blue Abishai
Blue Abishai.description: Draconic humanoids, with scaled blue skin, large wings on their back and a long tail.

items.name: Blue Abishai Scales
items.description: The scales of an abishai are tough and immediately become brittle once the creature dies. As such, each scale must be carefully extracted one-by-one, and then treated with special oils in order to strengthen them again. The scales are highly decorative, and often used in jewelry. Smiths prize the scales for use in scale armor (the scales from 4 abishai are required to create a single set of scale mail).

items.name: Blue Abishai Wing (x2)
items.description: The wings of an abishai produce a durable scaly leather. Once the creature is killed, the wings can rip easily, and must be removed with care. The leather can be used in tents, backpacks, clothing and other items.

Blue Slaad.name: Blue Slaad
Blue Slaad.description: The creature resembles a large, blue, bipedal toad with long, sharp claws, a wide mouth filled with pointy teeth and a huge toad-like head with beady eyes.

items.name: Slaad Slime (vial)
items.description: A slaad's skin is covered in a thin layer of clear mucus that smells of sulfur and rot. The slime has various healing and regenerative properties.

items.name: Blue Slaad Hooked Claw (x4)
items.description: A blue slaad has two black bone-like hooks protruding on the back of each of its hands. The hooks are used to inflict a terrible disease called the chaos phage, which transforms its victim into a fully grown slaad. The contagion loses its effectiveness once the slaad dies, but they still must be handled carefully. Healers and researchers are especially interested this item, although most communities forbid its study.

items.name: Blue Slaad Control Gem
items.description:
Embedded in a Blue Slaad's brain is a foggy blue gem, about the size of a child's fist. If obtained while the slaad is alive, the slaad will obey whoever possesses the gem.

Obtaining the Gem from a Living Slaad: Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against imprisonment, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A wish spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem. A greater restoration spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can attempt to remove the gem from an incapacitated slaad . Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 (4dl0) psychic damage to the slaad.

Uses: If a slaad is killed, that slaad's gem can not be used to control other slaadi by itself. However, it's magic can be used to enhance certain spells cast on other slaadi. While holding the gem, any slaad that is targeted by Enthrall, Suggestion, or Charm Monster, will have disadvantage on the creature's Wisdom save.

Boar.name: Boar
Boar.description: The creature has a typical pig-like shape with a long, blunt snout, small eyes, large ears, and two tusks protruding from its mouth. Its legs are longer and appears more powerful than that of a domestic pig. It has a very coarse, brown coat with thick, short hairs.

items.name: Boar Tusks
items.description: A boar's tusk range from 4 to 10 inches long, depending on the boar's size. The tusks are used in trophies and decorations, but some small tools can be crafted using the tusks.

items.name: Boar Hide
items.description: A boar has a tough hide covered in short, dark fur. A boar's hide produces a good quality leather.

Boar, Giant.name: Boar, Giant
Boar, Giant.description: The creature is almost as large as a horse, but much heavier. It has a typical pig-like shape with a long, blunt snout, small eyes, large ears, and two tusks protruding from its mouth. Its legs are longer and appears more powerful than that of a domestic pig. It has a very coarse, brown coat with thick, short hairs.

items.name: Giant Boar Tusks (x2)
items.description: A giant boar's tusks are 1 to 2 feet long. The tusks are used in trophies and decorations. Weaponsmiths can be carved into ivory weapons.

items.name: Giant Boar Hide
items.description: A giant boar's hide is valued for producing a good quality leather.

Bodak.name: Bodak
Bodak.description: The creature has a humanoid form resembling the race it was in life. It has deathly pale gray skin, devoid of any hair. Its face is twisted into an inhuman visage of sheer madness and horror with empty eye sockets, outstretched to the shape of vertical ovals.

items.name: Mark of Orcus
items.description:
The symbol of Orcus, a mace and skull, is carved into every bodak's chest. A harvester can carefully remove the skin, resulting in a dark leather sheet with the scarred symbol. Powerful curses can be created using this symbol.

Before the expiration, a creature can spend 6 hours and 5gp for alchemical ingredients to dry and treat the mark, allowing it to retain its magic abilities without expiring.

items.name: Bodak Eye (x2)
items.description: White, milky orbs that resonate unholy magic.

Boggle.name: Boggle
Boggle.description: A 3‑foot tall creature, humanoid in shape, with a large bulbous head and pointy ears. It has rubbery, hairless, blackish-blue flesh. It walks hunched over with its knuckles dragging along the floor.

items.name: Boggle Tar (vial)
items.description:
A sticky, tar-like substance, with strong adhesive properties. Use: You may spend an action to coat your hands with this substance. For 1 hour, you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple and any ability check made to maintain a hold on another creature, surface, or object. You can also climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. Alternatively, you may spend an action to pour this oil on the ground, creating a 5 ft puddle for 1 hour. Any creature that enters that
puddle or starts its turn there must make a Strength save (DC 11) or be restrained. On its turn, a creature can attempt a Strength check to free itself from the sticky puddle (DC 11). Success ends the effect and the creature must move into the nearest unoccupied space.

items.name: Slippery Boggle Oil (vial)
items.description: A slippery viscous oil. Use: You may spend an action to cover your body with this oil. For 1 hour, you gain advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to escape bonds, squeeze through narrow spaces, and end grapples. Alternatively, you may spend an action to pour this oil on the ground, creating a 5 foot puddle for 1 hour. Any creature that enters the puddle's space or starts its turn there must succeed a Dexterity save (DC 11) or fall prone.

Bone Devil (Osyluth).name: Bone Devil (Osyluth)
Bone Devil (Osyluth).description: The creature stands over 9 feet tall creatures and has dry, sickly white-gray skin that seems tautly stretched over every bone in their body. Despite being over 500 lbs, its frame is an incredibly gaunt husk so emaciated that it seems skeletal.

items.name: Bone Devil Bones (large bag)
items.description: A bone devil's bones are as hard as steel, and due to the creature's origins, are resistant to fire. Weaponsmiths, blacksmiths and crafters may be able to create tools and weapons from these bones.

items.name: Bone Devil Skin
items.description: The thin layer of skin that stretches over the bone devil's emaciated form can be harvested, oiled and treated. The skin is too thin to be useful in apparel, however, leatherworkers may be able to make thin sheets of a unique vellum which are useful within the arcane community.

items.name: Bone Devil Stinger
items.description:
A bone devil's stinger contains a strong poison. A skilled harvester can remove the stinger which is useful to alchemists and poisoners.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting the stinger. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's stinger that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Bone Devil Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the poison gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's sting ([[/r 5d6]] damage, or DC 14 Constitution save for half).

Refining the Poison: Once the stinger is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 3 days and 400gp worth of material to create Bone Devil Poison (DC 18 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Bone Devil Poison: Bone Devil Poison is slightly weaker than Wyvern Poison (see DMG p258). A creature hit with this poison must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. Failure results in [[/r 5d6]] damage and the creature becomes poisoned for 1 minute. Success for half damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on success. This poison usually sells for 800gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Bone Devil Wings (x2)
items.description: A bone devil's translucent wings appear light and fragile, but are surprisingly strong. Leatherworker praise the thin material because of its transparency and durability, which is unique in their profession. Artificers desire the wings for the magic they retain, even after death.

Bone Naga.name: Bone Naga
Bone Naga.description: A skeletal form of a giant, snake with a fanged, reptilian, human-like head.

items.name: Naga Spine
items.description: A nage has a very long spine, made up of hundreds of vertebrae. The bones have various uses, especially to make tools and sculptures. The spine can also be fashioned into necromatic staves.

items.name: Naga Fang (x2)
items.description: A naga has no poison gland, but the fangs magically produce a deadly venom. This poison fades once the naga is killed, but the large fangs remain an arcane conduit. The fangs can be crafted into useful items that are easily enchanted by an adept artificer.

Boneclaw.name: Boneclaw
Boneclaw.description: Boneclaws are gaunt, skeletal humanoid figures with withered flesh stretched tight across horribly visible bones. They have massive, oversized claws that they use to strike out against their foes.

items.name: Boneclaw Flesh
items.description: A boneclaw has pale, decaying flesh, which is easily pulled off the bone. When placed in darkness, the skin turns almost invisible. The flesh can be used my alchemists and spellcasters interested in invisibility and stealth. The flesh must be wrapped in enchanted paper or it will fade from existence in a few hours.

items.name: Boneclaw Claw (x6)
items.description: A boneclaw has two very large, skeletal hands, each with three long fingers ending in razor-sharp claws. Each claw is blackened-bone, over a foot long, often covered in dried blood. Weaponsmiths can make curved daggers from the claws. Craftsmen can also use the bones to make jewelry, decorations and other items. Each claw must be wrapped in enchanted paper or it will fade from existence in a few hours.

Braxat.name: Braxat
Braxat.description: A huge scaly giant with a thick, articulated shell covering it's back, a squarish head topped with horny protrusions, and thick arms ending in large hands with opposable thumbs. The creature walks upright on its two legs and often carries a large, crude weapon.

items.name: Braxat Saliva (1 vial)
items.description: A braxit's saliva is a corrosive thick fluid. If stored in a glass vial, it can be used as acid.
