items.name: Braxat Plates
items.description: Plates can be harvested from the Braxat's articulated shell. These plates can be used to make armor and shields.

items.name: Braxat Acid Glands
items.description: The braxat's acid breath is caused by two glands secreting a mix of chemicals together as the creature exhales. The two glands are wrapped together in a thin membrane, which can be harvested if careful. Alchemists prize the membrane for the unique mix of chemicals it contains.

items.name: Braxat Pineal Gland
items.description:
The pineal gland is believed to be the heart of a creature's psionic power. A braxat's pineal gland is a pea-shaped mound of soft, maroon flesh, about the size of a walnut. If the pineal gland is dried out and treated (using an alchemist's set), it will not expire for over a month.

Uses: As a reaction, a creature can crush the Braxat's pineal gland, which will release a burst of psionic energy, allowing the creature to add their Intelligence modifier to their AC until the end of their next turn.

Brigganock.name: Brigganock
Brigganock.description: Brigganock's are frantic, mouse-sized creatures that live in mines. They have a mouse-like humanoid appearance, with a large head featuring a tapered muzzle and prominent ears. Unlike a mouse, they do not have a tail.

items.name: Brigganock Wish Stone
items.description:
Sometimes a Brigganock is carrying a wish stone, which are created when a nonmagical wish gets lodged in a stone buried deep in the Feywild. The stone varies in color, but is perfectly smooth, with a soft glow. The stone is touched with fey magic, and valued by spellcasters, elves and certain fey.

It is believed that powerful fey can use a wish stone to scry on the maker of the wish, empower a supernatural charm, or provide the spark needed to create an animated object.

Brontosaurus.name: Brontosaurus
Brontosaurus.description: The creature is a giant dinosaur, extending almost 72 feet long, and its torso rises over 15 feet high (not including an extended neck). It has a small head and jaw set on a very long neck, with a bulky, heavy torso, and a long, whip-like tail. The creature looks to weigh about 15 tons. Brontosaurus means "thunder lizard" in Greek

items.name: Brontosaurus Skin
items.description: The skin of a Brontosaurus is a large reptilian hide. The skin is highly durable, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, tents and more.

items.name: Brontosaurus Toe (x4)
items.description: The toe of a brontosaurus are about a foot of hard bone. This bone can be used to create crafts, decorations and can be carved into weapons. Some weaponsmiths can fashion bludgeoning weapons from the bulky piece of bone.

items.name: Brontosaurus Spine
items.description: The long spine of a brontosaurus is prized by museums and collectors. The individual joins can be used to create crafts, decorations or weapons and tools.

Bronze Scout.name: Bronze Scout
Bronze Scout.description: A long, worm-like construct with a segmented body, a sharp metal beak, two digging pincers near it's head and telescopic eyestalks.

items.name: Clockwork Gears and Scrap Metal
items.description: When destroyed, a clockwork machine shuts down (usually releasing a cloud of steam) and falls to pieces. Among it's remains are several gears and pieces of scrap metal. These items can be used by artificers, tinkerers, inventors, smiths and jewelers.

items.name: Clockwork Oil (flask)
items.description: Some of the clockwork's interior gears and components are coated in a thin layer of slick, black oil. It may be possible to gather some of this oil and collect it in a flask. The oil is a useful lubricant that any merchant will buy.

Brown Bear.name: Brown Bear
Brown Bear.description: The bear has a large body and walks on all fours, but has the ability to stand on it's rear legs. Each of its stocky legs has a paw with five long claws. It has a short tail, shaggy brown hair, a long snout and small rounded ears.

items.name: Bear Claws/Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: The claws of the bear, and sometimes the teeth, can be used in decorations and jewelry.

items.name: Brown Bear Pelt
items.description: A brown bear's pelt can be made into anything from rugs to coats to bedspreads. Once removed from the corpse, typically with a skinning knife, the hide ranges from 6-8 feet long.

Brown Scavver.name: Brown Scavver
Brown Scavver.description: A shark-like scavengers, with a single large eye on the leading edge of its head. The eye glows while the creature is awake. Its mouth is full of razor sharp teeth. Brown scavvers are 10 feet long and range in color from sun-dappled brownish gold to dark amber.

items.name: Brown Scavver Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A brown scavver's teeth are extremely sharp, triangular pieces of dentin covered in a hard coating of enamel. The teeth are used in jewelry and decoration, but can also be used to make serrate blades and saws.

items.name: Brown Scavver Skin
items.description: A brown scavver's skin is covered in small, rough, hard scales. Leatherworkers dry and treat the leather, then grind down the scales to make the leather smoother and easier to handle, giving it a pebbled appearance.

Bugbear.name: Bugbear
Bugbear.description: A hairy, feral, 7-foot tall goblin-like creature, with a bear-like nose, and sharp teeth. It's bipedal humanoid body is covered in brown fur. It has clawed hands but is carrying a morningstar.

items.name: Bugbear Tusk (x2)
items.description: Two small tusks that protrude from a bugbear's mouth. They can be used to create small crafts, jewelry and decorations.

items.name: Bugbear Ears (x2)
items.description: Two pointy, leather ears. Some towns offer a bounty for these ears.

items.name: Bugbear Hide
items.description: Bugbear hide is often filthy and riddled with mange. However, once dried and tanned, the leather is tough and sound.

Bugbear Chief.name: Bugbear Chief
Bugbear Chief.description: A hairy, feral, 7-foot tall goblin-like creature, with a bear-like nose, and sharp teeth. It's bipedal humanoid body is covered in brown fur. It has clawed hands but is carrying a morningstar.

items.name: Bugbear Tusk (x2)
items.description: Two small tusks that protrude from a bugbear's mouth. They can be used to create small crafts, jewelry and decorations.

items.name: Bugbear Ears (x2)
items.description: Two pointy, leather ears. Some towns offer a bounty for these ears.

items.name: Bugbear Hide
items.description: Bugbear hide is often filthy and riddled with mange. However, once dried and tanned, the leather is tough and sound.

items.name: Heart of Hruggek
items.description: A bugbear chief's heart is often blessed by their god, Hrugged. It is believed that consuming a powerful bugbear chief's heart allows you to gain their power. Use: You may spend an action to consume this heart, granting you advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned, or sleep for the next hour. Once this effect wears off, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 12) or gain one level of exhaustion as the adrenaline filled organ passes through your system.

Bulette.name: Bulette
Bulette.description: A bizarre cross between an armadillo and a snapping turtle. The creature is covered in thick, layered plates. Its head is bullet-shaped, similar to that of a shark, with a massive mouth filled with multiple rows of razor-sharp teeth. Its armor is a blue-brown color.

items.name: Bulette Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Bulette teeth are as hard as steel, and often used to craft daggers and spears.

items.name: Bulette Claw (x4)
items.description: Bullette claw are capable of piercing rock and metals alike, and are often sought after by weaponsmiths.

items.name: Bulette Hide
items.description: A bulette's thick hide sweats with a slimy, slightly acidic chemical. Upon death, this chemical hardens the hide, making it prized by those that craft protective armor and equipment.

Bulezau.name: Bulezau
Bulezau.description: Bulezaus looked like 8-foot tall minotaurs, but were gaunt to the point of seeming skeletal as opposed to being muscular, weighing around 250 lbs. A bulezaus' massive horns were curved like that of a ram, and their feet ended in claws as opposed to hooves.

items.name: Bulezau Mane
items.description: A bulezau has a mane of hair that grows downwards, covering most of the neck, shoulders, and chest. The mane smells horrible, is covered in filth, and is riddled with insects. Alchemists and healers may want the mane for the filthy oil that coats the hair.

items.name: Bulezau Horn (x2)
items.description: The hard, pointed horns of a Bulezau have many uses. Craftsmen can use the item to create drinking horns, musical instruments, decorations, small weapons and even horned helms.

items.name: Bulezau Tail Oil (3x vials)
items.description: A Bulezau has a long tail ending with sharp, black spikes. Each spike is covered in a filthy green oil that causes festering boils, rotting skin, and the victim to cough up flies. Alchemists and healers can create healing poultices and cure diseases using this tainted oil.

Bullywug.name: Bullywug
Bullywug.description: An amphibious, frog-like humanoid with lanky limbs and webbed digits, standing 5'8". Its skin is smooth and reasonably tough, with mottled yellow coloring.

items.name: Bullywug Tongue
items.description: A bullywug tongue is extremely long, rough covered in a sticky slime. The tongue can be dried and treated, and turned into a crude rope (20') with a successful Survival check (DC 14).

Bullywug Knight.name: Bullywug Knight
Bullywug Knight.description: An amphibious, frog-like humanoid with lanky limbs and webbed digits, standing 5'8". Its skin is smooth and reasonably tough, with mottled yellow coloring.

items.name: Bullywug Tongue
items.description: A bullywug tongue is extremely long, rough covered in a sticky slime. The tongue can be dried and treated, and turned into a crude rope (20') with a successful Survival check (DC 14).

Bullywug Royal.name: Bullywug Royal
Bullywug Royal.description: An amphibious, frog-like humanoid with lanky limbs and webbed digits, standing 5'8". Its skin is smooth and reasonably tough, with mottled yellow coloring.

items.name: Bullywug Tongue
items.description: A bullywug tongue is extremely long, rough covered in a sticky slime. The tongue can be dried and treated, and turned into a crude rope (20') with a successful Survival check (DC 14).

Cadaver Collector.name: Cadaver Collector
Cadaver Collector.description: This large, hulking construct is encased in the armor and weapons of fallen warriors, with the corpses these warrior impaled on the lances and other weapons embedded on the salvaged armor.

items.name: Cadaver Collector Armor and Weapons
items.description: A cadaver collector is covered in corpses, and various pieces of armor and weapon. This cadaver collector has the following items: Weapons:  3 longswords, 1 spear Armor:  1 chain mail armor, 1 breastplate

items.name: Cadaver Collector Core
items.description: Embedded inside the chest of a cadaver collector is a hot, metal and glass tube filled with a glowing blue substance. This tube continues to glow, long after the cadaver collector is destroyed. The core is useful to artificers and other spellcasters.

items.name: Cadaver Collector Paralytic Gas Canister
items.description: Cadaver collectors are built with a canister of toxic chemicals that they use to spew a paralytic vapor. This canister can often be harvested after the creature is destroyed, if it is not punctured or disconnected improperly. The chemicals in the canister can be used by artificers, alchemists and poisoners.

Cambion.name: Cambion
Cambion.description: A humanoid female or male figure with red skin colors vary, large leather wings, and two small horns protruding from it's forehead horn shape vary.

items.name: Cambion Sulfur (small pouch)
items.description: While most fiends dissolve when slain, a cambion bursts into flames. Typically, piles of sulfuric ash can be found among the burnt remains.

items.name: Devil-Tinged Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The dark red blood of a cambion possesses certain magical properties commonly associated with fiends. Because a cambion is the child of a fiend and a human, the blood is highly valued because of the compatibility with humanoid physiology. Typically the blood is harvested from area where the cambion died, and not from the cambion itself (since they combust on death)

items.name: Cambion Wing (x2)
items.description: When a dead cambion combusts, the wings sometimes remain. The leathery, bat-like wings can be sold to collectors or to leatherworkers for their leather. Artificers and enchanters may be able to awaken the wings arcane power.

Camel.name: Camel
Camel.description: The camel is a four legged mammal. It has long legs, a big-lipped snout and a humped back.

items.name: Camel Hide
items.description: A camel's hide has outer guard hairs and soft inner down. The guard hairs can be felted for use as waterproof coats for the herdsmen, while the softer hair is used for premium goods. Camel hides are often treated and fashioned into tents, yurts, clothing, bedding and accessories.

Campestri.name: Campestri
Campestri.description: Campestri are mushroom-like creatures, that vary widely in color, from white to tan to dark brown, but always have red or purple caps with spots. They have a face on the stem of the mushroom stalk, featuring two black beady eyes and mouth that is usually smiling.

items.name: Campestri Mushroom Cap
items.description: Campestri mushroom caps are edible, but are extremely salty and unpleasant to most creature, though bullywugs consider them a delicacy. The caps have medicinal benefits that healers can use.

Canoloth.name: Canoloth
Canoloth.description: The canoloth is 4 feet tall and 6 feet long, resembling a giant canine with insect-like traits, such as chitinous armor plating. Its a hulking, 400 lb beasts  with short, stubby forelegs and clawed feet. Within its mouth are two sets of teeth and a long barbed tongue, several inches thick, that can flick outward up to 20‒30 feet. It lacks eyes, but has large gaping nostrils at the front of its skull, and navigates using its powerful olfactory and auditory senses.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Canoloth Chitinous Plates
items.description: A canoloth's body is covered in large chitinous plates. The chitin can be cut, treated and repurposed as armor or shields.

items.name: Canoloth Tongue
items.description: A canoloth's tongue is a rough, spongy slab of red flesh, about 25 feet long, and covered in sharp barbs. The barbs can be shaved into dust that is useful to alchemists, and the flesh of the tongue can be mashed into pulp, and used for medicinal purposes.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Carrion Crawler.name: Carrion Crawler
Carrion Crawler.description: A large, pale yellow aberration that looks like a appearance was akin to a four-foot-long centipede. The creature possesses eight long tentacles protruding from the side of its head, two bulbous black eyes, a set of mandible on the sides of a mouth full of jagged teeth.

items.name: Carrion Crawler Intestines
items.description: As a scavenger that feeds off the dead and rotting flesh, harvesting a carrion crawler's intestines can be a revolting task. Such creatures are have a unique digestive system that is uniquely adapted to overcoming various diseases and poisons. These intestines are used in salves, tonics and potions.

items.name: Carrion Crawler Mucus (vial)
items.description:
A carrion crawler's mucus is a powerful contact poison.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this poison. On a successful check, the character harvests enough poison for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any poison. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Chuul Poison (DC 13 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Crawler Mucus (Contact): (DMG p258) A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute (a poisoned creature has disadvantage on Attack rolls and Ability Checks). The poisoned creature is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Cat.name: Cat
Cat.description: A small animal with fur, four legs, a tail, claws and two triangular pointy ears on its head.

items.name: Cat Carcass
items.description: If the cat carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's eyes, tongue, tail, fur, tiny teeth and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Catoblepas.name: Catoblepas
Catoblepas.description: The creature has the large body of a buffalo that sits atop four squat legs with hooved feet. Its head resembles that of a warthog that rests sat atop an elongated neck that seemed ill-suited for actual support.

items.name: Catoblepas Milk (1 gallon)
items.description: A pale, reddish liquid. It is easy to mistake even fresh catoblepas milk as having gone rancid, due to its sharp taste and odor. Despite this, it is considerably valuable, as it is the basis for death cheese - cherished among the gourmet community.

items.name: Catoblepas Fur (large pouch)
items.description: Thick and mangy red fur, often wet and matted. Being a natural barrier for the beast against the ravages of the swamp, the fur has strong filtration properties.

items.name: Catoblepas Tail
items.description: A thick skinned tail with a hard bulbous end. Weaponsmiths are able to treat and reinforce the tail to make whips and flails. Artificers and magic users may be able to enchant these items.

items.name: Catoblepas Eye (x2)
items.description: Large, dark eyes, filled with necrotic energy, that wither anything they look at.

Cave Bear.name: Cave Bear
Cave Bear.description: The bear has a large body and walks on all fours, but has the ability to stand on it's rear legs. Each of its stocky legs has a paw with five long claws. It has a short tail, shaggy gray sometime brown hair, a long snout and small rounded ears.

items.name: Bear Claws/Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: The claws of the bear, and sometimes the teeth, can be used in decorations and jewelry.

items.name: Cave Bear Pelt
items.description: A cave bear's pelt can be made into anything from rugs to coats to bedspreads. Once removed from the corpse, typically with a skinning knife, the hide ranges from 6-8 feet long.

Cave Fisher.name: Cave Fisher
Cave Fisher.description: A large, white lobster-like creature about 7 feet long. It has a hard, chitinous shell arranged in overlapping plates for an exoskeleton. It has eight legs and two forelimbs that ended in large pincers. Its shelled head has a mouth full of mandibles and a long snout that drips with a sticky filament.

items.name: Cave Fisher Blood (3 vials)
items.description:
Cave fisher blood is an alcoholic, and highly flammable substance. Use: As an action, you may throw this vial at a target you can see within 20 feet of you as a ranged attack. This vial shatters on impact, covering your target in  flammable liquid. That target has vulnerability to fire damage until the end of your
next turn.

items.name: Cave Fisher Carapace
items.description: Hard, milky white chitinous sheets, highly valued in subterranean societies. Used to make armor, weapons, tools and jewelry.

items.name: Cave Fisher Thread (60 feet)
items.description:
The thick, sticky webbing of a cave fisher is difficult to harvest, and often wrapped around bolts of silk fabric to keep the adhesive from sticking.

Use: This filament may be unspooled like a regular piece of rope, and stretched across a 5' area. A creature that touches the filament immediately becomes adhered to it. A creature adhered to the filament is considered grappled (escape DC 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage), but a weapon that fails to sever it becomes grappled, requiring an action and a successful Strength check (DC 13) to pull free.

Centaur.name: Centaur
Centaur.description: The creature has the head, arms, and torso of a man or woman and the body and legs of a horse.

items.name: Centaur Hoof (x4)
items.description: A centaur's hooves contains a unique collagen that is used to make a strong adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be made into tools, bowls and other items. It is not uncommon for Centaurs to harvest hooves from their own dead.

items.name: Centaur Mane/Tail
items.description: Long, thick, strong strands of hair (colors varies, depending on the centaur). The hairs of a centaur are renowned for their tensile strength while remaining supple and flexible. As such they make superb bowstrings and centaur archers are known for using their own hairs in their bows.

Centipede, Giant.name: Centipede, Giant
Centipede, Giant.description: A long, flattened, many-​segmented creature that contains a pair of legs per segment. The insect-like creature has dozens of legs and moves extremely fast.

items.name: Giant Centipede Shell
items.description: The segmented chitinous shell of the giant centipede can be used by armor smiths to create shields and armor.

items.name: Giant Centipede Venom (vial)
items.description:
The giant centipede has a poisonous bite. A skilled harvester can extract a vial of the thick yellow vemon.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 3 hours and 60gp worth of material to create Scorpion Poison (DC 10 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Centipede Poison (Contact): Upon contact with this poison, the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or take 4 ([[/r 1d8]]) poison damage (NOT the poison condition). If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but paralyzed for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points. This poison usually sells for 120gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Chain Devil (Kyton).name: Chain Devil (Kyton)
Chain Devil (Kyton).description: The creature is a 6 foot tall humanoid wrapped in chains as if they were regular apparel. The chains wrapped tightly around its body like a shroud, rattling as it moves and slithering around its body as if they were alive. The lower part of its face and neck are covered in chains as well, like a large scarf.

items.name: Chain Devil's Chains
items.description: A chain devil's hooked and barbed chains are valued by magical crafters.

items.name: Chain Devil Eye (x2)
items.description: A chain devil's eyes have an unnerving ability to incite fear, as well as the power to see through magical darkness. Artificers and magic users find this item useful in their endeavors.

Champion.name: Champion
Champion.description: A champion is a mighty warrior that has honed their fighting skills in wars and gladiatorial pits. They often wear quality armor and wield deadly weapons.

Chasme.name: Chasme
Chasme.description: A demonic cross between a fly and a human. With the body of a giant fly, it bears two sets of large, buzzing wings and carries six limbs, the two forelimbs resembling long, slender human arms with long-fingered hands, the other four being hooked insectoid limbs. Emerging from its thorax, it has a head vaguely like that of a human, but ugly and exaggerated, with compound eyes, and a long needle-like nose. This nose is hard, sharp, and is used to stick into enemies and suck their blood. Its maw contains black, bony ridges rather than teeth, and its tongue is hollow. Tufts of wiry hair sprout from between the black plates that cover its thick, insectoid body. The creature can walk upright or crawl upon walls and ceilings as they will, and of course can fly with excellent maneuverability.

items.name: Chasme Proboscis
items.description: The curved, horn-like nose that a chasme uses to suck blood from it's victims. This horn is often used in torture and bloodletting.

items.name: Chasme Wing (x2)
items.description: A chasme's insect-like wings are thin, translucent, and amazingly strong. The are capable of moving at extremely high speeds, creating a loud buzzing noise, allowing the chasme to take flight. Artificers and researchers often have an interest in these wings.

Chimera.name: Chimera
Chimera.description: The creature has three heads, that of a horned goat, a lion and a dragon typically red. It has the hindquarters of a goat, the forequarters of a lion, and a large set of leathery dragon wings.

items.name: Chimera Hoof (x2)
items.description: The hindquarters of a Chimera resemble an ordinary goat in shape, they are much larger in size. A chimera's hooves contains a unique collagen that is used to make a strong adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Chimera Goat Head
items.description: One of the chimera's three heads. Larger than a regular goat's, the horns are particularly hard and large. The head is a prized trophy, and the horns can be crafted into prized ale horns (ornate drinking mugs).

items.name: Chimera Lion Claws (x2)
items.description: A lion's claws must be some of the most fearsome weaponry in nature. The chimera's claws are twice the size of a regular lions. They are razor sharp and as strong as steel. The claws can be used to make small weapons and jewelry.

items.name: Chimera Lion Head
items.description: One of the chimera's three heads. Larger than a regular lion's. The head is a prized trophy for hunters. The teeth can be used in jewelry and decorations. The mane can be used to make wigs and apparel (everything from simple pouches to fur-lined cloaks).

items.name: Chimera Dragon Wing (x2)
items.description: Large, leathery dragonic wings. They can be used to make apparel or simply as a trophy. Artificers and enchanters may find other uses for the wings.

items.name: Chimera Dragon Head
items.description: One of the chimera's three heads. The head is a prized trophy, but contains valuable items like teeth, scales and fire glands. The teeth and scales can be used in jewelry and decorations. The glands are cherished by alchemists and magic users.

Chitine.name: Chitine
Chitine.description: The creature is about 4 feet tall and has two legs and four long arms, each ending in sharp claws that allows it to climb most surfaces. Its entire body is covered with short dark fur. Its face has several milky white eyes, long pointy ears and two long mandibles that extend from its mouth.

items.name: Chitine Blood (vial)
items.description:
A thick, black liquid that smells of both metal and decay. Chitine blood has lot in common with drow blood, and can be used to create drow poison. Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the blood is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend  12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Drow Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Drow Poison (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Chitine Fur (small pouch)
items.description: Gray-black fur that is surprisingly light and fluffy. The fur is used by the Chitine to sense tiny vibrations on their webs. Crafters and tailors may be able to use this fur in their trade.

Choker.name: Choker
Choker.description: A choker's body is roughly humanoid, with a small torso and head, but the creature's arms and legs are long, thin, and extremely flexible, and are more like tentacles. Its hands are shaped like a starfish, with spiny stiff cartilage jutting through the skin — that allows it to grip tightly to the surfaces of walls and ceilings and to cut through flesh.

items.name: Choker Skin
items.description: The rubbery skin of a choker can be repurposed as a stretchable, waterproof fabric.

items.name: Choker Cartilage
items.description: Instead of a skeleton, a choker has an internal structure made of flexible cartilage. Craftsmen use this pliable material to make specialized tools and machine parts.

Choldrith.name: Choldrith
Choldrith.description: The twisted monstrosity, that has the head, arms and shoulders of a humanoid, but the body of a spider. Its face has several milky white eyes, long pointy ears and two long mandibles that extend from its mouth.

items.name: Choldrith Blood (3 vials)
items.description:
A thick, black liquid with a slight redish tint. Choldrith blood is used in the creation of drow poison. Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the blood is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend  12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Drow Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Drow Poison (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Choldrith Fur (small pouch)
items.description: Gray-black fur that is surprisingly light and fluffy. The fur is used by the Choldrith to sense tiny vibrations on their webs. The fur is used by the Chitine to sense tiny vibrations on their webs. Crafters and tailors may be able to use this fur in their trade.

items.name: Mark of Lolth
items.description:
Choldriths bear the mark of Lolth on its body. If harvested and preserved properly, artificers and enchanters may be able to use the symbols power to create magic items.

Before the expiration, a creature can spend 6 hours and 5gp for alchemical ingredients to dry and treat the mark, allowing it to retain its magic abilities without expiring.

Chuul.name: Chuul
Chuul.description: An 8-foot tall, yellow-green, lobster-like creature with four long legs, two large pincer claws, and a mass of writhing tentacles around its mouth. The creature has a strong protective exoskeleton, a fan-like tail.

items.name: Chuul Pincer (x2)
items.description: Large crab-like pincers, with razor sharp hooks. While too unwieldy to be fashioned into a useful weapon, the pincer's teeth can be repurposed for useful tools.

items.name: Chuul Carapace
items.description: The hard chitinous shell of the Chuul. Armorers often use the carapace to craft armor and shields.

items.name: Chuul Venom (vial)
items.description:
The chuul's tentacles contain a paralizing toxin. Alchemists can use the toxin to create various poisons and potions.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Chuul Poison (DC 13 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Chuul Poison (Contact): A creature can spend an action and use 1 vial of this poison to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying, or until a creature is hit with the poison. Any Medium or smaller creature successfully hit must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Chuul's Parietal Lobe
items.description: The parietal lobe can be harvested from a Chuul's brain. The parietal lobes in a human brain manage sensation, but in a Chuul they aid in sensing magic. Enchanters and artificers may be able to repurpose the lobe into magical items.

Chwinga.name: Chwinga
Chwinga.description: A tiny, 6'inch tall, elemental spirit that resembles an animated doll with a mask-like face, spindly limbs and wild hair.

items.name: Chwinga Essence (vial)
items.description: When a chwinga is killed, it's elemental form disperses, temporarily leaving behind a small amount of wispy mist. If harvested quickly, this smokey vapor can be collected. It is prized by spellcasters and those that study the arcane. Requires an enchanted vial.

Clay Golem.name: Clay Golem
Clay Golem.description: The creature has a human-shape, but looks to be made of hard, red clay. It wears only a stiff leather loin cloth.

items.name: Clay Golem Core
items.description: In the middle of a clay golem's chest is a lump of soft clay. When the creature is destroyed, its body crumbles to the floor, and this clay core can get lost among the clay remains. The core contains traces of magic from the Elemental Plane of Earth. Artificers and those that study the elemental planes have an interest in this item.

items.name: Clay Golem Clay
items.description: When a clay golem crumbles to pieces, much of the clay is nothing but moist earth. However, it may be possible to find a few that retain some trace amounts of arcane energy. Clay can be used to make all kinds of things, such as statues and pottery. However, this magically infused clay can be used by master craftsmen to make weapons and tools.

items.name: Clay Golem Manual Ashes (vial, small pouch)
items.description: The final step of creating a new golem is to sprinkle the ashes of the manual of golem creation over the inanimate body. Harvesting these ashes can be difficult, as they are tiny and hard to find. The ashes don't retain the power they had prior to the golem's creation, but still have value in the arcane community.

Cloaker.name: Cloaker
Cloaker.description: A dark-skinned stingray-like creature with a wide wingspan and a long tail covered in barbs. It has a wide mouth full of sharp teeth.

items.name: Cloaker Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Sharp, needle-like teeth. The teeth can be used to make a variety of tools and arrowheads.

items.name: Cloaker Tail
items.description: Covered in razor sharp barbs, a cloaker's tail can be treated and fashioned into lashes and whips by accomplished weaponsmiths.

items.name: Cloaker Hide
items.description: The cloaker's skin needs to be removed carefully in order to maintain its magical propertoes. If successfully harvested, the skin can be fashioned into magical apparel by accomplished tailors and artificers.

items.name: Cloaker Blood (vial)
items.description: A thick, black fluid with arcane properties. The blood must be harvested quickly, as it loses it's potency when exposed to air. Accomplished alchemists may be able to use the blood to create Potions of Stealth (1 hour, advantage to stealth rolls).

Cloud Giant.name: Cloud Giant
Cloud Giant.description: The giant has handsome and well-defined features. His/her skin is a light sky blue, with silvery white hair and iridescent blue eyes. He/she is dressed in clothing made of the finest material and jewelry.

items.name: Lock of Cloud Giant Hair
items.description: Long and strong strands of silvery-white hair. Highly valued among tailors, weavers and textile makers.

items.name: Cloud Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a cloud giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Cloud Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A cloud giant's blood is a translucent white liquid that must be harvested quickly, as it disperses once exposed to air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Cloud Giant Mist (1 vials)
items.description: The air in a cloud giant's lungs often has a misty, cloud-like shroud, probably the result of its innate arcane energy dispersing upon death. It must be harvested quickly before the mist dissolves. The mist can be harvested using an enchanted vial. Requires an enchanted vial.

Cloud Giant Smiling One.name: Cloud Giant Smiling One
Cloud Giant Smiling One.description: The giant has handsome and well-defined features. His/her skin is a light sky blue, with silvery white hair and iridescent blue eyes. He/she is dressed in clothing made of the finest material and jewelry.

items.name: Lock of Cloud Giant Hair
items.description: Long and strong strands of silvery-white hair. Highly valued among tailors, weavers and textile makers.

items.name: Cloud Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a cloud giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Cloud Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A cloud giant's blood is a translucent white liquid that must be harvested quickly, as it disperses once exposed to air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Cloud Giant Mist (1 vials)
items.description: The air in a cloud giant's lungs often has a misty, cloud-like shroud, probably the result of its innate arcane energy dispersing upon death. It must be harvested quickly before the mist dissolves. The mist can be harvested using an enchanted vial. Requires an enchanted vial.

Cockatrice.name: Cockatrice
Cockatrice.description: The creature has the shape of an emaciated rooster with no feathers and a long pointy tail. It has leathery, lizard-like skin and bat-like wings. It has a sharp beak and two long legs that end in curved claws.

items.name: Cockatrice Feet (x2)
items.description: A cockatrice's feet are almost indistinguishable from chicken feet. Most butchers discard the feet, but the feet are edible.

items.name: Cockatrice Bile (vial)
items.description: A cockatrice's bile is a thick yellow sticky fluid, know to slow the petrification process. Stonemasons and sculptors find the bile extremely useful in their work.

items.name: Cockatrice Droppings (small pouch)
items.description: While cockatrices don't intentionally eat stone, many petrified objects end up in their stomach. Unique stone trinkets, molded and shaped by the cockatrices digestive system, can be found in their droppings. Jewelers and artists find these trinkets valuable.

items.name: Cockatrice Beak
items.description: A cockatrice's beak is harden bone and keratin, sharp and smooth. The beak can be fashioned into weapons. Artificers and magic users may be able to reignite the arcane powers and magically empower these weapons.

Constrictor Snake.name: Constrictor Snake
Constrictor Snake.description: A reptile with a long, thin body but no legs. It has a large mouth and a slithering tongue that lashes about. The creature is about 9 feet long.

items.name: Constrictor Snake Skin
items.description: A snake's skin can be used in the creation of boots, belts and other apparel. A large constrictor snake can be as large as 7 meters long. The often have enough skin for tailors to create most apparel.

Constrictor Snake, Giant.name: Constrictor Snake, Giant
Constrictor Snake, Giant.description: A giant snake - an elongated, limbless, carnivorous reptile.

items.name: Giant Constrictor Snake Skin
items.description: A snake's skin can be used in the creation of boots, belts and other apparel.

Corpse Flower.name: Corpse Flower
Corpse Flower.description: A large, round, bundle of fibrous tentacles and leaves, topped with many large yellow and red sprouting flower buds.

items.name: Corpse Flower Dirt (large pouch)
items.description: Inside the bundle of fibrous vines that make up the creatures body, is a complex root structure enveloping a ball of dirt. This dirt is mixed with several rotting corpses and can be used as a highly effective fertilizer.

items.name: Corpse Flower Vine (x4)
items.description: A shambling mound usually has several long, vines wrapped around its plant-like form. The vines can be combed into fibrous threads used to make rope or simple apparel.

items.name: Corpse Flower Petals (sack)
items.description: The flowers of a Corpse Flower begin as red buds, but blossom into large yellow petals with red tips. When these petals reach full bloom, they can be harvested and used in various potions.

Cosmic Horror.name: Cosmic Horror
Cosmic Horror.description: A gargantuan aberration. No two are the same, but each is roughly 100 feet long, and its physical form is a seemingly impossible conglomeration of eyes, mouths, wings, tentacles and other appendages.

items.name: Cosmic Horror Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A cosmic horror's blood is a dark-gray, thick liquid. The blood is valued by spellcasters and anyone studying the Far Realm.

items.name: Cosmic Horror Hide
items.description: A cosmic horror's hide is strong and rubbery. The hide can only be harvested from certain areas of the creature, in order to find workable material. This rubber-like fabric is used in protective cloaks and strong leather armor.

items.name: Cosmic Horror Poison Sack
items.description:
A cosmic horror has the ability to expel a poisonous foul gas. This gas builds up and is stored in a sac somewhere in the creature's torso.

If the sac is removed too quickly, or incorrectly, it may burst. On a successful harvesting check, the character harvests the gas sac. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the gas sac. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character must make a DC 21 Constitution save or take 14 ([[/r 4d6]]) poison damage.

Use: As an action you may throw the sac up to 20 feet, where it explodes. Each creature in a 10-foot radius must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ([[/r 4d6]]) poison damage.

items.name: Cosmic Horror Pineal Gland
items.description: A cosmic horror's pineal gland is believed to power the creature's powerful psychic whisper. The gland is a pea-shaped mound of soft, gray flesh, about the size of a basketball. The gland is prized by psionic researchers.

items.name: Cosmic Horror Heart ([[/r 1d3]])
items.description: A cosmic horror often has multiple hearts. The creature's heart is a powerful organ that pumps its dark blood throughout it's enormous body. The heart is prized by master artificers and wizards, who can use the heart in elaborate pumping machines.

Couatl.name: Couatl
Couatl.description: A 12-foot long, feathered serpent with a pair of rainbow-feathered wings.

items.name: Couatl Saliva (vial)
items.description:
Couatl saliva is a clear, sticky liquid with a rainbow sheen. The fluid is believed to have many anesthetic properties, making it prized by alchemists and healers. 

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this saliva. On a successful check, the character harvests enough saliva for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any saliva. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the saliva is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 12 hours and 250gp worth of material to create Couatl Poison (DC 13 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Couatl Poison: The poison can be used to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying, or until a creature is hit with the poison. Any Medium or smaller creature successfully hit must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. A creature automatically wakes up if they receive damage or if an adjacent creature spends their action to wake them up. The poisons does not work on undead or construct (or any creature with poison immunity). This poison usually sells for 500gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Couatl Feathers (large bag)
items.description: Couatl feathers come in a vibrant array of colors. They range from 6 inches to a foot long, and are soft as down. The feathers are used to create apparel, jewelry and decorations. Pillows and bedding stuffed with the feathers are prized by nobility.

Crab.name: Crab
Crab.description: The crab is an 8-legged crustaceans which is covered with a thick shell, or exoskeleton, and is armed with a single pair of claws.

items.name: Crab Carcass
items.description: If the crab carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's eyes, legs, shell, and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Crab, Giant.name: Crab, Giant
Crab, Giant.description: The giant crab is an 8-legged crustaceans which is covered with a thick shell, or exoskeleton, and is armed with a single pair of claws. The giant crab is several feet wide.

items.name: Giant Crab Shell
items.description: The hard chitinous shell of the giant crab. Armorers often use the shell to craft armor and shields.

Cranium Rat.name: Cranium Rat
Cranium Rat.description: The creature looks like a rat, save for its enlarged and exposed brain.

items.name: Cranium Rat Brain
items.description: A small rodent brain, that pulses with a dim glow of psionic energy. Artificers and magic users are often interested in these little orbs.

Crawling Claw.name: Crawling Claw
Crawling Claw.description: A human-sized disembodied hand that uses its fingers as legs, scuttling  across the floor. The skin in gray, dead flesh.

items.name: Desicated Hand
items.description: If successful, the hand wasn't destroyed during the battle and can be salvaged. The hand can be treated and preserved and used as an arcane focus for necromancy spells. The hand can also be dissected to obtain the crawling claw's knucklebones. The knuckles are infused with trace amounts of necrotic energy, that may be repurposed by magic users, shamans and witches.

Crocodile.name: Crocodile
Crocodile.description: The large reptilian biped has a long body, about 15 feet long, and four short stumpy legs. It's head has a long snout and a large mouth full of teeth. It weighs about 1500 lbs.

items.name: Crocodile Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A successful harvest can yield over 60 teeth, the longest being over 4 inches long. Crocodile teeth can be used to create simple jewelry and crafts.

items.name: Crocodile Skin
items.description: Crocodile skin is highly durable, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, and furniture.

Crocodile, Giant.name: Crocodile, Giant
Crocodile, Giant.description: The giant crocodile is about 20 feet long, and weighs around 2,500 lbs.

items.name: Giant Crocodile Teeth
items.description: A successful harvest can yield over 60 teeth, the longest being about 8 inches. A giant crocodile's tooth can be used to create certain weapons. The smaller teeth can be used in jewelry and decorations.

items.name: Giant Crocodile Skin
items.description: Crocodile skin is highly durable, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, and furniture.

Cyclops.name: Cyclops
Cyclops.description: The large, hulking 12-foot tall figure is human-like in appearance, but has a large single eyeball and carries a greatclub.

items.name: Cyclops Eyelid
items.description: The large eyelid of a cyclops is a flat, thick flap of skin, about a foot long. Various crafters may be able to fashion the lid into something useful.

items.name: Cyclops Toes
items.description: The large, bulbous toes of a cyclops. The toe bones can be used for decorations.

items.name: Cyclops Heart
items.description: The extremely large heart of a cyclops. Healers, researchers and magic user often find the heart interesting for research purposes. In some cultures, the heart is a gourmet delicacy.

items.name: Cyclops Eye
items.description: The eye of a cyclops is a large, heavy, soft orb about 18 inches in diameter. Alchemists mash the eye into a paste, which they use as an ingredient in various salves and potions. Magic users and artificers extract the lens which they find useful in creating and enchanting items.

Dao.name: Dao
Dao.description: The creature is a large, strong, stout humanoid with a sharp stone cold face and a nasty scowl, and an intelligent look in its eyes. He/she is wearing fine clothes and jewelry crafted from precious gems and rare metals. As he/she moves, he/she begins to hover, his/her lower body becomes a column of swirling sand.

items.name: Earth Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: A dao may leave behind a trace amount of essence from the elemental plane of earth. While invisible to the naked eye, a quick ritual can reveal its presence -- a small glowing ball of green light. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Dao Crystalline Powder (vial)
items.description:
When a dao fades from the prime material plane, it leaves behind a cloud of dust and dirt that quickly disperses. Among these particles is a small amount of crystalline powder. This powder is valued by spellcasters. Requires an enchanted vial.

Use: When casting the spell conjure minor elemental or conjure elemental, this crystalline powder may be used as the spell's material component, which allows the spell can be cast at one level higher than the spell slot used to cast it. The crystalline powder then becomes inert and useless.

Darkling.name: Darkling
Darkling.description: A squat, ugly humanoid, with light grey skin, pearly glazed eyes, and sickly white hair. Its skin seems to absorb the very light in the area.

items.name: Darkling Ash (small pouch)
items.description: All that remains of a darkling is a fine, dark powder that smells of soot. Alchemists and magic users often acquire the ash for the tiny bit of magical essence that it contains. Use: When you cast the darkness spell, you may expend 1 or more pouches of this ash instead of the usual material components. If you do so, the radius of the magical darkness you create expands by 5 feet for every pouch of ash used.

Darkling Elder.name: Darkling Elder
Darkling Elder.description: The creature resembles a well-built elf, with light grey skin, pearly glazed eyes, and white hair. Its skin seems to absorb the very light in the area.

items.name: Darkling Ash (small pouch)
items.description: All that remains of a darkling is a fine, dark powder that smells of soot. Alchemists and magic users often acquire the ash for the tiny bit of magical essence that it contains. Use: When you cast the darkness spell, you may expend 1 or more pouches of this ash instead of the usual material components. If you do so, the radius of the magical darkness you create expands by 5 feet for every pouch of ash used.

items.name: Darkling Elder Tattoo
items.description: During their transformation, darkling elders are marked with enchanted tattoos that enhance their abilities. Although darklings explode upon death, the trace metals, rare pigments, and magical reagents of these tattoos sometimes remain. These components are often very useful.

Darkmantle.name: Darkmantle
Darkmantle.description: The creature resembles an octopus or squid with limestone-colored skin and a thick membrane of skin stretched between each of its tentacles. The top part of its body is covered in a stony dorsal shell. It has eight milky yellow eyespots, that don't appear to see anything.

items.name: Darkmantle Tentacle (pouch)
items.description: A darkmantle's tentacles are lined with powerful suction cups, used to grasp and ensnare their prey. The suction cups for often used for medical purposes. Some cultures consider the darkmantle's tentacle a tasty delicacy.

items.name: Darkmantle Otolith
items.description: The otolith is a cartilage structure in the darkmantle's head that it uses to sense gravity and movement. Some believe that the darkmantle's otolith can be used to create hearing devices.

Death Dog.name: Death Dog
Death Dog.description: A vicious and hateful two-headed dog about 5 feet long.

items.name: Death Dog Saliva (vial)
items.description:
Death dog saliva is a nasty diseased substance, and care must be taken when harvesting. If the character fails the harvesting check by 5 or more, the character is affected by the saliva (see below). Alchemists and healers may find the saliva worth studying.
If affected by the death dog's saliva, the target succeed on a DC 12 Constitution save against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) on a failure.

Death Kiss.name: Death Kiss
Death Kiss.description: A large, 10 foot molten gray ball of flesh, with a giant eye in the center. The ball is covered in ten, 20-foot-long  tentacles. At the end of each of tentacle is a toothy mouth, and each tentacle is fully retractable.

items.name: Death Kiss Blood (5 vials)
items.description: The blood of a death kiss is an electrified substance and requires careful extraction, otherwise the substance become inert.

items.name: Death Kiss Tentacle (x4)
items.description: These tentacles, used by the death kiss to drain blood, are often purchased by scholars, magic users and medical researchers. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips.

items.name: Large Death Kiss Eye
items.description: A Death Kiss eye, when successfully harvested, can be used by alchemists in the creation of medicinal salves and potions. The eye's lens may also be used in the crafting of certain magical items.

Death Knight.name: Death Knight
Death Knight.description: A knight clad in a full set of plate armor. Where it's skin is exposed, rotting and decayed flesh can be seen. It's helm reveals two pinpoints of light in place of eyes.

items.name: Unholy Ash (small pouch)
items.description: To harvest unholy ash, a defeated death knight must be burned in a ritual fire. Alchemists often use to ash in potions to thwart undead.

items.name: Cursed Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A death knight's blood is thick and dark red, almost black. The cursed blood can be used by an accomplished alchemists.

items.name: Death Knight Heart
items.description: Harvesting a Death Knight's heart involves a complex ritual, and must be done before the death knight rises in a new body. Once harvested, the heart can be used to track and find the death knight. The heart beats faster as it gets closer to the risen death knight, but does not point in the direction.

Death Slaad.name: Death Slaad
Death Slaad.description: The creature resembles a large, black-gray, bipedal toad with long, sharp claws, a wide mouth filled with pointy teeth and a huge toad-like head with beady eyes.

items.name: Slaad Slime (vial)
items.description: A slaad's skin is covered in a thin layer of clear mucus that smells of sulfur and rot. The slime has various healing and regenerative properties.

items.name: Death Slaad Control Gem
items.description:
Embedded in a Death Slaad's brain is a black gem, about the size of a child's fist. If obtained while the slaad is alive, the slaad will obey whoever possesses the gem.

Obtaining the Gem from a Living Slaad: Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against imprisonment, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A wish spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem. A greater restoration spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can attempt to remove the gem from an incapacitated slaad . Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 (4dl0) psychic damage to the slaad.

Uses: If a slaad is killed, that slaad's gem can not be used to control other slaadi by itself. However, it's magic can be used to enhance certain spells cast on other slaadi. While holding the gem, any slaad that is targeted by Enthrall, Suggestion, or Charm Monster, will have disadvantage on the creature's Wisdom save.

items.name: Death Slaad Heart
items.description: A death slaad's heart is a black mass of flesh and veins. The heart swirls with dark chaotic energy. Spellcasters, especially summoners, and anyone that studies Limbo are interested in this item.

Death Tyrant.name: Death Tyrant
Death Tyrant.description: A large floating skull, with one large single eye and a mouth full of razor sharp teeth. The central eye hole glows red, and spectral points of red light float around the creature.

items.name: Death Tyrant Teeth
items.description: The teeth of a Death Tyrant are strong and sharp. The teeth can be used in bone crafts, decorations, jewelry and small weapons. Weaponsmiths often decorate hilts, or line blades with these teeth.

items.name: Death Tyrant Eye
items.description: The Death Tyrants eye resonates with negative energy, and is prized by magic users for it's arcane properties.

Deathlock.name: Deathlock
Deathlock.description: A deathlock is an undead warlock, with rotting flesh, tightly stretched over it's skeletal form. It is often dressed in tattered robes, and usually carries a staff.

items.name: Deathlock Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A deathlock's blood is a viscous black fluid. The blood has motes of necrotic energy, which can be harnessed by adept spellcasters.

items.name: Deathlock Claws (pouch)
items.description:
The hard yellowed claws of a deathlock are infused with necrotic arcane energy, tied to a dark patron or a lich. The nails can be used in necrotic potions, or to enhance certain spells.

Use: When casting Chill Touch, the deathlock claws can be used as a spell component (which the spell consumes), and the spells damage increases by [[/r 1d8]].

Deathlock Mastermind.name: Deathlock Mastermind
Deathlock Mastermind.description: A deathlock mastermind is an undead warlock, with rotting flesh, tightly stretched over it's skeletal form. It is often dressed in tattered robes, and usually carries a staff.

items.name: Deathlock Mastermind Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A deathlock's blood is a viscous black fluid. The blood has motes of necrotic energy, which can be harnessed by adept spellcasters.

items.name: Deathlock Mastermind Claws (pouch)
items.description:
The hard claws of a deathlock mastermind are infused with necrotic arcane energy, tied to a dark patron or a lich. The nails can be used in necrotic potions, or to enhance certain spells.

Use: When casting Chill Touch, the deathlock claws can be used as a spell component (which the spell consumes), and the spells damage increases by [[/r 1d8]].

items.name: Deathlock Mastermind Heart
items.description:
The dark, necrotic heart of a deathlock mastermind is tied to the warlock's patron. 

Use: At the DM's Discretion, a spellcaster may be able to perform a 10 minute ritual, using the heart, to determine who or what the patron of the deathlock mastermind was. The spellcaster will know the name of the patron (as the deathlock knew it) and have a visual image of the creature. If the patron is on the same plane, then the spellcaster will know which direction the patron is (but not know how far). This direction sense fades within an hour.

Deathlock Wight.name: Deathlock Wight
Deathlock Wight.description: A deathlock wight appears as a twisted reflection of the form it had in life. It lingers between the warlock it was and the wretches existence it has become. The wights' eyes glow like white-hot embers. Its mummified flesh covers a twisted skeleton, its hands end in deadly claws, and its teeth are sharp and jagged like needles.

items.name: Deathlock Wight Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A deathlock wight's blood is a viscous black fluid. The blood has motes of necrotic energy, which can be harnessed by adept spellcasters.

items.name: Deathlock Wight Nails (pouch)
items.description: The hard yellowed nails of a deathlock wight channel the creature's life draining ability. The nails can used by necromancers in dark rituals, or repurposed by alchemists to create rejuvenation potions.

Deep Roth\u00e9.name: Deep Rothé
Deep Roth\u00e9.description: A deep rothé is smaller than surface rothé, standing only 4 feet tall at the shoulder. It has a shaggy brown coats that darkens to black near the legs and belly. It has dark green or black hooves, and yellow or pink eyes.

items.name: Deep Rothé Horns (x2)
items.description: A deep rothé's horns can be used to create drinking horns, decorations, jewelry, weapon handles and simple tools (hoes, rakes,etc.).

items.name: Deep Rothé Hide
items.description: The hide of a deep rothé can be crafted into soft, supple leather, which is used to create armor and apparel.

Deep Scion.name: Deep Scion
Deep Scion.description: A humanoid creature with moist, scaly, deep blue skin. Fins line it's back and forearms. In place of hair, several 6' long tentacles hang down, ending in pads with suction cups. The lower part of it's face splits open vertically, revealing a large maw filled with sharp teeth.

items.name: Mark of the Depths
items.description:
Somewhere on a deep scion's body is a mark of it's underwater master. The mark must be quickly found and removed before the body reverts to it's original form. Harvesting requires carefully skinning the area, with the mark intact. Before the expiration, a creature can spend 6 hours and 5gp for alchemical ingredients to dry and treat the mark, allowing it to retain its magic abilities without expiring.

Use: You may spend an action to tear this item in half. All creatures within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. In addition, any creature that succeeds on the saving throw gains the memories of the last 24 hours of the deep scion from whom this item was harvested.

Deer.name: Deer
Deer.description: A four-legged, hooved mammal, with a long thick neck. It has a long muzzle, large ears that stand upright. It is covered in brown hide.

items.name: Deer Antlers
items.description: A deer's antlers are prized hunter trophies, but they can also be used to create weapon handles and simple tools (hoes, rakes,etc.)

items.name: Deer Hide
items.description: A deer's hide can be crafted into soft, supple buckskin, which is used to create armor and apparel.

Deinonychus.name: Deinonychus
Deinonychus.description: The creature looks similar to a raptor, but has a plumage of feathers all over it's body. It runs on it's hind legs, but has two small arm reaching out from it's torso. It has a very large sharp claw on the second digit of both hind feet, probably used to disembowel its prey. It stands only about 4 feet tall, but extends over 11 feet long (from head to tip of the tail) Deinonychus is Greek for "Terrible Claw"

items.name: Deinonychus Skin
items.description: The skin of a Deinonychus is a highly durable reptilian hide, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, tents and more.

items.name: Deinonychus Claw
items.description: Each of the hind feet has a very large sharp claw, that it used to kick and rip its prey apart. The claw can be anywhere from 4-7 inches long.

Demilich.name: Demilich
Demilich.description: A skull floats on a cloudy mist. Two large gems are firmly fixed in its eye sockets, and gems have replaced most of its teeth. The gems all glow with a greenish light.

items.name: Bone Dust (small pouch)
items.description: A fine white powder with a chalk-like smell. Often prized by magic users.

items.name: Demilich Smoke (vial)
items.description: As a demilich has ascended beyond it's normal body, much of it's form is wispy necrotic vapor. While not the demilich's true essence, this smoke can be captured and saved for later. Artificers can use this vapor to track the demilich when it reappears. Requires enchanted vial.

items.name: Soul Gem (Acererak disciple Demilich only)
items.description: Demilich disciples of Acererak insert soul gems into their empty eye sockets to steal the spirits of their victims. Harvesting control over these gems requires a complex ritual.

Demogorgon.name: Demogorgon
Demogorgon.description: Demogorgon is over 18 feet tall. He has two baleful baboon heads, with blue and red faces similar to those of mandrills. He has broad, lumbering shoulders, and each arm splits into two long, writhing tentacles. His lower torso was saurian, like some great reptile with blue-green, scaly skin. He had an immense forked tail.

items.name: Demogorgan's Hide
items.description: The hide of Demogorgon's torso is extremely tough and durable. A master leathermaker can use the hide to make armor, clothing, bags, shoes and rugs.

items.name: Demogorgan's Tentacles (x4)
items.description: The strong tentacle-like arms of  Demogorgon have a draining effect on creatures (reducing a creature's maximum hit points). If harvested incorrectly, the tentacles may begin to wither and drain themselves. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips, which may be easily enchanted.

items.name: Demogorgan Eye (x4)
items.description:
Demogorgon has a magical gaze that can cause creatures to become stunned, confused or hypnotized. The creature has two heads, each with two large eyes the size of a cantaloupe. These spongy, yellow orbs are have deep, black pupils that swirl with arcane power. Enchanters and artificers seek the orbs, hoping to harness this power. Alchemists can create potions from the fluids in the eyes.

Use: Using an action, a creature can throw a demogorgan's eyeball up to 30 feet and it explodes on impact, releasing a wave of arcane power. All creatures within 10 feet of the explosion must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn. The eye is destroyed in this explosion.

Derro.name: Derro
Derro.description: The derro resembles a small, haggard dwarf, wearing shabby clothing. It has blue-gray skin, and white hair (or yellow, or pale tan). It lacks both irises and pupils, showing uniformly pale eyes.

items.name: Derro Eye (x2)
items.description: A derro has pale, milky eyes that lack both irises and pupils. The eyes had alchemical properties that can be used by alchemists, healers and witches.

Derro Savant.name: Derro Savant
Derro Savant.description: The derro resembles a small, haggard dwarf, wearing shabby clothing. It has blue-gray skin, and white hair (or yellow, or pale tan). It lacks both irises and pupils, showing uniformly pale eyes.

items.name: Derro Eye (x2)
items.description: A derro has pale, milky eyes that lack both irises and pupils. The eyes had alchemical properties that can be used by alchemists, healers and witches.

Deva.name: Deva
Deva.description: The creature looks like a human of extraordinary beauty with two magnificent feathered wings emerging from its shoulders. It stands about 6.5 tall and has silver skin, fair hair, and beautiful eyes. It wears a simple loincloth.

items.name: Deva Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Deva's blood is known for it's amazing healing properties.Use: Drinking deva's blood restores [[/r 4d8]]+2 hit points and cures disease, poison, blindness, deafness, and removes any curse.

items.name: Deva Wing (x2)
items.description: Deva wings can be harvested for their feathers. Artificers and enchanters may be able to use a full set of wings to create magic items.

items.name: Deva Skin
items.description: A deva's skin can be used by alchemists in various concoctions, and by tailors when creating certain apparel.

Devourer.name: Devourer
Devourer.description: The creature is a tall, gaunt skeletal figure, 4-5 times the size of a regular human. The creature has a large forehead, long pointy ears, beady eyes and jagged broken teeth. It looks more undead than alive, with leprous skin and an exposed ribcage with an empty chest cavity.

items.name: Soul Shard (gem)
items.description:
A devourer, sent by Orcus with a hunger for souls, often imprisons victims in it's chest cavity as it slowly tortures the creatures soul. Using a gem, a harvester may be able to collect a collect a trace amount of the souls essence, creating a soul shard. A soul shard is highly valued in the magic community. 

A soul shard is a valuable currency in the Nine Hells. While not as valuable as a full soul, in the Nine Hells a soul shard is worth 10x value of the gem it is embedded in (but less valuable on the material plane).

Use: A magic user can use a soul shard as a magic focus. In addition, the soul shard can be shattered (if a hard surface is available), causing [[/r 2d6]] damage to every creature in a 30ft radius, including the caster.

items.name: Devourer Claw (x2)
items.description: A devourer's claws radiate with dark necrotic energy. They are sharp, piercing objects about 1 foot long. A skilled weaponsmith may be able to craft a weapon from the claws.

items.name: Devourer Ribcage
items.description: The iron-like rungs of the devourers ribcage, used to imprison souls, ring with dark arcane energy. The bones may be used to make weapons and tools, however, a skilled artificer may be able to retain the dark magic and create powerful armor.

items.name: Devourer Skin
items.description: The dead, necrotic skin of a devourer is difficult to harvest without tearing. However, if successful, magic users can create dark necromancer apparel and arcane vellum. Normal leatherworkers may be able to create simple leather from the skin (1/10 the value).

Dhergoloth.name: Dhergoloth
Dhergoloth.description: The dhergoloth stands around 9 feet tall on a tripod of legs. Its squat, muscular torso is a grayish green, barrel-like structure, encircled by five arms that each end in stumpy, four-fingered clawed hands. Its head is a strange combination of mantis and reptile, with faceted, burning eyes, and a mouth with pointy teeth flanked by four clicking mandibles.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Dhergoloth Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Dhergoloth blood is thick, red, and smells of rancid meat. Alchemists often use the blood to craft potions.

items.name: Dhergoloth Vertebrae (pouch)
items.description: A dhergoloth's skeletal structure allows its body to swivel 360 degrees, while its head and legs remain stationary. The bones and cartilage of a dhergoloth's vertebrae are extremely flexible. The bones can be ground into a fine powder by healers that treat bone injuries.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Dimetrodon.name: Dimetrodon
Dimetrodon.description: The creature looks like a large reptile with a large, ridged sail on its back. The creature is around 12 feet long and weighing about 500 lbs. The large sail on its back serves a thermoregulatory function, as it cools the animal on hot days and helps keep it warm on cold ones.

items.name: Dimetrodon Skin
items.description: The skin of a Dimetrodon, and the large sail on its back, is a highly durable reptilian hide, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, tents and more.

Dire Troll.name: Dire Troll
Dire Troll.description: Dire trolls are huge creatures with multiple arms, legs, eyes, claws and even heads. Dire trolls are cannibals, and increase their size by grafting flesh and organs of other trolls onto themselves.

items.name: Dire Troll Skin Strips (pouch)
items.description: A dire troll's skin is often green and covered in warts, pustules and mold. Despite its appearance, the skin has amazing healing properties, and is rumored to allow creatures to graft flesh and body parts. Samples of the vile flesh can be harvested and sold to healers.

items.name: Dire Troll Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Dire trolls have amazing regenerative properties. A troll's blood clots, scabs and heals the surrounding tissue extremely quickly. The blood is a common ingredient in many healing potions.

items.name: Dire Troll Heart
items.description: A dire troll's heart is larger than the heart of other trolls. It is a large mass of red flesh that pumps the creature's regenerative blood throughout its huge body. The heart is used in arcane healing rituals and enchantments.

Dire Wolf.name: Dire Wolf
Dire Wolf.description: The creature is a large ferocious wolf, about the size of a horse, around 9 feet long and weighing up to 800 pounds. Its fur is thick and mottled grey-black in color. It has fiery, hungry eyes.

items.name: Dire Wolf Pelt
items.description: The pelt of the dire wolf is thick grey-black fur. The pelt can be treated and turned into all kinds of apparel and bedding.

Displacer Beast.name: Displacer Beast
Displacer Beast.description: The creature is a large cat-like beast, resembling a puma. It has six legs and a pair of long tentacles sprouting from its shoulders. Its covered in a pelt of blue-black fur. It's about 9 feet long and weighs as much as 500 pounds but the occasional mutant could be twice this size.

items.name: Displacer Beast Tentacle (x2)
items.description: The long tentacles that sprout from a displacer beasts shoulders are tipped with a pad of spikes. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips.

items.name: Displacer Beast Blood (5 vials)
items.description: A displacer beasts blood is a thick, blue liquid. Alchemists can use the blood to aid in the creations of potions, paints and dyes. Artificers and enchanters may be able to unlock the arcane abilities stored within the blood.

items.name: Displacer Beast Hide
items.description: A displacer beasts innate ability to illusory shift its location is tied to the blue-black hide. Incorrectly skinning the beast can destroy the skins magical properties. Clothes and apparel can be made with the hide, but the true power is unlocked when the fabric is placed in the hands of an artificer or enchanter.

Djinni.name: Djinni
Djinni.description: The creature is a tall, well-muscled humanoid with blue skin and dark eyes. He/she is dressed in airy, shimmering silks, designed as much for comfort as to flaunt his/her musculature.

items.name: Air Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: A djinni may leave behind a trace amount of essence from the elemental plane of air. While invisible to the naked eye, a quick ritual can reveal its presence -- a small glowing ball of white light. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Djinni Dust Particles (vial)
items.description:
When a djinni fades from the prime material plane, it leaves behind a cloud of dust and particles that quickly disperses. A djinni's dust particles contain a strong amount of arcane power that can be used by spellcasters to enhance their magic. Requires an enchanted vial.

Use: When casting the spell conjure minor elemental or conjure elemental, this crystalline powder may be used as the spell's material component, which allows the spell can be cast at one level higher than the spell slot used to cast it. The crystalline powder then becomes inert and useless.

Dohwar.name: Dohwar
