Dohwar.description: A short, pudgy, flightless avian humanoid that looks very similar to a large penguin. Dohwar's are around 3 feet tall. Instead of wings, they have arms and tiny hands.

items.name: Dohwar Beak
items.description: A dohwar's beak is black, hardened bone, covered in a shiny sheath keratin. The beak can be ground into a fine powder, and used to enhance telepathic abilities.

Dolphin.name: Dolphin
Dolphin.description: Dolphins are a peaceful species of aquatic mammal. They have smooth skin, flippers, and a dorsal fin. They have a long, slender snout with about 100 teeth, and a streamlined body. The single blowhole on top of their head has a flap that opens to reveal a pair of nostrils, which dolphins use for breathing when they surface.

items.name: Dolphin Teeth (pouch)
items.description: Dolphins are mainly harvested for their teeth and meat. The teeth are used in jewelry. Some primitive island tribes use the teeth as currency.

Dolphin Delighter.name: Dolphin Delighter
Dolphin Delighter.description: Dolphin delighters are fey dolphins that leap and teleport through the luminous waters of the Feywild and the Material Plane. They telepathically sing as they swim, and are allies to those who battle evil forces under the waves.

items.name: Dolphin Delighter Teeth (pouch)
items.description: Dolphins are mainly harvested for their teeth and meat. The teeth are used in jewelry. Some primitive island tribes use the teeth as currency.

items.name: Dolphin Delighter Dorsal Fin
items.description: The dorsal fin of a dolphin delighter is used to maintain stability, and aid in teleportation. The fin can be shaved down and used in various concoctions.

Doppelganger.name: Doppelganger
Doppelganger.description: The creature is a tall, blue-gray skinned humanoid, slightly resembling an elf. It has a thin hairless body that appears sexless. Its head seems featureless with  bulging, pale yellow eyes that lack visible pupils. Despite appearing thin, and almost frail, the creature appears to be quite strong and agile.

items.name: Doppelganger Blood (3 vials)
items.description:
A doppleganger's blood is a dark red, almost black, fluid with a low viscosity and a  rainbow sheen. When the vial is held, the blood changes color to match the blood of the creature holding it.

Use: When you (or another small or medium-sized humanoid) drink a vial of this blood that has a drop of a humanoid's blood mixed into it, you polymorph into that humanoid's race (you will not turn into an identical version of that creature, but retain many of your own characteristics. For example, if you are bulky and have long red hair, your new race will be bulky and have long red hair). This effect lasts for [[/r 1d4]] hours. Your statistics, other than your size remain the same in the new form. Any equipment you are carrying or wearing is not transformed. You revert
to your true form at the end of the duration or if you die.

items.name: Doppelganger Face
items.description: Harvesting this item involves the delicate process of skinning a doppelgangers face. If carefully removed, the resulting skin appears to be a morbid mask of flesh. Artificers and enchanters may be able to use this "mask" to tap into the doppelgangers transformative abilities.

items.name: Doppelganger Brain
items.description: A doppelgangers telepathic abilities can be studied from the brain of such a creature. To the untrained eye, a doppelgangers brain looks identical to other humanoids brains.  Artificers, enchanters, researchers and other magic users may find the brain worth study. Some may be able to create magic items with

Dracohydra.name: Dracohydra
Dracohydra.description: A dracohydra is a huge, winged draconic creatures that combines many of the most fearsome characteristics of dragons and hydras. Dracohydras typically have 5 heads, but 2 to 6 heads have also been recorded. They are often covered in thick, muddy-brown scales, with light cream colored scales on their bellies. They usually have red eyes. A dracohydra can reach up to 125 feet long, not counting its multiple snake-like tails, which can be as long as 100 feet.

items.name: Dracohydra Teeth (sack)
items.description: A dracohydra has rows of sharp, jagged teeth. The teeth can be used to make jewelry, but also make good arrowheads. A sack of dracohydra teeth can produce about [[/r 6d10]] arrows.

items.name: Dracohydra Blood (7 vials)
items.description: Dracohydras are known for their regenerative abilities, making their blood prized by healers and alchemists.

items.name: Dracohydra Hide
items.description: The scaled hide of a dracohydra is extremely tough and durable. The scales are highly decorative, and often used in jewelry. Smiths can use the hide to make scale armor.

items.name: Dracohydra Head
items.description: A dracohydra is a terror to civilizations, often hunting local fauna to extinction, and then moving on to the people. The creature typically has a bounty on it, but the heads make grand hunting trophies. Artificers and spellcasters find the heads worth studying. Alchemists and healers can find useful ingredients in each head.

Dracolich.name: Dracolich
Dracolich.description: The creature looks like a large, undead, skeletal dragon. Pieces of leprous skin hang off the bones and the wings are tattered.

items.name: Dracolich Bones
items.description: The bones of a dracolich are infused with dark necrotic energy. The bones are exceptionally strong and can be used to make a variety of tools and weapons. The bones can also be ground into dust and used as an ingredient in alchemists potions. Artificers may be able to use the dust to aid in finding the location of the dracolich's spirit gem.

Draconian Dreadnought (Sivak).name: Draconian Dreadnought (Sivak)
Draconian Dreadnought (Sivak).description: Draconians are a race of dragon humanoids, also called dragonmen because they walk upright and are human-sized. Draconians have scaly bodies like a dragon's, a snout and short stubby tail. Draconian Dreadnoughts often have blue or dull-silver scaly skin. They also have a set of wings on their back that allow them to fly.

items.name: Draconian Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Draconians are born from dragon eggs corrupted and warped by powerful magic. This blood resembles dragon blood, but is tainted with dark arcane power. The blood is valued by spellcasters, alchemists and others.

items.name: Draconian Tail
items.description: The tail of a draconian is a long, thick slab of flesh. The meat is tainted and can't be eaten, but the tissue can be used in various potions. If draconians have been terrorizing local settlements, the tails may be used to collect a bounty.

Draconian Foot Soldier (Baaz).name: Draconian Foot Soldier (Baaz)
Draconian Foot Soldier (Baaz).description: Draconians are a race of dragon humanoids, also called dragonmen because they walk upright and are human-sized. Draconians have scaly bodies like a dragon's, a snout and short stubby tail. Draconian Foot Soldiers often have brass or dull-white scaly skin.

items.name: Draconian Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Draconians are born from dragon eggs corrupted and warped by powerful magic. This blood resembles dragon blood, but is tainted with dark arcane power. The blood is valued by spellcasters, alchemists and others.

items.name: Draconian Tail
items.description: The tail of a draconian is a long, thick slab of flesh. The meat is tainted and can't be eaten, but the tissue can be used in various potions. If draconians have been terrorizing local settlements, the tails may be used to collect a bounty.

Draconian Infiltrator (Kapak).name: Draconian Infiltrator (Kapak)
Draconian Infiltrator (Kapak).description: Draconians are a race of dragon humanoids, also called dragonmen because they walk upright and are human-sized. Draconians have scaly bodies like a dragon's, a snout and short stubby tail. Draconian Infiltrators often have copper or black scaly skin. They also have a set of wings on their back that can turn a fall into a glide.

items.name: Draconian Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Draconians are born from dragon eggs corrupted and warped by powerful magic. This blood resembles dragon blood, but is tainted with dark arcane power. The blood is valued by spellcasters, alchemists and others.

items.name: Draconian Tail
items.description: The tail of a draconian is a long, thick slab of flesh. The meat is tainted and can't be eaten, but the tissue can be used in various potions. If draconians have been terrorizing local settlements, the tails may be used to collect a bounty.

Draconian Mage (Bozak).name: Draconian Mage (Bozak)
Draconian Mage (Bozak).description: Draconians are a race of dragon humanoids, also called dragonmen because they walk upright and are human-sized. Draconians have scaly bodies like a dragon's, a snout and short stubby tail.  Draconian Mages often have bronze, green or dull-emerald scaly skin.

items.name: Draconian Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Draconians are born from dragon eggs corrupted and warped by powerful magic. This blood resembles dragon blood, but is tainted with dark arcane power. The blood is valued by spellcasters, alchemists and others.

items.name: Draconian Tail
items.description: The tail of a draconian is a long, thick slab of flesh. The meat is tainted and can't be eaten, but the tissue can be used in various potions. If draconians have been terrorizing local settlements, the tails may be used to collect a bounty.

Draconian Mastermind (Aurak).name: Draconian Mastermind (Aurak)
Draconian Mastermind (Aurak).description: Draconians are a race of dragon humanoids, also called dragonmen because they walk upright and are human-sized. Draconians have scaly bodies like a dragon's, a snout and short stubby tail. Draconian Masterminds often have red, reddish-purple (amethyst), or dull-gold scaly skin.

items.name: Draconian Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Draconians are born from dragon eggs corrupted and warped by powerful magic. This blood resembles dragon blood, but is tainted with dark arcane power. The blood is valued by spellcasters, alchemists and others.

items.name: Draconian Tail
items.description: The tail of a draconian is a long, thick slab of flesh. The meat is tainted and can't be eaten, but the tissue can be used in various potions. If draconians have been terrorizing local settlements, the tails may be used to collect a bounty.

Draconic Shard.name: Draconic Shard
Draconic Shard.description: A draconic shard in its true form resembles a shimmering, spectral image of a gem dragon. However, the dragon often inhabits an object that the gem dragon poured its psionic energy into—typically a weapon or other item from the dragon hoard.

items.name: Draconic Shard Gem
items.description:
When a draconic shard is slain, or the object that it inhabits is destroyed, a draconic shard leaves behind a cracked gemstone. This gemstone is valued by anyone interested in psionics or studying dragons. And even though the gemstone is cracked, jewelers will still purchase the large, 6-inch gem.

DM Note: Only a successful DC 15 Arcana check will reveal that the cracked gemstone is actually holding the spirit of the gem dragon, while it slowly regains strength. The only way to completely destroy the dragonic shard is to destroy this gem holding it.

Draegloth.name: Draegloth
Draegloth.description: The creature is an ogre-sized, four-armed humanoid with purple-black skin and a shaggy white mane of hair. It's two upper arms are huge and muscular with razor sharp claws. The lower arms are the size and shape of humanoid arms. The face is clearly demonic with bestial features, an elongated doglike snout and a mouth full of sharp teeth. It's eyes have a faint red glow.

items.name: Draegloth Claws (x2)
items.description: The claws on the end of a draegloths upper arms are razor sharp, and used for tearing apart prey. The claws can be used in jewelry and decorations. They can also be used to create and adorn weaponry.

items.name: Draegloth Heart
items.description:
The creation of a draegloth is considered a blessing of Lloth's favor. Thus, the heart of a draegloth has strong ties to Lloth and her realm in the Abyss. Summoner's may value this item in order to enhance their magic.

Use: This item can only be used by a magic user who can cast summon lessor demon. The spellcaster may expend this item instead of its usual material component, resulting in the CR limits of the summoned demons specified in the spell being doubled.

items.name: Mark of Lolth
items.description:
Draegloths bear the mark of Lolth somewhere on its body. If harvested and preserved properly, artificers and enchanters may be able to use the symbols power to create magic items.

Before the expiration, a creature can spend 6 hours and 5gp for alchemical ingredients to dry and treat the mark, allowing it to retain its magic abilities without expiring.

Draft Horse.name: Draft Horse
Draft Horse.description: A horse is a large hoofed, four-legged mammal with short hair, long slender legs, muscular and deep torso build, a long tail, long thick necks, and large elongated heads.

items.name: Horse Hoof (x4)
items.description: A horse's hooves contains a collagen that is used to make a sticky adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Horse Hide
items.description: A horse's hide is known for its durability and resistance to moisture absorption.  The hide is primarily used to make harnesses, bags, shoes and rugs.

items.name: Horse Mane/Tail
items.description: Long, thick, strong strands of hair. Craftsmen often use the hair to make wigs, painting brushes, and fishing line. Weavers can also create coarse fabrics and apparel.

Dragon Turtle.name: Dragon Turtle
Dragon Turtle.description: The gargantuan turtle-like creature has a long neck and tail, and a large shelled-back. The creatures head has a sharp hooked beak and four large, taloned flippers.

items.name: Dragon Turtle Blood (20 barrel)
items.description:
A dragon turtle's blood is thick, red, and abundant in its huge carcass. Many sailors and superstitious commoners believe that dragon turtle blood can be used to bless and sanctify ships. Tar, that is used to insulate ships, is often mixed with giant turtle blood for added protection. Whether it is true or not has never been proven (since even seeing a single dragon turtle, much less killing one, is very rare).
Value and weight are per barrel.

items.name: Dragon Turtle Tooth (x4)
items.description: The large teeth of a dragon turtle are several feet long. They provide enough bone to create several weapons. However, the large teeth are unwieldly too large to place into a normal backpack.

items.name: Steam Satchel
items.description:
A dragon turtle's steam satchel is a bundle of three different glands, each of which secrete a variety of chemicals that react to create a boiling spray of steam. Healers and alchemists may be able to use the satchel's heating abilities. Artificers are always looking for items that can fuel their devices.

Use: As an action, a creature may squeeze the steam satchel to release a 30-foot cone of
scalding steam. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving
throw, taking 18 ([[/r 6d6]]) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful
one. Once used, the satchel is empty and cannot be used again.

items.name: Dragon Turtle Pearl
items.description: A dragon turtle pearl is a large, skull-sized pearl rarely found in a dragon turtles stomach. When a dragon turtle swallows a gem (which sometimes happens when eating ships and humanoids), the gem may settle in the creatures stomach and avoid moving through the digestive system. Irritated by the gem, the stomach begins to  secrete a mixture of enzymes into the stomachs acid, hoping to alleviate the discomfort. These enzymes covering the gem in a smooth white coating. As the irritation continues, this secretion process is repeated many times, thus producing a pearl.

items.name: Raw Dragon Meat
items.description:
Dragon meat is a delicacy and is considered one of the finest meats you can eat. The meat spoils fast, but gourmet chefs will pay dearly for the meat.

Dragon Jerky: If the meat is dried and smoked, a wyrmling can yield about [[/r 1d6]] days worth of dragon jerky. Dragon jerky is extremely filling, and a days worth weighs only a quarter of a regular ration (0.5 lbs.). It costs 2gp per ration.

items.name: Dragon Wyrmling Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A dragon wyrmling's blood does not have the same arcane properties as old dragons, but they blood is still useful to alchemist and artificers.

items.name: Type Dragon Wyrmling Skin
items.description: A dragon wyrmling's scales are soft and flexible, but too weak to provide any protection. However, a wyrmling's hide can be treated and turned into a soft leather.

items.name: Type Dragon Wyrmling Breath Pouch
items.description:
The dragon's breath weapon is caused by two glands secreting a mix of chemicals together as the dragon exhales. The two glands are wrapped together in a thin membrane or pouch, which can be harvested if careful. Alchemists prize the membrane for the unique mix of chemicals it contains. Magic users prize it for the magic it holds. Artificers prize it for what they can make from it.

Use: The membrane may be thrown up to 20 feet and the pouch explodes upon impact. Any creature within 15 feet of impact must roll a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or suffer 8 ([[/r 2d8]]) damage (damage type depends on the dragon the membrane was harvested from).

items.name: Type Dragon Wyrmling Wing (x2)
items.description: The wings of a wyrmling provide an small amount of leather, which can be used to fashion apparel and light armor.

Dragon, Shadow.name: Dragon, Shadow
Dragon, Shadow.description: This dragons has dark, translucent scales that seems to blend into the darkness around it. While it looks like a black dragons, It had two horn on its head that point backwards and is often confused with black dragons, whose horns point forward. A long fringe of spines emerged from the back of its neck and its powerful tail features a swimming fin. The dragon is about 25 feet long.

items.name: Necrotic Fire (3 vials)
items.description: A shadow dragon exhales a shadowy cone of necrotic fire. If harvested quickly, some of these flames may still reside in the dragons throat. Using an enchanted vial, the flames can be "pulled" into the vial. Magic users, especially those who study the shadow realm, prize this item. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Shadow Dragon Scales (large bag)
items.description:
Harvested from: Young, Adult, and Ancient Shadow Dragons

A shadow dragons scales are deep black and appear to disappear as it gets darker, becoming almost invisible. The scales are used in apparel, decorations and armor. Artificers and some magic users may be able to reach into the shadow realm to enhance the scales powers.

items.name: Shadow Dragon Wing (x2)
items.description:
Harvested from: Adult, and Ancient Shadow Dragons

The dark leathery wings of a shadow dragon appear to fade as it gets darker, becoming almost invisible. The wings are valued for the dark leather they produce. Artificers may be able to tap into the wing's shadowy powers to enchant apparel and armor made from this item.

Dragonblood Ooze.name: Dragonblood Ooze
Dragonblood Ooze.description: A flowing head of thick red blood-like goo that constantly tries to shape itself into draconic form, but keeps collapses into an amorphous form.

items.name: Dragonblood Ooze Slime (5 vials)
items.description: When a dragonblood ooze is slain, its amorphous form collapses into a puddle. The puddle looks like blood, but is thicker, almost gelatinous. Dragon blood normally has many beneficial uses, but the tainted slime of a dragonblood ooze is a vile, acidic substance. Alchemists, spellcasters and anyone that performs odd experiments may be interested in the substance.

Dragonbone Golem.name: Dragonbone Golem
Dragonbone Golem.description: A dragonbone golem is composed of dragon bones linked together with adamantine wire into the form of a dragon, animated by drawing on the bones inherent magic.

items.name: Dragonbone Golem Remains
items.description: The remains of a dragonbone golem includes dragon bones and thick adamantine wire. The bones still retain arcane energy, and the wire is valued for the adamantine. The bones can be used to make a variety of tools and weapons. The bones can also be ground into dust and used as an ingredient in alchemists potions.

Dragonflesh Abomination.name: Dragonflesh Abomination
Dragonflesh Abomination.description: Dragonflesh abominations are the final stage of a dragonflesh grafter's transformation—a hulking monster whose corrupted brain is ablaze with the desire for treasure. The huge creature is hideously monstrosity resembling a dragon, complete with a long tail and clumsy wings.

items.name: Dragonflesh Abomination Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A dragonflesh abomination's blood contains some of the same traits as dragon blood, and has strong regenerative properties, but it is also tainted with foul magic. The blood is precious to shady doctors and anyone experimenting with grafted flesh. Alchemists and healers may be able to use the blood for other purposes.

items.name: Dragonflesh Abomination Flesh
items.description: The upper epidermis of a dragonflesh abomination is meaty red and covered in moist, irregular green scales. Strips of this flesh can be recovered and used by alchemists and healers. While the flesh and blood of these creatures is tainted, it can often be purified and used for healing purposes.

items.name: Dragonflesh Abomination Stomach
items.description:
A dragonflesh abomination's stomach is a bulbous pouch, about the size of a large football. The flesh-like sac churns with noxious acid. The stomach lining may be used to line armor and clothes, protecting them from acid. The stomach contents can be used by alchemists.

Use: As an action, a creature may throw this sac at a point it can see within 20 feet, bursting on impact. All creatures within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking [[/r 5d6]] acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Dragonflesh Grafter.name: Dragonflesh Grafter
Dragonflesh Grafter.description: These are often humanoid creatures that practice dark rituals and perform experiments that allow them to graft dragon parts on their bodies. They stitch on, implant or ingest these parts, absorbing the lingering latent magic energy. They are abominations, with asymmetrical limbs and  mishappen bodiesmcovered in a combination of skin and scale.

items.name: Dragonflesh Grafter Blood (5 vials)
items.description: A dragonflesh grafter's blood looks like a swirling mix of red, green and black fluids. The blood is tainted, but is sought after by shady doctors and anyone experimenting with grafted flesh. Alchemists and healers may be able to find a use for the blood.

items.name: Dragonflesh Grafter Grafted Flesh
items.description: Strips of the grafted dragon flesh can be harvested from this creature. This flesh is sought after by spellcasters, especially anyone performing grafting and regeneration research. Alchemists and healers may mistake the flesh as fresh dragon flesh (20% chance, x2 value).

Dragonfly, Giant.name: Dragonfly, Giant
Dragonfly, Giant.description: A giant dragonfly has a 20-foot wingspan. It drones loudly as it hovers and darts through the air, searching for smaller insects to consume.

items.name: Giant Dragonfly Wings
items.description: Giant dragonflies have two pairs of elongated membranous wings with many small veins that criss-cross in the wings. The membranous wings can be treated, making a lightweight, transparent fabric (but must be done within a few days, or the membrane hardens and becomes useless). Alternatively, various ingredients can be pulled from the wings and used in potions and elixirs.

Dragonnel.name: Dragonnel
Dragonnel.description: Dragonnel look like small dragons, slightly larger than a horse (and can be used as an aerial mount if raised from birth, is domesticated and trained). They are distantly related to dragons and resemble them in basic form.

items.name: Dragonnel Blood (5 vials)
items.description: As dragonnel are distantly related to dragons, their blood has a trace amount of arcane properties. The blood is still useful to alchemists, healers and spellcasters.

items.name: Dragonnel Skin
items.description: A dragonnel's scales are soft and flexible, but too weak to provide any protection. However, the hide can be treated and turned into a soft leather.

items.name: Dragonnel Wing (x2)
items.description: The wings of a dragonnel provide an small amount of smooth leather, which can be used to fashion apparel and light armor.

Dretch.name: Dretch
Dretch.description: The creature stands 4 feet tall and weighs about 60 lbs.  It has squat, round bodies and thick limbs. Its skin is often a fetid greenish-blue color. The skin has a rubbery feel and is sparsely covered by bristly hairs as well as pulsing, varicose veins. The eyes are slanted downward, its nose seems squashed, and its exposed ears are pointed and lopped. There are many small fangs inside its slobbery, slack mouths, and long black claws hang off its hands.

items.name: Dretch Miasma (vial)
items.description: The fetid stench of a dretch can be bottled and saved. If the character fails the harvesting by 5 or more, a potent form of the gas is released in a 10ft radius. Any creature in the area must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or immediately take [[/r 1d8]] poison damage. The damage continues every round until the creature leaves in the area. The gas lasts for 1 minute or until a Strong Wind disperses it.Use: As an action you may make a ranged weapon attack to throw this vial at a point within 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Any creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can't take reactions.

Drider.name: Drider
Drider.description: The centaur-like creature is a drow from the waist up, with their lower portions replaced by the abdomen and legs of an immense spiders.

items.name: Drider Oil (3 vials)
items.description:
Driders secrete a clear oily substance that allows them to avoid the adhesive of their own webs. 

Use: It takes 1 action to cover one medium or smaller sized creature with 1 vial of drider oil. A creature covered by this oil ignores movement restrictions and does not get restrained by webbing. The oil lasts for 1 hour.

items.name: Drider Venom Gland (vial)
items.description:
A drider's venom is produced by a gland at the back of its mouth. The venom is a black, sticky substance that smells of rot.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this gland. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's poison gland that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Drider Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the poison gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character accidentally gets poisoned.

Refining the Poison: Once the gland is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 3 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Drider Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Drider Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute, or until a target is successfully affected by the poison. A creature successfully hit with Drider Poison must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking [[/r 2d8]] poison damage on a failed save, or half that on a successful saving throw. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Mark of Lolth
items.description:
Driders bear the mark of Lolth somewhere on its body. If harvested and preserved properly, artificers and enchanters may be able to use the symbols power to create magic items.

Before the expiration, a creature can spend 6 hours and 5gp for alchemical ingredients to dry and treat the mark, allowing it to retain its magic abilities without expiring.

Drow.name: Drow
Drow.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

items.name: Drow Blood (3 vials)
items.description:
Drow blood is dark red, almost black, and has a sharp metallic smell. Drow's blood is the primary ingredient used in the creation of drow poison. Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the blood is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Drow Poison (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Drow Poison (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Drow Arachnomancer.name: Drow Arachnomancer
Drow Arachnomancer.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

Drow Elite Warrior.name: Drow Elite Warrior
Drow Elite Warrior.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

items.name: Drow Blood (3 vials)
items.description:

Drow House Captain.name: Drow House Captain
Drow House Captain.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

Drow Inquisitor.name: Drow Inquisitor
Drow Inquisitor.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

Drow Mage.name: Drow Mage
Drow Mage.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

Drow Matron Mother.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

Drow Priestess of Lolth.name: Drow Priestess of Lolth
Drow Priestess of Lolth.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

items.description:

This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Drow Shadowblade.name: Drow Shadowblade
Drow Shadowblade.description: The creature resembles an elf, with sharp features and almond-shaped eyes, but has dark gray, ashen skin, a wiry and athletic body, and long white hair.

Dryad.name: Dryad
Dryad.description: The creature is a beautiful women with delicate features seemingly made of soft wood. Her hair seems to be made of leaves and foliage. Her hair color changes with the seasons. During the spring and summer months, the hair is lush and green, while during autumn it turns red and eventually brown in the winter

items.name: Dryad Hair
items.description: A dryads hair is primarily thin branches, leaves and vines. The hair can be twisted, tied and coiled to create a 30' rope with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Survival) check.

items.name: Dryad Sap (vial)
items.description:
A dryads natural skin feels more like the stem of a flower, and their blood is more like thick, sticky orange sap. The sap has a variety of arcane properties that are prized by alchemists, magic users and artificers.

Use: The sap can be used to coat 1 medium or smaller creature. Applying the sap takes 1 minute. Once covered with the sap, that creatures skin hardens, similar to the barkskin spell. For the next hour, the target's AC can't be less than 16. This effect does not require any concentration check to maintain.

items.name: Dryad Petals
items.description: Occassionally, a dryad sprouts beautiful flowers, with large round petals. They typically appear in the dryad's hair. The petals can be used by alchemists for potions, dyes and elixirs.

Duergar.name: Duergar
Duergar.description: These dwarves are short, stocky and have dull gray skin. They are thinner than most dwarves. The males often have bald heads and a full face of dirty gray-white facial hair. Female duergar usually have frizzy, long white hair.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

Duergar Despot.name: Duergar Despot
Duergar Despot.description: These dwarves are short, stocky and have dull gray skin. They are thinner than most dwarves. The males often have bald heads and a full face of dirty gray-white facial hair. Female duergar usually have frizzy, long white hair.

items.name: Duergar Despot Iron Fist
items.description: A duergar despot's iron fist is fused to it's body and powered by the creature's psychic energy. When the creature dies, the fist has no more psionic power, but may be valuable to rare collectors, smiths and artificers.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

items.name: Duergar Despot Fuel Core
items.description: A duergar despot has a powerful cannon fused to one of its arms that shoots a jet of flames at its enemies. Somewhere inside this cannon is a small glass orb filled with swirling red fluid. The core is difficult to find and remove without exploding (when harvesting, if a 5 or less is rolled, the orb explodes and every creature within 10 feet of the must make a DC 12 Dexterity check. On a fail, a creature takes [[/r 2d6]] fire damage. On success, it takes half). The core is valuable to alchemists and artificers.

Duergar Hammerer.name: Duergar Hammerer
Duergar Hammerer.description: This creature is a duergar fused with mechanical devices, and fueled by the duergar's psionic energy. A duergar hammerer has a large hammer fused to its right hand, and a mechanical claw fused to the left.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

items.name: Duergar Hammerer Hammer
items.description: A duergar hammerer has a large mechanical hammer attached to one of its arms. If successfully harvested, the hammer is in good condition and salvageable. The hammer is a useful tool or weapon that can be traded.

Duergar Kavalrachni.name: Duergar Kavalrachni
Duergar Kavalrachni.description: These dwarves are short, stocky and have dull gray skin. They are thinner than most dwarves. The males often have bald heads and a full face of dirty gray-white facial hair. Female duergar usually have frizzy, long white hair.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

Duergar Mind Master.name: Duergar Mind Master
Duergar Mind Master.description: These dwarves are short, stocky and have dull gray skin. They are thinner than most dwarves. The males often have bald heads and a full face of dirty gray-white facial hair. Female duergar usually have frizzy, long white hair.

items.name: Duergar Mind Master Mask
items.description:
Duergar Mind Master's wear fearsome masks. Each mask is unique. The mask can be carved from dark stone, pieced together using various bones, or made from the sewn skin of dead creatures. The mask flows with the psionic energy of the deceased mind master. Spellcasters can wear the mask, and benefit from this energy.

Use: A creature wearing this mask can use a bonus action to target 1 creature within 30 feet. The target must make a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw, or the target must use its reaction, if available, to make one weapon attack against another creature the mask-wearer can see, within 5 feet of that creature. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect. Once the mask is used, the psionic energy is drained and can't be used again in this way.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

Duergar Screamer.name: Duergar Screamer
Duergar Screamer.description: This creature is a duergar fused with mechanical devices, and fueled by the duergar's psionic energy. A duergar screamer has a large mechanical drill fused to its right hand, and a sonic cannon fused to the left.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

items.name: Duergar Screamer Drill
items.description: A duergar screamer has a large steel-like drill attached to one of its arms. If successfully harvested, the drill is in good condition and salvageable. The drill is useful to miners and artificers.

Duergar Soulblade.name: Duergar Soulblade
Duergar Soulblade.description: These dwarves are short, stocky and have dull gray skin. They are thinner than most dwarves. The males often have bald heads and a full face of dirty gray-white facial hair. Female duergar usually have frizzy, long white hair.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

Duergar Stone Guard.name: Duergar Stone Guard
Duergar Stone Guard.description: These dwarves are short, stocky and have dull gray skin. They are thinner than most dwarves. The males often have bald heads and a full face of dirty gray-white facial hair. Female duergar usually have frizzy, long white hair.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

Duergar Warlord.name: Duergar Warlord
Duergar Warlord.description: These dwarves are short, stocky and have dull gray skin. They are thinner than most dwarves. The males often have bald heads and a full face of dirty gray-white facial hair. Female duergar usually have frizzy, long white hair.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

Duergar Xarrorn.name: Duergar Xarrorn
Duergar Xarrorn.description: These dwarves are short, stocky and have dull gray skin. They are thinner than most dwarves. The males often have bald heads and a full face of dirty gray-white facial hair. Female duergar usually have frizzy, long white hair.

items.name: Duergar Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is a pea-sized gland shaped like a pine cone, located in the middle of the brain. Due to a duergar's psionic abilities, their pineal gland is larger than many other humanoids. Alchemists and healers use the gland to create various concoctions.

items.name: Duergar Xarrorn Oil
items.description: A duergar xarrorn carries a small jug of green oil, that it coats its lance with, and uses to fuel its fire spray. A failed check results in a shattered or empty jug. The oil is a unique underdark concoction, but is the equivalent to lantern oil (1 jug of xarrorn oil = 5 oil flasks).

Duodrone.name: Duodrone
Duodrone.description: A block-shaped constructs, with two spindly arms, two spindly legs, a small set of wings, a central eye, and a large mouth.

Dust Mephit.name: Dust Mephit
Dust Mephit.description: The creature is impish in appearance, about 4 feet tall, with wispy wings and long pointy ears and nose. It has rough gray-brown skin, and a swirl of dust and grit constantly swirls around the creature.

items.name: Dual Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: When a mephit is killed, it's elemental form disperses, leaving behind trace remnants from two different elemental planes. If harvested quickly, a mote of residual energy can be found - an essence resulting from the mixture of two elemental powers. The essence is useful to elemental spellcasters and those that study the elemental planes. Requires an enchanted vial.

Dybbuk.name: Dybbuk
Dybbuk.description: Dybbuks possess corpses, appearing as a decaying body with rotting flesh and visible bones. In their natural form, which they rarely stay in for long, Dybbuks appear as translucent flying jellyfish, trailing long tentacles.

items.name: Dybbuk Fluid
items.description: If on the Material Plane, all that remains of this creature is the corpse that it possessed. However, if on the Abyss, one must first dissect the corpse to find the jellyfish-like form of the dybbuk. Once the dybbuk's semi-translucent membrane is pierced, a small amount of fluid can be extracted. This fluid has many alchemical properties, and is often studied by anyone researching necromancy and those that practice it.

Eagle.name: Eagle
Eagle.description: A big, powerful bird of prey, with a heavy head and beak. It has a very large hooked beak for ripping flesh from its prey, strong, muscular legs, and powerful talons. The bird is light, weighing about 12 pounds with a wingspan of 7 feet.

items.name: Eagle Feathers (pouch)
items.description: Eagle feathers are light decorative plumage, that help the bird soar through the sky. The feathers are used in decorations, dusters, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

Eagle, Giant.name: Eagle, Giant
Eagle, Giant.description: A large, powerful bird of prey, with a heavy head and beak. The creature is large enough for a small humanoid to ride on it's back some grew large enough to allow medium sized creatures to ride it. It has a very large hooked beak for ripping flesh from its prey, strong, muscular legs, and powerful talons. A giant eagles wing span could reach over 25 feet.

items.name: Giant Eagle Feathers (large pouch)
items.description: Giant eagle feathers are light decorative plumage, that help the bird soar through the sky. The feathers are used in decorations, fans, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

items.name: Giant Eagle Talons (pouch)
items.description: A giant eagles talons are sharp and curved, used for grasping and clawing at prey. They are several inches long. Most are used in jewelry and decorations. The longer talons can make hooked daggers.

Earth Elemental.name: Earth Elemental
Earth Elemental.description: The creature has a vaguely humanoid shape, made of earth and rock. It has club-like arms made of jagged stone and a head made of dirt and rocks. A few places on the body glitters and reflects light briefly, perhaps a gem or piece of raw metal.

items.name: Elemental Earth Essence (vial)
items.description: When an earth elemental disperses, the dirt and rocks crumble to the ground. Some of this dirt contains traces of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container. Requires an enchanted vial.

Earth Elemental Myrmidon.name: Earth Elemental Myrmidon
Earth Elemental Myrmidon.description: A earth elemental, composed of earth and rock, bound by magic into a ritually created suit of plate armor.

items.name: Elemental Earth Essence (vial)
items.description: When an earth elemental myrmidon disperses, the dirt and rocks crumble to the ground. Some of this dirt contains traces of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Myymidon Armor Plates
items.description: The magical armor that binds the elemental Mymidon may be salvageable and retain some of its arcane power. These magically infused plates can sold to blacksmiths for the soft glowing metal. Alternatively, spellcasters, especially conjurers and elemental wizards, seek the plates for the residual binding magic.

Efreeti.name: Efreeti
Efreeti.description: A hulking creature with magma-red skin. He/she is wearing fine silk caftans and damask robes, and is bedecked in brass and gold torcs, chains, and rings, all glittering with jewels. As it moves, it hovers and its lower body transforms into a column of smoke and embers.

items.name: Fire Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: A efreeti may leave behind a trace amount of essence from the elemental plane of fire. While invisible to the naked eye, a quick ritual can reveal its presence -- a small glowing ball of red light. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Efretti Ember Spark (vial)
items.description:
When an efreeti burns away, disappearing from the prime material plane, it leaves behind a handful of tiny floating embers. Before these embers burn out and fade, they may be harvested. These embers contain a strong amount of arcane power that can be used by spellcasters to enhance their magic. Requires an enchanted vial.

Use: When casting the spell conjure minor elemental or conjure elemental, this crystalline powder may be used as the spell's material component, which allows the spell can be cast at one level higher than the spell slot used to cast it. The crystalline powder then becomes inert and useless.

Egg Hunter Adult.name: Egg Hunter Adult
Egg Hunter Adult.description: Egg hunters are insect-like parasites. Its segmented body has a bulbous tail, multiple legs, and a head with several black beady eyes. It has a mouth with a single needle-like tooth that it can extend and retract at will.

items.name: Egg Hunter's Tooth
items.description: An egg hunter has a small, hard, needle-like tooth that it uses to crack into an egg and suck out its contents. An adult egg hunter's tooth can range from 6 to 10 inches long. It can be fashioned into large needles. These needles can be used by weavers and tailors, but are also used by medical professionals, alchemists and artificers.

items.name: Egg Hunter Spores (pouch)
items.description:
Inside the head of an adult egg hunter is a sac of spores that the creature releases when it's in danger. Harvesting these spores can be difficult, because the sac is usually empty by the time this creature is slain. These spores are valuable by healers and medical professionals, used for their anesthetic properties and often used to make sedatives.

Use: As an action you may make a ranged weapon attack to throw this pouch of spores at a point within 30 feet, shattering it on impact. Any creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for one minute. While poisoned in this way, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can't take reactions. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Egg Hunter Hatchling.name: Egg Hunter Hatchling
Egg Hunter Hatchling.description: Egg hunters are insect-like parasites. Its segmented body has a bulbous tail, multiple legs, and a head with several black beady eyes. It has a mouth with a single needle-like tooth that it can extend and retract at will.

items.name: Egg Hunter Hatchling's Tooth
items.description: An egg hunter has a small, hard, needle-like tooth that it uses to crack into an egg and suck out its contents. A hatchling's tooth is 2-3 inches long, and can be fashioned into a fine needle, usable by tailors and weavers.

Eidolon.name: Eidolon
Eidolon.description: Eidolons are undead spirits that are bound to protect temple and vaults. If an enemy sets foot inside a warded location, the eidolon plunges into a statue especially prepared to house its soul. It then houses this effigy and uses the statue to drive out intruders.

items.name: Eidolon Spirit Shard
items.description: When a eidolon disperses, a trace amount of its spiritual essence is briefly left behind. It may be possible to collect this essence using a gem worth at least 100gp. A ritual can capture the essence into the gem, creating a spirit shard. The gem contains a small amount of arcane energy that spellcasters (especially necromancers) may be able to use and study. In addition, using the gem, a magic user with specific training may be able to pull information about the vault or temple the eidolon was guarding.

Eidolon - Sacred Statue.name: Eidolon - Sacred Statue
Eidolon - Sacred Statue.description: Eidolons are undead spirits that are bound to protect temple and vaults. If an enemy sets foot inside a warded location, the eidolon plunges into a statue especially prepared to house its soul. It then houses this effigy and uses the statue to drive out intruders.

items.name: Sacred Statue Dust (pouch)
items.description: When a sacred statue is destroyed, it crumbles to pieces. Many of the stones that made the statue shatter when hitting the grown, breaking apart, leaving behind magical rock dust. The dust is prized by sculptors and golem creators. The dust can be made into a paste that seals cracks in statues and masonry, and looks as if no damage occurred.

items.name: Sacred Statue Radiating Stone
items.description: When a sacred statue is destroyed, it crumbles to pieces. Occasionally, one of the rocks that made up the statue is imbued with the eidolon's arcane power and has a soft blue glow. This stone, often referred to as a spirit stone, is prized by spellcasters.

Elder Brain.name: Elder Brain
Elder Brain.description: The creature appears to be a large, pink brain. It has dozens of tentacles protruding from underneath its form. It floats in a brine-filled pool.

items.name: Elder Brain Fluid (3 vials)
items.description:
The Elder Brain dwells in a dimly glowing brine pool, filled with foul and brackish water infused with the elder brain's vital fluids and with psionic energy. The fluid has many uses to many spellcasters, craftsmen and alchemists.

Use: As an action, a creature may drink a vial of this fluid. For the next 1o minutes, the creature gets advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Saving Throws against magic pertaining to illusions.

items.name: Elder Brain Tentacle (x2)
items.description: The tentacles of an elder brain flow with psionic energy. Harvesting a tentacle intact, and with enough psionic power, can be difficult. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips, which may be easily enchanted.

items.name: Elder Brain White Matter
items.description: White matter is found in the deeper tissue of the brain. Ripples of psionic energy flow through the tissue like electricity. Harvesting the tissue can be difficult, as it takes a great deal of dexterity and medical knowledge. Failing the DC check by 5 or more results in a backlash of psionic energy, sending out a wave of [[/r 4d6]] psionic damage to every conscious creature in a 15-foot radius. The tissue is a psionic sponge, valued by spellcasters.

items.name: Elder Brain Neural Core
items.description: An elder brain's neural network is so prominent that they manifest as wiry tendrils that snake across the brain's gray matter. These tendrils often lead to a large mass of neurons. Finding this fleshy ball of neural wires is difficult, as it is buried deep within the brain. The core is highly valued by artificers for electrical machinations, but also useful to researchers and spellcasters. Craftsmen can stretch the strands into thin, thread-like fibers that conduct electricity.

items.name: Elder Brain Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is believed to be the heart of the elder brain's psionic power. The gland is a pea-shaped mound of soft, maroon flesh, about the size of a basketball. The gland is a psionic focal point, and can be used to enhance psionic power.

Elder Brain Dragon.name: Elder Brain Dragon
Elder Brain Dragon.description: An Elder Brain Dragon is a gargantuan creature that vaguely resembles a dragon, except with rubbery, translucent purple skin and a large hump on its back. The hump is semi-transparent, with an enormous brain underneath. Dozens of long, purple, tentacles protrude from the bulbous hump, and extend out from the creature's mouth.

items.name: Elder Brain Dragon Blood (9 vials)
items.description: The blood of an elder brain dragon resonates with psionic energy. The blood is extremely powerful, and valuable to alchemists and spellcasters.

items.name: Elder Brain Dragon Tentacles (large sack)
items.description: The tentacles of an elder brain dragon flow with psionic energy. Harvesting a tentacle intact, and with enough psionic power, can be difficult. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips, which may be easily enchanted.

items.name: Elder Brain Dragon White Matter
items.description: White matter is found in the deep tissue of the enormous brain that sits on the back of the elder brain dragon. Ripples of psionic energy flow through the tissue like electricity. Harvesting the tissue can be difficult, as it takes a great deal of dexterity and medical knowledge. Failing the DC check by 5 or more results in a backlash of psionic energy, sending out a wave of [[/r 4d6]] psionic damage to every conscious creature in a 15-foot radius. The tissue is a psionic sponge, valued by spellcasters.

items.name: Elder Brain Dragon Brine (flask)
items.description:
An elder brain dragon can exhale a briny stream of fluid, which containing hundreds 
of mindflayer tadpoles. The brine can be used to create new mindflayers and is extremely dangerous, and forbidden in most kingdoms. The liquid is purchased by anyone studying mindflayers. It is also sought after by cults and evil leaders, especially those that seek to cause panic and chaos.

items.name: Elder Brain Dragon Neural Core
items.description: An elder brain dragon's neural network is so prominent that they manifest as wiry tendrils that snake across the brain's gray matter, and branch outward throughout the dragon's body. These tendrils often lead to a large mass of neurons. Finding this fleshy ball of neural wires is difficult, as it is buried deep within the brain. The core is highly valued by artificers for electrical machinations, but also useful to researchers and spellcasters. Craftsmen can stretch the strands into thin, thread-like fibers that conduct electricity.

items.name: Elder Brain Dragon Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland is believed to be the heart of the elder brain dragon's psionic power. The gland is a pea-shaped mound of soft, maroon flesh, about the size of a basketball. The gland is a psionic focal point, and can be used to enhance psionic power.

Elder Oblex.name: Elder Oblex
Elder Oblex.description: A pool of gelatinous ooze, smelling of sulfur, typically swimming with the remains of other creatures. Adult oblexes can form duplicates of the creatures they have devoured, sending these copies off to lure prey into their clutches while remaining tethered to the slime by long tendrils of goo.

items.name: Oblex Ooze (9x vials)
items.description: The gelatinous form of an oblex smells of sulfur. Before the ooze disperses and evaporates, it is possible to collect a sample. The ooze has many transformative properties, and is an ingredient in some polymorph potions. Some craftsmen use the ooze to create acidic baths, to dispose of trash and wasted materials.

items.name: Elder Oblex Nucleus
items.description: In the center of an Elder Oblex is a bundle of hardened gelatinous material, surrounded by the skull of a creature that it devoured while it was an Oblex Spawn. This bundle of flesh is believed to be the storage center for the memories that the Elder Oblex has collected over the years. Spellcasters and scholars may be able to tap into this core, accessing these memories and possibly tap into lost knowledge. The nucleus also has many alchemical properties.

Elder Tempest.name: Elder Tempest
Elder Tempest.description: Elder Tempests are beings carved from clouds, wind, raid, and lightning, often in the shape of serpents that slither through the sky.

items.name: Elder Tempest Essence (vial)
items.description:
An elder tempest rains terror down on the land below, and sometimes leave behind trace amounts of its elemental energy. It is possible to harness this energy using an enchanted bottle to collect some of the elder tempest's essence. Requires an enchanted vial. The essence may be used to craft a powerful staff.

Harvesting note: 25 DC if the elder tempest disperses over 20 feet above the ground (spreading its essence into a wider area, making it more difficult to find).

Elephant.name: Elephant
Elephant.description: The creature is a huge animal characterized by its long trunk, columnar legs, and huge head with temporal glands and wide, flat ears. It has grayish to brown skin, and sparse, coarse body hair. The creature also has two long tusks protruding from its mouth.

items.name: Elephant Skin
items.description: The large hide of an elephant can make a sturdy leather, used to create apparel, tents and armor.

items.name: Elephant Tusk (x2)
items.description: The elephant has two long ivory tusks that protrude well beyond its mouths. These tusks are prized as trophies and used to make small statues and carvings. There is enough ivory to create certain musical instruments and weapons.

Elk.name: Elk
Elk.description: The elk is larger than a deer. It weighs several hundred pounds more and stands 2-to-4 feet taller. The elk has a lighter back and hindquarters and a darker, reddish-brown neck and head. A pair of large antlers sprout from the top of it's head and are covered with a layer of furry skin.

items.name: Elk Antlers
items.description: An elks's antlers are prized hunting trophies, but they can also be used to create weapon handles and simple tools (hoes, rakes,etc.)

items.name: Elk Hide
items.description: An elks's hide can be crafted into soft, supple leather, which is used to create armor and apparel.

Elk, Giant.name: Elk, Giant
Elk, Giant.description: The giant elk stands over 15 feet high sometimes reaching 20 feet. A pair of large antlers sprout from the top of it's head and are covered with a layer of furry skin. The elk has a lighter back and hindquarters and a darker, reddish-brown neck and head.

items.name: Giant Elk Antlers
items.description: An giant elks's antlers are prized hunting trophies, but can also be used to make weapons (usually curved) and tools.

items.name: Giant Elk Hide
items.description: An giant elks's hide can be crafted into soft, supple leather, which is used to create armor and apparel.

Empyrean.name: Empyrean
Empyrean.description: is wearing long white tunic with a gold trim, tied at the waist with a belt

items.name: Lock of Empyrean Hair (x10)
items.description: An empyrean's hair is long and lush, and feels like silk. It is strong and supple, making it prized by tailors. The hair has many uses: it can be used to make fine wigs, it's celestial origins make it a useful alchemy ingredient, and it has numerous arcane properties, making it valued in the magic community.

items.name: Empyrean Blood (5 vials)
items.description: An empyreans celestial blood radiates with divine power. Good aligned empyreans have gold flowing blood, while evil empyreans have thick, black blood. Alchemists may be able to create potions with this item. However, possessing (or worse, drinking) empyrean blood may be frowned upon my the empyrean's divine parents.

items.name: Empyreans Skin
items.description: The white alabaster skin of an Empyrean is as hard as marble, but much lighter. Difficult to remove, but highly valued by leatherworkers and armorers.

items.name: Empyreans Essence
items.description:
It is difficult to harvest, but the divine essence of an empyrean may be captured immediately after death. The essence is a swirling vortex of pure emotion, that can be used to empower and bolsters mortals. Requires and enchanted vial.
Use: Using an action, the vial can be uncorked, releasing some of the essence into the immediate area. Every friendly creature within 60' becomes more aware and alert, gaining +5 to perception. They also can't be charmed or frightened, and they gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws. This effect lasts until the end of the wielder's next turn. This ability may be used 3 times, after which, all of the essence is gone.

Erinyes.name: Erinyes
Erinyes.description: The statuesque female has beautiful features, and looks almost celestial. She stands around 6 feet tall, weighing around 140 lbs. She is wearing dark, stylized armor, a horned helm, has a longsword, bow and a coil of rope at her waist. A pair of large red feathered wings extend from her back. Although naturally female, erinyes can appear as idealized versions of the sexes of any mortal race.

items.name: Fiend's Poison (vial)
items.description:
Erinyes often coat their weapons in a vile poison, which they carry in a small glass vial.

Fiend's Poison: A creature can coat up to 3 pieces of ammunition or 1 melee weapon. Applying the poison takes an action. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until a creature is exposed to the poison. Any creature successfully hit must succeed a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or suffer [[/r 3d8]] poison damage and be poisoned for 1 hour. This poison usually sells for 250gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Erinyes Heart
items.description: The dark heart of an erinyes is a dark redish, fist-sized organ, wrapped in thick veins. The heart is often used in rituals to curse, and cure curses.

items.name: Devil Wings (x2)
items.description: Erinyes have a large set of red feathered wings. While the feathers are useful, artificers may be able to use the entire wings in their crafting.

Esthetic.name: Esthetic
Esthetic.description: A gargantuan, organic vessel, primarily used by the Reigar on the Astral Plane. Each esthetic is unique in appearance, but many resemble a giant, space-dwelling jellyfish or cephalopod, with an outer shell made of bioluminescent resin.

items.name: Esthetic Blood (9 vials)
items.description: Esthetic blood is translucent and bioluminescent. The blood is valued by alchemists, dyers and painters.

items.name: Esthetic Tentacles (x4)
items.description: An esthetic's tentacles are long, rubbery limbs, used to grapple and attack prey. Each tentacle can reach up to 50 feet long, but only the last 5 feet are harvestable. The rubbery skin in used in fabrics. The suction cups are used by alchemists and artificers. And while the tentacle meat has a sour chemical taste, it is still edible.

items.name: Esthetic Hide
items.description: The bioluminescent hide of an esthetic sheds light for up to 30 feet while it is alive. Once the creature dies, this light begins to fade. However, while a harvested hide wont glow, a master leatherworker can fashion the hide into armor that shimmers in the light.

items.name: Esthetic Brain
items.description: An esthetic's brain, which is only the size of a softball, is wrapped inside a bundle of nerves located somewhere inside the creature's body. While an esthetic relies on its controller for decisions, all instructions flow through this organ. Spellcasters and artificers may be able to use an esthetic's brain to help build automatons and golems. Others may be able to use the brain to build their own spelljammers.

Ettercap.name: Ettercap
Ettercap.description: The creature resembles a hunched, grey-purple humanoid with a distended white underbelly, a spider-like face (fangs and eyes and such), and sharp, black chitinous claws instead of hands and feet. The creature stands 6 feet tall and weighs around 200 lbs.

items.name: Ettercap Poison Gland (vial)
items.description:
An ettercaps poison gland may be harvested in order to acquire the creatures poison.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this gland. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's poison gland that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Ettercap Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the poison gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the gland is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 hour and 50gp worth of material to create Ettercap Poison (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Ettercap Poison (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 100gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Ettercap Spinneret
items.description:
An ettercaps spinneret is a small group of organs that the creature uses to make spider webs. The spinnerets are valued for the raw silk they still hold, and the alchemical properties in the organs.

Use: As an action, a creature may throw the spinneret up to 15 feet. Upon impact with the ground, the item explodes, forcing all creatures within 5 feet to succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 11 Strength check and escape from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

Ettin.name: Ettin
Ettin.description: The large creature stands around 13 feet tall and has two-heads. It is a hulking creature with exceptionally broad shoulders and long arms. It is slighting hunched over, with a dimwitted Neanderthal look on both faces.

items.name: Ettin Fingernail
items.description: An ettins fingernail is a useful alchemy ingredient, used in a variety of potions. They hold little value elsewhere.

items.name: Ettin Head (x2)
items.description: The two large heads of an ettin, although often bickering with each other, subconsciously work together to move their massive form. This connection is valued in the research community, especially among artificers. Other than that, the heads are sometimes mounted as trophies.

Eye Monger.name: Eye Monger
Eye Monger.description: When it's large single eye and mouth are closed, this creature looks like a 12-foot diameter asteroid. This creature can most often be found floating on the Astral Plane.

items.name: Eye Monger Teeth (x10)
items.description: Eye monger teeth look like smooth, hard, oddly shaped rocks. They range from 6 inches to a foot long. They are prized by sculptures and some spellcasters.

items.name: Eye Monger Saliva (3 vials)
items.description: Eye monger saliva is a thick transparent fluid. The fluid is valued by alchemists and anyone studying the Astral Plane. Spellcaster and artificers use the saliva for its anti-magic properties.

items.name: Eye Monger Eye
items.description: The large orb is valued by scholars and magic users, especially those studying Divination magic and the Astral Plane.

items.name: Eye Monger Stomach
items.description: An Eye Monger's stomach is a thick, gray membrane. The stomach is known to suppress magical effects, and is valued by anyone studying or creating anti-magic items and devices. If the stomach lining is dried out and treated by a master leatherworker, it may be used to cover a shield, and provide resistance to certain effects and spells.

Eyedrake.name: Eyedrake
Eyedrake.description: An eyedrake resembles a winged draconic creature with no true limbs and a perpetually open mouth. Inside the mouth is a large eye that emits a breath-like wave of antimagic energy. The creature's wings are formed from multiple eyestalks, each which can fire magical rays that combine aspects of the dragon's breath weapon attacks and a beholder's eye rays.

items.name: Eyedrake Blood (5 vials)
items.description: The blood of an eyedrake is a thick reddish purple fluid, flowing with arcane energy. The blood contains a mix of alchemical elements, which may be useful in potions and elixirs.

items.name: Eyedrake Eyestalk (x6)
items.description: An eyedrake's eyestalks are valued by magic users, enchanters and artificers. The eyestalks must be carefully separated from the wing-webbing between them. Once successfully harvested, roll [[/r 1d6]] for the type of eyestalk received (1. Frost, 2. Sonic, 3. Telekinetic, 4. Fire, 5. Paralyzing, 6. Necrotic). See FToG p199 for more details on the Eyedrake

items.name: Large Eyedrake Eye
items.description: The large eye of an eyedrake rests inside the creature's mouth. When successfully harvested, alchemists can extract fluids from the eye that are useful in antimagic potions and elixir. The eye's lens may also be used in the crafting of certain magical items.

Faerie Dragon.name: Faerie Dragon
Faerie Dragon.description: A extremely small dragon, about the size of a cat. It has an iridescent coat of scales that reflects all colors of the rainbow predominantly reflecting one particular color which changed with age. It has a long, prehensile tail and platinum-colored, butterfly-like wings.

items.name: Faerie Dragon Blood (vial)
items.description:
The faerie dragon's blood is the same color as its skin, but with a rainbow sheen. Its blood has many alchemical properties, and is useful with the arcane community.

Use: Attempting to transcribe a spell into your spellbook using faerie dragon blood, instead of regular ink, will half the time it takes to make that transcription.

items.name: Faerie Dragon's Euphoric Breath
items.description:
Requires an enchanted vial. If one is quick, and has an enchanted vial, it is possible to capture the final breath of a faerie dragon. The breath contains a highly euphoric gas that is valued by alchemists and artificers.

Use: Using an action, you can throw the vial at a target within 20 ft. On a successful hit, the vial shatters and the gas is released. The target must succeed a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target is affected by a sense of euphoria. It can't take an action, bonus action or reaction, and must use its movement to move in a random direction. At the end of each of its turn, it can attempt the save again. A successful roll ends the effect.

items.name: Faerie Dragon Wing (x2)
items.description: A faerie dragon's wings are covered in a semi-translucent, rainbow-colored enzyme. Alchemists can coat the wings in a chemical concoction, dry them, and mash them into a fine powder that can be very useful.

Female Steeder.name: Female Steeder
Female Steeder.description: Steeders are giant spiders, sharing many physical characteristics of their smaller cousins. Their bodies are covered in a fine fur that varies in color. They have eight powerful legs and large mandibles.

items.name: Steeder Fur (large pouch)
items.description: A steeder's body is covered in a fine fur. This fur can be collected and is often used to fill pillows and mattresses. If enough fur is collected, it may be used for clothing and apparel. The fur also has some alchemical properties.

items.name: Steeder Glue (x5 vials)
items.description: The legs of a steeder excrete a viscous, glue-like substance, which allows the creature to creep along walls and ceilings. This goo can be harvested and used as an adhesive.

items.name: Steeder Chitin Plates (x8)
items.description: Several thin chitin plates protect the steeder's body. The plates are hard and flexible, but must be treated before they can be used to create armor and shields.

Feyr.name: Feyr
Feyr.description: A tentacled horror, with gray skin, several large eyes and a least one large mouth with sharp teeth. The creature shuns bright light, but is not harmed by it. It tends to prey on creatures while they sleep, devouring their nightmares. Feyrs are often at home in the void of Wildspace.

items.name: Feyr Teeth (large bag)
items.description: Feyr teeth can be crafted into jewelry and are prized tokens and often a focus for fear-based spells.

items.name: Feyr Tentacle (x2)
items.description: 5-foot long gray tentacles, ending in thin red strands. The tentacles are prized by anyone studying fear-based spells and effects.

items.name: Feyr Saliva (3 vials)
items.description: The bite of a Feyr is known to cause fear. The creature's saliva is valued by alchemists, witches and other spellcasters for the creation of fear-based potions and spells.

items.name: Nightmare Fuel (flask)
items.description:
This fluid is found in a black gland at the base of one of its tentacles. The black gland drips with a thick dark-red fluid that can be collected inside a flask. Alchemists and spellcasters can find many uses for this liquid.

Use: If this flask is uncorked, using an action, within a 10 feet of any sleeping creature, the creature(s) must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or experience terrifying nightmares, taking 16 ([[/r 3d10]]) psychic damage and immediately wakes up. This effect is instantaneous and the liquid quickly evaporates in 1 round.

When the flask is uncorked, any creature that is already awake (including the creature that uncorks the flask), must immediately make the same saving throw or become frightened. At the end of each turn, the creature can attempt to make a saving throw. The effect ends when the creature succeeds this saving throw, or a minute passes.

Fire Beetle, Giant.name: Fire Beetle, Giant
Fire Beetle, Giant.description: A giant beetle about ​2.5 feet long. The beetle has a hard outer shell, that is brown with a shiny bronze sheen. Its has six dark legs with glowing red tubular veins on its underbelly. Its head at two large dark eyes and two large mandibles.

items.name: Giant Fire Beetle Gland
items.description: The giant fire beetle has a gland that produces a luminescent gel that continues to glow [[/r 1d6]] days after the beetle dies. It is possible to harvest the gland in tact. The gland can be used by alchemists and healers to produce glowing concoctions.

Fire Elemental.name: Fire Elemental
Fire Elemental.description: A fast and agile creature made of swirling flame, that sometimes shows a vaguely humanoid shape.

items.name: Elemental Fire Essence (vial)
items.description:
When a fire elemental extinguishes, it often leaves behind burnt ash and soot. Some of this material contains traces of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the fire elemental disperses into a pool of lava or a large area of burning fire over 10 ft in diameter.

Fire Elemental Myrmidon.name: Fire Elemental Myrmidon
Fire Elemental Myrmidon.description: A fire elemental, composed of burning fire, bound by magic into a ritually created suit of plate armor.

items.name: Elemental Fire Essence (vial)
items.description:
When a fire elemental myrmidon extinguishes, it often leaves behind burnt ash and soot. Some of this material contains traces of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the fire elemental disperses into a pool of lava or a large area of burning fire over 10 ft in diameter.

items.name: Myymidon Armor Plates
items.description: The magical armor that binds the elemental Mymidon may be salvageable and retain some of its arcane power. These magically infused plates can sold to blacksmiths for the soft glowing metal. Alternatively, spellcasters, especially conjurers and elemental wizards, seek the plates for the residual binding magic.

Fire Giant.name: Fire Giant
Fire Giant.description: The giant has very broad bodies, with a dwarf-like appearance. His/her skin is very dark, reminiscent of coal, flaming orange hair and glowing red eyes. He/she is wearing black, singed clothes, and a large set of steel plate armor.

items.name: Lock of Fire Giant Hair
items.description: Long strands of hair, as strong as steel and fireproof. The hair is often black with a reddish sheen, or dark red, with a dark sheen. Highly valued among tailors, weavers and textile makers.

items.name: Fire Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a fire giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Fire Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A fire giant's blood is an extremely dark, highly viscous liquid that flows like lava. The blood must be harvested quickly as it hardens and turns black when exposed to the air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Fire Giant Heart
