items.description: A fire giant's heart is an ever-burning engine, that continues to beat long after death. Harvesting the heart intact is difficult, but possible. Artificers and many spellcasters prize the heart. Collectors find the beating heart fascinating.

Fire Giant Dreadnought.name: Fire Giant Dreadnought
Fire Giant Dreadnought.description: The giant has very broad bodies, with a dwarf-like appearance. His/her skin is very dark, reminiscent of coal, flaming orange hair and glowing red eyes. He/she is wearing black, singed clothes, and a large set of steel plate armor.

items.name: Lock of Fire Giant Hair
items.description: Long strands of hair, as strong as steel and fireproof. The hair is often black with a reddish sheen, or dark red, with a dark sheen. Highly valued among tailors, weavers and textile makers.

items.name: Fire Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a fire giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Fire Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A fire giant's blood is an extremely dark, highly viscous liquid that flows like lava. The blood must be harvested quickly as it hardens and turns black when exposed to the air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Fire Giant Heart
items.description: A fire giant's heart is an ever-burning engine, that continues to beat long after death. Harvesting the heart intact is difficult, but possible. Artificers and many spellcasters prize the heart. Collectors find the beating heart fascinating.

Fire Snake (Young Salamander).name: Fire Snake (Young Salamander)
Fire Snake (Young Salamander).description: This long snake is almost 4 ft long, with scales that ranged from blood-red to orange.

items.name: Salamander Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A salamander's blood is a thick, vivid red-orange fluid with a faint glow. The blood is hot, and bubbles like a pool of lava. Blacksmiths can use the blood to aid in forging powerful weapons.

items.name: Fire Snake Scales (small pouch)
items.description: These small, hard, red scales have a metallic sheen and are warm to the touch, even after the creature's death. The scales are often used to make cold-weather apparel. They can also be ground into a fine powder to make red-hued inks, paints and dyes.

Firenewt Warlock.name: Firenewt Warlock
Firenewt Warlock.description: A reptilian humanoid about the size of a slim human. The creature has a long neck and a simple snake-like face with large, inky-black eyes. Its translucent, smooth-scaled, red skin that appears eel-like with visible yellow flowing veins underneath. The creature has long feet and walks on its toes, giving it the appearance of "reversed knees".

items.name: Firenewt Mucus (vial)
items.description: A firenewt typically lives in a hot, moist environment, which gives them a thin coating of mucus on their skin. Alchemists often use the mucus to make lubricants.

Firenewt Warrior.name: Firenewt Warrior
Firenewt Warrior.description: A reptilian humanoid about the size of a slim human. The creature has a long neck and a simple snake-like face with large, inky-black eyes. Its translucent, smooth-scaled, red skin that appears eel-like with visible yellow flowing veins underneath. The creature has long feet and walks on its toes, giving it the appearance of "reversed knees".

items.name: Firenewt Mucus (vial)
items.description: A firenewt typically lives in a hot, moist environment, which gives them a thin coating of mucus on their skin. Alchemists often use the mucus to make lubricants.

Flail Snail.name: Flail Snail
Flail Snail.description: An enormous snail that has a slim, soft body with a hard outer shell on its back. It has no legs but slithers on it's soft belly. On its head are five tentacles, with barbed mace-like ends, that are constantly moving swaying slowly if the creature is calm and fast if it is agitated.

items.name: Flail Snail Barbed Flail
items.description: Each of the flail snail's tentacles end in a barbed ball of hard bone. Most of these bones are fractured and cracked, from years of use. However, it may be possible to find one intact. The bone is valued by weaponsmiths.

items.name: Flail Snail Slime (3 vials)
items.description: The flail snail is covered in a slick and sticky substance. It may be possible to harvest a pure sample of this slime from a gland in the creature's belly. Alchemists can use the slime to make lubricants and oils.

items.name: Flail Snail Shell
items.description: This incredibly hard shell is constantly coated by the flail snail's slime, which hardens over time, providing layer-upon-layer of protection. After years, the shell gets a metallic, rainbow sheen. While large and heavy, its hard surface is valued among most merchants.

Flameskull.name: Flameskull
Flameskull.description: A disembodied floating skull wreathed in an eerie blazing green flame.

items.name: Flameskull Ashes (small pouch)
items.description:
As a flameskull's green flame fades, it often leaves behind a small amount of grayish-green ash. The ash has many arcane properties that can be used to enhance spell effects.

Use: A character may use the flameskull's ashes, in addition to the spells other material components, to upcast a spell by a single level.

items.name: Flameskull Skull
items.description: As a flameskull is fashioned from the remains of a former spellcaster, the cursed skull contains residual traces of magic. The skull is useful among the arcane community, especially with divination casters.

Flesh Golem.name: Flesh Golem
Flesh Golem.description: This humanoid creature is an 8-foot tall ghoulish collection of body parts, stitched together into a single composite form. It walks and moves with a stiff-jointed gait, as if not in complete control of its body. It is wearing a ragged pair of trousers flesh golems wear whatever their creator wishes.

items.name: Flesh Golem Heart
items.description: The heart of a flesh golem is difficult to harvest, as the body begins to decay very quickly upon death. During the golem's creation, the creature is infused with an elemental spirit, traces of which remain embedded in the heart. The heart is useful to artificers and other spellcasters.

items.name: Flesh Golem Muscle Fiber
items.description: Being magically animated, some of the flesh golem's muscle fibers may still contain trace amounts of magic. These fibers still twitch slightly, even after the golem is destroyed. Artificers and magic users, especially necromancers, may find these muscle fibers worth studying.

items.name: Flesh Golem Manual Ashes (vial, small pouch)
items.description: The final step of creating a new golem is to sprinkle the ashes of the manual of golem creation over the inanimate body. Harvesting these ashes can be difficult, as they are tiny and hard to find. The ashes don't retain the power they had prior to the golem's creation, but still have value in the arcane community.

Flind.name: Flind
Flind.description: The creature is a human-hyena hybrid. It is extremely lean, muscular and tall, standing over 7 feet high. It has greenish-gray skin, most of which is covered by mangy brown fur, matted with blood and crude war paint. It also has a reddish-gray crest-like mane. It carries a three-headed flail, that is swings about with skill.

items.name: Gnoll Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Gnoll teeth can be used to create jewelry and decorations. However, the teeth are often used to show proof of a gnoll's death, in order to collect a bounty.

items.name: Mark of Yeenoghu
items.description: This mark, a brand of a triple-headed flail, is used to pay homage to Yeenoghu, the Ruler of Ruin, a demon lord worshipped by gnolls. The mark has little artistic worth, but it has value among demonologists, summoners, and those that study the abyss.

items.name: Flind's Heart
items.description: A flind is touched by Yeenoghu, a demon lord worshipped by gnolls. Their heart is a black mass of flesh, that still retains a tiny connection to its abyssal lord. Alchemists, demonologists, summoners and other spellcasters all have uses for the heart.

Flumph.name: Flumph
Flumph.description: The creature's body is a flat, 2 foot diameter saucer, about 4 inches thick in the middle and tapering off at the edges. A small circular hole is located at the center of its topside. It has two 6‑inch-long eyestalks on either side of the central hole, as well as numerous tentacles and small spikes that grow from the underside. The creature floats slightly above the ground, meandering from place to place.

items.name: Flumph Stench (Vial)
items.description:
A flumph has a gland that secretes a harmless, yet irritating spray, similar to a skunk. The fluid in the gland can be harvested and sold to perfumers and aromatologists, who can change the noxious liquid into a very pleasant perfume. Hunters can use the vial to mark hunting areas, disguise one's own scent, and scare off certain predators. 

Use: As an action, you may throw the vial of flumph stench up to 20 feet away, shattering it on impact. Each creature within 5 feet of the target location must succeed a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be coated in the foul-smelling liquid. A coated creature exudes a horrible stench for [[/r 1d4]] hours. The coated creature is
poisoned as long as the stench lasts. A creature can remove the stench on itself by using a short rest to bathe in water, alcohol, or vinegar.

items.name: Flumph Membrane
items.description:
A flumph's skin is a thin, semi-translucent membrane that gives it immunity to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as all divination spells. Spellcasters value the membrane for its protective properties.

Use: A creature can place the membrane on its head and use an action to focus, immediately absorbing the membrane's psionic power. For the next hour the creature is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as all divination spells.

items.name: Flumph Brain Stem
items.description: The flumph has a small gland on it's brain stem that controls it's psionic abilities. Harvesting the brain stem is valuable among those that study telepathy and powers.

Flying Snake.name: Flying Snake
Flying Snake.description: A reptile with a long, thin body but no legs. It has a large mouth with two sharp fangs and two small wings on its back. The creature is about 2-3 feet long.

items.name: Flying Snake Skin
items.description: A snake's skin can be used in the creation of boots, belts and other apparel. A regular size snake only has enough harvestable skin to create a single belt. Some tailors may refuse to purchase a single skin, as more skins are needed for most apparel.

Flying Sword.name: Flying Sword
Flying Sword.description: A floating sword or any other selected weapon, dances through the air.

items.name: Animated Sigil Material
items.description: Magical dust, ash and powder, the salvaged remains of a magical rune, often used to animate certain constructs.

Fomorian.name: Fomorian
Fomorian.description: Obviously a race of giant-kin, yet hideously deformed. Its has purple-gray, hairless skin pocked with large warts. Its head is misshapen, with one eye larger than the other -- the larger eye with a cat-like iris. Its humanoid form has disproportionate and crooked limbs, a humpback, and a crooked mouth with teeth of various size.

items.name: Fomorian Puss
items.description: A fomorian is often covered in pustules, blisters and boils, which contain a thick yellow puss. Alchemists can use the disgusting liquid in various concoctions, including glues and salves.

items.name: Fomorian "Evil Eye"
items.description: The large, yellow, cat-like eye of the fomorian has a debilitating, curse-like effect on creatures. The eye can be difficult to harvest without popping, but has various uses.

Fraz-Urb'luu.name: Fraz-Urb'luu
Fraz-Urb'luu.description: Fraz-Urb'luu resembles a 12-foot tall great gargoyle with an extended muscular neck; a smiling face framed by long, pointed ears and lank, dark hair; and bat-like wings are furled against his powerful shoulders.

items.name: Fraz-Urb'luu's Hair (pouch)
items.description: The hair of Fraz-Urb'luu frames the sides of its large face, much like a dirty beard. The hair is swirling with arcane energy, mainly from the school of illusion. The hair is prized by illusionist and other spellcasters, and can be used in potions and elixirs that cause hallucinogenic visions.

items.name: Fraz-Urb'luu's Hide
items.description: The hide of Fraz-Urb'luu torso is hard, thick, and resembles a rock surface. A master leatherworker can use the hide to create strong leather armor that looks like stone.

items.name: Fraz-Urb'luu's Head
items.description: Fraz-Urb'luu's head has a large, smiling face framed by long, pointed ears. A master leatherworker can create a mask from the creatures head. The craftsman carefully removes the skin from the head, treats the material, stretches the skin over a metal faceplate, and have a spellcaster perform several rituals on the mask using the creatures eyes, tongue and brain.

Frog.name: Frog
Frog.description: The tiny amphibious creature has smooth, moist skin and big, bulging eyes. Its hind legs are more than twice as long as its front ones, with webbed feet. It has a large toothless maw and a long tongue.

items.name: Frog Carcass
items.description: If the frogs carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's eyes, tongue, legs, and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Frog, Giant.name: Frog, Giant
Frog, Giant.description: This monstrous creature is about 6 feet long and weighs about 250 pounds. This amphibious creature has smooth, moist skin and big, bulging eyes. Its hind legs are more than twice as long as its front ones, with webbed feet. It has a large toothless maw and a long tongue.

items.name: Frog Mucus (5 vials)
items.description: The giant frog has an enormous gaping mouth, a long sticky tongue, and a large amount of thick mucus. Alchemists often use the mucus to make adhesives.

Froghemoth.name: Froghemoth
Froghemoth.description: An elephant-sized amphibious predator with four tentacles, three eyes on top of its head, and a wide mouth full of sharp teeth. It stands on two short, thick stumpy legs that each end in 4 stubby digits.

items.name: Froghemoth Saliva (5 vials)
items.description: The saliva of a froghemoth is a clear, sticky substance with a green-yellow tint. The saliva has a great deal of medicinal properties, and is valued by healers and doctors.

items.name: Froghemoth Eye (x3)
items.description: The squishy eyes of a froghemoth are used to create salves and unguents. Alchemists and healers tend to buy these when available.

items.name: Froghemoth Tongue
items.description: The froghemoth's tongue can be dried and stretched into strands, and then coated and treated with various oils. The long, rope-like filaments can then be crafted into various weapons and ropes.

Frost Giant.name: Frost Giant
Frost Giant.description: The giant has light blue skin and light blue eyes. He has long white hair and a white shaggy beard, covered in frost and icicles. He's wearing the skins or pelts of animals. He has on a large set of chainmail, and a helmet adorned with two large horns.

items.name: Lock of Frost Giant Hair
items.description: Long strands of incredibly cold hair, almost always covered in frost. The hair is often white with a blue sheen. The hair stays cold, even after the frost giant's death, making them extremely useful in lining bags to keep items cold. The hair is highly valued Highly valued among tailors, weavers and textile makers.

items.name: Frost Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a frost giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Frost Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A frost giant's blood is a translucent red liquid that is extremely cold. It must be harvested quickly, as the blood hardens like ice when exposed to air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Frost Giant Skin
items.description: A frost giant's skin is tough to harvest, as it starts to hardened like ice quickly after death. Once collected, the skin is highly insulated and provides a large degree of protection from the cold. Expert leatherworkers can treat and coat the skin, making it a great insulator for lining apparel.

Frost Giant Everlasting One.name: Frost Giant Everlasting One
Frost Giant Everlasting One.description: The giant has light blue skin and light blue eyes. He has long white hair and a white shaggy beard, covered in frost and icicles. He's wearing the skins or pelts of animals. He has on a large set of chainmail, and a helmet adorned with two large horns.

items.name: Lock of Frost Giant Hair
items.description: Long strands of incredibly cold hair, almost always covered in frost. The hair is often white with a blue sheen. The hair stays cold, even after the frost giant's death, making them extremely useful in lining bags to keep items cold. The hair is highly valued Highly valued among tailors, weavers and textile makers.

items.name: Frost Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a frost giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Frost Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A frost giant's blood is a translucent red liquid that is extremely cold. It must be harvested quickly, as the blood hardens like ice when exposed to air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Frost Giant Skin
items.description: A frost giant's skin is tough to harvest, as it starts to hardened like ice quickly after death. Once collected, the skin is highly insulated and provides a large degree of protection from the cold. Expert leatherworkers can treat and coat the skin, making it a great insulator for lining apparel.

Frost Salamander.name: Frost Salamander
Frost Salamander.description: Frost salamanders are magical beasts that mainly inhabit the elemental planes. It has an ice-blue, six-legged serpentine body, a reptilian head, and a very long tail. Its sharp claws resemble icicles, which they use for combat and climbing up slippery slopes.

items.name: Frost Salamander Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A salamander's blood is a thick, vivid white-blue fluid with a faint glow. The blood is ice-cold, and freezes when exposed to air. The blood is often used to preserve food and other items.

items.name: Frost Salamander Hide
items.description: The tough, scaled hide of a Frost Salamander has a blue, metallic sheen. Azer's often hunt these creatures for their hide to make armor.

items.name: Frost Salamander Claws
items.description: A frost salamander's claws resemble curved shards of sharp ice. They are hard as steel and always feel cold to the touch. Once the creature dies, if they are not harvested fast enough, they begin to crack and then melt. Azer often hunt these creatures for their claws to make weapons.

Gaj.name: Gaj
Gaj.description: Gaj are insect-like creatures with a hard exoskeleton and six legs. Its head is about 2 feet in diameter with 6 compound eyes, 6 finger-like mandibles, and 3 feathery antennae protruding from the top. Gaj prefer to ambush prey by burying themselves under sand or silt and lying in wait.

items.name: Gaj Mandibles (x6)
items.description: Gaj have six sharp, finger-like mandibles around its mouth. The mandibles can be fashioned into small weapons (daggers), tools and crude jewelry.

items.name: Gaj's Pineal Gland
items.description: It may be possible to harvest the pineal gland from a Gaj's brain. The pineal gland is a small, pine-cone shaped lump of flesh. It is believed to be the center of psychic abilities, allowing the creature to paralyze others. Alchemists and spellcasters can use the gland to create paralytic potions and effects.

items.name: Gaj Plates (x2)
items.description: A gaj has a hard exoskelton, made up of thick chitinous plates. Upon death, the exoskeleton immediately becomes brittle. If careful, some of these plates can be remove without cracking. A skilled armorer can treat the plates and make them into effective shields and armor.

items.name: Gaj Antennae (x3)
items.description: Three feathery antennae are located the Gaj's forehead. In order to retain its magical properties, each antennae must be removed whole. If the antennae rips or snaps, the entire antennae breaks apart and is lost. The antennae are known for their mind-probing  properties, and are valued by divinators and other spellcaster.  Alchemists may be able to use the antennae to make mind-reading potions.

Galeb-Duhr.name: Galeb-Duhr
Galeb-Duhr.description: A large rock-like humanoid, whose body matches the surrounding stone, lumbers forward. It has foreboding eyes, a wide mouth, two stout legs and two bulky arms. The creature stands at about 8 feet tall ranged between 4 and 16 feet

items.name: Earth Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: When a Galeb-Duhr crumbles to the ground, it may leave behind a trace amount of essence from the elemental plane of earth. While invisible to the naked eye, a quick ritual can reveal its presence -- a small glowing ball of yellow light. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Galeb-Duhr Core
items.description: When a Galeb-Duhr falls to pieces, the heart of the creature sometimes remains intact. It is a rough, glowing stone about 8 inches thick. The stone is prized by dwarves, and useful in the creation of stone golems.

Gargoyle.name: Gargoyle
Gargoyle.description: The creature resembles winged statues of demon-like humanoids.

items.name: Gargoyle Talons (x2)
items.description: When a gargoyle is destroyed, much of its body crumbles to the ground. However, it may be possible to salvage an intact stone talon or two. These stone talons are valued by artificers and animators, and sometimes contain traces of arcane magic.

items.name: Gargoyle Heart
items.description: At the center of a gargoyle is a faceted black stone of obsidian, that swirls with dark magical energy. If the stone doesn't shatter upon the creatures destruction, it may be collected. Dwarves value the stone for it's beauty and magic users prize the stone for its arcane properties.

Gas Spore.name: Gas Spore
Gas Spore.description: A spherical, balloon-like creature with a central false eye and ten root-like growths on its top, which resembled a beholder's central eye and eyestalks.

items.name: Gas Spore Gas (vial)
items.description: The gas spore floats using a mixture of gases, which include trace amounts of helium. It is possible to collect a sample of those gases before they disperse. Tinkerers and artificers may find uses for the gases. Alchemists may be able to use the gases to aid in potion creation. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Gas Spore Spores (pouch)
items.description: These spores disperse quickly and must be harvested with some haste. They are light, white balls about half a millimeter wide that float through the air. Dwarves and underground dwellers value the spores, but others may find them useful as well.

Gauth.name: Gauth
Gauth.description: A floating 5 foot ball with a large central eye, which is surrounded by a ridge of flesh and 13 smaller. Extending from the body are six eyestalks, along with four feeding tendrils on lower half of its body. The creature has brown flesh although mottled purple and gray were common. Some gauth have similar colors and textures to other beholders in their colony.

items.name: Gauth Stomach
items.description: A gauth's stomach contains a mixture of magical enzymes and chemicals that have the ability to nullify magic. The stomach is highly valued by magic users and certain alchemists. Use: Using an action, you can rupture the stomach and spill the contents onto a magical item. The item will lose all it's magical properties for 24 hours, as well as [[/r 1d4]] charges (if it is a charged item). The stomach contents do not affect artefacts or legendary items.

items.name: Gauth Eyestalk
items.description: Gauth eyestalks are valued by magic users, enchanters and artificers. Once successfully harvested, roll [[/r 1d6]] for the type of eyestalk received (1. Devour Magic, 2. Enervation, 3. Pushing, 4. Fire, 5. Paralyzing, 6. Sleep). See VGM p125 for more details on the Gauth

items.name: Large Gauth Eye
items.description: The gauth's large eye has a stunning gaze. The eye can be used by alchemists to create poisons. Magic users and artificers may be able to use the eye's lens to create magic items.

Gazer.name: Gazer
Gazer.description: The creature is a tiny beholder about 10 inches across. The creature has a large central eye and four small  eyestalks. It has a wide mouth full of teeth.

items.name: Gazer Eyestalk
items.description: Gazer eyestalks are valued by magic users, enchanters and artificers. Once successfully harvested, roll [[/r 1d4]] for the type of eyestalk received (1. Dazing, 2. Fear, 3. Frost, 4. Telekinetic). See VGM p126 for more details on the Gazer

items.name: Large Gazer Eye
items.description: The large eye of a gazer can be useful to magic users and certain alchemists.Use: Along with 100gp worth of rare components and spending 2 hours of preparation, the gazer's eye can be prepped for use in the find familiar spell. When casting find familiar, you may expend this prepared eye instead of the usual material components. The summoned familiar takes the form of a gazer instead of the usual choices. This gazer has all of the normal abilities of a familiar, as well as its normal abilities as a gazer. This familiar lasts until it either drops to 0 hit points or is dismissed. See VGM p126 for more details on the Gazer

Gelatinous Cube.name: Gelatinous Cube
Gelatinous Cube.description: A 10-foot high transparent ooze in the shape of a cube. Bits of debris float in its gelatinous body.

items.name: Gelatinous Cube Slime (vial)
items.description: The gelatinous, transparent cube begins to melt and lose it's form on death. The slime is extremely viscous, and has an acidic smell that burns the eyes. Samples of this ooze are often bought by alchemists and most merchants.

Gem Stalker.name: Gem Stalker
Gem Stalker.description: A gem stalker has a humanoid-like torso attached to a four-legged body resembling that of a wingless dragon. Its head has milk-white eyes and no mouth. Its skin is typically the color of the gem dragon that created it, and is studded with bright crystals that pulse with psychic energy.

items.name: Gem Stalker Claws (pouch)
items.description: Gem Stalker's claws resemble rock-hard gems, but are actually a semitranslucent bone. The claws are often used in jewelry and decorations.

items.name: Gem Stalker Crystal Shards (pouch)
items.description:
A gem stalker's skin is studded with bright, pulsing crystals (the crystals resemble the gems of the gem dragon that created the creature). When the creature is slain, most of the crystal begin to fade, but some may be recovered if harvested quickly. [[/r 1d8]]+4 crystals can be harvested from the creature, each radiating with psychic energy.

Use: A creature can use an action to make a ranged attack to throw one of the crystals at a target within 10 feet, that it can see. On a successful hit, the target takes 7 ([[/r 1d10]] + 2) force damage, and one of the following effects occurs, determined by the kind of dragon that created the gem stalker:

Amethyst. The target teleports to a random unoccupied space within 30 feet.
Crystal. The creature that threw the crystal gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.
Emerald. The target must roll a d4 and subtract the number from the next attack roll it makes.
Sapphire. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be pushed horizontally up to 10 feet away from the creature and be knocked prone.
Topaz. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Gem Stalker Heart Gem
items.description: The heart of a gem stalker is actually a glowing crystal, about the size of a fist, that sings with psychic energy. The gem is prized by spellcasters, and often used by artificers as a small energy source.

Geryon.name: Geryon
Geryon.description: Geryon stands about 10 feet tall, with an upper humanoid body, and a long serpentine lower half that stretches up to 30 feet, and ends in a venom-dripping barb. His humanoid torso is muscular with large, bestial arms ending in clawed hands. A massive set of bat-like wings protrude from his back. Despite his horrifying appearance, his human face is quite handsome, with sharp facial features and long brown hair.

items.name: Geryon Blood (9 vials)
items.description:
Geryon's blood is reddish fluid with swirls of green chemical trails. The blood has both toxic and regenerative abilities, making it highly valued among alchemists. The blood is also extremely poisonous, and does not need to be refined in order to be used as a poison. It also doesn't expire or dry like most blood.

Poison of Geryon: A creature can coat up to 3 pieces of ammunition or 1 melee weapon. Applying the poison takes an action. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until a creature is exposed to the poison. Any creature successfully hit must succeed a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or suffer [[/r 2d12]] poison damage and be poisoned until it finishes a short or long rest. This poison can sell for 300gp.

items.name: Geryon's Hide
items.description: The long, scaly, serpent-like tail of Geryon has extremely tough skin that resonates with hellish arcane energy. It can be used to make magical Scale Mail and other leather goods.

items.name: Geryon's Stinger
items.description: Geryon's snake-like tail ends in a large, barbed, poisonous stinger. It is about the size of a football, and is as hard as steel. The stinger may be used to create a special poisonous dagger.

Ghast.name: Ghast
Ghast.description: The humanoid creature is covered in decaying flesh, with parts of bones and muscles visible. It is slender and ghost-like, with pale skin. Its fingers are slightly elongated, ending in sharp claws. It's teeth are sharp, jagged and rotting, and a long tongue hangs from its mouth. The stench of death and rot linger in the air.

items.name: Ghast Blood (3 vials)
items.description:
A ghast's blood is black and tar-like. It has value among the arcane community, especially with necromancers. Alchemists may also find it useful in their concoctions

Use: A creature may spend 1 minute covering itself in ghast blood. Undead creatures with an Intelligence of less than 10 have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to find the covered creature. This effect lasts for 1 hour or until the blood is washed off.

items.name: Ghast Claws (x2)
items.description: A ghast's claws are covered in a numbing paralytic, which makes their claws useful. Harvesting the claws incorrectly can destroy the paralytic. Some alchemists, artificers and other spellcasters can use these claws in the craft.

items.name: Ghast Skin
items.description: A ghast's skin must be harvested with great care, as the decaying flesh does not hold together well. The flesh is used by alchemists and those that study undead.

Ghost.name: Ghost
Ghost.description: A transparent, humanoid form ghosts often appear as they did in life.

items.name: Ghost Ectoplasm
items.description: A ghost leaves behind a thick, clear, extremely sticky substance with ties to the Ethereal Plane. The substance must be harvested quickly, and must be collected in an enchanted container, before it disperses. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Spirit Shard
items.description: When a ghost disperses, a trace amount of its spiritual essence is briefly left behind. It may be possible to collect this essence using a gem worth at least 100gp. A ritual can capture the essence into the gem, creating a spirit shard. The gem contains a small amount of arcane energy that spellcasters (especially necromancers) may be able to use and study. In addition, using the gem, a magic user with specific training may be able to pull the memories from the ghost's past life.

Ghost Dragon.name: Ghost Dragon
Ghost Dragon.description: A ghost dragon is a translucent and incorporeal version of the original dragon.

items.name: Ghost Ectoplasm (9 flasks)
items.description: A ghost dragon leaves behind a thick, clear, extremely sticky substance with ties to the Ethereal Plane. The substance must be harvested quickly, and must be collected in an enchanted container, before it disperses. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Ghost Dragon Spirit Shard
items.description: When a ghost dragon disperses, a trace amount of its spiritual essence is briefly left behind. It may be possible to collect this essence using a gem worth at least 500gp. A ritual can capture the essence into the gem, creating a spirit shard. The gem contains arcane energy that spellcasters (especially necromancers) may be able to use and study. In addition, using the gem, a magic user with specific training may be able to pull the memories from the ghost's past life.

Ghoul.name: Ghoul
Ghoul.description: An emaciated, roughly humanoid creature with an almost-hairless mottled, decaying hide stretched tight over its bones. It has the sharp teeth of a carnivore and sunken eyes that burn as if they were hot coals.

items.name: Ghoul Claws (x2)
items.description: A ghoul's claws are covered in a numbing paralytic, which makes their claws useful. Harvesting the claws incorrectly can destroy the paralytic. Some alchemists, artificers and other spellcasters can use these claws in the craft.

items.name: Ghoul Skin
items.description: A ghoul's skin must be harvested with great care, as the decaying flesh does not hold together well. The flesh is used by alchemists and those that study undead.

Giant Shark.name: Giant Shark
Giant Shark.description: This monstrous sharks is around ​50 feet long It averages 20-65 feet long, some reaching as much as 90 feet. It weighs around 10‒60 tons. It has tough, dull gray skin that is roughened by toothlike scales. It has a muscular, asymmetrical, upturned tail and pointed fins. It also has a pointed snout extending forward and over a crescentic mouth set with sharp triangular teeth.

items.name: Giant Shark Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A shark's teeth are extremely sharp, triangular pieces of dentin covered in a hard coating of enamel. The teeth are used in jewelry and decoration, but can also be used to make serrate blades and saws.

items.name: Giant Shark Skin
items.description: A shark's skin is covered in small, rough, hard scales. Leatherworkers dry and treat the leather, then grind down the scales to make the leather smoother and easier to handle, giving it a pebbled appearance.

Giant Space Hamster.name: Giant Space Hamster
Giant Space Hamster.description: Giant space hamsters resemble normal hamsters, both in appearance and general demeanor, but are as big as brown bears.

items.name: Space Hamster Claws/Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: The claws of the space hamster, and sometimes the teeth, can be used in decorations and jewelry.

items.name: Space Hamster Pelt
items.description: A space hamster's pelt can be made into anything from rugs to coats to bedspreads. Once removed from the corpse, typically with a skinning knife, the hide ranges from 6-8 feet long.

Giant Spider.name: Giant Spider
Giant Spider.description: An giant arachnid, about the side of a horse, having eight legs and a body divided into two parts. The creature has sharp fangs, black eyes and a spinneret to create webs.

items.name: Spider Silk
items.description: A giant spider has a spinneret in its abdomen where white silk thread can be harvested. A skilled harvester can extract over 100 feet of thread. Weavers use the thread to create a light, soft, lustrous fabric.

items.name: Spider Venom (3 vials)
items.description:
A spider has a venomous bite. The venom can be extracted and refined into a poison.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests 1 vial of venom that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Spider Bite Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hour and 100gp worth of material to create Spider Bite Poison (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Spider Bite Poison  (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Giant Strider.name: Giant Strider
Giant Strider.description: An ostrich-like, featherless, flightless bird covered in mottled, leathery dusky red skin. Its eyes glow a dull red. Its beak-like jaws are lined with razor-sharp teeth and steam constantly billows from its noses. It stands about 8 feet tall.

items.name: Giant Strider Beak
items.description: A giant strider's beak is hard as stone, and can be used by various craftsmen and toolmakers.

items.name: Giant Strider Hide
items.description: The reptilian skin of a giant strider is tough and sturdy. A leatherworker can work the skin into a tough leather.

items.name: Giant Strider Fire Glands
items.description:
The giant strider's fire glands are a bundle of sacs that contain various caustic chemicals. When these chemicals combine and are passed into the throat, it allows the giant strider to spew forth a burst of fire. Alchemists can pull some useful chemicals from these glands.

Use: As an action, a creature can throw the bundle of glands up to 20 feet away. Upon impact, the glands explode. Any creature within 10 feet of the explosion must roll a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed roll, the creature takes [[/r 3d6]] fire damage, and half damage if saved.

Giant Wolf Spider.name: Giant Wolf Spider
Giant Wolf Spider.description: An giant brown arachnid, about the side of a horse, having eight legs and a body divided into two parts. The creature has sharp fangs, eight black eyes and a spinneret to create webs.

items.name: Spider Silk
items.description: A wolf spider has a spinneret in its abdomen where white silk thread can be harvested. A skilled harvester can extract over 100 feet of thread. Weavers use the thread to create a light, soft, lustrous fabric.

items.name: Wolf Spider Venom (vial)
items.description:
A wolf spider has a venomous bite. The venom can be extracted and refined into a poison.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests 1 vial of venom that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Wolf Spider Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hour and 100gp worth of material to create Wolf Spider Poison (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Wolf Spider Poison  (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Gibbering Mouther.name: Gibbering Mouther
Gibbering Mouther.description: A large blob composed entirely of mouths and eyes. When the eyes and mouths are closed, the creature resembles a large lump of earth.

items.name: Gibbering Mouther Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: A gibbering mouther's teeth is an assorted collection of molars, incisors and fangs from all kinds of creatures. The teeth can be used to create jewelry and decorations.

items.name: Gibbering Mouther Saliva (vial)
items.description:
On closer inspection, a gibbering mouther's saliva appears to be a mixture of saliva from various creatures. The saliva has a sharp acidic smell that is so strong it burns the eyes and nose.

Use: As an action, the vial of saliva can be thrown up to 20 feet. The vial explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact. Each creature within 5
feet of the flash must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mouther's next turn.

Giff Shipmate.name: Giff Shipmate
Giff Shipmate.description: Burly, 7-foot tall, hippopotamus-headed humanoids with grey skin.

items.name: Giff Ears (x2)
items.description: Two round, leathery ears protrude from the top-rear of a giffs head. The ears have little value to most people, but some towns offer a bounty for these ears (especially settlements that have been raided or attacked by Giff soldiers).

items.name: Giff Hide
items.description: Giff have a thick gray leathery hide. Common merchants can easily mistake the hide for that of a small hippopotamus. Giff will know the difference immediately.

items.name: Giff Teeth (x2)
items.description: Giff have two large teeth on their lower jaw that engravers find valuable. The teeth can be used to create small crafts, jewelry and decorations.

Giff Shock Trooper.name: Giff Shock Trooper
Giff Shock Trooper.description: Burly, 7-foot tall, hippopotamus-headed humanoids with grey skin.

items.name: Giff Ears (x2)
items.description: Two round, leathery ears protrude from the top-rear of a giffs head. The ears have little value to most people, but some towns offer a bounty for these ears (especially settlements that have been raided or attacked by Giff soldiers).

items.name: Giff Hide
items.description: Giff have a thick gray leathery hide. Common merchants can easily mistake the hide for that of a small hippopotamus. Giff will know the difference immediately.

items.name: Giff Teeth (x2)
items.description: Giff have two large teeth on their lower jaw that engravers find valuable. The teeth can be used to create small crafts, jewelry and decorations.

Giff Warlord.name: Giff Warlord
Giff Warlord.description: Burly, 7-foot tall, hippopotamus-headed humanoids with grey skin.

items.name: Giff Ears (x2)

items.name: Giff Hide
items.description: Giff have a thick gray leathery hide. Common merchants can easily mistake the hide for that of a small hippopotamus. Giff will know the difference immediately.

items.name: Giff Teeth (x2)
items.description: Giff have two large teeth on their lower jaw that engravers find valuable. The teeth can be used to create small crafts, jewelry and decorations.

Girallon.name: Girallon
Girallon.description: The creature appears to be a four-armed ape with thick white fur and curved tusks in its mouth. It stands about 8 feet tall and weighs around 800 lbs.

Githyanki Buccaneer.name: Githyanki Buccaneer
Githyanki Buccaneer.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and ears that are pointed and serrated in the back. He/she has black hair red is common as well styled in a topknot.

items.name: Githyanki Heart
items.description: Githyanki normally reside in the Astral Plane, and they don't age while there. However, when they return to the Prime Material Plane, time immediately catches up to them and they age quickly. This rapid change does unique things to a body, which is a fascination to most scientists and those that study the Astral Plane.

items.name: Githyanki Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githyanki brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and many spellcasters.

Githyanki Gish.name: Githyanki Gish
Githyanki Gish.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and ears that are pointed and serrated in the back. He/she has black hair red is common as well styled in a topknot.

items.name: Githyanki Heart
items.description: Githyanki normally reside in the Astral Plane, and they don't age while there. However, when they return to the Prime Material Plane, time immediately catches up to them and they age quickly. This rapid change does unique things to a body, which is a fascination to most scientists and those that study the Astral Plane.

items.name: Githyanki Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githyanki brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and many spellcasters. The brain fluid is especially valuable to alchemists.

Githyanki Kith'rak.name: Githyanki Kith'rak
Githyanki Kith'rak.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and ears that are pointed and serrated in the back. items.name: Githyanki Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githyanki brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and many spellcasters. The brain fluid is especially valuable to alchemists.

Githyanki Knight.name: Githyanki Knight
Githyanki Knight.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and ears that are pointed and serrated in the back. He/she has black hair red is common as well styled in a topknot.

items.name: Githyanki Braid
items.description: A githyanki knight has an intricate braid in its hair. Intricate metallic rings are weaved into the braid, each noting a significant victory in the githyank's life. The braid is a prized trophy, or it can be sold for the hair and jewelry.

items.name: Githyanki Heart
items.description: Githyanki normally reside in the Astral Plane, and they don't age while there. However, when they return to the Prime Material Plane, time immediately catches up to them and they age quickly. This rapid change does unique things to a body, which is a fascination to most scientists and those that study the Astral Plane.

items.name: Githyanki Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githyanki brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and many spellcasters.

Githyanki Xenomancer.name: Githyanki Xenomancer
Githyanki Xenomancer.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and ears that are pointed and serrated in the back. He/she has black hair red is common as well styled in a topknot.

However, when they return to the Prime Material Plane, time immediately catches up to them and they age quickly. This rapid change does unique things to a body, which is a fascination to most scientists and those that study the Astral Plane.

items.name: Githyanki Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githyanki brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and many spellcasters.

Githzerai Anarch.name: Githzerai Anarch
Githzerai Anarch.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin sometimes green or brownish tones and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and pointed ears. He/she has black hair although russet and gray are common. Male githzerai either wear braids or shave their head, with carefully groom their facial hair. Female githzerai usually wear their hair in buns or braids.

items.name: Githzerai Heart
items.description: A githzerai heart that has been subjected to the ever-changing chaos of Limbo for a long period of time is a prized specimen for spellcasters and those that study Limbo.

items.name: Githzerai Anarch Tattoo (x3)
items.description: Ritualistic tattoos are common among githzerai, and an Anarchs flesh are covered with symbols that resonate with psionic power. Peeling the skin off intact can be difficult, but there are those that will pay well for the tattoos.

items.name: Githzerai Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githzerai brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and spellcasters.

Githzerai Enlightened.name: Githzerai Enlightened
Githzerai Enlightened.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin sometimes green or brownish tones and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and pointed ears. He/she has black hair although russet and gray are common. Male githzerai either wear braids or shave their head, with carefully groom their facial hair. Female githzerai usually wear their hair in buns or braids.

items.name: Githzerai Heart
items.description: A githzerai heart that has been subjected to the ever-changing chaos of Limbo for a long period of time is a prized specimen for spellcasters and those that study Limbo.

items.name: Githzerai Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githzerai brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and spellcasters.

Githzerai Monk.name: Githzerai Monk
Githzerai Monk.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin sometimes green or brownish tones and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and pointed ears. He/she has black hair although russet and gray are common. Male githzerai either wear braids or shave their head, with carefully groom their facial hair. Female githzerai usually wear their hair in buns or braids.

items.name: Githzerai Heart
items.description: A githzerai heart that has been subjected to the ever-changing chaos of Limbo for a long period of time is a prized specimen for spellcasters and those that study Limbo.

items.name: Githzerai Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githzerai brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and spellcasters.

Githzerai Zerth.name: Githzerai Zerth
Githzerai Zerth.description: The creature is a tall and slender humanoid with rough, leathery yellow skin sometimes green or brownish tones and deep-set, bright black eyes. He/she has a long and angular skull, with a small and highly placed flat nose, sharp teeth, and pointed ears. He/she has black hair although russet and gray are common. Male githzerai either wear braids or shave their head, with carefully groom their facial hair. Female githzerai usually wear their hair in buns or braids.

items.name: Githzerai Heart
items.description: A githzerai heart that has been subjected to the ever-changing chaos of Limbo for a long period of time is a prized specimen for spellcasters and those that study Limbo.

items.name: Githzerai Zerth Tattoo
items.description: Ritualistic tattoos are common among githzerai, but zerth tattoos can be unique and beautiful works of art. Peeling the skin off intact can be difficult, but there are those that will pay well for the tattoos.

items.name: Githzerai Brain
items.description: Being adept at psionics, the githzerai brain is a marvel to those that study telepathy and psychokinesis, including scientists and spellcasters.

Glabrezu.name: Glabrezu
Glabrezu.description: With a broad, muscular body, the creature stands around 12 feet tall average: 9‒15 feet and weighs around 5,500 lb Its most physically bewildering features are its two pairs of arms, each with a different extremity. Its main arms are monstrous limbs that end in powerful pincers, while the smaller humanoid pair end in clawed hands and protrude from above its stomach. Goat horns adorn the top of its canine head and numerous fangs rest in its muzzles. Its wrinkled skin ranges in tone from deep russet to pitch black. A pair of cold, red, piercing eyes hint at its great intelligence, contrasting with its bestial appearance.

items.name: Glabrezu Horn (x2)
items.description: The long horns on a glabrezu's forehead. While the horns can be fashioned into simple instruments and drinking tools, artificers and magic users can repurpose the horns into magical items.

items.name: Glabrezu Claws
items.description: A glabrezu's hard, crab-like pincers are made of a strong fire-proof material. The claws can be fashioned into useful smithy tools.

items.name: Glabrezu Skin
items.description: Being extremely strong and resistant to fire, a glabrezu skin is prized by armorers and leatherworkers.

Gnoll.name: Gnoll
Gnoll.description: The creature is a human-hyena hybrid. It is extremely lean, muscular and tall, standing over 7 feet high. It has greenish-gray skin, most of which is covered by mangy brown fur, matted with blood and crude war paint. It also has a reddish-gray crest-like mane.

items.name: Gnoll Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Gnoll teeth can be used to create jewelry and decorations. However, the teeth are often used to show proof of a gnoll's death, in order to collect a bounty.

Gnoll Fang of Yeenoghu.name: Gnoll Fang of Yeenoghu
Gnoll Fang of Yeenoghu.description: The creature is a human-hyena hybrid, with a possessed look in its eyes. It is extremely lean, muscular and tall, standing over 7 feet high. It has greenish-gray skin, most of which is covered by mangy brown fur, matted with blood and crude war paint. It also has a reddish-gray crest-like mane.

items.name: Gnoll Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Gnoll teeth can be used to create jewelry and decorations. However, the teeth are often used to show proof of a gnoll's death, in order to collect a bounty.

items.name: Mark of Yeenoghu
items.description: This mark, a brand of a triple-headed flail, is used to pay homage to Yeenoghu, the Ruler of Ruin, a demon lord worshipped by gnolls. The mark has little artistic worth, but it has value among demonologists, summoners, and those that study the abyss.

items.name: Fang's Heart
items.description: A Fang of Yeenoghu is touched by Yeenoghu, a demon lord worshipped by gnolls. Their heart is a black mass of flesh, that still retains a tiny connection to its abyssal lord. Alchemists, demonologists, summoners and other spellcasters all have uses for the heart.

Gnoll Flesh Gnawer.name: Gnoll Flesh Gnawer
Gnoll Flesh Gnawer.description: The creature is a human-hyena hybrid. It is extremely lean, muscular and tall, standing over 7 feet high. It has greenish-gray skin, most of which is covered by mangy brown fur, matted with blood and crude war paint. It also has a reddish-gray crest-like mane and wields a shortsword and dagger..

items.name: Gnoll Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Gnoll teeth can be used to create jewelry and decorations. However, the teeth are often used to show proof of a gnoll's death, in order to collect a bounty.

Gnoll Hunter.name: Gnoll Hunter
Gnoll Hunter.description: The creature is a human-hyena hybrid. It is extremely lean, muscular and tall, standing over 7 feet high. It has greenish-gray skin, most of which is covered by mangy brown fur, matted with blood and crude war paint. It also has a reddish-gray crest-like mane and seems to favor ranged weapons.

items.name: Gnoll Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Gnoll teeth can be used to create jewelry and decorations. However, the teeth are often used to show proof of a gnoll's death, in order to collect a bounty.

Gnoll Pack Lord.name: Gnoll Pack Lord
Gnoll Pack Lord.description: The creature is a human-hyena hybrid, larger than the rest of its kind. It is extremely lean, muscular and tall, standing over 8 feet high. It has greenish-gray skin, most of which is covered by mangy brown fur, matted with blood, crude war paint and demonic sigils. It has a reddish-gray crest-like mane and a body covered in brutal piercings and grotesque trophies.

items.name: Gnoll Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Gnoll teeth can be used to create jewelry and decorations. However, the teeth are often used to show proof of a gnoll's death, in order to collect a bounty.

items.name: Mark of Yeenoghu
items.description: This mark, a brand of a triple-headed flail, is used to pay homage to Yeenoghu, the Ruler of Ruin, a demon lord worshipped by gnolls. The mark has little artistic worth, but it has value among demonologists, summoners, and those that study the abyss.

Gnoll Witherling.name: Gnoll Witherling
Gnoll Witherling.description: The creature is a shriveled and emaciated leprous humanoid with a hyena-like head. Its flesh is fully decayed, with an exposed skeletal form covered is tufts of mangy hair. It has sharp claws on each hand, one which grips a simple clubClaws like sharpened horns gripped simple weapons, and whatever teeth the animated corpse had left were tough enough to pierce flesh. What was left of their bodies was primarily bone, and other inedible pieces as the rest of the flesh had typically been devoured.

items.name: Gnoll Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: Gnoll teeth can be used to create jewelry and decorations. However, the teeth are often used to show proof of a gnoll's death, in order to collect a bounty.

Gnome, Deep (Svirfneblin).name: Gnome, Deep (Svirfneblin)
Gnome, Deep (Svirfneblin).description: The gnomes is wiry and lean with gray skin, and yet muscular. He she stands just over 3 feet tall. He is completely bald and beardless she has long gray hair tied in a neat braid behind her head. His her skin is a deep gay color brown is another common skin color among deep gnomes.

items.name: Deep Gnome Skin
items.description: A deep gnome's skin is tough and sturdy, having had to adapt to a grueling life underground. Being an underground dwelling species, the skin holds some properties which may be valued by alchemists and magic users. However, while a reclusive species, deep gnomes are inherently good, and it is highly frowned upon to cut one apart.

Goat.name: Goat
Goat.description: The goat is a four-legged creature, stocky and heavily shouldered, with stout, muscular legs. It has whitish fur, often stained a dirty yellow it is short in summer and long in winter. It has small, stiletto-like horns and weighs under 180 lbs.

items.name: Goat Hide
items.description: A goat is covered in a thick coat fur, often white in color. The coat is primarily used in apparel and bedding.

items.name: Goat Horns (x2)
items.description: A goat's horn is used for protection and to help the goat regulate its body temperature. The horn can be used to make a drinking horn (common in many norse-like societies), or in the creation of an instrument called a Bukkehorn.

Goat, Giant.name: Goat, Giant
Goat, Giant.description: The giant goat is a four-legged creature, about 5 feet tall at the shoulder. It is a stocky animal, with stout, muscular legs and stiletto-like horns. It has whitish fur, often stained a dirty yellow it is short in summer and long in winter.

items.name: Giant Goat Hide
items.description: A giant goat is covered in a thick coat fur, often white in color. The coat is primarily used in apparel and bedding.

items.name: Giant Goat Horn (x2)
items.description: A giant goat's horn is used for protection and to help the goat regulate its body temperature. The horn can be used to make a large drinking horn, or in the creation of an instrument called a Bukkehorn.

Goblin.name: Goblin
Goblin.description: This small goblinoid, standing under 4 feet tall, has a flat face, broad nose, pointed ears, and small, sharp fangs. Its forehead is sloped back, and it has yellow eyes and yellow-green skin skin color varies, with a tribe having the same color skin. Colors include green, yellow, orange and red.

items.name: Goblin Ear (x2)
items.description: Goblin ears have little use. However, most communities will take the ears as proof of killing the creature, and pay a small bounty.

Goblin Boss.name: Goblin Boss
Goblin Boss.description: This small goblinoid, standing under 4 feet tall, has a flat face, broad nose, pointed ears, and small, sharp fangs. Its forehead is sloped back, and it has yellow eyes and yellow-green skin skin color varies, with a tribe having the same color skin. Colors include green, yellow, orange and red.

items.name: Goblin Ear (x2)
items.description: Goblin ears have little use. However, most communities will take the ears as proof of killing the creature, and pay a small bounty.

Gorgon.name: Gorgon
Gorgon.description: A large magical beast that resembles a bull covered in dusky metallic scales.

items.name: Gorgon Oil (3 vials)
items.description: A gorgon lubricates its iron plates with an oil that it secretes. This oil is valued by tinkerer and artificers.

items.name: Gorgon Gas Sac
items.description:
A gorgon has the ability to exhale a petrifying gas. This gas builds up and is stored in a sac at the base of the creatures neck.

If the sac is removed too quickly, or incorrectly, it may burst. On a successful harvesting check, the character harvests the gas sac. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the gas sac. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the petrifying vapor.

Use: As an action you may throw the sac up to 20 feet, where it explodes. Each creature in a 10-foot radius must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effects ends on the target. On a failure, the target is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

items.name: Gorgon Plate
items.description: The gorgon's iron plates are riddled with magical energy. A skilled blacksmith may be able to rework the plates into useful armor and weapons.

items.name: Gorgon Horn (x2)
items.description: A gorgon has two iron horns on top of its head. The horns are heavy and difficult to remove, being attached to the monstrosity's skull. The horns can be fashioned into weapons by adept blacksmiths, or just sold as a trophy.

Goristro.name: Goristro
Goristro.description: The creature has a broad, lumbering frame, standing around 20 feet tall and weighing about 14,000 lbs. It has a muscular, squat, bear-like body, but its arms are long and thick like the trunks of trees. It moves on its knuckles like giant gorillas as it barrels forward.  Wide, hunched shoulders carry a massive head reminiscent of a leering bison, with carnivorous teeth and giant horns that curve upward. Its hands are humanoid in shape, while its legs resemble that of a goat.

items.name: Goristro Fur (large pouch)
items.description: Goristroi fur is short, rough, and radiates heat for some time after death. The fur can be used to make cloaks and other apparel.

items.name: Goristro Blood (7 vials)
items.description: Goristro blood is dark red and always extremely hot. Some alchemists and healers make use of the blood in potions.

items.name: Goristro Hoof (x2)
items.description: A goristro's hooves are strong enough to mash stone to dust. A skilled weaponsmith may be able to use the hooved to create powerful bludgeoning weapons.

items.name: Goristro Horn (x2)
items.description: The horns of the goristro are stronger than steel. Like most horns, they can be reshaped into musical instruments or large drinking horns. They can also be ground into a fine dust, which can be refined and used to strengthen weapons and armor.

Gray Ooze.name: Gray Ooze
Gray Ooze.description: A thick puddle of gray sludge, that closely resembled wet stone or an amorphous rock formation.

items.name: Gray Ooze Sample (vial)
items.description: A gray ooze is a fast flowing, gray liquid with many corrosive properties. The ooze is highly acidic and known to eat through metal and armor. Samples of this ooze are often bought by alchemists and most merchants.

Gray Render.name: Gray Render
Gray Render.description: Gray renders have thick gray hides and heavily muscled shoulders. They are nearly ten feet tall, bipedal, and have six yellow eyes, three on each side of their heads. Their feet and hands are clawed, and they have crocodilian mouths.

items.name: Gray Render Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Gray Renders have thick redish-black blood. The blood is an alchemical ingredient, and sometime used by powerful spellcasters to create bonds between creatures.

items.name: Gray Render Claws (pouch)
items.description: A gray render has sharp, rock-hard talons. The talons can be used in jewelry, decorations, and to make small weapons.

items.name: Gray Render Liver
items.description: A gray render's liver is a dark red, rubbery organ, about 2 feet long, that has many alchemical properties. It helps with bile production, synthesizing proteins, and has many other functions. In addition, the liver also has use in various arcane rituals, or can be used as a food item.

Gray Scavver.name: Gray Scavver
Gray Scavver.description: A shark-like scavengers, with a single large eye on the leading edge of its head. The eye glows while the creature is awake. Its mouth is full of razor sharp teeth. Gray scavvers are 6 feet long and often travel in packs.

items.name: Gray Scavver Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A gray scavver's teeth are extremely sharp, small, triangular pieces of dentin covered in a hard coating of enamel. The teeth are used in jewelry and decoration.

Gray Slaad.name: Gray Slaad
Gray Slaad.description: The creature resembles a large, gray, bipedal toad with long, sharp claws, a wide mouth filled with pointy teeth and a huge toad-like head with beady eyes.

items.name: Slaad Slime (vial)
items.description: A slaad's skin is covered in a thin layer of clear mucus that smells of sulfur and rot. The slime has various healing and regenerative properties.

items.name: Gray Slaad Hide
items.description: A gray slaad's hide is a thick, rubbery skin. The hide makes a strong leather, but is valued for its magical properties.

items.name: Gray Slaad Control Gem
items.description:
Embedded in a Gray Slaad's brain is a cloudy gray gem, about the size of a child's fist. If obtained while the slaad is alive, the slaad will obey whoever possesses the gem.

Obtaining the Gem from a Living Slaad: Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against imprisonment, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A wish spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem. A greater restoration spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can attempt to remove the gem from an incapacitated slaad . Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 (4dl0) psychic damage to the slaad.

Uses: If a slaad is killed, that slaad's gem can not be used to control other slaadi by itself. However, it's magic can be used to enhance certain spells cast on other slaadi. While holding the gem, any slaad that is targeted by Enthrall, Suggestion, or Charm Monster, will have disadvantage on the creature's Wisdom save.

Graz'zt.name: Graz'zt
Graz'zt.description: Graz'zt appears as a lithe, muscular, 9-foot tall humanoid. His skin shines like polished obsidian and his eyes glitter with malevolent green light. He has perfect yellowed fangs, pointed ears, and six slender fingers on each hand. He is sometimes described as having six small black horns half-hidden amid his thick black hair. He dresses in the most expensive and elegant finery.

items.name: Graz'zt's Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Graz'zt's blood is a thick red fluid that smells sweet. The blood can be used to make a highly intoxicating beverage that causes revelry, and in rare cases rage. The blood can also be used to create a powerful perfume that is believed to charm people.

items.name: Graz'zt's Tongue
items.description:
Graz'zt's tongue is a slab of spongy, red flesh, that hardens upon the creature's death. The tongue can be used by alchemists to create potions of persuasion and charm. 

Use: Rumor has it that a bard who holds the tongue (even if dried out, and preserved), gains a persuasive gift of gab. When performing to a crowd, a creature that holds the tongue will get a +2 to their performance check.

items.name: Graz'zt's Heart
items.description: The heart of Graz'zt is a black mass of flesh, about the size of a cantaloupe, that continues to slowly beat after his death. The heart can be used to create Graz'zt's Charm, a magical amulet imbued with some of the demon lord's power.

Green Abishai.name: Green Abishai
Green Abishai.description: Draconic humanoids, with scaled green skin, large wings on their back and a long tail.

items.name: Green Abishai Scales
items.description: The scales of an abishai are tough and immediately become brittle once the creature dies. As such, each scale must be carefully extracted one-by-one, and then treated with special oils in order to strengthen them again. The scales are highly decorative, and often used in jewelry. Smiths prize the scales for use in scale armor (the scales from 4 abishai are required to create a single set of scale mail).

items.name: Green Abishai Wing (x2)
items.description: The wings of an abishai produce a durable scaly leather. Once the creature is killed, the wings can rip easily, and must be removed with care. The leather can be used in tents, backpacks, clothing and other items.

Green Hag.name: Green Hag
Green Hag.description: The hag has the bodily figure of a withered and hunched female. Her skin is pallid green, bark-like and covered in knobby, cancerous protrusions. She has a tangled mane of vine-like hair, somewhere between a moldy olive green and shady black color. She has amber eyes and needle-sharp fangs. Her fingers wield yellow talons covered in filth. She wears a collection of ragged peasant rags, covering most of her frame.

items.name: Green Hag's Hair (small pouch)
items.description: A green hag has a tangled mane of vine-like hair. Its color is often gray, but sometimes moldy green or black. Due to the hag's abilities, the hair retains trace amounts of magic. Alchemists may find the hair useful in certain potions.

items.name: Green Hag's Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A hag's blood is a black, viscous fluid that smells like rancid swamp water. The blood has arcane properties that can be harnessed by certain spellcasters and alchemists.

items.name: Green Hag's Nails (pouch)
items.description: The nails of a hag are long, filthy, and sharp. After years of wielding magic, the nails become a conduit for the hags power. They must be carefully extracted during a complex ritual in order to retain their usefulness. Alchemists, magic users and other hags find value in this item.

items.name: Green Hag's Eyeball
items.description: Harvesting the hag's eyeball intact is a delicate task. The eye is useful to those that practice divination. It can also be used by alchemists.

Green Slaad.name: Green Slaad
Green Slaad.description: The creature resembles a large, green, bipedal toad with long, sharp claws, a wide mouth filled with pointy teeth and a huge toad-like head with beady eyes.

items.name: Slaad Slime (vial)
items.description: A slaad's skin is covered in a thin layer of clear mucus that smells of sulfur and rot. The slime has various healing and regenerative properties.

items.name: Green Slaad Claws (large pouch)
items.description: A green slaad has long, dark black claws. Due to the slaad's magical abilities, the claws are swirling with arcane power, making them valuable in the arcane community.

items.name: Green Slaad Control Gem
items.description:
Embedded in a Green Slaad's brain is a murky green gem, about the size of a child's fist. If obtained while the slaad is alive, the slaad will obey whoever possesses the gem.

Obtaining the Gem from a Living Slaad: Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against imprisonment, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A wish spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem. A greater restoration spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can attempt to remove the gem from an incapacitated slaad . Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 (4dl0) psychic damage to the slaad.

Uses: If a slaad is killed, that slaad's gem can not be used to control other slaadi by itself. However, it's magic can be used to enhance certain spells cast on other slaadi. While holding the gem, any slaad that is targeted by Enthrall, Suggestion, or Charm Monster, will have disadvantage on the creature's Wisdom save.

Grell.name: Grell
Grell.description: The creature looks like a bulbous floating brain with a wide, sharp beak. It has 10 long tentacles made of hundreds of ring-shaped muscles sheathed in its tough fibrous hide. Sharp barbs line the tip each tentacle. The creature's wrinkled hide has a purple-pink color with older specimens being darker in color than younger ones.

items.name: Grell Tentacle (x2)
items.description: The long tentacles of a grell are tough whip-like arms. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips. Some adept weavers can even make strands small enough to make fabric.

items.name: Grell Poison (vial)
items.description:
A grell has long tentacles that end in a collection of sharp needles. These needles are coated with a paralytic venom which has a numbing effect.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hour and 100gp worth of material to create Grell Poison (DC 11 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Grell Poison (Contact): Grell Poison is similar to Carrion Crawler Mucus (but with a lower DC check, see DMG p258) A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute (a poisoned creature has disadvantage on Attack rolls and Ability Checks). The poisoned creature is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Grell Hide
items.description: The wrinkled hide of a grell has a purple-pink color. Due to the brain-like crevasses, the hide can be difficult to harvest in one piece. The hide can be treated and used to create any kind of leather items, however some artificers and spellcasters can enhance the hide's natural abilities.

Grick.name: Grick
Grick.description: The wormlike creature ends in a head with a tiny pair of eyes and four barbed tentacles unfurling to reveal a hungry, snapping beak. The main body is about 6 feet long, 8 feet with the tentacles.

items.name: Grick Tentacle (x4)
items.description: The grick has 4 thick, rubbery tentacles with sharp barbs near the end. Some Underdark societies hunt gricks for the tentacle meat. When cooked, its texture resembles large calamari, but the meat is much oilier with a sharp acidic taste.

items.name: Grick Skin
items.description: A grick has a thick, snake-like skin. The skin can be used to create all kinds of aparrel and accessories.

Griffon.name: Griffon
Griffon.description: The creature has the muscular body of a lion and the head, forelegs, and wings of an eagle.

items.name: Griffon Talon (x2)
items.description: A griffon has large, curved talons on its eagle-like front claws. These claws are prized trophies, but can be used to create some weapons and tools.

items.name: Griffon Feather (x10)
items.description: A griffon has large eagle-like feathers, often brown and white in color. The feathers can be used in crafts and decorations. Certain feathers are the perfect size for fletching arrows and bolts.

items.name: Griffon Beak
items.description: The large, eagle-like beak is extremely hard, able to puncture armor. The beak may be used to fashion helms, pauldrons and other armaments. Craftsmen can use the beak to make shovels and other tools.

items.name: Griffon Eye (x2)
items.description: An griffon's eagle eyes are known for their exceptional vision, being able to see prey from miles away. As such, artificers and magic users may be able to harness the eye's abilities to create certain magic item. Alchemists and healers may find other uses for the eyes.

Grimlock.name: Grimlock
Grimlock.description: A humanoid creature with thick gray skin. It has sharp teeth and long black, unkempt hair. It has long claw-like nails. Its face is devoid of eyes, instead having skin stretching across where their eye sockets should be some have eyes that are not completely covered, but are milky white, staring blankly forward.

items.name: Grimlock Skin
