items.description: A grimlock's skin is dry and grey, almost hairless. It is not very useful to make leather, but it has many properties that may be of interest to researchers and those that study prolonged exposure to the Underdark.

items.name: Grimlock Brain
items.description: Years of being subjected to the mindflayer's psionics and experiments can transform a humanoids brain. A grimlock's brain is primarily valued by researchers, especially those that study psionics, mindflayers and the Underdark. Brain matter is also a useful alchemical ingredient.

Grung.name: Grung
Grung.description: The 3-foot tall creature resembles a small, frog-like humanoid. It has strong frog-like legs that ends in webbed feet, and has muscular forelimbs with hands having opposable thumbs. It stands upright and moved about in quick, short hops.

items.name: Grung Poison Gland
items.description:
All grungs secrete a substance that is harmless to them but poisonous to other creatures. This oily, clear liquid is produced in a gland near its heart, that is pumped into its bloodstream.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this gland. On a successful check, the character harvests the gland. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the gland is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 6 hours and 75gp worth of material to create Grung Poison (DC 13 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Grung Poison (Contact): Grung poison is a contact poison, and has a similar (but lesser) effect as Drow Poison (DMG p258). A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature touched with this poison must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute (a poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks). This poison usually sells for 150gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Grung Elite Warrior.name: Grung Elite Warrior
Grung Elite Warrior.description: The 3-foot tall creature resembles a small, frog-like humanoid. It has strong frog-like legs that ends in webbed feet, and has muscular forelimbs with hands having opposable thumbs. It stands upright and moved about in quick, short hops.

items.name: Grung Poison Gland
items.description:
All grungs secrete a substance that is harmless to them but poisonous to other creatures. This oily, clear liquid is produced in a gland near its heart, that is pumped into its bloodstream.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this gland. On a successful check, the character harvests the gland. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the gland is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 6 hours and 75gp worth of material to create Grung Poison (DC 13 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Grung Poison (Contact): Grung poison is a contact poison, and has a similar (but lesser) effect as Drow Poison (DMG p258). A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature touched with this poison must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute (a poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks). This poison usually sells for 150gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Grung Air Sack
items.description: Grungs can produce a sound from the air sac below their mouth that from the outside, is seen to inflate and deflate. Air from the lungs is channeled to the air sac, which resonates to make the sound louder. Orange and gold grungs, the elite warriors, have a more developed air sac, allowing them to communicate with lesser grungs more effectively. This sac has value among many craftsmen, especially those that make musical instruments (particularly bagpipes and other similar wind instruments).

Grung Wildling.name: Grung Wildling
Grung Wildling.description: The 3-foot tall creature resembles a small, frog-like humanoid. It has strong frog-like legs that ends in webbed feet, and has muscular forelimbs with hands having opposable thumbs. It stands upright and moved about in quick, short hops.

items.name: Grung Poison Gland
items.description:
All grungs secrete a substance that is harmless to them but poisonous to other creatures. This oily, clear liquid is produced in a gland near its heart, that is pumped into its bloodstream.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this gland. On a successful check, the character harvests the gland. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the gland is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 6 hours and 75gp worth of material to create Grung Poison (DC 13 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Grung Poison (Contact): Grung poison is a contact poison, and has a similar (but lesser) effect as Drow Poison (DMG p258). A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature touched with this poison must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute (a poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks). This poison usually sells for 150gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Guard Drake.name: Guard Drake
Guard Drake.description: The creature resembles a wingless dragon of a specific color, except it is stunted, with a squat and muscular build.

items.name: Guard Drake Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The blood is red and viscous. As the creature was created through a magic ritual, tied closely to dragons, the blood has many arcane properties that magic users prize. The blood is also valued by researchers and those that study dragons. Alchemist and healers can use the blood as an ingredient in some potions.

items.name: Guard Drake Scales (small pouch)
items.description: A guard drake's scales are smaller and less durable than the dragon's scale it was made from. While not as strong, they are still useful in creating basic scale armor, apparel, decorations and jewelry.

Guardian Naga.name: Guardian Naga
Guardian Naga.description: The creature looks like a giant cobra with a snake-like head with human features.

items.name: Naga Spine
items.description: A nage has a very long spine, made up of hundreds of vertebrae. The bones have various uses, especially to make tools and sculptures. The spine can also be fashioned into necromatic staves.

items.name: Naga Scales (3 pouches)
items.description: Each scale of a naga holds a tiny mote of power that spellcasters may be able to harness. The scales can also be used to make apparel and decorations. They can also be ground into a fine powder to make dyes and ink.

items.name: Naga Fang (x2)
items.description: A naga has no poison gland, but the fangs magically produce a deadly venom. This poison fades once the naga is killed, but the large fangs remain an arcane conduit. The fangs can be crafted into useful items that are easily enchanted by an adept artificer.

items.name: Guardian Naga Heart
items.description: The heart of a guardian naga is a center of power for the creature, and is a reservoir of arcane power when the creature dies. The heart can be used by spellcasters in arcane rituals of protection and summoning.

Gynosphinx.name: Gynosphinx
Gynosphinx.description: The creature has the body of a muscular lion with a luscious mane of hair, and a face that resembles a humanoid female more than a lion. It has two large wings on its back.

items.name: Sphinx Claws (large pouch)
items.description: The claws of a sphinx resemble the claws of a lion, but are larger and infused with arcane energy. Spellcasters can tap into the claws arcane power, using that power in rituals or spells.

items.name: Sphinx Mane/Hair (large pouch)
items.description: A sphinx often has a lush main of hair, similar to that of a lions. It is composed of soft, long strands that shimmer in the light, and are often braided and decorated with jewelry. The hair is valued among weavers and tailors. Spellcasters may be able to harness the hair's arcane energy when creating robes and hats.

items.name: Sphinx Feathers (large pouch)
items.description: A sphinx has two large wings with light, soft feathers. The feathers are infused with ancient arcane energy, allowing them to carry a large amount of weight. The feathers can be used in mundane items, like apparel and bedding, but hold more value with spellcasters and artificers.

items.name: Sphinx Hide
items.description: A sphinx has a soft hide of short fur (usually golden in color). The beautiful hide swirls with protective magic, and is valued among leatherworkers, tailors and spellcasters.

items.name: Gynosphinx Eye (x2)
items.description: The eyes of a gynosphinx ring with deep arcane power. Harvesting the eyes incorrectly extinguishes this power. It is believed that spellcasters can use the eyes to learn ancient, long lost secrets.

Hadozee Explorer.name: Hadozee Explorer
Hadozee Explorer.description: Slender, simian humanoids that have a slight resemblance to monkeys, with jet black eyes. Their feet are fully as dexterous as their hands, each with a toe that serves as an opposable thumb. Hadozee are often found in Wildspace as mercenary crews.

items.name: Hadozee Toe Knuckles (x2)
items.description: The opposable digits on a hadozees feet are valued by spellcasters interested in polymorph spells. They are also used by bone carvers and jewelers.

items.name: Hadozee Skin Membranes (x2)
items.description: Hadozee have cloak-like flaps of skin that hang from their arms to their back. A hadozee can extended these skin membranes to glide during a descent. If harvested correctly, this membrane may be dried out, treated and used to create special fabric.

Hadozee Shipmate.name: Hadozee Shipmate
Hadozee Shipmate.description: Slender, simian humanoids that have a slight resemblance to monkeys, with jet black eyes. Their feet are fully as dexterous as their hands, each with a toe that serves as an opposable thumb. Hadozee are often found in Wildspace as mercenary crews.

items.name: Hadozee Toe Knuckles (x2)
items.description: The opposable digits on a hadozees feet are valued by spellcasters interested in polymorph spells. They are also used by bone carvers and jewelers.

items.name: Hadozee Skin Membranes (x2)
items.description: Hadozee have cloak-like flaps of skin that hang from their arms to their back. A hadozee can extended these skin membranes to glide during a descent. If harvested correctly, this membrane may be dried out, treated and used to create special fabric.

Hadozee Warrior.name: Hadozee Warrior
Hadozee Warrior.description: Slender, simian humanoids that have a slight resemblance to monkeys, with jet black eyes. Their feet are fully as dexterous as their hands, each with a toe that serves as an opposable thumb. Hadozee are often found in Wildspace as mercenary crews.

items.name: Hadozee Toe Knuckles (x2)
items.description: The opposable digits on a hadozees feet are valued by spellcasters interested in polymorph spells. They are also used by bone carvers and jewelers.

items.name: Hadozee Skin Membranes (x2)
items.description: Hadozee have cloak-like flaps of skin that hang from their arms to their back. A hadozee can extended these skin membranes to glide during a descent. If harvested correctly, this membrane may be dried out, treated and used to create special fabric.

Hadrosaurus.name: Hadrosaurus
Hadrosaurus.description: This large, bipedal, duck-billed quadruped has a very prominent, robust projection jutting out from the back of it's head. It walks on its two hind legs and has two small arms. It is about 25 feet long and about 3 tons. Note: There are several hadrosaurs, some have a distinct flat snout, while other's don't. Some also don't have the protrusion at the back of it's head. Hadrosaurus is Greek for "sturdy lizard"

items.name: Hadrosaurus Skin
items.description: The skin of a Hadrosaurus is a highly durable reptilian hide, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, tents and more.

Half Dragon.name: Half Dragon
Half Dragon.description: The creature looks about the size of a human, but with dragon-like features. It has a lizard-like head, scaled skin or a dragon's color, sharp clawed hands and a long tail.

items.name: Half-Dragon Blood (3 vials)
items.description:
A half-dragon's blood is dark red, but has a slight metallic sheen. The blood has many magical properties and is valued in the magic community. Alchemists may be able to create concoctions that duplicate a half-dragon's abilities.

Use: As an action, a creature can may drink the vial of half-dragon blood. For the next 10 minutes, that creature gains the same type of damage resistance of the half-dragon it was taken from.

items.name: Half-Dragon Scales (small pouch)
items.description: While smaller than a full dragon, a half-dragon's scale have many of the same arcane properties. The scales of one half-dragon are too small to make any armor, but alchemists may be able to grind the scales into a powder, which can be used in various concoctions.

Half-Ogre.name: Half-Ogre
Half-Ogre.description: A large muscular humanoid, standing over 7 feet tall.

items.name: Half-Ogre Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The mixed blood of a half-ogre resembles human blood, but has many useful alchemical properties.

Harengon Brigand.name: Harengon Brigand
Harengon Brigand.description: Harengon are bipedal rabbitfolk, with soft fur and a rabbit-like face with long ears.

items.name: Harengon Ear (x2)
items.description: Harengon's have two long pointy ears on top of their head. Harvesting harengon ears are frowned upon in societies that are friendly toward harengons (and may be difficult, or even illegal to sell). However, these fluffy ears have value in other circles and in evil societies.

Harengon Sniper.name: Harengon Sniper
Harengon Sniper.description: Harengon are bipedal rabbitfolk, with soft fur and a rabbit-like face with long ears.

items.name: Harengon Ear (x2)
items.description: Harengon's have two long pointy ears on top of their head. Harvesting harengon ears are frowned upon in societies that are friendly toward harengons (and may be difficult, or even illegal to sell). However, these fluffy ears have value in other circles and in evil societies.

Harpy.name: Harpy
Harpy.description: The creature has the legs, and powerful leathery wings of a vulture with the torso, arms, and head of a human. She has wicked talons and is carrying a club of bone. She has the face of a cruel old women, with coal-black eyes. Her hair is filthy, tangled, and crusted with dry blood. She isn't wearing any clothing, but is adorned with jewelry and other trinkets, possibly from her victims.

items.name: Harpy Feathers (pouch)
items.description: The feathers of a harpy are large, and vary in color (depending on the harpy it came from). The feathers can be used in apparel, decorations and quills.

items.name: Harpy Talons (pouch)
items.description: The talons on a harpy's foot are large, sharp, and often used to claw and pierce their prey. The talons can be used in jewerly, ornamentation and to make simple tools.

items.name: Harpy Vocal Cords
items.description: The vocal cords of a harpy are difficult to harvest, as removing them takes great care. The cords resonate with a magical aura and create a soft hypnotizing hum when they are touched. A skilled craftsmen can stretch the cords into a fine wire, which can be used to string certain instruments.

items.name: Harpy Egg
items.description: It is possible to have slain a harpy while it was ovulating, and to recover an egg intact. The egg holds value to collectors, researchers and magic users. Alchemists and others may be able to make use of the shell or its content.

Hawk.name: Hawk
Hawk.description: A large, powerful predatory bird, with a strong, hooked beak used to bite and tear flesh. Its feet are equipped with sharp, curved talons for capturing prey. It's large wingspan can reach 3 to 4 feet.

items.name: Hawk Feathers (pouch)
items.description: A hawk's feathers can be used to make jewelry, decorations, fans, quills, arrows and bolts.

Hell Hound.name: Hell Hound
Hell Hound.description: This monstrous dog has a powerful physique, standing almost 4 feet high at the shoulder and weighing about 120 pounds. Its fearsome form is covered in short, rust-red fur, marked with soot and smelling of sulfur. It has hungry, glowing red eyes.

items.name: Hell Hound Sulfur (vial)
items.description: Hell hounds often combust upon death, leaving behind a cloud of sulfuric ash. The sulfur has various alchemical properties and uses.

items.name: Hell Hound Hair (3 handfuls)
items.description:
When a hell hound combusts, some of its shaggy dark hair may remain. Alchemists and magic users can use the hair for it's arcane properties and ties to other planes.

Use: As an action, a creature may burn a handful of hell hound hair. For the next minute, whenever that creature rolls a 1 or 2 on a fire damage dice roll, the creature may reroll that die and must use the new number.

Hellfire Engine.name: Hellfire Engine
Hellfire Engine.description: These machines are all unique, but are often huge metallic devices, releasing large plumes of smoke and lumbering about (either on legs, wheels or treads).

items.name: Hellfire Engine Arcane Gunpowder
items.description: The hellfire engine's thunder cannon fueled by magically infused gunpowder. If any of this gunpowder exists, it is useful to gunsmiths, artificers, tinkerers and alchemists.

items.name: Hellfire Engine Lightning Coil
items.description: Inside the Hellfire Engine is a large silver coil, about a foot long, that is used to power the constructs lightning flair. This silver coil is a highly conductive item, often used by artificers.

items.name: Hellfire Engine Core
items.description: Embedded in the huge body of a hellfire engine is a metallic core filled with a hot magical lava. The core is useful to artificers and tinkerers. The hot lava is wanted by elemental wizards and researchers.

items.name: Hellfire Engine Scrap Metal
items.description: Some of the iron used to make a hellfire engine is magically infused and very valuable to expert craftsmen. If any of this magical iron is salvageable after the construct is destroyed, this iron can be reforged to make various weapons and armor.

Helmed Horror.name: Helmed Horror
Helmed Horror.description: It appears to be an empty suit of armor, with redish-purple magical light flickering between the joints. It is carrying a longsword and shield.

items.name: Helmed Horror Helm
items.description: The helm of a helmed horror is magically enchanted, and crafted specifically for the creation of the construct. Harvesting the helm requires a simple ritual, or else the helm loses its value to the arcane community.

items.name: Helmed Horror Spark (vial)
items.description: The arcane spark that animates a Helmed Horror dissipates quickly, but can be gathered using an enchanted vial. The essence is valued by artificers and magic users. Requires an enchanted vial.

Hezrou.name: Hezrou
Hezrou.description: The creature is a large demonic monstrosity that stands 8 feet tall and weighs around 750 lbs. It resembles a toad in humanoid form, with arms and hands instead of forelegs. Within its wide maw are rows of blunt teeth that have a powerful crushing force, and a series of long spikes run down its back. The creature can walk on either two feet or on hands and feet, but it always fights standing upright.

items.name: Hezrou Teeth (small bundle)
items.description: Hezrou have razor sharp, shark-like teeth. The teeth can be used in jewelry or to create special tools (i.e. saws).

items.name: Hezrou Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Hezrou blood is thick, black, and smells of rancid meat. Alchemists often use the blood to craft potions.

items.name: Hezrou Stink Gland
items.description: Every hezrou gives off a fetid stench as a result of a stink gland near the back of it's neck. The gland can be harvested and the malicious odor can be weaponized. If the harvesting fails by 5 or more, the gland bursts and everyone within 10ft is exposed to a potent form of the hezrou's stench. They must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for the next hour.Use: As an action you may throw this item at a point within 20 feet, causing it to explode on impact. Any creature within 10 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

items.name: Hezrou Claw (x2)
items.description: The long, black claws of a hezrou are extremely sharp and strong. Weaponsmiths can use these claws to create powerful weapons.

Hill Giant.name: Hill Giant
Hill Giant.description: The voracious and dimwitted giant is stocky and extremely muscular, despite having a large belly and shorter limbs. His/her body has a tan skin tone and brown hair.

items.name: Lock of Hill Giant Hair
items.description: Shaggy bunches of strong strands. This hair is often brown or black. The hair is used by tailors, weavers and textile makers.

items.name: Hill Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a hill giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Hill Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A hill giant's blood is a thick red liquid. The blood must be harvested quickly as it coagulates very fast. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

Hill Giant, Mouth of Grolantor.name: Hill Giant, Mouth of Grolantor
Hill Giant, Mouth of Grolantor.description: The voracious and dimwitted giant is stocky and extremely muscular, despite having a large belly and shorter limbs. His/her body has a tan skin tone and brown hair.

items.name: Lock of Hill Giant Hair
items.description: Shaggy bunches of strong strands. This hair is often brown or black. The hair is used by tailors, weavers and textile makers.

items.name: Hill Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a hill giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Hill Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A hill giant's blood is a thick red liquid. The blood must be harvested quickly as it coagulates very fast. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

Hippogriff.name: Hippogriff
Hippogriff.description: The creature possesses the body of a horse, with the wings and head of a hawk or eagle. Its forelegs end in sharp talons similar to those found in birds of prey, while its hind legs have hooves. It stands about 9 feet long, with a wingspan of 20 feet, and weighs about 1,000 pounds.

items.name: Hippogriff Hoof (x2)
items.description: A hippogriff's hooves contains a unique collagen that is used to make a strong adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Hippogriff Feathers (pouch)
items.description: A hippogriff's feathers can be used to make high quality arrows and bolts. They can also be used to make jewelry, decorations, fans, quills and more.

items.name: Hippogriff Eye (x2)
items.description: An hippogriff's eagle eyes are known for their exceptional vision, being able to see prey from miles away. As such, artificers and magic users may be able to harness the eye's abilities to create certain magic item. Alchemists and healers may find other uses for the eyes.

Hoard Mimic.name: Hoard Mimic
Hoard Mimic.description: The creature retains some semblance of its disguised form, a vast trove of treasures (not just a single object). It has a large gaping mouth full of sharp teeth. Several yellow-orange eyes mark the area above it's mouth and tentacle-like appendages reach out from it's body.

items.name: Mimic Adhesive (9 vials)
items.description: A mimic can secrete a strong, clear adhesive. This glue-like substance dries very fast, and must be harvested quickly. The adhesive is valued by all kinds of craftsmen.

items.name: Mimic Skin Strips (sack)
items.description: When a mimic dies, it slowly melts into its original form, an amorphous gray blob. It is difficult to harvest even a strip of flesh from the creature, as most of its form is a gelatinous mass. A mimic's natural skin is not good for making leather, but it is valued by transmutation spellcasters and those that study polymorphing.

Hoard Scarab.name: Hoard Scarab
Hoard Scarab.description: Beetle-like creatures that blend in perfectly among piles of gold coins.

items.name: Hoard Scarab Dust (vial)
items.description:
Hoard scarabs produce a sticky, glittering metallic dust from their wings. The sticky glitter is difficult to collect. The dust has arcane properties and is valued by alchemists, often aiding in the creation of potions and elixirs involving light and tracking.

Harvesting the dust from one hoard scarab yields one vial of dust. 5 vials contain enough dust to fill a pouch.

Use: A pouch of this dust may be thrown up to 20 feet and the pouch explodes upon impact. Any creature within 10 feet of impact must roll a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be outlined in blue light for 10 minutes. While outlined in this way, a creature sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from being invisible.

Hobgoblin.name: Hobgoblin
Hobgoblin.description: A large goblinoid, with a muscular human-like frame, almost 7 feet tall. Its body is covered in coarse brown fur and it has a redish-orange face. It has yellow eyes and sharp, fanged teeth.

items.name: Hobgoblin Ear
items.description: A hobgoblin's ear has little practical use. However, most communities will offer a bounty for showing proof of killing such creature.

Hobgoblin Captain.name: Hobgoblin Captain
Hobgoblin Captain.description: A large goblinoid, with a muscular human-like frame, almost 7 feet tall. Its body is covered in coarse brown fur and it has a redish-orange face. It has yellow eyes and sharp, fanged teeth.

items.name: Hobgoblin Ear
items.description: A hobgoblin's ear has little practical use. However, most communities will offer a bounty for showing proof of killing such creature.

items.name: Hobgoblin War Braid
items.description: War-hardened hobgoblin veterans grow a long strand of hair to show their victories. Long braids signified a long life of fighting. And with every victory, the hobgoblin would add another knot and decoration. Powerful warriors had extremely long braids, full of beads, jewelry and small ornate bones. These braids fetch a good price in most markets.

Hobgoblin Devastator.name: Hobgoblin Devastator
Hobgoblin Devastator.description: A large goblinoid, with a muscular human-like frame, almost 7 feet tall. Its body is covered in coarse brown fur and it has a redish-orange face. It has yellow eyes and sharp, fanged teeth.

items.name: Hobgoblin Ear
items.description: A hobgoblin's ear has little practical use. However, most communities will offer a bounty for showing proof of killing such creature.

items.name: Hobgoblin War Braid
items.description: War-hardened hobgoblin veterans grow a long strand of hair to show their victories. Long braids signified a long life of fighting. And with every victory, the hobgoblin would add another knot and decoration. Powerful warriors had extremely long braids, full of beads, jewelry and small ornate bones. These braids fetch a good price in most markets.

Hobgoblin Iron Shadow.name: Hobgoblin Iron Shadow
Hobgoblin Iron Shadow.description: A large goblinoid, with a muscular human-like frame, almost 7 feet tall. Its body is covered in coarse brown fur and it has a redish-orange face. It has yellow eyes and sharp, fanged teeth.

items.name: Hobgoblin Ear
items.description: A hobgoblin's ear has little practical use. However, most communities will offer a bounty for showing proof of killing such creature.

items.name: Hobgoblin War Braid
items.description: War-hardened hobgoblin veterans grow a long strand of hair to show their victories. Long braids signified a long life of fighting. And with every victory, the hobgoblin would add another knot and decoration. Powerful warriors had extremely long braids, full of beads, jewelry and small ornate bones. These braids fetch a good price in most markets.

Hobgoblin Warlord.name: Hobgoblin Warlord
Hobgoblin Warlord.description: A large goblinoid, with a muscular human-like frame, almost 7 feet tall. Its body is covered in coarse brown fur and it has a redish-orange face. It has yellow eyes and sharp, fanged teeth.

items.name: Hobgoblin Ear
items.description: A hobgoblin's ear has little practical use. However, most communities will offer a bounty for showing proof of killing such creature.

items.name: Hobgoblin War Braid
items.description: War-hardened hobgoblin veterans grow a long strand of hair to show their victories. Long braids signified a long life of fighting. And with every victory, the hobgoblin would add another knot and decoration. Powerful warriors had extremely long braids, full of beads, jewelry and small ornate bones. These braids fetch a good price in most markets.

items.name: Mark of Maglubiyet
items.description: When a hobgoblin becomes a warlord, they undergo a ritual to receive the blessing of Maglubiyet, the chief goblinoid deity. During this ceremony, they receive a brand with Maglubiyet's symbol (a bloody axe). This symbol can be harvested by carefully flaying the skin around the tattoo, which often rips the skin and ruins the mark. The mark is valued by collectors and goblinoid hunters. The mark also has a touch of arcane power, useful to artificers and spellcasters.

Hollow Dragon.name: Hollow Dragon
Hollow Dragon.description: of flames, lightning, or misty vapors.

items.name: Hollow Dragon Ash
items.description: When a hollow dragon is slain, the energy that fills the hollow husk of the dragon surges and then is sucked inward, and the creature's body quickly disintegrates to ash. Depending on the metallic dragon type, this surge appears as a fiery burst, a surge of electricity, or a cloud of misty vapor. This ash is quickly dispersed by a small breeze, so it can be difficult to collect. The ash has alchemical and arcane value.

Homunculus.name: Homunculus
Homunculus.description: A small construct about the size of a squirrel. It has a squat, hairless, monkey-like body, with big bulbous eyes, a flat nose, large ears and a set of wings on its back.

items.name: Homunculus Clay
items.description: When a homunculus dies, its body slowing begins to revert to clay and break apart. If the clay is harvested quickly, it retains a touch of arcane power, useful to other spellcasters.

items.name: Homunculus Blood (vial)
items.description:
In order to create a homunculus, a spellcaster must use some of their own blood, which becomes part of the creature.  If harvested quickly, some of the homunculus' blood can be gathered, and is strongly tied to its master. This blood is an ingredient that can be used by alchemist and healers. It can also be used to track the location of the homunculus' master.

Use: As an action, a creature can drink the homunculus' blood while performing a ritual with a dagger. The dagger becomes magically enchanted for the next 6 hours. As an action, the creature can place the dagger on the ground and the dagger will spin, stopping to point in the direction of the homunculus' master. If the master moves, the dagger will not continue to spin until the creature picks the dagger up, and spends another action to place it down again.

Hooked Horror.name: Hooked Horror
Hooked Horror.description: The creature stands about 9 feet tall. It has a head like a vulture, with a hooked beak and a neck of crested feathers, but with multifaceted eyes, like those of an insect. It has the body of a beetle, with a mottled gray, thick, chitinous exoskeleton covered with sharp studs. Instead of hands, paws, or claws, its front limbs end in 12-inch-long razor-sharp, blade-like gray metallic hooks. Its legs are similar to those of a bird.

items.name: Hooked Horror Shell
items.description: A hooked horror has an insect-like exoskeleton studded by sharp, bony protuberances. It is possible to remove the back shell, but it takes time and care. The hard shell can be used by armorers and craftsmen.

items.name: Hooked Horror Hook (x2)
items.description: A hook horror's powerfully built arms end in wickedly curved hooked claws. It is possible to harvest the claws without fragmenting the bone. The hooked claws are often used by weaponsmiths and tool makers.

Horned Devil (Malebranche / Cornugon).name: Horned Devil (Malebranche / Cornugon)
Horned Devil (Malebranche / Cornugon).description: The ogre-sized, humanoid stands over 9 ft tall, and weighs over 600 lbs. It has a muscular frame, brownish scaled skin, and long sweeping horns on top of its head. A pair of massive leathery wings extend from its back and a long serpentine tail curls behind it.

items.name: Horned Devil's Horn (x2)
items.description: The devil's long horns extend back from its forehead and curl down behind its head, similar to that of an over-sized goat. The horns are prized as trophies, but can also be used to create instrumental horns and ornate drinking goblets.

items.name: Horned Devil's Blood (5 vials)
items.description: The dark red blood of a horned devil has the arcane ability to weaken and debilitate others. Alchemists can use the blood in their concoctions.

items.name: Horned Devil Tail
items.description: The horned devil's snake-like tail has a menacing barb at the end, that has a hellish arcane bite. Weaponsmiths may be able to use the barb to help create deadly weapons.

items.name: Devil Wings (x2)
items.description: A horned devil has a set of large, menacing leathery wings. The wings can be used for their leather, or to aid in the creation of magic items.

Howler.name: Howler
Howler.description: The creature is an 8 feet long, four-legged beast that weighs about 1 ton. Its two front legs have bruised, crushed digits ending in claws, while it back legs end in hooves. Its skin is covered by tangled, red fur that spreads into a mane of trembling quills on the backs of its necks. It has a bulbous, balloon-like chin and throat, beady eyes, a snub nose and a mouth full of sharp teeth.

items.name: Howler Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Howler blood is thick, black, and smells of rancid meat. Alchemists often use the blood to craft potions. Healers may be able to use the blood to create a fluid that soothes ear pain.

items.name: Howler Teeth (pouch)
items.description: Howlers have sharp, pointed teeth. The teeth can be used in jewelry or to create small tools and weapons.

items.name: Howler Claws (pouch)
items.description: The long, black claws of a Howler are extremely sharp and strong. The bone can be used in jewelry, decorations or to create small weapons.

items.name: Howler Vocal Cords
items.description: Howlers can emit a mind-breaking howl, using their extremely powerful vocal cords. These folds of membranous tissue project inward from the sides of the creature's larynx. Skilled artificers and magic users may be able to use the vocal cords in their crafting.

Hungry Sorrowsworn.name: Hungry Sorrowsworn
Hungry Sorrowsworn.description: Lonely sorrowsworn are humanoid monstrosities with grasping claws and distended jaws. They have ashen gray skin and a hunger that can not be satiated.

items.name: Sorrowsworn Saliva (vial)
items.description: The saliva of sorrowsworn is a thick, sticky, transparent fluid. The saliva is believed to be an ingredient in elixirs that treat depression. It is also studied by anyone interested in the Shadowfell.

items.name: Hungry Sorrowsworn Stomach
items.description: The stomach of a hungry sorrowsworn is a large, extremely flexible sac. The sac is valued by weavers and tailors for its elasticity.

Hunter Shark.name: Hunter Shark
Hunter Shark.description: A large predatory shark, under 20 feet long average 15-20 feet. It has tough, dull gray skin that is roughened by toothlike scales. It has a muscular, asymmetrical, upturned tail and pointed fins. It also has a pointed snout extending forward and over a crescentic mouth set with sharp triangular teeth.

items.name: Hunter Shark Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A shark's teeth are extremely sharp, triangular pieces of dentin covered in a hard coating of enamel. The teeth are used in jewelry and decoration, but can also be used to make serrate blades and saws.

items.name: Hunter Shark Skin
items.description: A shark's skin is covered in small, rough, hard scales. Leatherworkers dry and treat the leather, then grind down the scales to make the leather smoother and easier to handle, giving it a pebbled appearance.

Hutijin.name: Hutijin
Hutijin.description: Hutijin is a 12-foot tall pit fiend with a gargoyleish appearance. His body is armored with scales and a pair of massive, triangular bat-like wings rise from his back. His mouth has huge fangs driping with hissing, green venom. A long prehensile tails stretches out being him.

items.name: Hutijin's Blood (5 vials)
items.description: A pit fiend blood is a scalding red fluid, that bubbles with the fiery heat of hell. Skilled alchemists can cool and refine the blood using a variety of alchemic processes, and use the resulting liquid as a component in various potions.

items.name: Pit Fiend Venom (3 vials)
items.description:
Hutijin's venom is a noxious, vile poison, found mixed in the pit fiends saliva.
Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough vemon for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 4 days and 500gp worth of material and supplies to create Pit Fiend venom (DC 20 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Pit Fiend Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ([[/r 6d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 1100gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Hutijin's Claws (pouch)
items.description: The sharp claws of a pit fiend are a deadly natural weapon. Weaponsmiths can use the item in crafting certain weapons. It can also be sold as a trophy, or for use in crafting.

items.name: Hutijin's Larynx
items.description: Hutijin's Larynx is capable of producing a fearful voice to make his enemies tremble. The larynx must be carefully cut away, without tearing the vocal cords within. The larynx can be used by skilled instrument makers and artificers.

Hydra.name: Hydra
Hydra.description: A reptilian horror with a crocodilian body and multiple heads on long, serpentine necks.

items.name: Hydra Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Hydras are known for their regenerative abilities, making their blood prized by healers and alchemists.

items.name: Hydra Scales (sack)
items.description: A hydras scales are tough and flexible. The scale can be used to make armor, apparel and jewelry.

items.name: Hydra Teeth (sack)
items.description: A hydra has rows of sharp, jagged teeth. The teeth can be used to make jewelry, but also make good arrowheads. A sack of hydra teeth contains [[/r 1d20]]+20 teeth.

items.name: Hydra Head
items.description: A hydra's unique physiology causes their brains to share information subconsciously; a trait that is valued in the research community. Artificers and spellcasters find the heads worth studying. In addition, a hydra's head is a prized hunting trophy, and valued by collectors.

Hydroloth.name: Hydroloth
Hydroloth.description: The Hydroloth is a hideous amphibian that resembles a 10-foot tall, squat humanoid toad. Its skin is warty, yellow, and covered in mucus. It has a frog-like face, bulbous eyes, webbed digits ending in claws on its hands and feet, and gliding webbed flaps under its arms.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Hydroloth Eye (x2)
items.description: The squishy eyes of a Hydroloth are used to create salves and unguents. Alchemists and healers tend to buy these when available.

items.name: Hydroloth's Hippocampus
items.description: A hydroloth's hippocampus is a complex brain structure embedded deep into the creature's temporal lobe. Its hippocampus is used for memory encoding and consolidation, which is important to the creature's ability to steal memories. A hydroloth's hippocampus has several healing properties, especially pertaining to memory loss and aging.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Hyena.name: Hyena
Hyena.description: The hyena has a large head with a long, thick, muscular neck and powerful jaws. It has a short torso, and low hindquarters giving its back a hunched appearance. Its fur is tan-brown with dark spots and its paws have four toes with non-retractable claws.

items.name: Hyena Hide
items.description: A hyena hide is often a brown-orange color with dark spots. The hide can be used to make apparel and other leather goods.

Hyena, Giant.name: Hyena, Giant
Hyena, Giant.description: The giant hyena has a large head with a long, thick, muscular neck and powerful jaws. It has a short torso, and low hindquarters giving its back a hunched appearance. Its fur is tan-brown with dark spots and its paws have four toes with non-retractable claws.

items.name: Giant Hyena Hide
items.description: A giant hyena hide is often a brown-orange color with dark spots. The hide can be used to make apparel and other leather goods.

Ice Devil (Gelugon).name: Ice Devil (Gelugon)
Ice Devil (Gelugon).description: The creature is a blue and white, insect-like bipeds that stands over 10 feet tall and weighs around 700 lbs. Its hands and feet end in claws and its long, thick tail is lined in spikey ridges. Its mantis-like head hosts a set of antenna, sharp mandibles, and a pair of multifaceted eyes.

items.name: Ice Devil Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Ice devil blood is a light blue viscous fluid with some interesting alchemy properties. Alchemists find the blood useful in their craft.

items.name: Ice Devil Mandible (x2)
items.description: The two large appendages near the ice devils mouth sometimes retains the creatures arcane immunity to cold. Using the mandibles, some magic users and weaponsmiths can enhance certain weapons.

items.name: Ice Devil Carapace
items.description: The hard, segmented shell of the ice devil. The carapace not only protects against physical attacks, but also is resistent to cold. Often used to fashion armor.

Ice Mephit.name: Ice Mephit
Ice Mephit.description: The creature is impish in appearance, about 4 feet tall, with a long pointy nose, large pointy ears, and a large set of wings. It has cold blue-white skin, as if it was made of ice.

items.name: Dual Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: When a mephit is killed, it's elemental form disperses, leaving behind trace remnants from two different elemental planes. If harvested quickly, a mote of residual energy can be found - an essence resulting from the mixture of two elemental powers. The essence is useful to elemental spellcasters and those that study the elemental planes. Requires an enchanted vial.

Imp.name: Imp
Imp.description: The creature is a 2 foot tall humanoid, weighing about 10 lbs, with dark red skin although, imps come in a variety of colors. It flutters through the air on leathery, bat-like wings and its prehensile tail ends in a fearsome scorpion-like stinger. Its small head has beady eyes, long pointy ears and a pair of small, sharp horns protruding from its forehead. It smiles wickedly with sharp white fangs. Imps have the ability to take the form of various animals.

items.name: Imp Poison Gland
items.description:
The imp's red, scorpion-like stinger contains a fist-sized bloody sac that produces a deadly venom for the imp. A skilled harvester can attempt to remove the gland intact.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this gland. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's poison gland that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Serpent Venom (see below, or DMG p258). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the poison gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's venom.

Refining the Poison: Once the gland is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend  12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Serpent Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Serpent Venom (Injury): The poison can coat up to 3 pieces of ammunition or 1 melee weapon for 1 minute. Applying the poison takes 1 action. Any creature successfully hit must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking [[/r 3d6]] poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Imp Blood (vial)
items.description:
Imp blood is a red liquid with low viscosity. The blood can be used by spellcasters to enhance their familiars.

Use: When casting the find familiar spell, you may use a vial of imp blood instead of the usual material component of the spell. If you do, your summoned familiar gains the magic resistance trait described in the imp familiar's statblock (advantage on saving throws against spells and magic effects). Your familiar also shares this trait with you so long as you are within 10 feet of it. Both of these effects last for 1 hour, or until your familiar is killed or is dismissed.

items.name: Imp Head
items.description: A successfully harvested imp's head may still retains some of its arcane power. Artificers and magic users may be able to tap into that power, either to craft detection devices, or to find information that the imp had.

Insects, Swarm of.name: Insects, Swarm of
Insects, Swarm of.description: The actual "swarm" of insects is up to the DM. Some swarms include:

items.name: Collection of Insect Parts (x[[/r 1d8]])
items.description: If the insects aren't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's wings, legs, eyes and tiny organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Intellect Devourer.name: Intellect Devourer
Intellect Devourer.description: A human-sized brain, set on bestial clawed legs.

items.name: Intellect Devourer Brain Fluid (vial)
items.description:
An intellect devourer's brain fluid is a thick, clear fluid with a pink tint. The fluid is produced by tissues lining the ventricles of the brain. The fluid begins to dry quickly after death and must be harvested quickly. The fluid is useful to alchemists and artificers (especially those with an interest in flesh golems).

Use: As an action a creature may drink a vial of brain fluid. That creature must make a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, it becomes stunned for 1 minute as its mind struggles to grasp with a sudden rush of information. On a success, the creature learns the identity of who the intellect devourer used to be, as well as one key memory (DM discretion). The memory may be something that the intellect devourer knew in its original life, or something it learned after becoming an intellect devourer (i.e. the location of a mind flayer's lair).

items.name: Intellect Devourer Pineal Gland
items.description: The pineal gland plays a strong roll in the Intellect Devourer's mental abilities. It is a fragile gland that may rupture if harvested incorrectly. The gland is a small, pea-shaped ball located in the middle of the brain. The gland is values by spellcasters and individuals studying psionics. Artificers may also be able to harness something from the small gland. Alchemists use the gland as an ingredient in certain potions.

Invisible Stalker.name: Invisible Stalker
Invisible Stalker.description: A shimmering mass of air, similar to the refraction caused by hot air passing in front of cold.

items.name: Elemental Air Essence (vial)
items.description:
An invisible stalker can stir up dust and debris that carry trace amounts of the elementals energy. It is possible to harness this energy using an enchanted bottle to collect the creature's essence. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the invisible stalker disperses over 20 feet above the ground (spreading its essence into a wider area, making it more difficult to find).

Iron Cobra.name: Iron Cobra
Iron Cobra.description: A metallic cobra-like construct that looks like a cobra.

items.name: Clockwork Gears and Scrap Metal
items.description: When destroyed, a clockwork machine shuts down (usually releasing a cloud of steam) and falls to pieces. Among it's remains are several gears and pieces of scrap metal. These items can be used by artificers, tinkerers, inventors, smiths and jewelers.

items.name: Clockwork Oil (flask)
items.description: Some of the clockwork's interior gears and components are coated in a thin layer of slick, black oil. It may be possible to gather some of this oil and collect it in a flask. The oil is a useful lubricant that any merchant will buy.

Iron Golem.name: Iron Golem
Iron Golem.description: This large construct has a humanoid shape, but this robot-like figure looks to be covered in heavy iron plate armor. Occassionally, spouts of steam shoot out from behind its back. It stands about 12 feet tall, weighing probaby over 5000 pounds.

items.name: Iron Golem Fuel Core
items.description: Embedded in the chest of an iron golem is a burning red rock, resembling a large chuck of hot coal. This hot stone continues to give off heat, long after the golem is destroyed. The core is useful to artificers and other spellcasters.

items.name: Iron Golem Poison Canister
items.description: Iron golems are built with a canister of toxic chemicals that they use to spew a poisonous vapor. This canister can often be harvested after the creature is destroyed, if it is not punctured or disconnected improperly. The chemicals in the canister can be used by artificers, alchemists and poisoners.

items.name: Iron Golem Manual Ashes (vial, small pouch)
items.description: The final step of creating a new golem is to sprinkle the ashes of the manual of golem creation over the inanimate body. Harvesting these ashes can be difficult, as they are tiny and hard to find. The ashes don't retain the power they had prior to the golem's creation, but still have value in the arcane community.

items.name: Iron Golem Iron Scrap
items.description: The iron used to make an iron golem is magically infused and very valuable to expert craftsmen. This magic iron can be reforged to make various weapons and armor.

Jabberwock.name: Jabberwock
Jabberwock.description: A jabberwock is a sinewy, dragon-like monster covered in scales. It has a thick draconic torso, powerful hind legs, and sinuous front paws, each ending with four taloned fingers. It moves on all four legs as effortlessly as on its hind legs. It has a pair of leathery wings, a freakishly long tail, a long anguiform neck, and a massive head with has two large, round, menacing eyes, covered by semitransparent eyelids. Its eyes glow in the dark – a blood-chilling sight in a dark forest.

items.name: Jabberwock Blood (7 vials)
items.description: Very few people have seen a jabberwock, so very little is known about it's blood. However, its ties to the fey and its similarities to dragons, make its blood highly sought after.

items.name: Jabberwock Eye (x2)
items.description: The two round eyes of a jabberwock is capable of emitting a fiery gaze. Each round orb is about 8-inches wide. The eyes are extremely warm to the touch (even after they are removed), and radiate with arcane energy.

items.name: Jabberwock Larynx
items.description: A jabberwock can murmur to itself, resonating a steady and hypnotic droning sound, that confuses and charms its victims. The creature's larynx hums with magic energy and must be carefully cut away, without tearing the vocal cords within. The larynx can be used by skilled instrument makers and artificers.

Jackal.name: Jackal
Jackal.description: A type of canine that looks like a cross between a German shepherd and a fox. It has a fox's small face, delicate legs and fluffy tail, with the German shepherd's long, alert ears.

items.name: Jackal Hide
items.description: A jackal's hide is small animal skin, useful to leatherworkers. The skin can be used to make accessories, bags and small apparel items.

Jackalwere.name: Jackalwere
Jackalwere.description: A bipedal 6-foot tall figure with a lean and muscular body, a jackal's head, and covered in a coat of fur.

items.name: Jackal Hide
items.description: When a jackalwere dies, it transforms into its true form, indistinguishable from a normal jackal. As such, the small animal's skin is useful to leatherworkers. The skin can be used to make accessories, bags and small apparel items.

items.name: Jackalwere Heart
items.description: A jackalwere is a shapechanger created by the demon lord Graz'zt. As such, its heart flows with the chaotic energy of the Abyss, making the organ a powerful arcane conduit. The heart has value among those that study the occult, demons and the Abyss. Summoners and alchemists may also find uses for the heart.

Jammer Leech.name: Jammer Leech
Jammer Leech.description: A jammer leech typically attaches itself to a spelljammer's hull in the Astral Sea as a tiny spore. It then grows to a barnacle-like creature, as it absorbs magic from the spelljamming helm. It has a hard shell with a reddish-purple snail-like body inside.

items.name: Jammer Leech Intestine
items.description: A jammer leech slowly absorbs magic from whatever it is attached to through it's uniquely made intestines. These tiny intestines act as a sponge for arcane power. While too small to cause any noticeable effects, they are still valued by spellcasters.

items.name: Jammer Leech Secretions (vial)
items.description: A jammer leech attaches itself to a ship using a glue-like secretion. If quick enough, this sticky substance can be harvested before it dries. This glue is a strong adhesive with various uses. If stored in a sealed vial, the glue will not expire. If exposed to air, it will dry in [[/r 1d6]] rounds.

Jubilex.name: Jubilex
Jubilex.description: Jubilex is an amorphous mass of bubbling slime, swirling black and green, with glaring red eyes floating and shifting within. Its form is a foul, primordial soup of bubbling bile and nauseating fluid bound by a thin epidermis bathed in oil and thick mucus.

items.name: Jubilex Slime (7 vials)
items.description:
The greenish-black slime of Jubilex is a vial concoction of nauseating thick fluid. The slime has various alchemical properties, but can also be used to create a deadly poison.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough poison for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any poison. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the poison is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 250gp worth of material to create Jubilex Poison (DC 15 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Jubilex Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 12 ([[/r 4d6]]) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison can sell for 500gp.

items.name: Jubilex Eye (x[[/r 1d6]])
items.description: Jubilex has numerous glaring red eyes, all different sizes, floating around inside its amorphous form. Fluids can be extracted from these soft orbs that can be used to create powerful cleaning and detoxifying solutions.

items.name: Jubilex Slime Orb
items.description: Somewhere inside Jubilex's gelatinous form is a misshapen orb of harder slime, about 6 inches wide. This ball of slime is difficult to find amidst the puddle of ooze that remains of the creature's body. This orb retains its shape because it contains a collection of nerves, and one could argue is the creature's brain. The orb can be used to create a powerful gem.

Kenku.name: Kenku
Kenku.description: The humanoid creature has raven-like features, with black and beady eyes, a long dark-hued beak, and is covered with dark russet-brown feathers. It has no wings, but has two arms, scaled like a birds with hands ending in sharp talons.

Ki-Rin.name: Ki-Rin
Ki-Rin.description: The creature is a noble equine creature with a single horn, similar to a unicorn. Its stag-like body is covered in golden scales and it has a thick mane of golden hair. The shimmering scales appear to shine with magical light while the creature is in flight. It has deep violet eyes and melodious voice.

items.name: Ki-rin Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A ki'rin's blood is a thick, golden fluid. The blood has strong healing and regenerative properties.

items.name: Ki-rin Hair
items.description: A ki'rin's thick mane is made of soft, thick stands of golden hair that shimmers in the light. The hair is valued in the healing community. Wounds stitched with a ki'rin's hair heal extremely fast. The hair is also prized by upscale weavers and tailors.

items.name: Ki-rin Scales (large pouch)
items.description: The golden scales of a ki'rin glisten in the sunlight. They are highly reflective, and have a soft glow, even in darkness. They are prized by craftsmen in all fields, creating fine jewelry, fashionable apparel and strong armor.

items.name: Ki-rin Hoof (x4)
items.description: The golden hooves of a ki'rin are extremely hard and surprisingly light. Weaponsmiths can use the hooves to create beautiful and powerful bludgeoning weapons.

items.name: Ki-rin Horn
items.description: A ki'rin's horn appears to be made of pure gold and radiates with arcane energy. The horn is exceptionally strong, yet easily malleable to an expert craftsman. It can be forged into a variety of items, including weapons and tools.

Killer Whale.name: Killer Whale
Killer Whale.description: A large marine mammal, easily distinguished by its black-and-white coloration, large dorsal fin and a sleek, streamlined body.

items.name: Whale Blubber
items.description: Harvesting whale blubber requires cutting out long strips of fat from the creature's belly. Failure occurs when the strips are cut too thin, or the fat is spoiled by hitting a major artery or organ. Whale blubber is primarily used to make oil and soap by boiling the fat for several hours.

Kindori.name: Kindori
Kindori.description: Kindori resemble gargantuan aquatic whales, and can grow up to 80 feet long. It lacks any noticeable mouth, and the edge of its body is dotted with small eyes that can emit bright beams of light. Kindori are found in Wildspace, and are large enough to have their own gravitational field and air envelope, enabling smaller creatures to live and travel on its body.

items.name: Kindori Blood (7 vials)
items.description: Kindori blood is light blue and has a luminescent glow. The blood is extremely rich in nutrients. It is often used in healing salves.

items.name: Kindori Moss (x4 sacks)
items.description: Kindori are large creatures with mosses, molds and other parasitic organisms growing on its surface. This moss can be harvested and sold to farmers who use it to make a powerful fertilizer.

items.name: Kindori Hide
items.description: The thick hide of a kindori can be as hard as a rock. If harvested carefully, and treated by a master leatherworker, this hide can be used to make strong leather armor.

items.name: Kindori Eyes (x6)
items.description: A Kindori's body is dotted with several glowing eyes. If harvested quickly and intact, the radiant properties can be preserved. These foot-wide glowing orbs are valued by spellcasters, and often used to create balls of continual light.

items.name: Kindori Heart
items.description: The large heart of a Kindori is a powerful organ. The heart continues to beat for several days after the creature's death. Spellcasters, especially artificers, can use the heart to power machines and run experiments.

Kobold.name: Kobold
Kobold.description: A reptilian humanoid standing under 3 feet tall with reddish brown scaled skin and burnt orange eyes kobolds were also known to have black skin. Its two legs are sinewy and digitigrade (walking on its long toes and not touching the ground with its heels, like a dog or cat). It has long, clawed fingers and a jaw like a crocodile.

items.name: Kobold's Tail
items.description: A kobold's tail has little value, but it can be used to collect any bounties on the creatures.

Kobold Dragonshield.name: Kobold Dragonshield
Kobold Dragonshield.description: A reptilian humanoid standing under 3 feet tall with reddish brown scaled skin and burnt orange eyes kobolds were also known to have black skin. Its two legs are sinewy and digitigrade (walking on its long toes and not touching the ground with its heels, like a dog or cat). It has long, clawed fingers and a jaw like a crocodile.

items.name: Kobold's Tail
items.description: A kobold's tail has little value, but it can be used to collect any bounties on the creatures.

items.name: Kobold Dragonshield Blood (vial)
items.description:
A kobold dragonshield has several innate abilities, and a power runs through its veins. The blood must be harvested quickly before that power dissipates. The blood can be used to create various potions.

Uses: If a creature is frightened or paralyzed, they can use an action to drink the blood, or pour it down another creatures throat. The creature that drinks the blood is no longer frightened or paralyzed, and can't be frightened or paralyzed for 1 minute.

Kobold Inventor.name: Kobold Inventor
Kobold Inventor.description: A reptilian humanoid standing under 3 feet tall with reddish brown scaled skin and burnt orange eyes kobolds were also known to have black skin. Its two legs are sinewy and digitigrade (walking on its long toes and not touching the ground with its heels, like a dog or cat). It has long, clawed fingers and a jaw like a crocodile.

items.name: Kobold's Tail
items.description: A kobold's tail has little value, but it can be used to collect any bounties on the creatures.

Kobold Scale Sorceror.name: Kobold Scale Sorceror
Kobold Scale Sorceror.description: A reptilian humanoid standing under 3 feet tall with reddish brown scaled skin and burnt orange eyes kobolds were also known to have black skin. Its two legs are sinewy and digitigrade (walking on its long toes and not touching the ground with its heels, like a dog or cat). It has long, clawed fingers and a jaw like a crocodile.

items.name: Kobold's Tail
items.description: A kobold's tail has little value, but it can be used to collect any bounties on the creatures.

Korred.name: Korred
Korred.description: A grey skinned humanoid about 4 feet tall, with incredibly long beard and hair, snaking out in all directions and covering most of the creature's body. It has the lower-body of a goat and two muscular arms.

items.name: Korred Hoof (x2)
items.description: The collagen in a Korred's hooves can be used to make a strong adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Korred Hair
items.description: A korred has long, scraggly, dark hair infused with fey magic. If the hair is cut too short, its magic immediately fades. Weavers can clean and weave the hair into a soft, shimmering fabric. The hair can also be used to create a strong, silk-like rope.

items.name: Korred Skin
items.description: A korred has rough gray skin that seems to shift slightly in the light, especially when near stone. The skin still retains some of the korred's camouflage ability even after death, but must be harvested carefully. While the skin itself is too thin to be used to make leather, it has many arcane and alchemical properties.

Kraken.name: Kraken
Kraken.description: The creature looks akin to an enormous squid, with a body almost 30 feet long, 100 feet with it's long tentacles. The creature has a ring of tentacles surrounding a mouth connected to a conical central body. It's body extends down into 10 long tentacles, each large enough to crush a galleon. The monster has very large eyes, and two large fins protruding from the upper part of its elongated central body.

items.name: Kraken Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A kraken's blood is dark blue with a low viscosity, and smells like the shore during low tide. The legendary creature's blood radiates with arcane energy, especially since they are believed to have once been fierce warriors of the gods, and even have their own cults and followers. Alchemists and magic users all clamor for a little bit of this creature's blood.

items.name: Kraken Ink (5 vials)
items.description:
The ink, which the kraken uses to expel a giant ink cloud, is a black, free flowing liquid. The ink is flowing with magical energy making it highly valued by alchemists, scholars and magic users. It is used as an ingredient in invisible ink, certain magic runes, special scroll and magical tomes.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Kraken Hide
items.description: A kraken's hide is a strong, rubbery material. The hide can only be harvested from certain areas of the creature, in order to find workable material. The hide is extremely versatile. It can be crafted into water resistant fabric and apparel. It can be treated and made into flexible tarps. It can also be soaked, stretched, and made into sturdy, but light, sails.

items.name: Kraken Tooth (x10)
items.description: A kraken's tooth resembles a sharks tooth, but can reach up to 2 feet long. The teeth are razor sharp, and extremely hard. The teeth are valued by weaponsmiths, collectors and ocean/sea cults.

items.name: Kraken Horns (4)
items.description: A kraken's head is covered in many hard, bone-like protrusions. These large bones are difficult to harvest, considering their size. Cutting into the bone is difficult, and can fracture the item, making it useless. Expert craftsmen can carve the horns down into many shapes and sizes, making them ideal for weapons and shields.

items.name: Kraken Eye x2
items.description: A kraken is an old and ancient creature, believed to have been around since the dawn of time. Their eyes hold the secrets of the deep, many of which are long forgotten. Spellcasters can tap into the magic within those eyes, often revealing useful information about long forgotten creatures, ships and treasures.

items.name: Kraken Heart
items.description:
A kraken has three hearts, which is partly a consequence of having blue blood. Its two peripheral hearts pump blood through its gills, and its central heart circulates the oxygenated blood to the rest of the body. The ancient power that runs through a kraken's heart makes it a powerful artifact that can be harnessed by an experienced spellcaster.
Use: A spellcaster may spend 1 year performing a daily ritual to transform a kraken's heart into a large, pulsing red crystal. When 3 of these crystals are placed within 5 miles of each other, the area is enclosed within an invisible magical field. Creatures are unaware of the field, and can pass through without limitation. The centroid of the triangle (the point at which the three medians meet) is a source of great power where a spellcaster can control the weather within the region. This place of power is often a wall-in protected area.

items.name: Kraken Pearl
items.description: A kraken is a gargantuan devourer, swallowing tons of objects whole throughout the millennia. Some of the more valuable (and even magical) objects get caught in the creature's digestive tract, and are covered in a thick mucus that quickly hardens. Over time, the object is coated again and again, forming a glistening and hardened pearl. A fully-formed kraken's pearl can range from 2-3 feet in diameter. The beautiful sphere is prized by collectors, but also an object of great power (especially if the pearl is extremely old).

Kraken Priest.name: Kraken Priest
Kraken Priest.description: Kraken Priests are humanoids that have undergone unique physical changes due to appeasing the monster through dark rituals and sacrifice. One kraken priest might have ink-black eyes and a suckered tentacle for a tongue, while another has a featureless face and a body covered in eyes and mouths that dribble seawater.

items.name: Kraken Priest Blood (vial)
items.description: A kraken priest's blood is a black fluid that resembles ink. The blood can be used to create potion.

items.name: Kraken Priest Mutated Body Part (x2)
items.description: Every kraken priest is goes through a unique physical transformation. Some have  tentacles, gills, fins and/or flippers. These body parts are useful to alchemists and anyone studying sea creatures, especially the kraken.

Kruthik Hive Lord.name: Kruthik Hive Lord
Kruthik Hive Lord.description: The kruthik vaguely resembles a repilian canine, with insect-like features. Its body is covered in plates of thick, purple chitin, with bristles of thick hair growing in patches. It has six limbs composed of bone, chitin, and steely scales; all ending in long scythes that can hew through stone. Its reptilian head has two black beady eyes and a large mouth filled with sharp teeth, and flanked by serrated mandibles.

items.name: Kruthik Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Kruthik blood is a warm, red fluid. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in potions and elixirs.

items.name: Kruthik Hive Lord Leg (x6)
items.description: A kruthik's leg is composed of bone, chitin, and steely scales; all ending in long scythes. The scythes are extremely sharp and can dig through stone. The creature's scythes can be used to make sharp weapons.

items.name: Kruthik Hive Lord Acid Glands
items.description: The kruthik hive lord's acid spray is caused by two glands secreting a mix of chemicals together as the creature exhales. The two glands are wrapped together in a thin membrane, which can be harvested if careful. Alchemists prize the membrane for the unique mix of chemicals it contains.

Kuo-Toa.name: Kuo-Toa
Kuo-Toa.description: The creature looks like a humanoid with fish-like features, covered in grey-green scales with yellow undertones. It has a large, bullet-shaped, piscine head hosting a mouth full of sharp teeth and a pair of bulging silver-black eyes, swiveling in all directions. It has a thick, bulbous body, contrasted by slender, lithe arms and legs. At the end of each limb is a broad, distended and partially webbed hand or foot. The creature stands about 5 feet tall. A light stench of rotten fish comes for it.

items.name: Kuo-toa's Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A kuo-toa's teeth are sharp, slightly curved, and often serrated at the edges. Fishermen often use the teeth to create fish hooks. Some teeth are large enough to carve and paint to make decorative lures. The teeth can also be used to make crude jewelry and decorations.

items.name: Kuo-Toa Eyes (x2)
items.description: A kuo-toa's eyes are large, bulbous spheres. The eyes are edible, and often used as an ingredient in many coastal societies. However, many communities pay for the eyes as proof of a bounty being fulfilled.

Kuo-Toa Archpriest.name: Kuo-Toa Archpriest
Kuo-Toa Archpriest.description: The creature looks like a humanoid with fish-like features, covered in grey-green scales with yellow undertones. It has a large, bullet-shaped, piscine head hosting a mouth full of sharp teeth and a pair of bulging silver-black eyes, swiveling in all directions. It has a thick, bulbous body, contrasted by slender, lithe arms and legs. At the end of each limb is a broad, distended and partially webbed hand or foot. The creature stands about 5 feet tall. A light stench of rotten fish comes for it.

items.name: Kuo-toa's Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A kuo-toa's teeth are sharp, slightly curved, and often serrated at the edges. Fishermen often use the teeth to create fish hooks. Some teeth are large enough to carve and paint to make decorative lures. The teeth can also be used to make crude jewelry and decorations.

items.name: Kuo-Toa Eyes (x2)
items.description: A kuo-toa's eyes are large, bulbous spheres. The eyes are edible, and often used as an ingredient in many coastal societies. However, many communities pay for the eyes as proof of a bounty being fulfilled.

Kuo-Toa Whip.name: Kuo-Toa Whip
Kuo-Toa Whip.description: The creature looks like a humanoid with fish-like features, covered in grey-green scales with yellow undertones. It has a large, bullet-shaped, piscine head hosting a mouth full of sharp teeth and a pair of bulging silver-black eyes, swiveling in all directions. It has a thick, bulbous body, contrasted by slender, lithe arms and legs. At the end of each limb is a broad, distended and partially webbed hand or foot. The creature stands about 5 feet tall. A light stench of rotten fish comes for it.

items.name: Kuo-toa's Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A kuo-toa's teeth are sharp, slightly curved, and often serrated at the edges. Fishermen often use the teeth to create fish hooks. Some teeth are large enough to carve and paint to make decorative lures. The teeth can also be used to make crude jewelry and decorations.

items.name: Kuo-Toa Eyes (x2)
items.description: A kuo-toa's eyes are large, bulbous spheres. The eyes are edible, and often used as an ingredient in many coastal societies. However, many communities pay for the eyes as proof of a bounty being fulfilled.

Lamia.name: Lamia
Lamia.description: The creature appears to be a beautiful woman from the waist up with the body of a powerful lion from the waist down.

items.name: Lamia Claws (pouch)
items.description: A lamia's ability to persuade and charm is ingrained in the creatures very bones. The creatures claws become brittle immediately after death, making it difficult to harvest, but quickly harden again once removed. The claws can be used in jewelry and decorations, but larger claws may be used to make simple tools and small weapons.

items.name: Lamia Hide
items.description: A lamia's hide is similar to a lion's pelt, but much softer, with a golden sheen. If harvested too quickly, the hide quickly begins to shed and often rips. The hide is prized by leatherworkers and furriers, and often still contains trace amounts of arcane energy.

Lemure.name: Lemure
Lemure.description: The creature is a hideous, 5 foot blob of melting, stinking flesh that oozes across the ground as it moves. Its head, torso and arms are a vaguely humanoid shape, but it is a formless, shivering, mass below its waist. Its melted face has a permanent expression of horror and anguish, and is constantly gibbering to itself, despite being unable to speak.

items.name: Lemure Blubber
items.description: The blubbery fat of a lemure can be cut away and saved. It is useful in making soap and oils.

Leucrotta.name: Leucrotta
Leucrotta.description: The creature has the head of a giant badger, the legs of a deer, and the body of a large hyena. It has brown-black skin, sharp teeth dripping with thick saliva and bright red eyes. The smell of death hangs in the air.

items.name: Leucrotta Saliva (3 vials)
items.description: The mouth of a Leucrota contains a vile, thick, mucus that burns to the touch. The saliva dries and flakes quickly, so it may be difficult to harvest. The saliva is used by alchemists as a catalyst to break down other ingredients.

items.name: Leucrotta Hide
items.description: A leucrota has a dark, thick, greasy hide. The oil makes the hide difficult to grab, cut, and harvest. An expert leatherworker may be able to fashion something from the hide. Although, the black ichor that continues to sweat off the hide (even after death) is a value to alchemists, demonologists and certain spellcasters.

items.name: Leucrotta Vocal Cords
items.description: A leucrotta has the ability to mimic any creature it has heard. This ability to copy voices and sounds stem from the creature's unique vocal chords. While most vocal cords are folds of tissue in the throat, a leucrotta's vocal cords are rows of strong, flexible filament. These cartilage-like strands can be stretched and treated, creating extremely strong wire or strings, often used for musical instruments. Spellcasters and artificers may be able to use the strands in mimicry or disguise spells/objects.

Leviathan.name: Leviathan
Leviathan.description: A leviathan is an immense creature that acts as a force of nature, arising from a body of water in the form of a gigantic serpent.

items.name: Leviathan Essence (vial)
items.description:
