A leviathan is an immense creature that is found in large body of water, and is difficult to distinguish from the water it resides. At times, the slain creature will leave behind trace amounts of its elemental energy. It is possible to collect this energy within an enchanted bottle. Requires an enchanted vial. The essence may be used to craft a powerful elemental ring.

Harvesting note: 30 DC if the leviathan disperses over 20 feet below the surface of a large body of water (spreading its essence into a wider area, making it more difficult to find).

Lich.name: Lich
Lich.description: A skeletal figure in regal tattered robes, gaunt with withered flesh stretched tightly across its visible bones. Bright pinpoints of crimson light burn in its empty sockets. It appears to hover above the ground, rather than walk.

items.name: Lich Dust (pouch)
items.description: While a lich's body is but a shell (and its soul is kept safe in its phylactery), the body still flows with arcane power. When the lich's body is destroyed, its withered form crumbles to ash and much of that power still resides. The ash is valuable to alchemists and spellcasters (especially artificers and necromancers).

Lion.name: Lion
Lion.description: The lion has strong, compact bodies and powerful forelegs, teeth and jaws for pulling down and killing prey. Its coats is yellow-gold and it has a shaggy brownish-blonde mane.

items.name: Lion's Hide
items.description: The lion's hide is covered in yellow-gold hair. It is often used to make rugs and apparel.

items.name: Lion's Mane
items.description: A lion's mane can be blond, reddish-brown or black. Harvesting the mane incorrectly means that not enough hair was gathered, or it was ruined by getting covered in the animal's blood. The hair is mainly used by weavers, tailors and wig makers.

Liondrake.name: Liondrake
Liondrake.description: A liondrake is a solitary and territorial predator with the strong body and head of a lion (males have a luxurious mane), a long dragon-like neck, and the wings of a brass dragon.

items.name: Liondrake's Hide
items.description: The liondrake's hide is covered in yellow-gold hair. The creatures ability to fly makes the hair much softer, and more valuable than a regular lion's hide. It is often used to make rugs and apparel.

items.name: Lion's Mane male only
items.description: A male liondrake has a long, blonde mane that grows around its head, and down its long neck. The mane can be blond, reddish-brown or black. Harvesting the mane incorrectly means it was ruined during the battle or is spoiled with the creature's blood. The hair is mainly used by weavers, tailors and wig makers.

Living Doll.name: Living Doll
Living Doll.description: A living doll is easily mistaken for an inanimate doll or stuffed animal.

items.name: Living Doll Soul Spark (vial)
items.description: The spirit that animates a living doll dissipates quickly, but can be gathered using an enchanted vial. The essence is valued by artificers and magic users, especially necromancers. Requires an enchanted vial.

Lizard.name: Lizard
Lizard.description: The lizard is a green, scaly-skinned reptile, usually distinguished from snakes by the possession of legs and movable eyelids.

items.name: Lizard Carcass
items.description: If the lizard's carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's eyes, tongue, tail, tiny teeth, claws and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Lizard, Giant.name: Lizard, Giant
Lizard, Giant.description: The giant lizard is a green, scaly-skinned reptile about as large as a horse. The animal has four legs, a long tail, two large round eyes and a large, wide mouth.

items.name: Giant Lizard Skin
items.description: A giant lizard's hide is large, green and covered in scales. The hide can be used to make apparel and accessories, including belts and footwear.

items.name: Giant Lizard Tongue
items.description: A giant lizard's tongue is a long, rough, spongy slab of red flesh. The tongue is cooked and eaten by some desert communities. Alchemists and healers can use the tongue as an ingredient in some potions.

Lizardfolk.name: Lizardfolk
Lizardfolk.description: A tall, powerfully build reptilian humanoid, with skin covered in green scales brown and gray were also common colors. It has a non-prehensile muscular tail about three to four feet in length. It also has sharp claws and teeth.

items.name: Lizardfolk Tail
items.description: The lizardfolk tail is long and thick with a thin spinal cord running down the middle. Swamp communities and primitive tribes often use the tail for its meat. Alchemists and healers can use the tail for salves and potions, due to the creature's regenerative capabilities. However, most communities will pay for the tails as a bounty on the creatures.

items.name: Lizardfolk Skin
items.description: A lizardfolk's skin is green and covered in small scales. The scales aren't strong or large enough to make armor, but the skin can be used to make apparel and accessories, including belts and footwear. The scales can also be used by alchemists and healers.

Lizardfolk King/Queen.name: Lizardfolk King/Queen
Lizardfolk King/Queen.description: A tall, powerfully build reptilian humanoid, with skin covered in green scales brown and gray were also common colors. It has a non-prehensile muscular tail about three to four feet in length. It also has sharp claws and teeth.

items.name: Lizardfolk Tail
items.description: The lizardfolk tail is long and thick with a thin spinal cord running down the middle. Swamp communities and primitive tribes often use the tail for its meat. Alchemists and healers can use the tail for salves and potions, due to the creature's regenerative capabilities. However, most communities will pay for the tails as a bounty on the creatures.

items.name: Lizardfolk Skin
items.description: A lizardfolk's skin is green and covered in small scales. The scales aren't strong or large enough to make armor, but the skin can be used to make apparel and accessories, including belts and footwear. The scales can also be used by alchemists and healers.

items.name: Blood of Sess'inek
items.description: Some lizardfolk leaders are touched by Sess'inek. This demon lord grants the creature strength and cunning, and makes it thoroughly evil. As a result, the creature's blood becomes a black ichor. The blood is useful to spellcasters, summoners, demonologists and alchemists.

Lizardfolk Shaman.name: Lizardfolk Shaman
Lizardfolk Shaman.description: A tall, powerfully build reptilian humanoid, with skin covered in green scales brown and gray were also common colors. It has a non-prehensile muscular tail about three to four feet in length. It also has sharp claws and teeth.

items.name: Lizardfolk Tail
items.description: The lizardfolk tail is long and thick with a thin spinal cord running down the middle. Swamp communities and primitive tribes often use the tail for its meat. Alchemists and healers can use the tail for salves and potions, due to the creature's regenerative capabilities. However, most communities will pay for the tails as a bounty on the creatures.

items.name: Lizardfolk Skin
items.description: A lizardfolk's skin is green and covered in small scales. The scales aren't strong or large enough to make armor, but the skin can be used to make apparel and accessories, including belts and footwear. The scales can also be used by alchemists and healers.

items.name: Lizardfolk Horns
items.description: Lizardfolk Shaman are blessed by Semuanya and develop a distinctive set of ridges/horns that run from the top of the shaman's head down to the end of its tail. These horns act as a conduit between the shaman and Semuanya. The horns must be harvested before the link with Semuanya is broken. If the horns are ground to dust, one can tap into their arcane power.

Lonely Sorrowsworn.name: Lonely Sorrowsworn
Lonely Sorrowsworn.description: Lonely sorrowsworn are humanoid monstrosities with arms and legs ending in sharp scythes. The creatures can shoot each of its arms like a harpoon, tethered to its body with strands of its own flesh, and drag its victims closer. They have ashen gray skin and dark beady eyes dripping with black fluid.

items.name: Sorrowsworn Saliva (vial)
items.description: The saliva of sorrowsworn is a thick, sticky, transparent fluid. The saliva is believed to be an ingredient in elixirs that treat depression. It is also studied by anyone interested in the Shadowfell.

items.name: Lost Sorrowsworn Harpoon (x2)
items.description: Each arm of a lost sorrowsworn ends in a sharp, pointed bone spike. These spikes may be used to craft some piercing weapons.

Lost Sorrowsworn.name: Lost Sorrowsworn
Lost Sorrowsworn.description: Lost sorrowsworn are humanoid monstrosities with 5 arms, each ending in a sharp, piercing scythe. They have ashen gray skin, tautly drawn on a skeletal frame.

items.name: Sorrowsworn Saliva (vial)
items.description: The saliva of sorrowsworn is a thick, sticky, transparent fluid. The saliva is believed to be an ingredient in elixirs that treat depression. It is also studied by anyone interested in the Shadowfell.

items.name: Lost Sorrowsworn Scythe (x5)
items.description: The 5 arms of a lost sorrowsworn end in sharp scythes. These scythes can often be harvested and used to make weapons.

Magma Mephit.name: Magma Mephit
Magma Mephit.description: The creature is impish in appearance, about 4 feet tall, with wispy wings and long pointy ears and nose. The creature has hot, red skin and its body constantly oozes molten lava, as if it were perspiration. It gives off a large degree of heat.

items.name: Dual Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: When a mephit is killed, it's elemental form disperses, leaving behind trace remnants from two different elemental planes. If harvested quickly, a mote of residual energy can be found - an essence resulting from the mixture of two elemental powers. The essence is useful to elemental spellcasters and those that study the elemental planes. Requires an enchanted vial.

Magmin.name: Magmin
Magmin.description: A grinning, stumpy humanoid sculpted from a black shell of burning hot magma. The creature radiates heat like a bonfire, and small jets of flame erupt from its porous skin.

items.name: Magmin Igneous Rock
items.description:
When a magmin is killed, its hot, molten form begins to cool. It crystallizes and solidifies, then slowly begins to crumble to pieces. Larger chunks of hot, glowing igneous rock can be found among the debris. These rocks often contain trace amounts of elemental power that can be harnessed by spellcasters and summoners. The rock is also rich in minerals, making it valued by alchemists.

Harvesting note: 15 DC if the fire elemental disperses into a pool of lava or a large area of burning fire over 10 ft in diameter.

items.name: Elemental Fire Essence (vial)
items.description:
When a fire elemental extinguishes, it often leaves behind burnt ash and soot. Some of this material contains traces of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the fire elemental disperses into a pool of lava or a large area of burning fire over 10 ft in diameter.

Male Steeder.name: Male Steeder
Male Steeder.description: Steeders are giant spiders, sharing many physical characteristics of their smaller cousins. Their bodies are covered in a fine fur that varies in color. They have eight powerful legs and large mandibles.

items.name: Steeder Fur (pouch)
items.description: A steeder's body is covered in a fine fur. This fur can be collected and is often used to fill pillows and mattresses. If enough fur is collected, it may be used for clothing and apparel. The fur also has some alchemical properties.

items.name: Steeder Glue (x3 vials)
items.description: The legs of a steeder excrete a viscous, glue-like substance, which allows the creature to creep along walls and ceilings. This goo can be harvested and used as an adhesive.

items.name: Steeder Chitin Plates (x4)
items.description: Several thin chitin plates protect the steeder's body. The plates are hard and flexible, but must be treated before they can be used to create armor and shields.

Mammoth.name: Mammoth
Mammoth.description: A large elephant with a long trunk, big floppy ears, and two long, curved tusks protruding from it's mouth. It is covered with a thick coat of shaggy fur.

items.name: Mammoth Skin
items.description: The large hide of an elephant is covered in a thick coat of brown fur. The hide is primarily used to make blankets, bedding and apparel.

items.name: Mammoth Tusk (x2)
items.description: The elephant has two long ivory tusks that protrude well beyond its mouths. These tusks are prized as trophies and used to make small statues and carvings. There is enough ivory to create certain musical instruments and weapons.

Manes.name: Manes
Manes.description: The humanoid stands approximately 3 feet tall, weighing over 150 lbs. Its body is pale, bloated, hairless, and crawling with maggots. Both of its eyes constantly drip disgusting liquids, and show no signs of sentience. Its jagged teeth and cruel dark claws compliment its feral minds.

items.name: Manes Blood (vial)
items.description: The blood of a mane is a thick, dark red fluid. Accomplished alchemists can create potions with a few drops of the blood.

Manticore.name: Manticore
Manticore.description: A monstrous creature with a body of a lion, the wings of a dragon and a vaguely humanoid head surrounded by a shaggy mane bristling with spikes that stretches down the creature's back. It has a long tail that ends in a cluster of deadly spikes.

items.name: Manticore Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: A manticore has rows of sharp, pointed teeth that they use to tear into their victims. Prying out the teeth can be difficult, and often results in chipping or cracking the teeth. The teeth can be used in jewelry and decorations. They are also used to line blades to make serrated edges and saws.

items.name: Manticore Tail Spikes (large pouch)
items.description: A manticore has a cluster of deadly spikes at the end of it's tail. There are about two dozen barbs in total and they usually regrow within a day. The barbs are dark, bone-like needles, some reaching a foot in length. They can be used to make daggers and other implements.

items.name: Manticore Wings (x2)
items.description: A manticore has a set of large, dragon-like, leathery wings on its back. The leather is extremely tough, yet very light, making it an ideal material for leatherworkers. The leather can be used to make apparel and accessories.

Marid.name: Marid
Marid.description: The large creature is a humanoid with moist, scaly skin. It has webbed hands and feet, and thin fins line its arms and legs. He/she is clad in a finely stitched vest and colorful pantaloons. As it moves, it flies and its lower body transform into a column of foamy water.

items.name: Water Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: A marid may leave behind a trace amount of essence from the elemental plane of water. While invisible to the naked eye, a quick ritual can reveal its presence -- a small glowing ball of blue light. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Marid Foam (vial)
items.description:
On the prime material plane, when a dead marid turns to water and splashes to the ground, it can leave behind a frothy foam. This foam quickly disperses and must be harvested quickly. This foam contain a strong amount of arcane power that can be used by spellcasters to enhance their magic. Requires an enchanted vial.

Use: When casting the spell conjure minor elemental or conjure elemental, this crystalline powder may be used as the spell's material component, which allows the spell can be cast at one level higher than the spell slot used to cast it. The crystalline powder then becomes inert and useless.

Marilith.name: Marilith
Marilith.description: From the waist up, the creature appears to be an attractive humanoid women with six arms, but its lower half is that of a giant, green snake. In each hand it carries highly decorated weapons, and adorns itself with bangles and jewelry. The creature  measures 20 feet (from head to tip of the tail) but normally stands between 7 and 9 feet tall. It's weighs almost 2 tons.

items.name: Marilith Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Marilith blood is infused with many magical properties, and is believed to help reflexes and co-ordination. Alchemists can use the blood to create powerful potions.

items.name: Marilith Snake Skin
items.description: A marilith's thick reptilian tail can provide soft, but strong, leather. Leatherworkers can use the skin in their craft, but some artificers may be able to create highly protective armor using the skin.

items.name: Marilith Spine
items.description: A marilith's spine is much stronger and flexible than a human spine. Being a creature from the Abyss, the spine is infused with dark magic that a spellcaster may be able to adapt. Or, a crafter can use the bones for their own trade (1/20 the value).

Marut.name: Marut
Marut.description: A marut is a mechanical construct, composed of onyx and gold components.

items.name: Marut Scrap Metal ([[/r 1d8]])
items.description:
When a marut is destroyed, what remains is usually a husk of fused metal, onyx and mechanical components. However, it is often possible to find a few pieces of salvageable, magically infused scrap metal. The metal can be used to craft pieces of armor.

When harvested, the creature yields [[/r 1d8]] pieces of useable scrap metal. To craft a set of medium armor, a smith requires 4 pieces of marut scrap metal. A set of heavy armor requires 6 pieces.

items.name: Marut Onyx Shards (pouch)
items.description: A marut is a large construct made of metal, onyx and gold. Most of the onyx shatters when the marut reaches 0 hit points, but some shards may be found.

items.name: Marut Components
items.description: Inside a Marut is a collection of complex robotic components, include wires, sensors, circuit boards and magical batteries. All of these components fetch a high price in gnomish communities and with skilled artificers.

items.name: Marut Gold Plate
items.description: Inside of each marut is a thin golden plate, with various geometric symbols etched on its surface (if the plate survives the constructs destruction). The symbols are the modron language, and outline a contract with instructions for the Marut, which the creature would follow to the letter. The plate is valued for the gold, but is also valued for its contents. If the holder of the plate fulfills the Marut's instructions, a high price can be collected from the Kolyarut (the modron that write the contract), in the Hall of Concordance, in Sigil. Or, if the gold plate is given to the party that broke the contract, it may be possible to collect an award for destroying the Marut.

Mastiff.name: Mastiff
Mastiff.description: A large canine with a massive head and a short dark coat colors include: tan, brown and black. It has black on it muzzle, ears, and nose and around the eyes.

items.name: Mastiff Hide
items.description: The hide of a large mastiff can be used to make a thin leather.

Maurezhi.name: Maurezhi
Maurezhi.description: The maurezhi is visibly similar to ordinary ghouls, with an emaciated form and pale, leathery, gray skin. Its facial features are more bestial than those of regular ghouls, with long, pointed ears and a maw that slopes into a short muzzle filled with serrated fangs. Its long fingers end in filth-ridden claws.

items.name: Maurezhi Claws (pouch)
items.description: A maurezhi's claws are covered in a numbing paralytic, which makes their claws useful. Harvesting the claws incorrectly can destroy the paralytic. Some alchemists, artificers and other spellcasters can use these claws in the craft.

items.name: Maurezhi Saliva (3 vials)
items.description: A maurezhi's saliva is a dangerous substance that can drain a victim's sense of self, eventually causing an unholy hunger for flesh that overpowers their personality and transforms them into a ghoul. Necromancers will pay a great deal for this saliva. Alchemist and healers may be able to transform the saliva into a healing unguent that heals decaying flesh.

Maw Demon.name: Maw Demon
Maw Demon.description: The creature resembles an enormous toothy mouth surrounded by numerous stubby appendages, and a few bulbous eyes. The squat, round body is practically split in half to accommodate its giant gullet and its four arms work to carry food to its slavering jaws. Its tough skin is either grayish-blue, or rusty brown.

items.name: Maw Demon Teeth (large bag)
items.description: Long, razor sharp teeth, each over a foot in length. The abyssal magic that flows through each maw demon gives the teeth power - power that many spellcasters can use.

items.name: Maw Demon Stomach
items.description: While alive, the stomach of a maw demon acts as a portal to the Abyss. Spellcasters may be able to use the residual magic left in the stomach as a conduit for summoning lesser demons.Use: If you cast the summon lesser demons spell, you may expend this item instead of its usual material component. If you do, the CR limits of the summoned demons specified in the spell are doubled.

Meazel.name: Meazel
Meazel.description: The meazel is a 4-foot tall humanoid with gray skin and thick dark, waxy greenish-gray hair. Most meazels have clawed hands and webbed digits, and jet black eyes.

items.name: Meazel Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Meazel blood is a thick, dark substance. The blood is touched by the Shadowfell and can be used in various potions, often related to darkvision and shadows.

items.name: Meazel Hair
items.description: The gray hair of a meazel turn black when placed in darkness. These hairs are believed to allow Meazels to briefly enter shadowfell, and teleport between shadows. Alchemist use these hairs as an ingredient in certain potions.

Medusa.name: Medusa
Medusa.description: The creature looks like a human female with pale, scaly skin and eyes that glow with an intense red color. Instead of hair, her heads is covered in a mass of 1‑foot-long living venomous serpents.

items.name: Medusa Snake Hair (large pouch)
items.description: A medusa's hair is a nest of venomous serpents. The snakes can be harvested and used by various craftsmen. Some use the snakes for their skin, others for the venom.

items.name: Medusa Heart
items.description: A medusa's heart is a red bulbous organ, wrapped in muscles and dark veins. The cursed heart seems to radiate with a dark energy, which quickly begins to dissipate as the creatures life essence fades. However, the heart still retains some arcane power that can be harnessed by spellcasters and witches.

items.name: Medusa Head (sack)
items.description:
A medusa's gaze turns creatures to stone. It is possible to harvest the head without snuffing out the eye's power. The head is a weapon itself, and can be used to turn a creature to stone. The medusa's curse keeps the head from decaying. It must be safely stored in a sack or chest, or it will lose its power.

Use: A creature can use an action to remove the head from its container and aim the head's gaze at a target within 30 feet. If the target can see the head, it is forced to make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, the target that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. The head has a single charge, which is depleted once another creature meets the head's gaze.

Meenlock.name: Meenlock
Meenlock.description: A two-foot tall hideous being with a deformed body. Underneath thick bristles of hair that are more like spines, is a body covered in cysts and sores. It stands hunched-over and drags its claws along the ground. It has an insectoid head with several sets of twitching mandibles, two long antenna-like feelers and a pair of yellow, pupil-less eyes.

items.name: Meenlock Claws (x2)
items.description: Meenlock's have long claw-like appendages that can paralyze their prey. The venom loses its potency when the creature dies, but the claws still have various uses. Alchemists can scrap off the dry paralytic to use in potions. The claws themselves can be used to make small tools.

items.name: Meenlock Pineal Gland
items.description: At the base of a meenlock's brain is a small blue gland that controls the creature's telepathic abilities. These abilities allow meenlocks to psychically join together and attack another creature, forcing it to painfully transform into a meenlock itself. This gland is highly valued by spellcasters and those that study psionic abilities. Alchemist want an enzyme that the gland secretes.

items.name: Meenlock Heart
items.description:
The heart of a meenlock is a small bundle of yellow-orange muscle and veins. The cold heart radiates a sense of fear, and is possibly the source of the creature's terror. Alchemists, spellcasters and witches may find a use for the heart.

Use: The heart has the same effect as a level 3 fear spell. A creature may use an action to squeeze the heart, making it burst in a spray of blood. All creatures in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become frightened for the duration.

While frightened by this effect, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from the source by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight with the source, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the effect ends for that creature.

Megapede.name: Megapede
Megapede.description: Gargantuan centipedes that can be as much as 150 feet long. They have dozens of legs, each 5 feet long and tipped with flexible claws, and they have a fur covered carapaces.

items.name: Megapede Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A remorhaz has dark-red blood swirling with motes of black sand-like grains. The blood is swirling with psychic energy, and is valued my spellcasters and alchemists.

items.name: Megapede Fur (x4 pelts)
items.description: The fur covered carapace of a megapede is often dirty and swarming with bugs. If large enough patches can be harvested, they may be cleaned, treated and fashioned into cloaks and other clothing.

items.name: Megapede Chitin Plates
items.description: A megapede has a segmented exoskeleton of large, heavy chitinous plates. The chitin can be cut, treated and repurposed as armor or shields.

items.name: Megapede Mandible (x2)
items.description: The mandibles of a megapede are about 4 feet long, and are hard as steel. An expert weaponsmith can craft the mandibles into various weapons and tools.

items.name: Megapede Eggs
items.description: Megepedes returning to their nest can sometimes be found carrying an egg, which is attached to it's back using its sticky saliva. The egg must be removed carefully, or it will break and be useless. Some civilizations forbid the selling of megapede eggs, since a hatched megapede will consume everything it can and become full size within weeks. However, some spellcasters and researchers will buy the egg.

Mercane.name: Mercane
Mercane.description: 12-foot tall, lanky blue giant with elongated heads, pointy ears, and long, spindly fingers. They dress well and often wear elegant robes.

items.name: Mercane Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Mercanes have white, translucent blood, swirling with glowing motes. The blood has many unique properties valued by alchemists. However, since killing a mercane is frowned upon by most merchants, many wont buy or sell the item. Reputable merchants know that mercane's specialize in trading magic items and artifacts, and they have a telepathic link to other mercanes, immediately warning of dangerous individuals.

items.name: Mercane Pineal Gland
items.description: Mercanes have the telepathic ability to communicate with other mercanes across the multiverse. The mercane's pineal gland, located in its brain, is believed to be the source of its psychic abilities, and is highly valued by spellcasters and researchers studying telepathy and other psionics.

Merfolk.name: Merfolk
Merfolk.description: The creature has the upper body, arms, and head of a fair-featured human, and from the hips down it has a fish-like tail. Its humanoid features are fey-like, more similar to elves than humans, and it has scaly, blue-green, fish-like skin and webbed hands. Instead of hair, it has a collection of fin-like protrusions on is head.

items.name: Merfolk Scales (small pouch)
items.description: Merfolk scales appear blue-green underwater, but have a rainbow sheen when brought to the surface. The small scales are useful when creating jewelry, decorations, and apparel. Some dyers and alchemists use the scales to create a variety of colorful dyes and paints.

Merregon.name: Merregon
Merregon.description: A merregons is a 6-foot tall, heavily armored humanoid, with a metal mask bolted to its head. All merregon are identical, and the only way to tell them apart is to check the metal masks which indicates their commander and the layer of the Nine Hells they are assigned to.

items.name: Merregon Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Merregon blood is a hot, boiling red liquid. Fiend blood is sought after as an ingredient in potions, and can be used in arcane rituals.

items.name: Merregon Mask
items.description: A metal mask is bolted, and often fused, to a merregon's face. The shape and style of the mask indicates the merregon's commander and the layer of the Nine Hells it was assigned to. The mask is made of metal forged in the Nine Hells, and has value to collectors and anyone studying devils and the Nine Hells.

Merrenoloth.name: Merrenoloth
Merrenoloth.description: The merrenoloth is a pale, nearly skeletal, 5-foot tall humanoid. It wears rotted, hooded robes and burial wraps. Its eyes glow red, especially when its angered. Merrenoloths are the captains of ferries on the River Styx.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Merrenoloth Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Merrenoloth blood is an oozing black substance. It is believed to make creatures immune to the effects of the River Styx, and is valued by spellcasters and alchemists.

items.name: Merrenoloth Eyes (x2)
items.description: A merrenoloth has burning red eyes. Fluids can be extracted from these soft orbs that have alchemical properties, and is believed to be used to bolster a creatures fortitude, and negate the effects of fear-based spells and effects.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Merrow.name: Merrow
Merrow.description: The evil sea creature has the upper body of a hulking, monstrous humanoid with a long fish-like tail. It is covered in dark, blue-green scales and tattered fins. It has a beastial reptilian head with a mouth full of sharp teeth. It has small, wavy tentacles on its chin, dark beady eyes, and a ridged fin running from its forehead down its back.

items.name: Merrow Blood (3 vials)
items.description:
Compared to regular merfolk, the transformed nature of the merrow makes their blood
more useful when used in alchemy. One of the most common uses of their blood is for
the ubiquitous potion of water breathing. Ironically, a failed merrow assault can lead to
survivors using their blood as a means to go back and hunt their attackers in their own
domain.

items.name: Merrow Scales (small pouch)
items.description: Merrow scales are a dull blue color. The small, hard scales are useful when creating jewelry and decorations. Some dyers and alchemists use the scales to create deep blue dyes and paints.

items.name: Merrow Claw (x2)
items.description: A merrow has long, black, sharp claws, used for snatching prey and rending flesh. The claws can be fashioned into small blades or tools.

items.name: Merrow Heart
items.description: A merrow's heart is a bulbous blue ball of flesh and veins. The heart has a loose connection to the Abyss and the demon lord Demogorgon. Spellcasters, especially summoners, and demonologists value the heart.

Metallic Peacekeeper.name: Metallic Peacekeeper
Metallic Peacekeeper.description: A metallic peacekeeper is a humanoid construct, forged from the metal associated with its metallic dragon creator. It is often instructed to protect a community that the metallic dragon is attached to, maintaining peace and order.

items.name: Metallic Peacekeeper Parts
items.description: When destroyed, the magic holding a metallic peacekeeper together disperses, and the construct falls to pieces. All that remains are several pieces of scrap metal, including cogs, gears and wires. These items can be used by artificers, tinkerers, inventors, smiths and jewelers.

items.name: Metallic Peacekeeper Mist
items.description: A metallic peacekeeper is able to release a calming gas. When the construct is destroyed, a cloud of this gas is released. Using an enchanted flask or vial, it may be possible to collect some of this mist. The calming properties are often studied by alchemists and healers. Requires an enchanted flask/vial.

Metallic Warbler.name: Metallic Warbler
Metallic Warbler.description: A metallic warbler resembles a metal songbird, forged from the metal associated with its metallic dragon creator. It acts as clandestine agent of its creator.

items.name: Metallic Warbler Parts
items.description: When destroyed, the magic holding a metallic warbler together disperses, and the construct falls to pieces. All that remains are several pieces of scrap metal, including cogs and gears. These items can be used by artificers, tinkerers, inventors, smiths and jewelers.

Mezzoloth.name: Mezzoloth
Mezzoloth.description: A human-sized insect creature, covered in a dense exoskeleton with chitinous plates. It has four insectoid arms with pincer-like hands and two chitinous covered legs. Its head has two orange compound eyes, and two mandibles flanking a mouth of sharp teeth.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Mezzoloth Chitin
items.description: A mezzoloth's insect-like humanoid form is covered in hard chitinous plates. If the plates can be removed, they can be crafted into various armor pieces by adept armorers.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Mimic.name: Mimic
Mimic.description: The creature retains some semblance of its disguised shape (i.e. a barrel, a chest), but has a large gaping mouth full of sharp teeth. Several yellow-orange eyes mark the area above it's mouth and tentacle-like appendages reach out from it's body.

items.name: Mimic Adhesive (vial)
items.description: A mimic can secrete a strong, clear adhesive. This glue-like substance dries very fast, and must be harvested quickly. The adhesive is valued by all kinds of craftsmen.

items.name: Mimic Skin Strip
items.description: When a mimic dies, it slowly melts into its original form, an amorphous gray blob. It is difficult to harvest even a strip of flesh from the creature, as it is like cutting through water. A mimic's natural skin is not good for making leather, but it is valued by transmutation spellcasters and those that study polymorphing.

Mind Flayer.name: Mind Flayer
Mind Flayer.description: The alien-like humanoid has soft, moist, rubbery skin with a greenish-violet color. Its large, bald, octopus-like head has two eyes and four tentacles snaking from down from where it's nose should be. It excretes a thin film of slimy, glistening mucus and gives off a faint onion and garlic odor. It wears a long robe, and has thin, lengthy fingers ending in sharp talons.

items.name: Mind Flayer Mucus
items.description: The moist, rubbery mauve skin of a mind flayer is coated with a thin glaze of mucus that smells of formaldahyde. The mucus is valued by alchemists. Spellcasters value the mucus for its ability to enhance psionic powers.

items.name: Mind Flayer Tentacle (x4)
items.description: An illithid's tentacles are writhing with psionic energy. Each tentacle is a long strand of moist purple flesh, oozing with a sticky, clear mucus. The tentacle's fluids are useful to alchemists, and artificers may be able to find a use for the tentacles themselves.

items.name: Mind Flayer Membrane
items.description: Many of the illithid's organs are wrapped in a thin, semi-translucent membrane. It can rip easily if removed incorrectly or too quickly. The membrane is believed to insulate the creature's internal organs, allowing psionic energy to flow around the area. The membrane is valued as a psionic conduit.

items.name: Mind Flayer Brain
items.description: An illithid's brain is larger than a human brain, and contains many more ridges. The large pinkish organ secretes a translucent foggy yellow fluid, several days after death. The brain of an illithid are prized by the arcane community, and the fluid is highly valued by alchemists, healers and witches.

Mindwitness.name: Mindwitness
Mindwitness.description: The creature resembles a beholder. It is an orb-shaped being 6 feet in diameter, with a large central eye on its body, and ten smaller eyes on stalks emerging from the top. Unlike a beholder, it has a toothy lamprey-like mouth surrounded by four large octopus-like tentacles.

items.name: Mindwitness Tentacle (x4)
items.description: A mindwitness has four long, fleshy tentacles. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips.

items.name: Mindwitness Eye Stalk
items.description: The eye stalks of a mindwitness each have unique psionic properties, and are prized by spellcasters, artificers and anyone studying psionics. Once successfully harvested, roll [[/r 1d6]] for the type of eyestalk received (1. Aversion, 2. Fear, 3. Psychic, 4. Slowing, 5. Stunning, 6. Telekinetic). see VGM p176 for more details on the Mindwitness

items.name: Mindwitness Large Eye
items.description: A mindwitness is a telepathic hub or beacon for mind flayers. This link is tied directly to the large eye of the mindwitness, which acts like a signal dish, receiving and transmitting telepathic messages. The large eye can be used by spellcasters, artificers and anyone that studies psionics. Alchemists may be able to mash the eye into a fine paste to create potions and salves.

Minotaur.name: Minotaur
Minotaur.description: A giant muscular humanoid, with a bull-like head and a fur-covered body.

items.name: Minotaur Hide
items.description: A minotaur's hide is similar to bovine hides, such as cows and bulls. It is known for its durability and resistance to moisture absorption. The hide can be used to make harnesses, bags, shoes and rugs.

items.name: Minotaur Horn (x2)
items.description: The hard, pointed horns of a minotaur have many uses. Craftsmen can use the item to create drinking horns, musical instruments, decorations, small weapons and even horned helms.

items.name: Minotaur Pineal Gland
items.description: Minotaur are believed to visualize every route it might take to reach its prey. This ability to coordinate their senses, and possible tie into a psionic "third eye", is a result of the creature's pineal gland. The gland is a small pea-shape ball of flesh located in the center of the brain. The gland is useful to many researchers (especially those studying demonology or Baphomet). Alchemist, artificers and spellcasters may also be interested in the gland.

Minotaur Skeleton.name: Minotaur Skeleton
Minotaur Skeleton.description: The large, undead, animated corpse of a minotaur, completely devoid of any flesh. Its loose bones and joints are held together by some unseen necromatic energy.

items.name: Bone Dust (pouch)
items.description: When destroyed, the bones of a skeleton collapse to the ground. Shifting through the remains, it may be possible to find bone dust coated with dark necrotic energy. The dust is commonly used in many necromantic spells and rituals.

items.name: Minotaur Horn (x2)
items.description: The hard, pointed horns of a minotaur have many uses. Craftsmen can use the item to create drinking horns, musical instruments, decorations, small weapons and even horned helms.

Moloch.name: Moloch
Moloch.description: Moloch is an archdevil standing over 14 feet tall with a powerful, almost square physique. He has reddish-orange skin and a bestial visage, with a huge horned head hosting fiery, unblinking eyes and a salivating, gaping mouth full of sharp-like teeth. He has thick, muscular arms ending in clawed hand, and bulky legs ending in hooves. He carries a large, many-tailed whip surging with electric energy.

items.name: Moloch's Blood (5 vials)
items.description: A pit fiend blood is a scalding red fluid, that bubbles with the fiery heat of hell. Skilled alchemists can cool and refine the blood using a variety of alchemic processes, and use the resulting liquid as a component in various potions.

items.name: Moloch's Claws (pouch)
items.description: The sharp claws of a pit fiend are a deadly natural weapon. Weaponsmiths can use the item in crafting certain weapons. It can also be sold as a trophy, or used to make certain crafts.

items.name: Moloch's Gland of Despair
items.description:
Moloch is capable of exhaling a noxious breath of despair, causing a powerful psychic blast, that makes enemies run in fear. This toxic blast is emitted from a glandular sac, that resonates in arcane power, located at the roof of the creature's mouth. 

Use: As an action, a creature may throw this sac at a point it can see within 30 feet, bursting on impact. All creatures within 10 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, or take [[/r 3d10]] psychic damage and become frightened of the attacker for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

items.name: Moloch's Horns (x2)
items.description: The horns of Moloch are strong as steel, and can only be reshaped using magical means (either by spellcasters, or by using enchanted tools). They can also be ground into a fine dust, which can be refined and used to strengthen weapons and armor.

items.name: Moloch's Hooves (x2)
items.description: The two hooves of Moloch are almost indestructible. It is rumored that the hard objects can be magical reshaped into a powerful warhammer head.

Molydeus.name: Molydeus
Molydeus.description: The molydeus is a 12-foot tall humanoid with a muscular body covered in crimson red skin and equipped with a set of clawed hands. Its main head resembles a salivating, silver-eyed wolf or hyena, while a writhing serpent protrudes from its neck. Molydeus' weapon is carved with jagged runes with a shimmering ruby set within the base of the shaft. However, once the creature is slain, its weapon dissolves into a puddle of ichor.

items.name: Molydeus' Wolf Fangs (pouch)
items.description: The primary head of molydeus has a mouth full of steel-hard teeth (wolf or hyena, depending on the molydeus). The teeth can be fashioned into crafts, jewelry and small tools.

items.name: Molydeus' Snake Skin
items.description: A molydeus has a second head, that of a giant snake protruding out of its neck. The thick reptilian hide can provide soft, but strong leather. Leatherworkers can use the skin in their craft, but some artificers may be able to create highly protective armor using the skin. Some say the snake skin provides protection from poison.

items.name: Molydeus' Weapon Ichor ([[/r 1d8]] vials)
items.description:
When a molydeus is killed, it's rune-covered weapon dissolves into a foul ichor. This thick, yellow-orange substance is valued by alchemists, but its also prized for its arcane properties. The substance is believed to magically enhance weapons.

Use: A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with 1 vial of this demonic ichor. The ichor lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with this ichor must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take an additional [[/r 3d8]] force damage.

Monodrone.name: Monodrone
Monodrone.description: A simple spherical construct with two mechanical arms and two legs. It has a single eye and rudimentary wings.

Morkoth.name: Morkoth
Morkoth.description: The creature resembles a monstrous squid-like aberration. It has a round, bulbous head with eight thick, octopus-like tentacles extending downward, with lobster-like legs protruding down its side. It has two large, bulbous eyes and a beaked maw with many sharp teeth visible even when its mouth is shut.

items.name: Morkoth Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A morkoth is an ancient creature, believed to have celestial power coursing through its veins. The blood is dark red, with a slight silvery sheen. The blood is used by alchemists, healers, dyers and spellcasters.

items.name: Morkoth Eye (x2)
items.description: A morkoth's eyes are capable of hypnotizing its prey. The spherical milky orbs are reservoirs of arcane energy. Spellcasters, artificers and alchemists all have uses for a morkoth's eyes.

items.name: Morkoth Tentacle (x2)
items.description: The long, thick tentacles of a morkoth resemble the suction cup feelers of an octopus. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips.

items.name: Morkoth Celestial Pearl
items.description: A morkoth is believed to have been created when the dead body of a deity of greed collided with a piece of life-giving celestial matter. It may be possible to find a remnant of celestial power within the creature's carcass, which resembles a white shimmering stone with a rainbow sheen. Collectors value the pearl for its beauty, and arcanists value its celestial power.

Mud Mephit.name: Mud Mephit
Mud Mephit.description: The creature is impish in appearance, about 4 feet tall, with dripping wings and long pointy ears and nose. The creature appears to be made of water and dirt, its murky brown skin constantly oozing mud, as if it were perspiration.

items.name: Dual Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: When a mephit is killed, it's elemental form disperses, leaving behind trace remnants from two different elemental planes. If harvested quickly, a mote of residual energy can be found - an essence resulting from the mixture of two elemental powers. The essence is useful to elemental spellcasters and those that study the elemental planes. Requires an enchanted vial.

Mule.name: Mule
Mule.description: It looks like a mixture between a donkey and a horse. Its body is slightly stouter than an average horse, but leaner than a donkey. Its ears are also slightly longer than those of a horse and stick prominently up in the air. Its mane is different than a horse, as it has short hairs that stick straight up. It stands just over 4 feet tall and weighs about 800 pounds.

items.name: Mule Hoof (x4)
items.description: A mule's hooves contains a collagen that is used to make a sticky adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Mule Hide
items.description: A mule's hide is known for its durability and resistance to moisture absorption.  The hide is primarily used to make harnesses, bags, shoes and rugs.

Mummy.name: Mummy
Mummy.description: A walking corpse, wrapped in tattered bandages. The skin that is visible looks preserved, but ashen gray and desiccated.

items.name: Mummy Bandages (pouch)
items.description: Prior to a mummy being set to rest, strips of white cotton cloth are soaked in a secret alchemical formula. These bandages are then carefully wrapped around the body while an arcane ritual is performed. Add centuries of rest, and the bandages arcane magic becomes even stronger. The bandages are old, and some may deteriorate upon harvesting, but many should be viable for use. The bandages can be treated by alchemists and healers to treat injuries and disease. Spellcasters, especially necromancers, may be able to pull some arcane power from the item.

items.name: Mummy Dust (small pouch)
items.description: Over time, the skin and bandages begin to dry and decay, creating a thin coating of dust on the creature. Combined with the magical aura of the mummy, this dust retains a touch of arcane power that can be used in potions and spells. Necromancers are especially interested in this item.

Mummy Lord.name: Mummy Lord
Mummy Lord.description: A walking corpse, wrapped in tattered bandages. The skin that is visible looks preserved, but ashen gray and desiccated. It wears the ornaments and jewelry of a king.

items.name: Mummy Bandages (pouch)
items.description: Prior to a mummy being set to rest, strips of white cotton cloth are soaked in a secret alchemical formula. These bandages are then carefully wrapped around the body while an arcane ritual is performed. Add centuries of rest, and the bandages arcane magic becomes even stronger. The bandages are old, and some may deteriorate upon harvesting, but many should be viable for use. The bandages can be treated by alchemists and healers to treat injuries and disease. Spellcasters, especially necromancers, may be able to pull some arcane power from the item.

items.name: Mummy Dust (small pouch)
items.description: Over time, the skin and bandages begin to dry and decay, creating a thin coating of dust on the creature. Combined with the magical aura of the mummy, this dust retains a touch of arcane power that can be used in potions and spells. Necromancers are especially interested in this item.

items.name: Mummy Heart
items.description: When the body of a mummy is prepared, the body is cut open and all of the organs are removed, each being preserved in a ceremonial urn. These urns are often located somewhere within the mummy's lair (DMs discretion on the urns location). While the heart is desiccated and somewhat preserved, the harvesting DC check determines if the heart doesn't get damaged or crumble to dust when it is removed from the urn. The heart is useful to necromancers, artificers and other spellcasters.

Murder Comet.name: Murder Comet
Murder Comet.description: A screaming stone head wreathed in flame, with a trail of fire behind it as it flies through Wildspace.

items.name: Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: When a Murder Comet is destroyed, the flames subside and the stone face crumbles to pieces. The creature may leave behind a trace amount of essence from the elemental plane of earth. While invisible to the naked eye, a quick ritual can reveal its presence - a small glowing ball of redish light. Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Murder Comet Ore
items.description: The stone that makes up a murder comet goes through a metamorphosis as it flies through Wildspace over the decades. The rock develops veins of a unique white-silver ore. This ore can be smelted, purified and then fashioned into jewelry and weapons. The ore in a single murder comet can be used to create a dagger or shortsword (more ore is required for larger weapons)

Myconid Adult.name: Myconid Adult
Myconid Adult.description: A 6-foot tall, giant fungi with a humanoid form and a mushroom-capped head.  Its upper half splits into a pair of arms below its head. Its lower half divides into a pair of legs at the stump. Each extremity is pudgy and broad, with its hands ending in two stubby fingers and a thumb, and its feet hosts numerous vestigial toes some fungus folk host more than the usual number of limbs and/or digits. The bloated flesh of most myconids ranged in coloration from purple to gray.

items.name: Rapport Spores (small pouch)
items.description: All myconids emit miniscule motes of fuzzy yellow spores, that look almost invisible as they float through the air like dust. These spores allows the myconids to communicate with each other. Alchemists, artificers and spellcasters may be able to repurpose these spores.

items.name: Pacifying Spores (small pouch)
items.description:
This item can only be harvested if the myconid hasn't used all of its Pacifying Spores abilities (3/day). These light pink spores have a sweet smell and a calming effect. Alchemists find these spores useful in creating concoctions. Some medicinal experts and healers can create pain killer and sedatives using the spores.

Use: A creature can use an action to make a ranged attack to throw the pouch of pacifying spores at a target within 10 feet that it can see. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. This effect ends if the target is attacked. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

Myconid Sovereign.name: Myconid Sovereign
Myconid Sovereign.description: A 12-foot tall, giant fungi with a humanoid form and a mushroom-capped head.  Its upper half splits into a pair of arms below its head. Its lower half divides into a pair of legs at the stump. Each extremity is pudgy and broad, with its hands ending in two stubby fingers and a thumb, and its feet hosts numerous vestigial toes some fungus folk host more than the usual number of limbs and/or digits. The bloated flesh of most myconids ranged in coloration from purple to gray.

items.name: Rapport Spores (small pouch)
items.description: All myconids emit miniscule motes of fuzzy yellow spores, that look almost invisible as they float through the air like dust. These spores allows the myconids to communicate with each other. Alchemists, artificers and spellcasters may be able to repurpose these spores.

items.name: Pacifying Spores (small pouch)
items.description:
This item can only be harvested if the myconid hasn't used all of its Pacifying Spores abilities (3/day). These light pink spores have a calming effect, and have a sweet smell. Alchemists find these spores useful in creating concoctions.

Use: A creature can use an action to make a ranged attack to throw the pouch of pacifying spores at a target within 10 feet, that it can see. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. This effect ends if the target is attacked. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Hallucination Spores (small pouch)
items.description:
Myconid sovereigns have the ability to emit a spray of soft purple spores, that appear as a translucent purple mist. These spores can cause hallucinations among non-myconids. This item is sought after by shady alchemists and illicit drug dealers.

Use: A creature can use an action to make a ranged attack and throw the pouch of hallucination spores at a target within 10 feet that it can see. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is incapacitated while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Animating Spores (small pouch)
items.description: This item can only be harvested if the myconid sovereign hasn't used all of its Animating Spores abilities (3/day). These miniscule gray spores are sprayed like a soft hazy mist. These spores have the ability to raise a corpse as a spore servant (MM p230). Unfortunately, a spore servant can only be controlled by a myconid, so the spore have little to your average adventurer. However, necromancers have a strong appreciation for these spores.

Myconid Sprout.name: Myconid Sprout
Myconid Sprout.description: A 3-foot tall fungi with a humanoid form and a mushroom-capped head.  Its upper half splits into a pair of arms below its head. Its lower half divides into a pair of legs at the stump. Each extremity is pudgy and broad, with its hands ending in two stubby fingers and a thumb, and its feet hosts numerous vestigial toes some fungus folk host more than the usual number of limbs and/or digits. The bloated flesh of most myconids ranged in coloration from purple to gray.

items.name: Rapport Spores (small pouch)
items.description: All myconids emit miniscule motes of fuzzy yellow spores, that look almost invisible as they float through the air like dust. These spores allows the myconids to communicate with each other. Alchemists, artificers and spellcasters may be able to repurpose these spores.

Nabassu.name: Nabassu
Nabassu.description: The nabassus is a gaunt, 7-foot tall, gargoyleish creature. It emaciated body is covered in scaled leather skin. It has tight sinewy muscles, thin arms, and hands with long fingers and lengthy talons. Its elongated head has pointy, bat-like ears, a pair of horns on its forehead, and two beady, glowing yellow eyes. A pair of large bat-like stretch out from its back.

items.name: Nabassu Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Nabassu blood is a viscous black fluid, that appears to absorb light. The blood is believed to cause magical darkness, and is valued by alchemists and spellcasters.

items.name: Nabassu Hide
items.description: A nabassu's hide is a dull shade of black, with small tufts of dark fur on its shoulders and back. Nabassus have the ability to change their coloration to better blend in with their surroundings, changing to black, brown, and pale gray at will. The hide can be fashioned into a black leather, that rogues and assassins cherish.

items.name: Nabassu Eye (x2)
items.description: A nabassu has two steel gray eyes that glow yellow whenever a soul is near. The orbs resonate with arcane power, trace amounts of energy left from the souls the creature has eaten. The eyes can be used by alchemist and spellcasters.

Nagpa.name: Nagpa
Nagpa.description: The nagpa resembles a human with the head of a vulture and a hunched back. Its skin is shriveled, dry and gray. It smell potently of dust, bird droppings, and spoiled milk. Nagpas prefer long flowing robes, and most carry a staff of their own creation.

items.name: Nagpa Claws (pouch)
items.description: The claws of a nagpa are black talons, covered in trace amounts of arcane energy. Alchemists, healers, and spellcasters can shave the claws down into a powder, and tap into the magical power, using it for potions and spells.

items.name: Nagpa Beak
items.description: The large, vulture-like beak is extremely hard. It may be used to fashion helms, pauldrons and other armaments. Craftsmen can use the beak to make shovels and other tools.

items.name: Nagpa Hair (pouch)
items.description: A nagpa has scattered patches of long, hard, black bristles sticking out of its body. Spellcasters and researchers often use these pointing hairs as writing implements. Craftsmen may use the hairs as needles and thin supports for fabric and other lightweight materials.

Nalfeshnee.name: Nalfeshnee
Nalfeshnee.description: The creature stands over 15 feet tall avg. 10 to 20 ft and looks to weigh over 8,000 pounds. It's body is corpulent, combining the most abysmal features of a boar and ape into a bipedal monstrosity. It has small, feathered wings, greatly undersized compared to its rotund figure. However, despite their flimsy appearance, the small wings enable the heavy creature to fly. When not flying, it waddles, rather than walks. Their glowing red eyes have a hungry look.

items.name: Nalfeshnee Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: A nalfeshnee's teeth are a strong ivory, covered in enamel as tough as steel. The teeth can be fashioned into ivory crafts, statuettes and tools.

items.name: Nalfeshnee Tusk (x2)
items.description: A nalfeshnee's tusks often protrude from their bottom lip (although some protrude from their bottom lip, and a few have tusks on both). The tusks are solid, curved ivory. They average around 2 to 3 feet long. The smaller tusks make excellent hilts, while longer tusks can be fashioned into their own weapons.

items.name: Nalfeshnee Wing (x2)
items.description:
Dark abyssal magic allows the diminutive wings of a nalfeshnee to support its large weight. The wings also give the nalfeshnee the ability to teleport, which can be used by a skilled harvester. Use: You may spend an action focusing on a wing in your hand. If you do so, you magically teleport, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once this item has been used once, it loses
all magical properties and becomes useless.

items.name: Nalfeshnee Eyes (x2)
items.description: A Nalfeshnee's eyes grant it the ability to emit a magically scintillating, multicolored light that can instill fear on their enemies (as if their appearance wasn't enough!). A skilled artificer or magic user can transform the eyes into gems that have a similar effect.

Narzugon.name: Narzugon
Narzugon.description: The narzugon is a ghastly, gray humanoid standing over 6 feet tall. It is fully encased in a masterfully constructed set of spiked, plate armor.

items.name: Narzugan Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Narzugan blood is an extremely hot, thick red liquid. Fiend blood is always valued by alchemists and spellcasters (especially conjurers).

items.name: Narzugon Heart
items.description: The heart of a narzugon is a dark redish, fist-sized organ, wrapped in thick veins. The heart of these dark paladins can be used in rituals to appease certain deities. The heart also has many alchemical properties.

Needle Blight.name: Needle Blight
Needle Blight.description: A human-sized amalgamation of plant matter and needle-like thorns.

items.name: Blight Needles (small bundle)
items.description: Hardened wooden needles. Often used by fletchers for wooden darts and arrow heads.

items.name: Blight Pollen (small pouch)
items.description: Blight's use their pollen to communicate with each other. As such, alchemists and druids often use the pollen for potions that aid in talking to plants.

items.name: Blight Seeds (x5)
items.description: These hard, dry, wrinkled seeds, about the size of a walnut, can often be found on dead blights. Once a seed is unnaturally plucked from a blight's body, the seed become sterile. Alchemists often use the seeds to create oils and potions. Some farmers can repurpose the seeds as a unique fertilizer.

items.name: Gulthias Sap (vial)
items.description: A dark red, thick and sticky sap can sometimes be found on a blight's body.

Neh-thalggu.name: Neh-thalggu
Neh-thalggu.description: A neh-thalggu has a bulbous white body and six legs resembling those of a crustacean. Four bulging eyes and a tooth-filled maw dominate its hideous visage. Behind and above these features, one or more clear lumps protrude from it's back, each containing a brain it has consumed.

items.name: Neh-thalggu Pincers (x2)
items.description: The pincers of a Neh-thalggu are about one foot long, and their white shell is often covered in dried blood. The pincers are extremely sharp, and often used by others to create cutting tools.

items.name: Neh-thalggu Saliva (x2 vials)
items.description: Unlike the saliva of other creatures, the saliva of a Neh-thalggu preserves anything that it eats, most notably the brains that it consumes. Alchemist and healers can use the saliva to help potions and ingredients last longer.

items.name: Neh-thalggu Brain Sacks (x [[/r 1d12]])
items.description: A Neh-thalggu has [[/r 1d12]] clear bulbous sacs protruding from it's back, each containing a humanoid's brain. These brain sacs, coated in a Neh-thalggu's saliva, are useful in creating bags of preservation and similar magic items.

Neogi.name: Neogi
Neogi.description: A small eight-legged creature resembling a giant spider, about 2 feet tall. It has a long eel-like neck ending in a rounded head, with reflective eyes and a mouth full of teeth.

items.name: Neogi Venom (vial)
items.description:
The clear yellow venom of a neogi is used weaken and subjugate potential slaves.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough vemon for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 250gp worth of material to create Neogi Poison (DC 15 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Neogi Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 12 ([[/r 4d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 500gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Neogi Eyes (x2)
items.description: A neogi's eyes can hypnotize and subdue creatures much larger than themselves. If harvested correctly, the eyes retain trace amounts of the trance-like power, which can be harnessed by other spellcasters and artificers. The eyes can also be used as an ingredient in various charm potions.

Neogi Hatchling.name: Neogi Hatchling
Neogi Hatchling.description: A small eight-legged creature resembling a giant spider about a foot tall. It has a long eel-like neck ending in a rounded head, with reflective eyes and a mouth full of teeth.

items.name: Neogi Hatchling Venom (vial)
items.description:
The clear yellow venom of a hatchling neogi is used weaken and subjugate potential slaves. A hatchlings poison is weaker than an adults.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough vemon for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 100gp worth of material to create Neogi Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Neogi Hatchling Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Neogi Hatchling Swarm.name: Neogi Hatchling Swarm
Neogi Hatchling Swarm.description: A small eight-legged creature resembling a giant spider about a foot tall. It has a long eel-like neck ending in a rounded head, with reflective eyes and a mouth full of teeth.

items.name: Neogi Hatchling Venom (x3 vial)
items.description:
The clear yellow venom of a hatchling neogi is used weaken and subjugate potential slaves. A hatchlings poison is weaker than an adults.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough vemon for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 100gp worth of material to create Neogi Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Neogi Hatchling Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Neogi Master.name: Neogi Master
Neogi Master.description: An eight-legged creature resembling a giant spider, about 4 feet tall. It has a long eel-like neck ending in a rounded head, with reflective eyes and a mouth full of teeth.

items.name: Neogi Venom (vial)
items.description:
The clear yellow venom of a neogi is used weaken and subjugate potential slaves.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough vemon for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 250gp worth of material to create Neogi Poison (DC 15 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Neogi Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 12 ([[/r 4d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 500gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Neogi Eyes (x2)
items.description: A neogi's eyes can hypnotize and subdue creatures much larger than themselves. If harvested correctly, the eyes retain trace amounts of the trance-like power, which can be harnessed by other spellcasters and artificers. The eyes can also be used as an ingredient in various charm potions.

items.name: Neogi Egg Sack
items.description: The large abdomen of an old master neogi is covered in large, round yellow sacs which house the embryos of neogi hatchlings. If one is careful, an egg sac can be removed intact. Once a single egg sac is removed, the tube that keeps all the sacs alive is cut, and the rest of the eggs wither immediately. A neogi egg sac is forbidden in many lands, since it is believed that a single egg will spawn a swarm of the creatures (untrue). However, spellcasters, researchers and people studying arachnids will certainly pay for such an item.

Neogi Pirate.name: Neogi Pirate
Neogi Pirate.description: A small eight-legged creature resembling a giant spider, about 2 feet tall. It has a long eel-like neck ending in a rounded head, with reflective eyes and a mouth full of teeth.

items.name: Neogi Venom (vial)
items.description:
The clear yellow venom of a neogi is used weaken and subjugate potential slaves.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough vemon for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 250gp worth of material to create Neogi Poison (DC 15 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Neogi Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 12 ([[/r 4d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 500gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Neogi Eyes (x2)
items.description: A neogi's eyes can hypnotize and subdue creatures much larger than themselves. If harvested correctly, the eyes retain trace amounts of the trance-like power, which can be harnessed by other spellcasters and artificers. The eyes can also be used as an ingredient in various charm potions.

Neogi Void Hunter.name: Neogi Void Hunter
Neogi Void Hunter.description: An eight-legged creature resembling a giant spider, about 4 feet tall. It has a long eel-like neck ending in a rounded head, with reflective eyes and a mouth full of teeth.

items.name: Neogi Venom (vial)
items.description:
The clear yellow venom of a neogi is used weaken and subjugate potential slaves.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough vemon for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 250gp worth of material to create Neogi Poison (DC 15 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Neogi Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 12 ([[/r 4d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 500gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Neogi Void Hunter Eyes (x2)
items.description: A neogi's eyes can hypnotize and subdue creatures much larger than themselves. In addition, a neogi void hunter has the ability to see through magical darkness. If harvested correctly, the eyes retain trace amounts of its power, which can be harnessed by other spellcasters and artificers. The eyes can also be used as an ingredient in charm and darkvision potions.

items.name: Neogi Void Hunter Brain
items.description: Neogi Void Hunters are rare creatures with several arcane abilities. As such, a neogi void hunter's brain is valued for research and study, and may be used in potions and arcane rituals.

Neothelid.name: Neothelid
Neothelid.description: A slime-covered worm of immense size. Its mouth opens like a flower with four barbed petals, revealing a lamprey-like mouth, with four long tentacles lashing out like hungry tongues.

items.name: Neothelid Tentacle (x4)
items.description: A neothelid has long, light purple tentacles that end in sharp serrated edges. Normally covered in a corrosive digestive enzyme, the tentacles are tough, durable and resistant to caustic substances. An expert craftsman can stretch the tentacles and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips.

items.name: Neothelid Glandular Sack
items.description:
A neothelid has two glands that secrete a collection of chemicals into the creature's throat. When these chemicals combine, and the neothelid exhales, a spray of acid shoots forth. If the harvesting DC check fails by 5 or more, the glandular sac ruptures, causing [[/r 4d6]] acid damage to every creature within a 10-foot radius. These glands are valued by alchemist, artificers and anyone that studies illithids.

Use: As an action, a creature may throw this sac at a point it can see within 20 feet, bursting on impact. All creatures within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking [[/r 5d6]] acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Neothelid Hide
items.description: A neothelid's purple hide is covered in a thick caustic enzyme, that doesn't appear to harm the skin due to the creature's natural psionic abilities. However, when the creature dies, the acidic substance begins to eat away at the creature's flesh. Harvesting must be done quickly before the skin begins to melt away. The hide can be used to make a tough leather that still retains some of the creature's psionic powers.

items.name: Neothelid Hook (4x)
items.description: The neothelid's mouth opens like a flower with four barbed petals ending in sharp hooks. These black, curved hooks act as psionic antennas and are prized in the arcane community. The large hooks can also be crafted into various weapons.

Night Hag.name: Night Hag
Night Hag.description: The hag is horribly grotesque, with a decrepit frame and long limbs. She has dark blue-purple bruised skin with tattoo-like scars all over her flesh, marred with grotesque warts, open sores, and diseased blisters. Her hair is unkempt and pitch-black, woven with bones, fingers and other heinous accessories. She has a pair of light, hellish eyes with pinprick pupils and a jaw that reaches out like a fearsome hook from underneath her sharply pointed nose. Her yellow teeth feature sharp, jagged fangs.

items.name: Night Hag's Hair (small pouch)
items.description: A night hag has a tangled mane of vine-like, pitch black hair. Due to the hag's abilities, the hair retains trace amounts of magic. Alchemists may find the hair useful in certain potions.

items.name: Night Hag's Blood (3 vials)
