items.description: A hag's blood is a black, viscous fluid that smells like rotting flesh. The blood has arcane properties that can be harnessed by certain spellcasters and alchemists.

items.name: Night Hag's Nails (pouch)
items.description: The nails of a hag are long, filthy, and sharp. After years of wielding magic, the nails become a conduit for the hags power. They must be carefully extracted during a complex ritual in order to retain their usefulness. Alchemists, magic users and other hags find value in this item.

items.name: Night Hag's Eyeball
items.description: Harvesting the hag's eyeball intact is a delicate task. The eye is useful to those that practice divination. It can also be used by alchemists.

Night Scavver.name: Night Scavver
Night Scavver.description: A shark-like scavengers, with a single large eye on the leading edge of its head. The eye glows while the creature is awake. Its mouth is full of razor sharp teeth. Gray scavvers are 6 feet long and often travel in packs. Night scavvers are 15 feet long and resemble the color of Wildspace: white spots sprinkled amid dark patches and patterns of color.

items.name: Night Scavver Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A night scavver's teeth are extremely sharp, triangular pieces of dentin covered in a hard coating of enamel. The teeth are used in jewelry and decoration, but can also be used to make serrate blades and saws.

items.name: Night Scavver Skin
items.description: A night scavver's skin is covered in small, rough, hard scales. Leatherworkers dry and treat the leather, then grind down the scales to make the leather smoother and easier to handle, giving it a pebbled appearance.

Nightmare.name: Nightmare
Nightmare.description: The creature looks like an emaciated stallion, approximately 6 feet tall at the shoulder, with a night-black coat. It has a huge head, fangs like a viper, and red-hot flaming eyes. Its most noticeable features are its flaming mane, tail and hooves.

items.name: Nightmare Ashes (vial)
items.description: When a nightmare is killed, the flames of its mane and tail extinguish, leaving behind trace amounts of sulfuric ash. This gray, yellow fine residue is useful to alchemists. Spellcasters can use the ash as a component or in certain rituals.

items.name: Nightmare Hoof (x4)
items.description: The hard hooves of a nightmare are solid, obsidian-like blocks. An expert stonemason or sculptor can carve the hooves into small statuettes, figurines, jewelry and tiny tools. These small creations swirl with arcane energy and accept certain enchantments from adept spellcasters.

Nightwalker.name: Nightwalker
Nightwalker.description: Nightwalkers are the shades of extremely strong-willed and evil mortals whose ancient and unyielding will and malice allowed them to hold their corporeal shape. Its nightwalker's looks vaguely humanoid with smooth, hairless black skin and two long dark horns rising from its head. It appears to be made of shadows and wispy dark smoke. It is about the size of a house, (usually no taller than 20 ft).

items.name: Nightwalker Dust (pouch)
items.description: When a nightwalker is killed, it disperses into wispy black smoke, that settles into a fine black dust. The dust fades from the prime material plane very quickly and is difficult to collect. This dust is prized by anyone studying the Negative Plane. The dust also has alchemical necrotic properties.

Nilbog.name: Nilbog
Nilbog.description: The creature looks like a goblin with a large, toothy grin.

items.name: Goblin Ear (x2)
items.description: Goblin ears have little use. However, most communities will take the ears as proof of killing the creature, and pay a small bounty.

items.name: Nilbog Jaw
items.description: Being possessed by a goblin trickster deity causes a nilbog's mouth to develop into a wide, toothy smile full of jagged, yellow teeth. As the jaw has been touched by a deity, albeit a minor one, it retains a trace amount of celestial power. The jaw of the creature is difficult to remove intact, and quite a messy affair, but is prized in the arcane community.

items.name: Nilbog Essence
items.description: When a nilbog dies, the essence of the goblin deity lingers briefly before dispersing. It is possible to collect a piece of this essence, which is valued by spellcasters and summoners. Requires an enchanted bottle.

Nothic.name: Nothic
Nothic.description: A monstrous humanoid with rough, leathery skin, terrible talons, a mouth full of teeth and a single great eye.

items.name: Nothic Claws (x2)
items.description:
Being a former spellcaster, with no knowledge of its past life, a torrent of magic has surged through the creature's fingers over the years. Now, these fingers end in long, sharp talons. The claw on each index fingers of a nothic retain a spark of the spellcaster's former power. The talons aren't very large, but are often used by spellcasters, especially divinators and seers. The talons are believed to help find magic items.

Use: A spellcaster can spend an hour, and 100gp worth of materials (incense, rare herbs, special candles, etc.), to perform a ritual with one of the claws. At the end of the ritual, the claw will point to the nearest magical item, and have a slight magnetic pull in that direction (unfortunately, this includes items carried by the spellcaster and their party). The claw will continue to have a slight pull in that direction for the next 12 hours. If any magic items are stored within a lead container, the ritual will not detect those items. Once the ritual is cast, the same claw loses its power and cannot be effective in the ritual again.

items.name: Nothic Eye
items.description: The large eye of a nothic is a round white orb with a huge iris and pupil. The eye is swimming with arcane energy, prized by necromancers and divinators. The lens can be extracted and used by skilled artificers. Some spellcasters can preserve the eye into a solid orb, with a glass-like texture and use it as a scrying device.

Nupperibo.name: Nupperibo
Nupperibo.description: Nupperibos are bloated, rotund, 5-foot tall humanoids that waddled about with their 400 pound bodies. They are similar to lemures, being vaguely humanoid monstrosities with even less discernible features. They have lanky, arm-like appendages and a small head with its eyes and mouth sewn shut.  Vestiges of the creatures old form lingers, such as tattoos, scars, or other obscure leftovers. Clouds of vermin often form a stinging veil around their distended forms.

items.name: Nupperibo Blubber
items.description: The blubbery fat of a nupperibo can be cut away and saved. It is useful in making soap and oils.

Nycaloth.name: Nycaloth
Nycaloth.description: A large gargoyle-like creature standing over 8 feet tall. A hulking, thick, muscular figure with tough, leathery, light green skin and powerful, orange, bat-like wings. Its head is vaguely canine in appearance, with a pair of horns and pointy webbed ears.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Nycaloth Wing (x2)
items.description: The leathery, bat-like wings of a nycaloth are extremely light, yet incredibly sturdy. Leatherworkers can use the leather to create various items, but artificers make use of the arcane power that courses through the item.

items.name: Nycaloth Horn (x2)
items.description: A nycaloth's horns vary in size and shape, but each horn helps the creature focus its innate arcane abilities. The horns can be carved into daggers or small trinkets, which can be enchanted by adept spellcasters.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Oaken Bolter.name: Oaken Bolter
Oaken Bolter.description: Oaken bolters are magical siege engines, a living ballista designed to fire at a rapid rate.

items.name: Clockwork Gears and Scrap Metal
items.description: When destroyed, a clockwork machine shuts down (usually releasing a cloud of steam) and falls to pieces. Among it's remains are several gears and pieces of scrap metal. These items can be used by artificers, tinkerers, inventors, smiths and jewelers.

items.name: Clockwork Oil (flask)
items.description: Some of the clockwork's interior gears and components are coated in a thin layer of slick, black oil. It may be possible to gather some of this oil and collect it in a flask. The oil is a useful lubricant that any merchant will buy.

Oblex Spawn.name: Oblex Spawn
Oblex Spawn.description: A pool of gelatinous ooze, smelling of sulfur, typically swimming with the remains of other creatures.

items.name: Oblex Spawn Ooze (vial)
items.description: The gelatinous form of an oblex spawn smells of sulfur. Before the ooze disperses and evaporates, it is possible to collect a sample. Some craftsmen use the ooze to create acidic baths, to dispose of trash and wasted materials.

Ochre Jelly.name: Ochre Jelly
Ochre Jelly.description: The ooze resembles a giant amoeba, consisting of a thick, golden sludge.

items.name: Ochre Jelly (vial)
items.description: This yellow jelly is extremely thick, and burns to the touch. Samples of this ooze are often bought by alchemists and most merchants.

Octopus.name: Octopus
Octopus.description: A small creature with a large bulbous head, big black eyes, and eight long tentacles.

items.name: Octopus Ink (2 vials)
items.description: An octopus produces a dark-colored, watery ink. A vial of octopus ink can easily be converted into a 1 ounce bottle of writing ink (using 3 gp worth of materials, proficiency with Alchemist's Supplies, DC 5). Most merchants or alchemists will purchase the ink.

Octopus, Giant.name: Octopus, Giant
Octopus, Giant.description: An enormous creature with a large bulbous head, big black eyes, and eight long tentacles. It's head can grow over 8 feet long, with each tentacles growing over 10 feet.

items.name: Octopus Ink (6 vials)
items.description: An octopus produces a dark-colored, watery ink. A vial of octopus ink can easily be converted into a 1 ounce bottle of writing ink (using 3 gp worth of materials, proficiency with Alchemist's Supplies, DC 5). Most merchants or alchemists will purchase the ink.

Ogre.name: Ogre
Ogre.description: A giant humanoid with a very muscular body and a large head with a dim-witted look. It stands over 9 feet tall.

items.name: Ogre Fat (large pouch)
items.description: An Ogre has a thick layer of fat under its filthy skin. It can be difficult to cut away enough useful fat, depending on the harvester's skill. The fat can be used to make soaps and candles.

items.name: Ogre Skin
items.description: An ogre has a large, rough layer of pale skin. While strong and durable, leather made from the skin is not very aesthetic and has an odd smell (even after being treated).

items.name: Ogre Stomach
items.description: Ogres are known to be voracious eaters, and have an enlarged, elastic stomach with a strong lining. Leatherworkers can treat and fashion larger than normal sack and bags. While these bags are larger (50% bigger), they do not increase a character's encumbrance.

Ogre Battering Ram.name: Ogre Battering Ram
Ogre Battering Ram.description: A giant humanoid with a very muscular body and a large head with a dim-witted look. It stands over 9 feet tall. Ogre battering rams carry an enormous club that's primarily use for bashing doors into kindling and smashing foes.

items.name: Ogre Fat (large pouch)
items.description: An Ogre has a thick layer of fat under its filthy skin. It can be difficult to cut away enough useful fat, depending on the harvester's skill. The fat can be used to make soaps and candles.

items.name: Ogre Skin
items.description: An ogre has a large, rough layer of pale skin. While strong and durable, leather made from the skin is not very aesthetic and has an odd smell (even after being treated).

items.name: Ogre Stomach
items.description: Ogres are known to be voracious eaters, and have an enlarged, elastic stomach with a strong lining. Leatherworkers can treat and fashion larger than normal sack and bags. While these bags are larger (50% bigger), they do not increase a character's encumbrance.

Ogre Bolt Launcher.name: Ogre Bolt Launcher
Ogre Bolt Launcher.description: A giant humanoid with a very muscular body and a large head with a dim-witted look. It stands over 9 feet tall. Bolt launchers carry a gigantic crossbow - a weapon so large it's essentially an ogre-held ballista. The bolts are so large, that few ogres can carry more than a half dozen at a time.

items.name: Ogre Fat (large pouch)
items.description: An Ogre has a thick layer of fat under its filthy skin. It can be difficult to cut away enough useful fat, depending on the harvester's skill. The fat can be used to make soaps and candles.

items.name: Ogre Skin
items.description: An ogre has a large, rough layer of pale skin. While strong and durable, leather made from the skin is not very aesthetic and has an odd smell (even after being treated).

items.name: Ogre Stomach
items.description: Ogres are known to be voracious eaters, and have an enlarged, elastic stomach with a strong lining. Leatherworkers can treat and fashion larger than normal sack and bags. While these bags are larger (50% bigger), they do not increase a character's encumbrance.

Ogre Chain Brute.name: Ogre Chain Brute
Ogre Chain Brute.description: A giant humanoid with a very muscular body and a large head with a dim-witted look. It stands over 9 feet tall. Chain brutes wield a great spiked chain, swinging it with both hands in a wide circle to knock foes off their feet, or in a crushing overhead smash.

items.name: Ogre's Giant Chain
items.description: A chain ogre carried an enormous iron chain. The chain is over 15 feet long and weighs over 150 lbs. Each link is 6 inches thick, 1 foot long, and 8 inches wide. The chain is poorly forged, but shipbuilders, architects and smiths may find it useful. If the harvesting check is failed, the quality is extremely poor or the chain was shattered to pieces during the fight.

items.name: Ogre Fat (large pouch)
items.description: An Ogre has a thick layer of fat under its filthy skin. It can be difficult to cut away enough useful fat, depending on the harvester's skill. The fat can be used to make soaps and candles.

items.name: Ogre Skin
items.description: An ogre has a large, rough layer of pale skin. While strong and durable, leather made from the skin is not very aesthetic and has an odd smell (even after being treated).

items.name: Ogre Stomach
items.description: Ogres are known to be voracious eaters, and have an enlarged, elastic stomach with a strong lining. Leatherworkers can treat and fashion larger than normal sack and bags. While these bags are larger (50% bigger), they do not increase a character's encumbrance.

Ogre Howdah.name: Ogre Howdah
Ogre Howdah.description: A giant humanoid with a very muscular body and a large head with a dim-witted look. It stands over 9 feet tall. Howdah's carry a palisaded wooden fort on its back. The fort serves as a platform for up to four Small creatures (for example: goblins, kobolds, deep gnomes).

items.name: Ogre Fat (large pouch)
items.description: An Ogre has a thick layer of fat under its filthy skin. It can be difficult to cut away enough useful fat, depending on the harvester's skill. The fat can be used to make soaps and candles.

items.name: Ogre Skin
items.description: An ogre has a large, rough layer of pale skin. While strong and durable, leather made from the skin is not very aesthetic and has an odd smell (even after being treated).

items.name: Ogre Stomach
items.description: Ogres are known to be voracious eaters, and have an enlarged, elastic stomach with a strong lining. Leatherworkers can treat and fashion larger than normal sack and bags. While these bags are larger (50% bigger), they do not increase a character's encumbrance.

Ogre Zombie.name: Ogre Zombie
Ogre Zombie.description: An giant humanoid figure, with pale white-gray skin stretched tightly over a muscular form. The creature smells of rot and decay, with leprous skin. Its eyes are milky white and stare about blankly.

items.name: Zombie Fluid
items.description: A zombie's saliva and blood are both a thick, black fluid that smells of rotting meat. The fluid is a disease-ridden substance that necromancers often use in dark rituals and spells. Alchemists may be able to repurpose the blood for use in certain potions.

Oinoloth.name: Oinoloth
Oinoloth.description: The Oinoloth is a thin, humanoid figure with skin covered in boils, blisters and pustules, and flesh tautly strung over its bones. Its head resembling that of a foaming ram that has been deformed by disease. It's has large hands, often with extremely long nails that curl at the ends.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Oinoloth Nails (pouch)
items.description: The long nails of an oinoloth are covered in filth, and scratches often cause illnesses. Healers may be able to use these nails to create healing salves.

items.name: Oinoloth Puss (vial)
items.description: The puss from the Oinoloth's boils carry numerous plagues and diseases. This puss can be used to create anti-toxins and cures for some of these illnesses.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Oni.name: Oni
Oni.description: The creature looks like a demonic ogre with dark blue skin, dirty gray hair, and a pair of short ivory horns protruding from its forehead. Its has yellow, pupil-less eyes, and jet-black teeth and claws.

items.name: Oni Blood (3 vials)
items.description: An oni's black blood has many transformative and regenerative properties, making it an ideal component for healing potions, salves and ointments.

items.name: Oni Skin
items.description: An oni has elastic, blue skin with little body hair. The skin is extremely flexible, making it valued by leatherworkers and tailors. The blue color also makes it unique and easily recognizable.

items.name: Oni Claws (pouch)
items.description: An oni has long, black claws, often filthy and covered in dry blood. The claws have some arcane properties relating to the creature's polymorphing ability.

items.name: Oni Horn (x2)
items.description: An oni has a pair of short ivory horns on its forehead, each a few inches long. The horns focus an oni's innate magical abilities, and hold a spark of power when harvested correctly.

items.name: Oni Heart
items.description: An oni's heart is a large mass of black flesh. The heart still radiates with energy, even after death. It can be used by spellcasters in rituals and summonings.

Orc.name: Orc
Orc.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

Orc - Blade of Ilneval.name: Orc - Blade of Ilneval
Orc - Blade of Ilneval.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: Blade of Ilneval Blood (vial)
items.description:
A Blade of Ilneval is touched by the orc god Ilneval, and is exceptionally fast. The blood of the orc can be used to tap into the creature's speed. Alchemists often look for this blood to create various potions.

Use: A creature may spend an action to drink this blood. For the next 10 minutes, the creatures has double its movement speed. This ability does not work for elves and half-elves.

items.name: Mark of Ilneval
items.description: An orc blade of Ilneval is often marked with Ilneval's symbol (an upright, blood-spattered sword). The tattoo is commonly found on its calf or thigh muscle. Harvesting the item requires flaying the skin under the mark, in one piece. The mark retains a connection to the deity, and is valued by many spellcasters. Healers and potion makers may find the mark useful for the alchemical properties of the tattooed skin.

Orc - Claw of Luthic.name: Orc - Claw of Luthic
Orc - Claw of Luthic.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: Claw of Luthic Claws
items.description:
A claw of luthic grows extremely long nails, just like its patron goddess. 
With Luthic's blessing, these nails become long, sharp claws that are hard as iron. The nails are often black, filthy and covered in dried blood. Alchemists and spellcasters often scratch the residue off of these nails and use it as an ingredient for components and potions. Some weaponsmiths can craft daggers and small tools from the claws.

Orc - Eye of Gruumsh.name: Orc - Eye of Gruumsh
Orc - Eye of Gruumsh.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: Eye of Gruumsh Blood (vial)
items.description:
This orc is touched by the orc god Gruumsh. The blood of the orc is dark red and flows quickly. Alchemists often look for this blood to create various potions.

Use: A creature may use an action to drink a vial of this blood. For the next minute, the creature deals an extra [[/r 1d8]] damage when it hits with a melee attack. This ability does not work for elves and half-elves.

items.name: Eye of Gruumsh Eyeball
items.description: An orc Eye of Gruumsh has a single eye, having sacrificed the other for its deity. This remaining eye has a strong connection to Gruumsh, and radiates a magic aura. Divination wizards and seers value the eye, but it also has uses among other spellcasters and alchemists.

Orc - Hand of Yurtrus.name: Orc - Hand of Yurtrus
Orc - Hand of Yurtrus.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: White Hand of Yurtrus
items.description: The white hand of this orc is infused with dark necrotic energy, a blessing of the orc deity Yurtrus. The hand causes rot and decay. Healers and alchemists may be able to use the hand to reverse certain diseases. Spellcasters use the hand for its link to Yurtrus.

Orc - Nurtured One of Yurtrus.name: Orc - Nurtured One of Yurtrus
Orc - Nurtured One of Yurtrus.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: Nurtured One of Yurtrus Puss (vial)
items.description: The plague infested skin of a nurtured one is riddled with boils and pustules. If a boil is lanced incorrectly, it pops and the puss cannot be harvested. The puss is often used by healers and alchemists, attempting to cure an affliction. Necromancers may also have an interest in the puss for darker purposes.

Orc - Orog.name: Orc - Orog
Orc - Orog.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: Orog Heart
items.description:
Orogs are gifted by Luthic with strength and cunning. Their large size makes their heart considerably larger than other orcs, pumping harder and faster. The heart radiates a dark energy that can be harnessed.

Use: As an action a creature may consume the heart. For the next minute, the creature deals an
extra [[/r 1d8]] damage when it hits with a melee attack. This ability does not work for elves and half-elves.

Orc - Red Fang of Shargaas.name: Orc - Red Fang of Shargaas
Orc - Red Fang of Shargaas.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: Red Fang of Shargaas Blood (vial)
items.description:
This orc is touched by the orc god Shargaas, the Night Lord. The blood of the orc is pure black, and resonates with dark energy. Alchemists often look for this blood to create various potions.

Use: A creature may use an action to drink this blood. For the next 10 minutes, a creature's darkvision range is doubled. If the creature does not have darkvision, they have darkvision up to 60'. This ability does not work for elves and half-elves.

Orc - Tanarukk.name: Orc - Tanarukk
Orc - Tanarukk.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: Tanarukk Blood (vial)
items.description:
This orc is corrupted in the womb using dark, abyssal magic. The blood of this orc is a dark, viscous ichor. Alchemists, summoners and demonologists have uses for this blood.

Use: A creature may use an action to drink a vial of this blood. For the next minute, the creature deals an extra [[/r 1d10]] damage when it hits with a melee attack. This ability does not work for elves and half-elves.

items.name: Tanarukk Horn
items.description: A Tanarukk's horn is a long, sharp bone on the creature's skull. The horn is a beacon for abyssal energy, and retains some of the creature's power after death. Weaponsmiths can carve the bone into various weapons.

Orc War Chief.name: Orc War Chief
Orc War Chief.description: The humanoid stands about 7 feet tall, with a large muscular body, grayish skin, coarse hair and a stooped posture. It has a low forehead and a pig-like face, with lower canines that resemble boar tusks. It also has ears that are pointed at the end.

items.name: Orc Tusks
items.description: Orcs have a set of lower canines that resembled boar tusks. While these tusks have little uses, except for ornamentation and trophies, they can be used to collect the bounty for an orc.

items.name: Orc Warchief Ornamentation
items.description: An orc warchief often wears jewelry and gems taken from its enemies. This ornamentation includes earrings, nose rings, ornamental hair ties, and tusk inlays.

items.name: Mark or Gruumsh
items.description: An orc warchief is often marked with the symbol of Gruumsh (a triangular eye with bony protrusions). The tattoo is commonly found on its forearm or pectoral muscle. Harvesting the item requires flaying the skin under the mark, in one piece. The mark retains a connection to the deity, and is valued by many spellcasters. Healers and potion makers may find the mark useful for the alchemical properties of the tattooed skin.

Orcus.name: Orcus
Orcus.description: Orcus, the Demon Prince of Undeath, is a bestial creature of corruption with a diseased, decaying look. He has the lower body of a goat and a humanlike upper body with a belly swollen with rot. Great bat wings sprout from his shoulders, and his head is like the skull of a goat, the flesh nearly rotted from it.

items.name: Wand of Orcus
items.description: Orcus wields the legendary Wand of Orcus. This is a powerful artifact. The DM will need to decide if this item remains after the creature is slain.

items.name: Orcus Skin (pouch)
items.description: Orcus has rotting, dry skin, similar to that of a corpse. It's possible to delicately peel off several strips of desiccated skin flakes. These pieces of skin can be used in dark rituals to create undead. Alternatively, it's believed that the flakes can also be used to create elixirs that halt the undead process from bites and injuries.

items.name: Orcus' Hooves (x2)
items.description: Orcus' hooves are made of steel-hard bone, and are strong enough to crush a skull. A skilled weaponsmith may be able to use the hooves to create powerful bludgeoning weapons. The hooves may also be used to create crafts and jewelry.

items.name: Orcus' Wings
items.description: The leathery, bat-like wings of orcus can be sold to collectors or to leatherworkers for their leather. Artificers and enchanters may be able to find other uses for the wings.

items.name: Orcus' Horn (x2)
items.description: Orcus has two large horns protruding from its goat-like head. The horns are heavy and difficult to remove, being firmly attached to the demon lord's skull. The horns are seething with necrotic power.

Orthon.name: Orthon
Orthon.description: Orthons are large baatezu devils, used as bounty hunters and soldiers in the Nine Hells. Its main distinguishing feature are two large, sharp tusks growing from the sides of its mouths. Plates of metal are bolted directly onto its bodies, providing effective armor, but also causing constant pain.

items.name: Orthon Ash (vial)
items.description: When an orthon drops under 16 hit points, it explodes. Before the ashes scatter, it may be possible to harvest some of these burnt remains. Due to the creatures various abilities and resistances, the ashes have many alchemical properties.

Otyugh.name: Otyugh
Otyugh.description: A grotesque, bulbous creature borne along on three sturdy, elephantine legs. It has two long tentacles ending in leaf-shaped pads bearing rows of sharp spikes. A third tentacle on its back ends in a pair of eyes and an olfactory organ. Its massive fang-filled mouth is shaped like a crude gash through its center.

items.name: Otyugh Saliva (vial)
items.description: An otyugh's saliva is a clear, viscous fluid that burns slightly to the flesh, and slowing eats away at organic matter. The fluid has a number of uses in the alchemical community.

items.name: Otyugh Stomach Acid (vial)
items.description: An Otyugh's stomach acid is so exceptionally corrosive, that it can safely digest carrion and disease infested flesh. To harvest the item successfully, the stomach must be cut open without exposing the acid to blood. The stomach acid is useful to alchemists.

items.name: Otyugh Pineal Gland (vial)
items.description: The pineal gland is a small, pea-shaped spongy ball of flesh, located in the center of the creature's brain. This gland is believed to give the otyugh limited telepathic abilities, sending images and simple messages to other creatures. The gland is useful in the research community, but is also valued with alchemists and spellcasters.

Owl.name: Owl
Owl.description: A nocturnal birds of prey with an upright stance, a large, broad head, binocular vision, sharp talons, and feathers adapted for silent flight.

items.name: Owl Feathers (pouch)
items.description: Owl feathers are light decorative plumage, that help the bird soar through the sky. The feathers are used in decorations, dusters, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

Owl, Giant.name: Owl, Giant
Owl, Giant.description: A large nocturnal birds of prey with an upright stance, a large, broad head, binocular vision, sharp talons, and feathers adapted for silent flight. It sits perched at about 9 feet tall, with a 20-foot wingspan.

items.name: Giant Owl Feathers (large pouch)
items.description: Giant owl feathers are light decorative plumage, that help the bird soar through the sky. The feathers are used in decorations, fans, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

items.name: Giant Owl Talons (pouch)
items.description: A giant owl talons are sharp and curved, used for grasping and clawing at prey. They are several inches long. Most are used in jewelry and decorations. The longer talons can make hooked daggers.

Owlbear.name: Owlbear
Owlbear.description: A monstrous beasts with the body of a bear covered in thick fur and feathers. Its head is like that of an owls but with a serrated beak.

items.name: Owlbear Feathers (large pouch)
items.description: An owlbear's feathers are light decorative plumage. The feathers are used in decorations, fans, apparel, arrows and bolts.

items.name: Owlbear Claws (pouch)
items.description: An owlbear's claws are a deadly natural weapon. The long claws can be sold as a trophy, or for use in decorations, jewelry or small carvings.

items.name: Owlbear Liver
items.description: The owlbear's liver is a thick, rubbery, reddish-brown organ that filters the blood and produces a yellowish bile. The organ is primarily used by alchemists and healers.

Ox.name: Ox
Ox.description: Oxen are large bovines that are often used as work animals, and bred for their milk and meat.

items.name: Ox Horns (x2)
items.description: Ox horns can be used to create drinking horns, decorations, jewelry, weapon handles and simple tools (hoes, rakes,etc.).

items.name: Ox Hide
items.description: The hide of an Ox can be crafted into soft, supple leather, which is used to create armor and apparel.

Panther.name: Panther
Panther.description: A black-furred jungle wildcat similar to a jaguar, leopard, or mountain lion.

items.name: Panther's Hide
items.description: The panther's hide is covered in a coat of short fur (colors vary, usually black or light brown). It is often used to make rugs and apparel.

Pegasus.name: Pegasus
Pegasus.description: The creature resembles a horse, but with large bird-like wings. It has a beautiful pure white hide typically.

items.name: Pegasus Hoof (x4)
items.description: A Pegasus's hooves contains a collagen that is used to make a sticky adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Pegasus Hide
items.description: The pure white hide of a pegasus is known for its durability and resistance to moisture absorption. It is softer than the hide of a typical riding horse and valued by leatherworkers and tailors.

items.name: Pegasus Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A pegasus has silver blood that has a plethora of healing properties. Alchemists and healers use the blood in various potions, salves and ointments.

items.name: Pegasus Wings (x2)
items.description: A pegasus has a large set of white wings covered in soft, plush feathers. The feather are often used for bedding, apparel, fans and quills. The feathers also have useful alchemical properties.

Pentadrone.name: Pentadrone
Pentadrone.description: The construct is shaped like a five-pointed, clockwork starfish with one eye on each appendage, on top of five strong mechanical legs, and a tube protruding from the center of the star.

Peryton.name: Peryton
Peryton.description: The creature has the body of a giant eagle with dark green feathers. Its head, however, is covered in blue-black hair and is roughly the shape of a deer's. Its maw is full of jagged fangs, and its talons are as sharp as razors. On the top of its head is a set of extremely sharp and strong antlers, which are as hard as steel and jet black in color a male had light blue chest feathers, while a female's were pale brown. It eyes glow with an orange-red color. Its strangest feature is that its shadow appears humanoid rather than reflecting the creature's physical form.

items.name: Peryton Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Peryton's have redish-purple blood. A peryton is believed to have been created from a curse, or as a magical experiment. As such, the blood has some arcane properties which are useful to spellcasters and alchemists.

items.name: Peryton Feathers (large pouch)
items.description: A peryton is covered in a lush coat of soft feather, of various colors. The feathers can be used in apparel, decorations, bedding, arrows and bolts.

items.name: Peryton Antlers
items.description: A peryton has a set of large branching bone-like protrusions on the top of its head, similar to a buck. The antlers are covered in a thin layer of skin with a soft fur, that feels like velvet. The antlers are strong as steel, and can be used by craftsmen and weaponsmiths to create various items. They are also a prized trophy for hunters.

items.name: Peryton Heart
items.description: A peryton's heart is a red mass of flesh covered in veins. The heart throbs with magical energy, which slowly begins to fade once the creature is killed. Whether that energy is the result of a long suffered curse, or a because the creature is a magical creation, is unknown. Spellcasters, especially artificers, may be able to use and adapt this energy.

Phase Spider.name: Phase Spider
Phase Spider.description: A giant, two-eyed, spindly-legged spider with blue and white coloration.

items.name: Phase Spider Venom (2 vials)
items.description:
A phase spider has a venomous bite. The venom can be extracted and refined into a poison.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests 1 vial of venom that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Phase Spider Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 4 days and 400gp worth of material to create Phase Spider Poison (DC 13 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Phase Spider Poison  (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ([[/r 4d8]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way. This poison usually sells for 700gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Phase Spider Ethereal Spindle
items.description: Unlike a regular spider that spins silk, a phase spider has an spindle it it abdomen that allows the creature to jump in and out of the ethereal plane. The spindle is several rings of cartilage that rotate like a gyroscope creating a wave of arcane energy. The spindles is a valuable item to artificers.

Phoenix.name: Phoenix
Phoenix.description: A Phoenix is an enormous bird. Its body is almost immaterial, composed of flame taken solid shape. For that reason, they were capable of passing through extremely narrow passages and of engulfing opponents within their fiery bodies. A phoenix's body is naturally bright and shed its own light.

items.name: Phoenix Egg
items.description: When a phoenix dies, it explodes, leaving behind an egg-shaped cinder, which weighs 5 pounds. The cinder deals 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) fire damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The cinder is immune to all damage, and after [[/r 1d6]] days, it hatches a new phoenix. The eggs is prized by powerful wizards and other spellcasters.

items.name: Phoenix Ash (pouch)
items.description: When a phoenix dies, it explodes, scattering flaming embers and ash, that quickly begin to burn away. If quick enough, it may be possible to collect some of this ash. The ash is believed to have amazing restorative properties.

Piercer.name: Piercer
Piercer.description: A rock-like shell encases the creature's body, giving it the look and texture of a stalactite. That shell protects a soft, slug-like upper. With its eye and mouth closed, it would be difficult to distinguish the creature from ordinary rock formations.

items.name: Piercer Slime (vial)
items.description: A piercer's underbelly is covered in a thick, sticky slime that it uses to climb up walls and aid in clinging to the ceiling. This slime can be used to create a strong adhesive useful to craftsmen and leatherworkers.

items.name: Piercer Shell
items.description: A piercer is covered in a rock-like shell, which encases the creature's body. This shell can be used to craft pieces of armor and protective equipment.

Pit Fiend.name: Pit Fiend
Pit Fiend.description: The 12 foot tall, hulking humanoid is both majestic and horrifying, having a gargoyle  features and massive bat-like wings. Weighing 800 pounds of pure muscle, its body is armored with reddish scales. It's huge fangs drip with hissing, green venom and its long tail swings around ferociously.

items.name: Pit Fiend Blood (5 vials)
items.description: A pit fiend blood is a scalding red fluid, that bubbles with the fiery heat of hell. Skilled alchemists can cool and refine the blood using a variety of alchemic processes, and use the resulting liquid as a component in various potions.

items.name: Pit Fiend Venom (3 vials)
items.description:
A pit fiend's venom is a noxious, vile poison, found mixed in the pit fiends saliva.
Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough vemon for a single dose. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 4 days and 500gp worth of material and supplies to create Pit Fiend venom (DC 20 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Pit Fiend Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ([[/r 6d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 1100gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Pit Fiend Claw (x2)
items.description: The sharp claws of a pit fiend are a deadly natural weapon. Weaponsmiths can use the item in crafting certain weapons. It can also be sold as a trophy, or for use in crafting.

items.name: Devil Wing (x2)
items.description: The massive leathery wings of a pit fiend is a useful source of tough, fireproof leather. In addition, artificers can sometimes use the wings to craft magic items.

items.name: Pit Fiend Head
items.description: The skull of a pit fiend is a fearsome trophy. It can also be forged into a terrifying helm. Artificers may be able to retain some of the fiends hellish, arcane power.

Pixie.name: Pixie
Pixie.description: The little humanoid resembles a tiny elf, one to two feet tall. It has silvery, moth-like wings and wears brightly colored clothing.

items.name: Pixie Dust (small pouch)
items.description: Pixies have tiny gossamer wings, like those of dragonflies, which shed tiny flecks of shimmering dust when they fly. When a pixie dies, the dust is difficult to see, and it is often hard to harvest a sufficient amount. The dust has a variety of uses, especially among spellcasters and alchemists.

Planetar.name: Planetar
Planetar.description: The creature looks like a large, giant-sized human with opalescent green skin and white feathered wings. It is muscular and hairless and carried an immense sword.

items.name: Planetar Ear (x2)
items.description: Planetar's are natural lie detectors, making their ear's highly sought after.Use: If a player is holding 2 planetar's ears, they have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) ability checks to detect lies. The ears lose their magic and become ineffective after two weeks.

items.name: Planetar Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Planetar's blood is known for it's amazing healing properties.Use: Drinking Planetar's blood restores [[/r 4d8]]+2 hit points and cures disease, poison, blindness, deafness, and removes any curse.

items.name: Planetar Wing (x2)
items.description: Planetar wings can be harvested for their feathers. Artificers and enchanters may be able to use a full set of wings to create magic items.

items.name: Planetar Bone
items.description: Planetar bones are extremely strong and infused with holy magic, making them extremely valuable to those who create magic weapons.

Plasmoid Boss.name: Plasmoid Boss
Plasmoid Boss.description: Intelligent oozes that can alter their shape at will. Their amorphous bodies have a soft, malleable texture and can extrude up to five pseudopods. The are often transparent, with a bluish hue, with nerve clusters and nerve endings visible inside their body.

items.name: Plasmoid Ooze (vial)
items.description: The clear-blue ooze of a plasmoid is valued for its high electrical conductivity.

items.name: Plasmoid Nerve Cluster
items.description: It may be possible to collect the bundle of nerves that act as the plasmoid's brain. The nerve cluster may be used in various potions, but also has healing properties for restoring tissue.

Plasmoid Explorer.name: Plasmoid Explorer
Plasmoid Explorer.description: Intelligent oozes that can alter their shape at will. Their amorphous bodies have a soft, malleable texture and can extrude up to five pseudopods. The are often transparent, with a bluish hue, with nerve clusters and nerve endings visible inside their body.

items.name: Plasmoid Ooze (vial)
items.description: The clear-blue ooze of a plasmoid is valued for its high electrical conductivity.

items.name: Plasmoid Nerve Cluster
items.description: It may be possible to collect the bundle of nerves that act as the plasmoid's brain. The nerve cluster may be used in various potions, but also has healing properties for restoring tissue.

Plasmoid Warrior.name: Plasmoid Warrior
Plasmoid Warrior.description: Intelligent oozes that can alter their shape at will. Their amorphous bodies have a soft, malleable texture and can extrude up to five pseudopods. The are often transparent, with a bluish hue, with nerve clusters and nerve endings visible inside their body.

items.name: Plasmoid Ooze (vial)
items.description: The clear-blue ooze of a plasmoid is valued for its high electrical conductivity.

items.name: Plasmoid Nerve Cluster
items.description: It may be possible to collect the bundle of nerves that act as the plasmoid's brain. The nerve cluster may be used in various potions, but also has healing properties for restoring tissue.

Plesiosaurus.name: Plesiosaurus
Plesiosaurus.description: The creature is a large marine reptile, about 16 feet long. It has a very long neck, a small head, and a short, stubby tail. It had four limbs that have evolved into paddles that it uses to swim.

items.name: Plesiosaurus Skin
items.description: The skin of a Plesiosaurus is a highly durable reptilian hide, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, tents and more.

items.name: Plesiosaurus Tooth (x10)
items.description: The teeth of Plesiosaurus are simple, needle-like cones that are slightly curved. They are sharply pointed with fine striations running from tip to base. The shape, weight and strength makes them valued by fletchers.

Poisonous Snake.name: Poisonous Snake
Poisonous Snake.description: A reptile with a long, thin body but no legs. It has a large mouth with two sharp fangs and a slithering tongue that lashes about. The creature is several feet long.

items.name: Poisonous Snake Skin
items.description: A snake's skin can be used in the creation of boots, belts and other apparel. A regular size snake only has enough harvestable skin to create a single belt. Some tailors may refuse to purchase a single skin, as more skins are needed for most apparel.

items.name: Poisonous Snake Venom (vial)
items.description:
A skilled harvester can extract the venom from poisonous snakes. The poison is a clear fluid with a yellow tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 3 hours and 50gp worth of material to create Scorpion Poison (DC 10 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Snake Poison (Poison, Basic see PHB p153) (Injury): A creature can spend an action using a vial of this poison to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take [[/r 1d4]] poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying. This poison usually sells for 100gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Poisonous Snake, Giant.name: Poisonous Snake, Giant
Poisonous Snake, Giant.description: A reptile with a long, thin body but no legs. It has a large mouth with two sharp fangs and slithering tongue that lashes about. The creature is about 40 feet long.

items.name: Giant Poisonous Snake Skin
items.description: A snake's skin can be used in the creation of boots, belts and other apparel.

items.name: Poisonous Snake Venom (3 vials)
items.description:
A skilled harvester can extract the venom from poisonous snakes. The poison is a clear fluid with a yellow tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 3 hours and 50gp worth of material to create Scorpion Poison (DC 10 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Snake Poison (Poison, Basic see PHB p153) (Injury): A creature can spend an action using a vial of this poison to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take [[/r 1d4]] poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying. This poison usually sells for 100gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Polar Bear.name: Polar Bear
Polar Bear.description: The bear has a large body and walks on all fours, but has the ability to stand on it's rear legs. Each of its stocky legs has a paw with five long claws. It has a short tail, shaggy white hair, a long snout and small rounded ears.

items.name: Bear Claws/Teeth (small pouch)
items.description: The claws of the bear, and sometimes the teeth, can be used in decorations and jewelry.

items.name: Polar Bear Pelt
items.description: A polar bear's pelt can be made into anything from rugs to coats to bedspreads. Once removed from the corpse, typically with a skinning knife, the hide ranges from 6-8 feet long.

Pony.name: Pony
Pony.description: Similar to a horse, but smaller and it exhibits a thicker mane, tail and coat. It also has proportionally shorter legs and a thicker neck.

items.name: Pony Hoof (x4)
items.description: A pony's hooves contains a collagen that is used to make a sticky adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Pony Hide
items.description: A pony's hide is known for its durability and resistance to moisture absorption.  The hide is primarily used to make harnesses, bags, shoes and rugs.

items.name: Pony Mane/Tail
items.description: Long, thick, strands of hair. Craftsmen often use the hair to make wigs, painting brushes, and fishing line. Weavers can also create coarse fabrics and apparel.

Pseudodragon.name: Pseudodragon
Pseudodragon.description: The creature looks like a tiny dragon about one foot long, with a two-foot long tail ending in a stinger.

items.name: Pseudodragon Blood (vial)
items.description: Due to its draconic ancestry, a pseudodragon's blood is flowing with trace amounts of arcane power. Alchemists, healers and spellcasters can all finds a use for this item

items.name: Pseudodragon Venom (vial)
items.description:
A pseudodragon has a tail with a barbed stinger, similar to a scorpion's tail. A skilled harvester may be able to extract some venom from the stinger, which is useful to alchemists and poisoners.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests the pseudodragon's venom that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Pseudodragon Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's sting (see Pseudodragon Poison below).

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hours and 80gp worth of material to create Pseudodragon Poison (DC 10 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Pseudodragon Poison (Injury): A creature hit with this poison must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake. This poison usually sells for 160gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Psurlon.name: Psurlon
Psurlon.description: Wormlike creatures, with six legs that end in hooves and two arms that end in hands with three long fingers. A psurlon's eyeless head resembles that of an earthworm, with a mouth ringed with teeth. Psurlon adorn themselves in richly colored robes and rarely carry armor or weapons.

items.name: Psurlon Blood (vial)
items.description: Psurlons live for thousands of years, and have blood with a rich history. As such, the blood is valued by divination wizards and often used by others in blood rituals.

items.name: Psurlon Hooves (x6)
items.description: The six legs of a psurlon end in hard gray hooves. These hooves contain a collagen that is used to make a strong adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be made into tools, bowls and other items.

Psurlon Leader.name: Psurlon Leader
Psurlon Leader.description: Wormlike creatures, with six legs that end in hooves and two arms that end in hands with three long fingers. A psurlon's eyeless head resembles that of an earthworm, with a mouth ringed with teeth. Psurlon adorn themselves in richly colored robes and rarely carry armor or weapons.

items.name: Psurlon Blood (vial)
items.description: Psurlons live for thousands of years, and have blood with a rich history. As such, the blood is valued by divination wizards and often used by others in blood rituals.

items.name: Psurlon Hooves (x6)
items.description: The six legs of a psurlon end in hard gray hooves. These hooves contain a collagen that is used to make a strong adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be made into tools, bowls and other items.

items.name: Psurlon Leader Brain Fluid (vial)
items.description: The brains of a Psurlon Leader is charged with psychic energy. If careful, the brain fluid can be extracted. This fluid is believed to enhance psionics. Most use the fluid in healing poultices that calm and sooth victims. Note: The fluid must be harvested quickly. The harvester must choose one of the creatures two heads. There is a 50% that they choose the wrong head, and the fluid is lost.

Psurlon Ringer.name: Psurlon Ringer
Psurlon Ringer.description: Wormlike creatures, with six legs that end in hooves and two arms that end in hands with three long fingers. A psurlon's eyeless head resembles that of an earthworm, with a mouth ringed with teeth. Psurlon adorn themselves in richly colored robes and rarely carry armor or weapons.

items.name: Psurlon Blood (vial)
items.description: Psurlons live for thousands of years, and have blood with a rich history. As such, the blood is valued by divination wizards and often used by others in blood rituals.

items.name: Psurlon Hooves (x6)
items.description: The six legs of a psurlon end in hard gray hooves. These hooves contain a collagen that is used to make a strong adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be made into tools, bowls and other items.

Pteranodon.name: Pteranodon
Pteranodon.description: The creature is a large flying reptile having a long pointy beak  and a backwardly directed bony crest on its skull. It has a  wingspan over 20 feet long. Pteranodon's means "wings and no teeth."

items.name: Pteranodon Beak
items.description: The Pteranodon's beak is long, slender, and ends in a sharp point. The toothless beak can be used to craft various tools and weapons. The beak may even be used as the tip of a lance.

items.name: Pteranodon Wings (x2)
items.description: The wings of a Pteranodon can be harvested to make a thin but tough reptilian hide. Leatherworkers can use the wings to make apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, and more.

Purple Worm.name: Purple Worm
Purple Worm.description: An enormous worm-like creature with a hide covered in dark purple, chitinous plates, with a mouth filled with teeth at one end and a poisonous stinger on the other. Its body is over 12 feet wide and 100 feet long.

items.name: Purple Worm Blood (9 vials)
items.description: The dark blood of a purple worm has a good deal of healing properties. Once refined with other ingredients, it is often used by the healers of many underground communities. The nutrient-rich substance can also be used to make a fertilizer for fungal crops.

items.name: Purple Worm Tooth (x6)
items.description: The teeth of a purple worm are sharp, stone-like protrusions inside its gigantic maw. The teeth are made of ivory, covered in a layer of stone-textured keratin that is as hard as steel and able to chew through rock. The large teeth are often used by weaponsmiths to create unique weapons, which accept enchantments fairly well.

items.name: Purple Worm Stomach Acid (3 vials)
items.description:
The stomach of a purple worm contains a highly acidic mix of chemicals that eats slowly eats through rock and stone. This stomach acid is useful to many craftsmen.

The acid can be hard to harvest. Failing the harvesting DC check by 5 or more results the stomach bursting, spraying acid in a 10-foot radius. Any creature in range immediately takes [[/r 2d6]] acid damage.

items.name: Purple Worm Stinger
items.description:
The large stinger on a Purple Worm's tail contains a powerful venom.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this stinger. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's stinger, which must be refined before producing 3 doses of Purple Worm Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the stinger. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the stinger is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 6 days and 1500gp worth of material to create 3 doses of Purple Worm Poison (DC 17 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Purple Worm Poison (Injury): The poison can be used to coat up to 3 pieces of ammunition or one slashing/piercing weapon. Applying the poison takes 1 action. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ([[/r 12d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 2,000gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Purple Worm Pearl
items.description: Small bits of stone often get caught in the creature's digestive tract, and are covered in a thick mucus that quickly hardens. Over time, the object is coated again and again, forming a glistening white pearl with a purple sheen.

Quadrone.name: Quadrone
Quadrone.description: A cube-shaped, winged construct with two arms and two legs. The front face has two eyes and a mouth.

Quaggoth.name: Quaggoth
Quaggoth.description: A subterranean bestial humanoid covered in dirty green-gray fur. The creature walks digitigrade, on its hind legs, and pulls itself across the ground on its knuckles like a gorilla. It appears hunches over, has dark black eyes, pointy ears and a mouth full of sharp teeth.

items.name: Quaggoth Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A quaggoth's dark blood is able to differential, separate and dilute poison without using a filtration organ like the kidneys. This property make their blood highly valued in many underdark communities.

items.name: Quaggoth Hide
items.description: A quaggoth has a sturdy hide of dirty green-gray fur. The fur provides warm apparel and bedding for deep underground communities.

Quasit.name: Quasit
Quasit.description: The creature stands somewhere between 1 and 2 ft tall and weighs around 20 lbs. The tiny humanoid form has green skin covered in warts and pustules. Its has a long tail covered in barbs, and two long horns  protrude from its head, above their long pointy ears. They have two dark, bug-like eyes with a small mouth full of sharp teeth. Both their hands and feet are slender, with long, sharp claws. Some of these creatures have a pair of bat-like wings that mark their visual similarity to imps.

items.name: Quasit Venom (vial)
items.description:
Quasit venom coats a Quasit's claws and teeth. The translucent fluid has a cloudy yellow tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests a mild form of the venom that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Quasit Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's venom. 

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 6 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Quasit Poison (DC 15 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Quasit Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Quasit Blood (vial)
items.description: Quasit blood is a yellow fluid with low viscosity. Magic users often use the blood to enhance their familiars for a short time. Use: The next time you cast the find familiar spell, you may use a vial of quasit blood instead of using the usual material component of the spell. If you do, your summoned familiar gains the quasit's magic resistance (advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects). Your familiar also shares this trait with you so long as you are within 10 feet of it. Both of these effects last for 1 hour, or until your familiar is killed, dismissed or pulled into your dimensional pocket.

Quetzalcoatlus.name: Quetzalcoatlus
Quetzalcoatlus.description: The creature is a very large flying reptile, with a wingspan of over 50 feet. It has a long neck and a very sharp, pointed beak. Its limbs include its wings and two short hind legs, which is uses to perch and pick up prey. Quetzalcoatlus are named for the Aztec deity Quetzacouatl, a mythical feathered serpent

items.name: Quetzalcoatlus Beak
items.description: The beak of a Quetzalcoatlus is long, sharp and pointed, similar to storks but much larger.

items.name: Quetzalcoatlus Wings (x2)
items.description: The wings of a Quetzalcoatlus can be harvested to make a thin but tough reptilian hide. Leatherworkers can use the wings to make apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, and more.

Quickling.name: Quickling
Quickling.description: A small, slender fey, similar to a miniature elf with sharp, feral features. It has cold, cruel eyes that gleam like jewels. It moves effortlessly and with great speed.

items.name: Quickling Blood (vial)
items.description:
Quickling blood flows quickly, having an extremely low viscosity. It is a red substance, with tiny swirling motes that appear to swim around inside the substance. It is difficult to fill a vial with so much blood from such a small creature. The blood is valued by alchemists.
Use: A creature may spend an action to drink a vial of this blood. The creature will gain an extra reaction per round (if the creature normally has 1 action per round, they now have 2). This benefit lasts for 10 minutes.

Quipper.name: Quipper
Quipper.description: A carnivorous fish with sharp teeth.

items.name: Quipper Fish
items.description: The small fish has tiny sharp teeth, beady eyes, small scales and fins. The fish doesn't have any major parts, but healers and alchemists will buy the fish for its individual parts and organs. Or, the whole fish can be sold to taverns and dining halls.

Quippers, Swarm of.name: Quippers, Swarm of
Quippers, Swarm of.description: A swarm of carnivorous fish with sharp teeth.

items.name: Quipper Fish (x[[/r 1d8]])
items.description: The small fish has tiny sharp teeth, beady eyes, small scales and fins. The fish doesn't have any major parts, but healers and alchemists will buy the fish for its individual parts and organs. Or, the whole fish can be sold to taverns and dining halls.

Rakshasa.name: Rakshasa
Rakshasa.description: A humanoid with the head of a Bengal tiger and luxurious fur. It wears fine garments and precious jewelry.

items.name: Rakshasa Whiskers (pouch)
items.description: The whiskers of a rakshasa are long, thick strands of translucent-white hair. The hairs are often used in divination and enchantment spells, and are a useful alchemical ingredient.

items.name: Rakshasa Heart
items.description: The heart of a rakshasa is a redish, fist-sized organ, wrapped in thick veins. The heart has strong ties to the Nine Hells and is used in many dark rituals and binding spells.

items.name: Rakshasa Hide
items.description: A rakshasa's tiger-like hide is covered in orange fur with black and white streaks. The hide has a strong resistance to magic, which makes it highly valued in most places.

Rat.name: Rat
Rat.description: A tiny slender rodent with a pointy head, large black eyes, and prominent, thinly furred ears. It has moderately long legs and long, sharp claws.

items.name: Rat Tail
items.description: Rat tails are useless for eating or crafting, however, many cities will pay a bounty for each rat tail turned in.

items.name: Rat Carcass
items.description: If the rat carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's eyes, tiny teeth and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Rat, Giant.name: Rat, Giant
Rat, Giant.description: The giant rat is about the size of a dog. It is a slender rodent with a pointy head, large black eyes, and prominent, thinly furred ears. It has moderately long legs and long, sharp claws.

items.name: Giant Rat Tail
items.description: Giant rat tails are useless for eating or crafting, however, many cities will pay a bounty for each rat tail turned in.

Rats, Swarm of.name: Rats, Swarm of
Rats, Swarm of.description: A swarm of tiny slender rodents with pointy heads, large black eyes, and prominent, thinly furred ears. They have moderately long legs and long, sharp claws.

items.name: Rat Tail (x[[/r 1d8]])
items.description: Rat tails are useless for eating or crafting, however, many cities will pay a bounty for each rat tail turned in.

Raven.name: Raven
Raven.description: A large, black bird with a thick bill, which makes a deep "quorking" sound. Its dark beak is quite large and slightly rounded.

items.name: Raven Feathers (pouch)
items.description: Black raven feathers are decorative plumage, that help the bird soar through the sky. The feathers are used in decorations, dusters, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

Ravens, Swarm of.name: Ravens, Swarm of
Ravens, Swarm of.description: A swarm of large, black birds with thick, dark beaks.

items.name: Raven Feathers (x[[/r 1d8]], pouches)
items.description: Black raven feathers are decorative plumage, that help the bird soar through the sky. The feathers are used in decorations, dusters, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

Red Abishai.name: Red Abishai
Red Abishai.description: Draconic humanoids, with scaled blue skin, large wings on their back and a long tail.

items.name: Red Abishai Scales
items.description: The scales of an abishai are tough and immediately become brittle once the creature dies. As such, each scale must be carefully extracted one-by-one, and then treated with special oils in order to strengthen them again. The scales are highly decorative, and often used in jewelry. Smiths prize the scales for use in scale armor (the scales from 4 abishai are required to create a single set of scale mail).

items.name: Red Abishai Wing (x2)
items.description: The wings of an abishai produce a durable scaly leather. Once the creature is killed, the wings can rip easily, and must be removed with care. The leather can be used in tents, backpacks, clothing and other items.

Red Slaad.name: Red Slaad
Red Slaad.description: The creature resembles a large, red, bipedal toad with long, sharp claws, a wide mouth filled with pointy teeth and a huge toad-like head with beady eyes.

items.name: Slaad Slime (vial)
items.description: A slaad's skin is covered in a thin layer of clear mucus that smells of sulfur and rot. The slime has various healing and regenerative properties.

items.name: Red Slaad Control Gem
items.description:
Embedded in a Red Slaad's brain is a dull red gem, about the size of a child's fist. If obtained while the slaad is alive, the slaad will obey whoever possesses the gem.

Obtaining the Gem from a Living Slaad: Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against imprisonment, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A wish spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem. A greater restoration spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can attempt to remove the gem from an incapacitated slaad . Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 (4dl0) psychic damage to the slaad.

Uses: If a slaad is killed, that slaad's gem can not be used to control other slaadi by itself. However, it's magic can be used to enhance certain spells cast on other slaadi. While holding the gem, any slaad that is targeted by Enthrall, Suggestion, or Charm Monster, will have disadvantage on the creature's Wisdom save.

items.name: Slaad Egg Sack
items.description: Under one of the red slaad's long black claws is a sac of tiny eggs that it can inject into its victims. Its a bulbous sac, a couple inches wide, filled with hundreds of tiny black orbs. The eggs are a dangerous item, and often illegal in many cities. They are valued by witches, cruel assassins and anyone studying Limbo or Slaads.

Redcap.name: Redcap
Redcap.description: The creature resembles a tough, elderly gnome around 3​ to ​4 feet tall. It has a hunched back, wiry muscles, leathery tan skin, and an evil smile filled with wickedly sharp, protruding teeth. It wears heavy iron boots, leather pants, and a bright-red leather pointed caps soaked in fresh blood.

items.name: Redcap Blood (vial)
items.description: A redcap's blood is infused with dark fey energy. The blood is dark red, almost black. The blood can be used in potions and summonings, but is especially valued by anyone studying the connection between the feywild and the prime material plane.

items.name: Redcap Hat
items.description: The hat is regularly soaked in the fresh blood of a redcap's victims, and the hat retains a vivid red color (not drying, or crusting). The dark fey magic that courses through the hat can be modified by artificers and spellcasters. When the blood is wringed from the hat, its has trace amounts of magical energy that alchemists can tap into.

Reef Shark.name: Reef Shark
Reef Shark.description: A predatory shark, under 10 feet long average 6-10 feet. It has tough, dull gray skin that is roughened by toothlike scales. It has a muscular, asymmetrical, upturned tail and pointed fins. It also has a pointed snout extending forward and over a crescentic mouth set with sharp triangular teeth.

items.name: Reef Shark Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A shark's teeth are extremely sharp, triangular pieces of dentin covered in a hard coating of enamel. The teeth are used in jewelry and decoration, but can also be used to make serrate blades and saws.

items.name: Reef Shark Skin
items.description: A shark's skin is covered in small, rough, hard scales. Leatherworkers dry and treat the leather, then grind down the scales to make the leather smoother and easier to handle, giving it a pebbled appearance.

Reigar.name: Reigar
Reigar.description: Reigar are humanoid creatures resemble humans, but ere believed to have evolved from octopi. They have the ability to change the color of their skin, which has bioluminescent freckles and/or patterns. A glory (or halo) wraps around each reigar, with glittering motes that change color randomly.

items.name: Reigar Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Reigar blood is swirling with magical energy. The blood is translucent with a reddish hue and floating motes of light. The blood can be used by alchemists and healers, and any spellcaster interested in transmutation magic.

items.name: Reigar Talarith
items.description: A talarith (which can be a bracelet, brooch, diadem or necklace) can only be attuned to the reigar that created it, and loses all of its magic when its reigar is killed. In a few hours, it will slowly crumble to dust. However, with a careful ritual, the talarith may be removed from the talarith in tact. With its magic faded, this piece of jewelry is still unique and highly valued.

Remorhaz.name: Remorhaz
Remorhaz.description: A monstrous beast resembling a cross between a worm and a centipede. It has tough, leathery wings fanning off the side of its body, an insect-like head with razor sharp teeth, and a 40-foot long scaly body with dozens of legs. It is ice-blue in color, but its back glows red with an inner fire that radiates extreme heat. Sharp horns run along its back, glowing red hot.

items.name: Remorhaz Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A remorhaz has blood that burns as hot as lava, and flows just as thick. The blood must be harvested before it cools. The blood in often used in potions that protect against the elements.

items.name: Remorhaz Chitin Plates
