items.description: A remorhaz has a segmented exoskeleton of large chitinous plates. The chitin can be cut, treated and repurposed as armor or shields.

items.name: Remorhaz Heart
items.description: A remorhaz's heart is a hot ball of hard, course flesh, and looks like a burning coal. The heart continues to burn long after the remorhaz is killed. Arctic communities prize the heart for the continual life-giving heat the heart gives off. Artificers value the heart for its ongoing energy they can harness.

Retriever.name: Retriever
Retriever.description: The retriever is a large spider-like construct, often built by Underdark followers of Lloth.

items.name: Retriever Scarp Metal
items.description: When destroyed, the metallic body of a retriever collapses and falls to pieces. Among it's remains various pieces of salvageable metal. This metal can be used by artificers, tinkerers, inventors, smiths and jewelers.

items.name: Retriever Oil (flask)
items.description: Much of the Retriever's interior gears and components are coated in a thin layer of slick, black oil. It may be possible to gather some of this oil and collect it in a flask. The oil is a useful lubricant that any merchant will buy.

items.name: Retriever Core
items.description: Embedded inside the body of a retriever is a steel orb, swirling with dark magic. The orb is useful to artificers, tinkerers, inventors and other spellcasters.

Revenant.name: Revenant
Revenant.description: A decayed and emaciated human elf, dwarf, etc.. It has open festering wounds and drawn, clammy skin covering its flesh. It has lifeless eyes when faced with their murderers their eyes would flare with an unnatural light.

items.name: Reverant's Spark of Revenge (vial)
items.description:
A revenant's body is just a vessel for a soul craving revenge. When the body is killed, the soul flees to seek out another vessel, sometimes leaving behind a spark of dark necrotic energy that resonates with a deep hatred. Finding this spark requires a short arcane ritual, which isn't always successful. Requires an enchanted flask/vial.

Use: A spellcaster can spend a minute performing an arcane ritual with this item. Once the ritual is complete, for the next hour, the spellcaster will know the distance and direction of any creature(s) the revenant seeks revenge on (as long as the creature is on the same plane of existence). If a tracked creature dies, the spellcaster will know immediately. The spellcaster can repeat the ritual with the same spark after an hour. When the revenant finds a new vessel, the revenant will be aware of the distance and direction of this spark, regardless of whether the ritual was performed or not, and will kill to get it back.

Rhinoceros.name: Rhinoceros
Rhinoceros.description: The beast has a robust, cylindrical body with a big head and large horn in the middle of its face. It has a rough, gray hide, relatively short legs, and a short tail.

items.name: Rhinoceros Skin
items.description: The skin of a Rhinocerosis a thick, rough, gray hide that can be used to make a highly durable leather. It can be used in the production of leather armor, apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, tents and more.

items.name: Rhinoceros Horn
items.description: A rhinoceros has a long, bone-like protrusion made of keratin on its snout. The horn is often used as a trophy, ornament or in traditional medicines. The horn can also be treated and carved into short weapons.

Riding Horse.name: Riding Horse
Riding Horse.description: A horse is a large hoofed, four-legged mammal with short hair, long slender legs, muscular and deep torso build, a long tail, long thick necks, and large elongated heads.

items.name: Horse Hoof (x4)
items.description: A horse's hooves contains a collagen that is used to make a sticky adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Horse Hide
items.description: A horse's hide is known for its durability and resistance to moisture absorption.  The hide is primarily used to make harnesses, bags, shoes and rugs.

items.name: Horse Mane/Tail
items.description: Long, thick, strong strands of hair. Craftsmen often use the hair to make wigs, painting brushes, and fishing line. Weavers can also create coarse fabrics and apparel.

Roc.name: Roc
Roc.description: A gargantuan bird of prey. From the head to the base of the tail, the creature is about 50 feet long, with a 200-foot wingspan. It has a very large hooked beak and strong, muscular legs, and powerful talons.

items.name: Roc Blood (9 vials)
items.description: Rocs tend to be large, ancient creatures with dark red blood. The blood is often used in rituals and spells, but can also an ingredient in some sauces and stews.

items.name: Roc Feathers (5 large pouches)
items.description: A rock has a large collection of feathers of a variety of colors. While the feathers appear too large for common crafting, the soft bristles of the feathers can be removed and used in most items.

items.name: Roc Liver
items.description: A roc's liver is a dark red, rubbery organ, about three feet long, that has many alchemical properties. It helps with bile production, synthesizing proteins, and has many other functions. In addition, the liver also has use in various arcane rituals, or can be used as a food item.

items.name: Roc Talon (x6)
items.description: A roc has six large, sharp, iron-hard talons, each several feet long. Expert weaponsmiths can shape and carve the talons into weapons and tools of all shapes and sizes.

Roper.name: Roper
Roper.description: The creature has rock-like skin, and is almost indistinguishable from a stalactite, except for it's large bulbous eye, a mouth full of razor sharp teeth and tentacle-like appendages that reach out to grab its prey.

items.name: Roper Tendril (x6)
items.description: A roper has 6 long, fleshy tendrils. An expert craftsman can stretch these tendrils and carefully comb them into long, thin fibers. These fibers are then soaked and treated with oils, making them useful filaments for creating ropes and whips.

items.name: Roper Stomach Acid (vial)
items.description: A roper's stomach acid is a clear, green acidic substance. The gastric acid is valued by alchemists.

items.name: Roper Shell
items.description: A roper has a thick, stone shell that allows it to hide among stalactites and stalagmites. The shell is rock hard, made primarily of calcium carbonate, which is secreted by the creatures skin. The shell can be used to create armor and shields. It can also be ground into its base components, which are composed of various minerals useful to healers and alchemists.

Rot Grubs, Swarm of.name: Rot Grubs, Swarm of
Rot Grubs, Swarm of.description: Rot grubs are fist-sized maggots that eat living and dead creatures, although they can survive on vegetation.

items.name: Rot Grubs (x[[/r 2d10]])
items.description: If the rot grubs aren't completely destroyed, dead rot grubs can be can sold to alchemists and healers, and may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Rot Troll.name: Rot Troll
Rot Troll.description: A 9-foot tall troll, with a thin body that is infused with waves of necrotic energy. Its body withers and the flesh falls from its body as quickly as it regenerates. Anyone standing near a rot troll is exposed to its lethal emanations.

items.name: Rot Troll Skin Strips (pouch)
items.description: A rot troll's skin is in a constant state of flux. As it rots away, it is simultaneously regenerating. Samples of this skin can be harvested and sold to healers, alchemists and necromancers.

items.name: Rot Troll Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Rot trolls have amazing regenerative properties, since it has to compensate for it's decaying nature. A troll's blood clots, scabs and heals the surrounding tissue extremely quickly. The blood is a common ingredient in many healing potions.

items.name: Rot Troll Heart
items.description: A rot troll's heart is a large mass of red flesh that pumps the creature's regenerative blood throughout its body. The heart is used in arcane healing rituals and enchantments.

Rug of Smothering.name: Rug of Smothering
Rug of Smothering.description: A finely woven carpet, fit for a queen. or, a coarse mat in a peasant's hovel)

items.name: Animated Sigil Material
items.description: Magical dust, ash and powder, the salvaged remains of a magical rune, often used to animate certain constructs.

items.name: Magic Fabric
items.description: Magic fabric is used by tailors in the creation of various magical items.

Rust Monster.name: Rust Monster
Rust Monster.description: The creature is about the size of a small pony, with four insect-like legs and a squat, humped body. Its has a thick, segmented, chitinous, rusty-red shell (similar to a lobster). Its tail branches out into leaf-like paddles. Two long antennae come out of the side of its head.

items.name: Rust Monster Saliva (3 vials)
items.description: The saliva of this creature is a rusty red, highly acidic fluid. The saliva is highly valued by alchemists. Sculptors, masons, carvers and etchers all find the corrosive saliva useful.

items.name: Rust Monster Antenna (x2)
items.description: A rust monster has two long, feather-like appendages sticking off its head. The antenna aid the rust monster in detecting metal, as well as secreting a corrosive substance that breaks down any metal the antennas brush up against. Upon death, the antennas stop secreting any fluids, but an artificer may be able to repurpose the item. It is highly recommended that the antennas be cleaned and wrapped before placing them in an adventurer's backpack.

items.name: Rust Monster Chitin
items.description: A rust monster's exoskeleton is covered in the creature's corrosive fluids, which makes harvesting the item very difficult. If the shell is cleaned, and broken into smaller pieces, the hard chitinous plates can be used by armorers and alchemists.

Rutterkin.name: Rutterkin
Rutterkin.description: The rutterkin is a 6-foot tall, disfigured humanoid with mottled green and blue-violet skin, often riddled with lumps and tumors. It is completely hairless, with a rare patch or two of uncomfortable-looking wiry bristles. It has elongated skulls, and tiny, red eyes swollen with vicious hatred.

items.name: Rutterkin Tumor
items.description: A rutterkin's body is often riddled with tumors and cists. These balls of tissue often contain several components that healers can extract to aid in treating growths.

Sabre-Toothed Tiger.name: Sabre-Toothed Tiger
Sabre-Toothed Tiger.description: A large, short-limbed cat, about the size of a lion with abnormally-long canines stretching down from its upper jaw.

items.name: Sabre-Toothed Tiger Skin
items.description: The skin of a sabre-toothed tiger is covered in short, light brown fur. A sabre-toothed tiger's hide produces a good quality leather.

items.name: Sabre-Toothed Tiger Tooth (x2)
items.description: A sabre-toothed tiger has a distinctive pair of long, razor sharp canine teeth. The teeth can be crafted into small weapons and tools, or carved into small statues and decorations.

Sahuagin.name: Sahuagin
Sahuagin.description: The creature is a fish-like humanoid, with webbed feet and hands, gills, and a finned tail. It has additional webbing down its back, at the elbows, and where human ears would be. It has usually green, moist, scaly skin.

items.name: Sahuagin Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A sahuagin has dark blue blood that smells of rancid seaweed. The blood is oxygen rich, and has many transformative properties, making it useful in the alchemy community.

Sahuagin Baron.name: Sahuagin Baron
Sahuagin Baron.description: The creature is a fish-like humanoid, with webbed feet and hands, gills, and a finned tail. It has additional webbing down its back, at the elbows, and where human ears would be. It has usually green, moist, scaly skin.

items.name: Sahuagin Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A sahuagin has dark blue blood that smells of rancid seaweed. The blood is oxygen rich, and has many transformative properties, making it useful in the alchemy community.

Sahuagin Priestess.name: Sahuagin Priestess
Sahuagin Priestess.description: The creature is a fish-like humanoid, with webbed feet and hands, gills, and a finned tail. It has additional webbing down its back, at the elbows, and where human ears would be. It has usually green, moist, scaly skin.

items.name: Sahuagin Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A sahuagin has dark blue blood that smells of rancid seaweed. The blood is oxygen rich, and has many transformative properties, making it useful in the alchemy community.

items.name: Sahuagin Egg Clutch (pouch)
items.description: Only female sahuagin are deemed worthy of channeling the shark god Sekolah's power. It may be possible that a sahuagin priestess has various opaque, spongy egg sacs stuck to her back. The eggs are always unfertilized, as fertilized eggs are removed and taken to a hatchery. The eggs are a delicacy in some coastal cities, but are also used in potions and fertility rituals.

Salamander.name: Salamander
Salamander.description: A serpentine creatures with a humanoid torso and a long snake-like tail from the waist down. Its head, arms, back and tail all have flame-shaped webbing, used to regulate its body temperature. The creature's body radiates an extreme amount of heat.

items.name: Salamander Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A salamander's blood is a thick, vivid red-orange fluid with a faint glow. The blood is hot, and bubbles like a pool of lava. Blacksmiths can use the blood to aid in forging powerful weapons.

items.name: Salamander Scales (large pouch)
items.description: These small, hard, red scales have a metallic sheen and are warm to the touch, even after the creature's death. The scales are often used to make cold-weather apparel. They can also be ground into a fine powder to make red-hued inks, paints and dyes.

items.name: Salamander Heart
items.description: A salamander's heart is a warm ball of red flesh that pumps molten hot blood through its veins. When an extracted heart is pumped, it gets hotter and hotter, and becomes a burning ball of fire. A blacksmith can heat a forge for months using an enchanted salamander's heart.

Satyr.name: Satyr
Satyr.description: It resembles a stout man with a fur covered lower body and cloven hooves similar to that of a goat. A pair of Horns grow from its heads the horns are different for every satyr, they come in a variety of shapes and sizes. It also has a cleanly trimmed goatee although not all satyrs have facial hair.

items.name: Satyr Hair (small pouch)
items.description: A satyr typically has a full head of lush, dark hair. The hair can be used to brew strong liquors, and rejuvenation tonics.

items.name: Satyr Horn (x2)
items.description: A satyr's horns are different for each satyr, and have a variety of uses. Some make unique drinking horns, while others can be crafted into a musical instruments. All of the horns can be ground into a fine powder, which is believed to be a strong aphrodisiac.

Scarecrow.name: Scarecrow
Scarecrow.description: The creature looks like a humanoid figure constructed from stuffed sackcloths, stitched together. Bristles of hay stick out from its joints although stuffing varies. It is wearing a commoner's shirt and briches although, attire is completely up to the scarecrow's creator.

items.name: Scarecrow Stuffing (pouch)
items.description: The stuffing in a scarecrow looks like ordinary straw, but each straw is touched with spiritual energy. It is often used in arcane rituals where the straw is burned.

items.name: Scarecrow Cloth
items.description: The cloth "skin" of a scarecrow is typically made of a tan burlap fabric, crudely stitched together. The cloth is meant to magically contain the dark spirit that is bound inside the construct. The cloth can be pulled apart and the thread can be used for various purposes. Some artificers are able to create terrifying hoods and masks.

items.name: Scarecrow Essence (vial)
items.description: The evil spirit that is used to animate a scarecrow is released upon the creature's death, but it sometimes leaves behind a spark of the spirit's energy. The energy is a mote of arcane power used in spells, rituals and enchantments. Requires an enchanted vial/flask.

Scorpion.name: Scorpion
Scorpion.description: A tiny, elongated arachnid with a segmented curved tail tipped with a venomous stinger at the rear of its body and a pair of grasping pincers at the front. It has six chitinous legs that allow it to scurry across the ground.

items.name: Scorpion Venom (1 vial)
items.description:
A scorpion have a long tail with a poisonous stinger at the end. It may be difficult to harvest enough venom from the small creature's tail. The venom is a clear fluid with a yellow-green tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any poison. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 3 hours and 75gp worth of material to create Scorpion Poison (DC 10 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Scorpion Poison (Injury): A creature can use a vial of this poison to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ([[/r 1d8]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Scorpion, Giant.name: Scorpion, Giant
Scorpion, Giant.description: A large, elongated arachnid whose body is about the size of a horse. It has a segmented curved tail tipped with a venomous stinger at the rear of its body and a pair of grasping pincers at the front. It has six chitinous legs that allow it to scurry across the ground.

items.name: Scorpion Venom (3 vial)
items.description:
A scorpion have a long tail with a poisonous stinger at the end. It may be difficult to harvest enough venom from the small creature's tail. The venom is a clear fluid with a yellow-green tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any poison. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 3 hours and 75gp worth of material to create Scorpion Poison (DC 10 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Scorpion Poison (Injury): A creature can use a vial of this poison to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ([[/r 1d8]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Giant Scorpion Chitin
items.description: A giant scorpion is covered in large, segmented plates of hard chitin. It can be difficult removing this shell-like covering from the scorpion's large body. Armorers can often fashion chitin armor using these plates.

Sea Hags.name: Sea Hags
Sea Hags.description: This hag is abysmally grotesque. She has an emaciated form and long, thin limbs. Her pallid yellow-green skin has slimy scales and bony protrusions, rife with warts and oozing cankers. Her red piscine eyes are devoid of life with deep, black pupils. She has long, limp, hair that resembles rancid seaweed.

items.name: Sea Hag's Hair (small pouch)
items.description: A sea hag has long, limp, hair that resembles rancid seaweed. Its color is often gray, but sometimes moldy green or black. Due to the hag's abilities, the hair retains trace amounts of magic. Alchemists may find the hair useful in certain potions.

items.name: Sea Hag's Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A hag's blood is a black, viscous fluid that smells like rancid swamp water. The blood has arcane properties that can be harnessed by certain spellcasters and alchemists.

items.name: Sea Hag's Nails (pouch)
items.description: The nails of a hag are long, filthy, and sharp. After years of wielding magic, the nails become a conduit for the hags power. They must be carefully extracted during a complex ritual in order to retain their usefulness. Alchemists, magic users and other hags find value in this item.

items.name: Sea Hag's Eyeball
items.description: Harvesting the hag's eyeball intact is a delicate task. The eye is useful to those that practice divination. It can also be used by alchemists.

Sea Horse.name: Sea Horse
Sea Horse.description: The tiny creature has a horse-shaped head, with a long snout and a puckered mouth. It has a long "standing" body that goes down into a curving spiral tail. It has a dorsal fin on its back, and steers using pectoral fins on the side of its head.

items.name: Sea Horse Carcass
items.description: If the sea horse's carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's eyes, snout, tail, bones and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Sea Horse, Giant.name: Sea Horse, Giant
Sea Horse, Giant.description: The large creature is several feet taller than your average humanoid. It has a horse-shaped head, with a long snout and a puckered mouth. It has a long "standing" body that goes down into a curving spiral tail. It has a dorsal fin on its back, and steers using pectoral fins on the side of its head.

items.name: Giant Sea Horse Plates
items.description: A giant sea horse's body is made up of hard, external, bony plates that are fused together with a fleshy covering. The plates can be used to create hard, water-proof pieces of armor.

Sea Spawn.name: Sea Spawn
Sea Spawn.description: The creature has a ghastly piscine appearance that resembles a human figure sea spawn can be any humanoid race. Barnacles and coral encrust its cold, pale skin. Its warped body has a horrific combination of marine features tentacle arms, cephalopod eyes, urchin spines, whale fins, and seaweed hair are but some of the terrifying mutations.

items.name: Sea Spawn Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A sea spawns blood is a greenish brine that smells of rancid seaweed. The blood has many transformative properties that alchemists value. The harvesting DC becomes 15 if the attempt is done underwater.

items.name: Sea Spawn Appendage
items.description: Most sea spawns have an odd anatomical feature, such as: tentacle arm, sea urchin's spines, octopus eyes/beak, whale's fin, seaweed hair. The piscine body parts are prized by collectors and researchers. The parts may be useful to medical professionals and alchemists.

Shadar-kai Gloom Weaver.name: Shadar-kai Gloom Weaver
Shadar-kai Gloom Weaver.description: In the Shadowfell, the Shadar-kai look like withered, almost corpse-like elves, with wrinkled skin and swollen joints; on other planes they appear more youthful. Their hair is pale and their skin has a deathly pallor no matter the location. They prefer to wear cloaks and veils. They often wear masks of wood or metal to conceal their faces

items.name: Shadar-kai Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Shadar-kai blood is viscous, dark red (almost black) fluid with a dull metallic smell. The blood begins to evaporate into dark wisps of smoke when exposed to air on the Prime Material plane, and must be harvested quickly. The blood has deep ties to the Shadowfell, and is used by alchemists and spellcasters.

Shadar-kai Shadow Dancer.name: Shadar-kai Shadow Dancer
Shadar-kai Shadow Dancer.description: In the Shadowfell, the Shadar-kai look like withered, almost corpse-like elves, with wrinkled skin and swollen joints; on other planes they appear more youthful. Their hair is pale and their skin has a deathly pallor no matter the location. They prefer to wear cloaks and veils. They often wear masks of wood or metal to conceal their faces

items.name: Shadar-kai Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Shadar-kai blood is viscous, dark red (almost black) fluid with a dull metallic smell. The blood begins to evaporate into dark wisps of smoke when exposed to air on the Prime Material plane, and must be harvested quickly. The blood has deep ties to the Shadowfell, and is used by alchemists and spellcasters.

Shadar-kai Soul Monger.name: Shadar-kai Soul Monger
Shadar-kai Soul Monger.description: In the Shadowfell, the Shadar-kai look like withered, almost corpse-like elves, with wrinkled skin and swollen joints; on other planes they appear more youthful. Their hair is pale and their skin has a deathly pallor no matter the location. They prefer to wear cloaks and veils. They often wear masks of wood or metal to conceal their faces

items.name: Shadar-kai Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Shadar-kai blood is viscous, dark red (almost black) fluid with a dull metallic smell. The blood begins to evaporate into dark wisps of smoke when exposed to air on the Prime Material plane, and must be harvested quickly. The blood has deep ties to the Shadowfell, and is used by alchemists and spellcasters.

Shadow.name: Shadow
Shadow.description: The incorporeal creature can easily be seen in brightly lit areas, resembling a shadowy humanoid figure, but is invisible is extremely dark areas.

items.name: Shadow Mist
items.description: When the creature is killed, its shadowy form breaks apart into a cloud of dark mist that quickly disperses. An adept harvester can perform a simple ritual that forces the mist to reform and gather inside a vial. The mist is primarily used in summoning and teleportation spells to the Shadowfell. Requires an enchanted vial.

Shadow Demon.name: Shadow Demon
Shadow Demon.description: The physical form of the creature is vague and undefined. It seems to mesh with the dark contours of the environment or the shadows in the area. Its form becomes clearer as it moves through light (or has light shined directly on it). The true form of the creature is that of an angular, thin, 6 foot tall, humanoid figure with a pair of bat-like wings, inky talons and a lower half that bled away into nothingness.

items.name: Demonic Mist
items.description: Being a creature of darkness, lacking physical form, one may be able to capture the creature's dark demonic essence using an enchanted bottle. The essence can be used by a skilled magic user in dark experiments, or to create certain magic items. Requires an enchanted bottle.

Shadow Mastiff.name: Shadow Mastiff
Shadow Mastiff.description: The creature has the body of a large dog, standing a bit over 2 feet at the shoulder, with a smooth black coat (making it very hard to be seen in the dark). Its face is flatter than most canines, with a less prominent snout, and it has a monstrous mouth full of vicious teeth.

items.name: Shadow Mastiff Teeth (small bag)
items.description: A shadow mastiff has dark, stout, pointy teeth. The teeth can be used to make serrated blades and saws, or can be used in jewelry and decorations. Some craftsmen can carve the teeth to make dark caltrops.

items.name: Shadow Mastiff Blood (vial)
items.description: A shadow mastiff's blood is a black fluid that quickly turns to a dark vapor when exposed to air, making it hard to harvest. The blood is useful to alchemists, spellcasters, and anyone studying the Shadowfell.

items.name: Shadow Mastiff Hide
items.description: A shadow mastiff's dark hide is covered in soft, short coat of black fur. The hide is difficult to see in dim light, and nearly invisible in darkness. If harvested incorrectly, the fur disperses into a fine black mist, and the hide falls apart. The fur has a connection to the Shadowfell, and is useful in making dark apparel.

Shadow Mastiff Alpha.name: Shadow Mastiff Alpha
Shadow Mastiff Alpha.description: The creature has the body of a large dog, standing a bit over 2 feet at the shoulder, with a smooth black coat (making it very hard to be seen in the dark). Its face is flatter than most canines, with a less prominent snout, and it has a monstrous mouth full of vicious teeth.

items.name: Shadow Mastiff Teeth (small bag)
items.description: A shadow mastiff has dark, stout, pointy teeth. The teeth can be used to make serrated blades and saws, or can be used in jewelry and decorations. Some craftsmen can carve the teeth to make dark caltrops.

items.name: Shadow Mastiff Blood (vial)
items.description: A shadow mastiff's blood is a black fluid that quickly turns to a dark vapor when exposed to air, making it hard to harvest. The blood is useful to alchemists, spellcasters, and anyone studying the Shadowfell.

items.name: Shadow Mastiff Hide
items.description: A shadow mastiff's dark hide is covered in soft, short coat of black fur. The hide is difficult to see in dim light, and nearly invisible in darkness. If harvested incorrectly, the fur disperses into a fine black mist, and the hide falls apart. The fur has a connection to the Shadowfell, and is useful in making dark apparel.

Shambling Mound.name: Shambling Mound
Shambling Mound.description: The creature is a moving, vaguely man-shaped, mound of rotting vegetation.

items.name: Shambling Mound Moss (x3 pouch)
items.description: The amorphous body of a shambling mound is often covered in a soft, green moss, which is usually layered with a variety of molds and fungus, all of which have some healing or botanical uses.

items.name: Shambling Mound Vine (x4)
items.description: A shambling mound usually has several long, vines wrapped around its plant-like form. The vines can be combed into fibrous threads used to make rope or simple apparel.

items.name: Shambling Mound Root-Stem
items.description: At the center of a shambling mound is a knotted ball of roots that branch out in all directions. This fleshy root-stem is valued by healers.

Shield Guardian.name: Shield Guardian
Shield Guardian.description: The humanoid construct stands about 9 feet tall although size varies. Typical weight is over 1,200 pounds. It looks something like a large stick figure made of wood with metal plating, similar to plate armor.

items.name: Shield Guardian Plates
items.description: The metal plates of a shield guardian are infused with protective arcane magic. The plates can be repurposed and reforged into armor and shields.

items.name: Shield Guardian Sphere
items.description: Inside of a shield guardian is a perfectly round, 5-inch sphere of iron. This object lets a spellcaster store a single spell inside the shield guardian. The sphere is valued by spellcasters hoping to harness the sphere's power or forge it into other items.

Shoosuva.name: Shoosuva
Shoosuva.description: The creature is a 6 foot high, bestial quadruped resembling an emaciated hyena. It has a series of bony ridges that run down its spine and has a giant poisonous stinger on its barbed tail. Its leprous skin is mottled and its fur was patchy. The creature has red eyes and jagged fangs that fill its slavering maws.

items.name: Shoosuva Fur (small pouch)
items.description:
Shoosuva fur is mangy and disease ridden. The fur has a strong odor that makes animals more aggressive and violent. 

Use: If a beast with an Intelligence score of 4 or less comes within 10 feet of the fur, and can smell it, it must succeed a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or become berserk. While berserk, the beast spends each of its turns moving toward the closest creature and attacking it, if possible. The beast remains berserk for 1 minute or until it becomes unconscious. A creature that the beast is normally friendly with can spend an action to make a DC 15 Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. On a success, the effect ends. A beast that has had the effect end, or who succeeds its initial saving throw, is immune to the effect of this item for 24 hours.

items.name: Shoosuva Spike
items.description: Running down a Shoosuva's spine are a series of bony ridges. These ridges are extremely hard and razor sharp. Adept weaponsmiths may be able to craft something useful from these spikes.

items.name: Shoosuva Heart
items.description: A shoosuva's heart is a black mass of flesh, about the size of a volleyball. Even after it is removed, the heart beats when it comes within 30 feet of fresh blood or raw meat.

items.name: Shoosuva Poison Gland
items.description:
A shoosuva's tail has a large poisonous stinger on the end. A skilled harvester can attempt to dissect the stinger and remove the poison gland.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this gland. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's poison gland that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Yeenoghu's Sting (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the poison gland. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's sting.

Refining the Poison: Once the gland is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 6 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Yeenoghu's Sting (DC 16 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Yeenoghu's Sting (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. Yeenoghu's Sting is slightly stronger than Carrion Crawler Mucus. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned, the target is also paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on success. This poison usually sells for 250gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Shrieker.name: Shrieker
Shrieker.description: A human-sized mushroom, with a gray-white top and a reddish stalk.

items.name: Shrieker Spores (pouch)
items.description: Shrieker spores are light, round, puffy yellow balls about a millimeter in diameter. They are highly valued among underground societies, as they provide a natural alarm system for a community.

Sibriex.name: Sibriex
Sibriex.description: A sibriex is a bloated, 15-foot tall demon that is little more than an enormous, deformed head. Its misshapen body is covered in lesions and puss-covered flesh, that constantly exude streams of blood and bile, polluting the ground and withering plants wherever it goes. Its face is the size of a wagon, with shriveled appendages ending in trembling digits where its ears would be. In place of a neck, its underbelly hosts a writhing mass of stalks, puckers, and feeding tubes. Although it could lazily float through the air, a sibriex often wears a steel chain body harness wrapped around its form, that firmly tethered them to the ground. When they wanted to "walk" along a solid surface, they would animate the chains to stab into the ground, in a crawling fashion.

items.name: Sibriex Bile (9 vials)
items.description: The sibriex excretes a disgusting combination of blood, puss and bile. This revolting fluid drips down from it's floating bulbous form. The bile contains a mix of demonic fluids, all of which are valuable to a proficient alchemist. It is rumored that the fluid can be used to cause mutations.

items.name: Sibriex Chains
items.description: A sibriex often wears a harness of thick chains that is uses to tether itself, and move about the ground. These chains resonate with arcane energy. The chains are useful, especially to shipbuilders. The metal can also be reforged by skilled smiths.

items.name: Sibriex Hippocampus
items.description: A sibriex's body is little more than an enormous, deformed head. As such, the creature has a well-formed hippocampus, located in the brain's temporal lobe. The hippocampus is where memories are formed and indexed for later access. Being a creature that seeks ancient lore, a sibriex's hippocampus is often sought after by anyone looking to tap into lost knowledge. And since sibriexes are thought to be as old as the Abyss itself, they probably have many secrets.

Skeleton.name: Skeleton
Skeleton.description: An undead animated corpse, completely devoid of any flesh. Its loose bones and joints are held together by some unseen necromatic energy.

items.name: Bone Dust (pouch)
items.description: When destroyed, the bones of a skeleton collapse to the ground. Shifting through the remains, it may be possible to find bone dust coated with dark necrotic energy. The dust is commonly used in many necromantic spells and rituals.

Skulk.name: Skulk
Skulk.description: Skulks are invisible, soulless shells of travelers who became lost in the Shadowfell (and can be summoned to other planes).

items.name: Skulk Residue (flask)
items.description: When a skulk is killed, its form disperses and it returns to the Shadowfell. Occasionally, it leaves behind a fine, almost invisible, moist residue. The residue resonates with shadow magic, and can be used by alchemists, spellcasters and anyone studying the Shadowfell. Requires an enchanted flask.

Skull Lord.name: Skull Lord
Skull Lord.description: Skull lords have a skeletal humanoid form, but have three skull — one each side of the central one. These undead often wear plate armor and carry a powerful staff of bone.

items.name: Skull Lord Dust (pouch)
items.description: When a skull lord is destroyed, its skeletal form crumbles to ash. The ash is valuable to alchemists and spellcasters (especially artificers and necromancers).

Slaad Tadpole.name: Slaad Tadpole
Slaad Tadpole.description: A tiny, fish-like creature with beady eyes and a round, lamprey-like mouth full of sharp teeth.

items.name: Slaad Slime (vial)
items.description: A slaad's skin is covered in a thin layer of clear mucus that smells of sulfur and rot. The slime has various healing and regenerative properties.

Slithering Tracker.name: Slithering Tracker
Slithering Tracker.description: A glistening creature of transparent ooze. When still, it looks like a wet patch of stone or a patch of condensation on a wall.

items.name: Slithering Tracker Fluid (vial)
items.description: When a slithering tracker is defeated, it falls into a puddle of clear liquid, with a reddish tint (even redder if it has killed recently). The fluid has a low viscosity and spreads out fast, flowing in crevasses and small holes, and and can be difficult to collect. The fluid has many alchemical properties. It is also valued by spellcasters and clerics of vengeful deities.

items.name: Slithering Tracker Essence (vial)
items.description: The essence of a slithering tracker is invisible to the naked eye. Harvesting the essence requires a simple ritual, which gathers a red mote of light into an enchanted container. The red light is almost hypnotizing, and fills most people with a deep anger. The essence is just a speck of the creature's vengeful spirit, and is useful to spellcasters. Requires an enchanted vial.

Smoke Mephit.name: Smoke Mephit
Smoke Mephit.description: The creature is impish in appearance, about 4 feet tall, with wispy wings, long pointy ears, and an elongated nose. The creature has a body of whispy dark smoke, that billows constantly, and smells of burned embers.

items.name: Dual Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: When a mephit is killed, it's elemental form disperses, leaving behind trace remnants from two different elemental planes. If harvested quickly, a mote of residual energy can be found - an essence resulting from the mixture of two elemental powers. The essence is useful to elemental spellcasters and those that study the elemental planes. Requires an enchanted vial.

Snail, Giant.name: Snail, Giant
Snail, Giant.description: These large mollusks are slug-like creatures partly enclosed in a calcium carbonate shell. They retreat into their hardy shells when threatened, and are particularly susceptible to being injured by contact with salt.

items.name: Giant Snail Shell
items.description: The large shell of a giant snail is extremely heavy, even after it is hollowed out. The shell can be repurposed for armor, or used as a tiny shelter.

items.name: Giant Snail Slime (5 vials)
items.description: Giant snails leave behind a slimy trail of thick, sticky, transparent fluid. This slime can be harvested, and is often used by alchemists.

Solar.name: Solar
Solar.description: The creature is a beautiful human-like muscular figure with copper skin and hair. It has a set of large, white, gleaming wings and radiant topaz eyes. It stands about 10 feet tall and looks to weigh around 500 pounds.

items.name: Solar Ear (x2)
items.description: Solar's are natural lie detectors, making their ear's highly sought after.Use: If a player is holding 2 solar ears, they have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) ability checks to detect lies. The ears lose their magic and become ineffective after two weeks.

items.name: Solar Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Solar blood is known for it's amazing healing properties.Use: Drinking Solar blood restores [[/r 4d8]]+2 hit points and cures disease, poison, blindness, deafness, and removes any curse.

items.name: Solar Wing (x2)
items.description: Solar wings can be harvested for their feathers. Artificers and enchanters may be able to use a full set of wings to create magic items.

items.name: Solar Eye (x2)
items.description: Solar Eyes can be magically transformed into large shimmering diamonds.

Space Clowns.name: Space Clowns
Space Clowns.description: Space Clowns are fiendish humanoids with clown-like appearances. Their facial features are often exaggerated, usually with wide tooth-filled grins. Their skin is often pale, with paint-like colorations. They choose to wear extremely colorful clothing.

items.name: Space Clown Ichor (3 vials)
items.description: When a space clown dies, it pops like a balloon, releasing a splash of putrid, corrosive ichor. This acidic ichor can be harvested, but little else remains of the creature.

Space Eel.name: Space Eel
Space Eel.description: 5-foot long scavengers. These eels trail spelljamming ships and feed on barnacles.

items.name: Space Eel Roe (pouch)
items.description: The eggs of a space eel are a delicacy, and can sometimes be found in the eel's corpse.

Space Guppy.name: Space Guppy
Space Guppy.description: 2-3 feet long, fish-like creatures that glide through Wildspace and the Astral Sea.

items.name: Space Guppy Scales (pouch)
items.description: These small, scales have a golden sheen. The scales can be used as an ingredient in potions of flying. They can also be ground into a fine powder to make golden inks, paints and dyes.

Space Hamster.name: Space Hamster
Space Hamster.description: Space hamsters resemble normal hamsters, both in size, appearance and general demeanor. They are cute, plant eating rodents that come in a variety of colors.

Space Mollymawk.name: Space Mollymawk
Space Mollymawk.description: Superstitious Wildspace voyagers consider it bad luck to kill a space mollymawk.

items.name: Space Mollymawk Feathers (pouch)
items.description: Space mollymawk feathers are light decorative plumage, that help the bird fly. The feathers are used in decorations, dusters, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

Space Swine.name: Space Swine
Space Swine.description: Space swine are a species of winged boar. They are often bred by dohwars and serve as mounts for small creatures.

items.name: Space Swine Tusks
items.description: A space swine's tusk range from 4 to 10 inches long, depending on the creature's size. The tusks are used in trophies and decorations, but some small tools can be crafted using the tusks.

items.name: Space Swine Hide
items.description: A space swine has a tough hide covered in short, dark fur. A boar's hide produces a good quality leather.

Spawn of Kyuss.name: Spawn of Kyuss
Spawn of Kyuss.description: The creature looks like an ordinary zombie, with withering and decayed flesh. A closer inspection reveals that the zombie is covered in hundreds of wriggling worms, crawling all in and out of its torn and damaged flesh.

items.name: Spawn of Kyuss Worm
items.description:
The skin of a spawn of kyuss is covered in a mass of wriggling green worms. When a spawn falls, the worms slowly begin to wither, and weakly crawl away from the body to seek a new host. Gathering one of these worms can be dangerous (see below) and requires an enchanted vial. The worms are valued by spellcasters, especially necromancers, and anyone with an interest in Kyuss. In addition, medical researchers and healers may be interested in the worms for their ability to spread disease and reproduce rapidly.

Harvesting Note: If the harvester fails the DC check by 5 or more, one of the worms jump at the creature. Unless the target succeeds on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, the worm latches onto the target's skin. The worm is a Tiny undead with AC 6, l hit point, a 2 (-4) in every ability score, and a speed of 1 foot. While on the target's skin, the worm can be killed by normal means or scraped off using an action. Otherwise, the worm burrows under the target's skin at the end of the target's next turn, dealing 1 piercing damage to it. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) necrotic damage per worm infesting it (maximum of [[/r 10d6]]). A worm-infested target dies if it drops to 0 hit points, then rises 10 minutes later as a spawn of Kyuss. If a worm-infested creature is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away.

Spectator.name: Spectator
Spectator.description: a 3.5 foot beholder with a large central eye and had four eyestalks - two located symmetrically on either side of the upper half of the body. Its skin is thick, lumpy, and rubbery, with numerous blood vessels visible on the surface.

items.name: Spectator Eye Stalk
items.description: Spectator eyestalks are valued by magic users, enchanters and artificers. Once successfully harvested, roll [[/r 1d4]] for the type of eyestalk received (1. Confusion, 2. Paralyzing, 3. Fear, 4. Wounding). see MM p30 for more details on the Spectator

items.name: Large Spectator Eye
items.description: A spectator main eye is highly valued to enchanters, artificers and magic users for it's magical reflective properties.

Specter.name: Specter
Specter.description: A mostly transparent and faintly luminous humanoid form It looks much as it did in life, though the injuries that caused its violent deaths are visible on the specter. It can be recognized by someone who knew the person while it was alive.

items.name: Specter Dust
items.description: When a specter is killed, its form disperses into a fine mist, often scattering tiny motes of dust. The dust resonates with dark necrotic energy and is highly valued by necromancers, but has uses in other areas.

items.name: Specter Remnants
items.description: On rare occasions, a dispersed specter may leave behind a physical formation from their spectral form. This can be a strip of fabric, a lock of hair or even a piece of jewelry. The item glows with a soft blue color. These items are useful in arcane rituals and necromancy spells.

Spider.name: Spider
Spider.description: A tiny arachnid having eight legs and a body divided into two parts. The creature has sharp fangs, black eyes and a spinneret to create webs.

items.name: Spider Carcass
items.description: If the spider carcass isn't completely destroyed, the creature's body can be can sold to alchemists and healers. The little beast's legs, eyes, and organs may have uses in potions, salves and ointments.

Spined Devil (Spinagon).name: Spined Devil (Spinagon)
Spined Devil (Spinagon).description: The creature has a devilish, gargoyle-like appearance and spines bristling all over its humanoid form. A set of dark, leathery, ragged wings stretch out from it's back. It stands almost 3 feet tall and weighs only about 40 lbs. It has long, keen talons at the end of its hands and feet. You see glowing muted red eyes, and emits high-pitched giggles and shrieks. In one of its hands is a long, three-pointed military fork.

items.name: Spine Devil Blood (vial)
items.description: The spine devil's blood is a clear, reddish substance that smells like kerosene. Alchemists can use the blood as a potion ingredient, while others choose to create fiery concoctions.

items.name: Spined Devil Spines
items.description: The spine devil's spines are hard, sharp needles that have a variety of uses. Harvesting is difficult - if the character fails the harvesting by 5 or more, they immediate take [[/r 1d6]] damage. Success results in 10 needles (1sp each). The smaller needles are used by tailors and healers, while the larger barbs can be used to make arrows.

Spirit Naga.name: Spirit Naga
Spirit Naga.description: The creature looks like a giant cobra with a snake-like head with human features.

items.name: Naga Spine
items.description: A nage has a very long spine, made up of hundreds of vertebrae. The bones have various uses, especially to make tools and sculptures. The spine can also be fashioned into necromatic staves.

items.name: Naga Scales (3 pouches)
items.description: Each scale of a naga holds a tiny mote of power that spellcasters may be able to harness. The scales can also be used to make apparel and decorations. They can also be ground into a fine powder to make dyes and ink.

items.name: Naga Fang (x2)
items.description: A naga has no poison gland, but the fangs magically produce a deadly venom. This poison fades once the naga is killed, but the large fangs remain an arcane conduit. The fangs can be crafted into useful items that are easily enchanted by an adept artificer.

Spirit Troll.name: Spirit Troll
Spirit Troll.description: A 9-foot tall troll blasted with psychic energy that is able to take a non-physical form upon regenerating.

items.name: Spirit Troll Skin Strips (pouch)
items.description: A spirit troll's skin is transparent, with a green hue. The skin has properties that are tied to the ethereal plane. Alchemists can use the skin to make special oils.

items.name: Spirit Troll Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Spirit trolls have translucent green blood. The blood has amazing regenerative properties. It is a common ingredient in many healing potions.

items.name: Spirit Troll Heart
items.description: A spirit troll's heart is a large mass of translucent red flesh that pumps the creature's regenerative blood throughout its body. The heart is used in arcane healing rituals and enchantments.

Spring Eladrin.name: Spring Eladrin
Spring Eladrin.description: Eladrin are a subrace of elves who adopted the Feywild as their home. After centuries of exposure to Feywild magic, they acquired supernatural abilities and were effectively transformed into fey. Spring Eladrin have green-tinted skin, with green hair (often woven with twigs and leaves). Their pointy ears are slightly longer than their Prime Material kin.

items.name: Spring Eladrin Hair
items.description: The hair of a spring eladrin is green, silky, and smells like freshly cut grass. The hair retains magic from the Feywild, and is often used is potions and elixirs. The hair can also be used as decorations and trinkets.

items.name: Eladrin Ear (x2)
items.description: Eladrin ears are similar to elven ears, but slightly longer. Most people considering killing an eladrin an evil act, and are suspicious of those selling such items. However, some evil communities, or those having trouble with Eladrin (such as lumbermills), may pay a bounty for such ears.

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description: The tiny creature looks like a small humanoid with elven features: a thin body with sharp feaatures, pointy ears, almond-shaped eyes. It has a pair of insect-like wings on its back.

items.name: Sprite Wings (x2)
items.description: A sprite's dragonfly-like wings are a useful alchemical ingredient.

items.name: Sprite Dust (small pouch)
items.description: Sprites have tiny gossamer wings, like those of dragonflies, which shed tiny flecks of shimmering dust when they fly. When a sprite dies, the dust is difficult to see, and its often hard to harvest a sufficient amount. The dust has a variety of uses, especially among spellcasters and alchemists.

Ssurran.name: Ssurran
Ssurran.description: Ssurran are lizardfolk that have adapted to arid climates and in Wildspace. They are tall, powerfully built reptilian humanoids, with skin covered in scales. They have a non-prehensile muscular tail about three to four feet in length. They also have sharp claws and teeth.

items.name: Ssurran Tail
items.description: The ssurran tail is long and thick with a thin spinal cord running down the middle. Alchemists and healers can use the tail for salves and potions, due to the creature's regenerative capabilities. Hungry communities and primitive tribes often use the tail for its meat. Other communities will pay for the tails as a bounty on the creatures.

items.name: Ssurran Skin
items.description: A Ssurran's skin is covered in small scales. The scales aren't strong or large enough to make armor, but the skin can be used to make apparel and accessories, including belts and footwear. The scales can also be used by alchemists and healers.

Ssurran Defiler.name: Ssurran Defiler
Ssurran Defiler.description: Ssurran are lizardfolk that have adapted to arid climates and in Wildspace. They are tall, powerfully built reptilian humanoids, with skin covered in scales. They have a non-prehensile muscular tail about three to four feet in length. They also have sharp claws and teeth.

items.name: Ssurran Tail
items.description: The ssurran tail is long and thick with a thin spinal cord running down the middle. Alchemists and healers can use the tail for salves and potions, due to the creature's regenerative capabilities. Hungry communities and primitive tribes often use the tail for its meat. Other communities will pay for the tails as a bounty on the creatures.

items.name: Ssurran Skin
items.description: A Ssurran's skin is covered in small scales. The scales aren't strong or large enough to make armor, but the skin can be used to make apparel and accessories, including belts and footwear. The scales can also be used by alchemists and healers.

Ssurran Poisoner.name: Ssurran Poisoner
Ssurran Poisoner.description: Ssurran are lizardfolk that have adapted to arid climates and in Wildspace. They are tall, powerfully built reptilian humanoids, with skin covered in scales. They have a non-prehensile muscular tail about three to four feet in length. They also have sharp claws and teeth.

items.name: Ssurran Tail
items.description: The ssurran tail is long and thick with a thin spinal cord running down the middle. Alchemists and healers can use the tail for salves and potions, due to the creature's regenerative capabilities. Hungry communities and primitive tribes often use the tail for its meat. Other communities will pay for the tails as a bounty on the creatures.

items.name: Ssurran Skin
items.description: A Ssurran's skin is covered in small scales. The scales aren't strong or large enough to make armor, but the skin can be used to make apparel and accessories, including belts and footwear. The scales can also be used by alchemists and healers.

Star Spawn Grue.name: Star Spawn Grue
Star Spawn Grue.description: Star spawn grue are humanoid aberrations, with fanged, lipless, ever-grinning mouths. Bristles and spines project from odd patches of its grayish skin, and its long fingers end in broken and dirty nails.

items.name: Star Spawn Dust (pouch)
items.description: The skin of star spawn is covered in a translucent dust. The dust begins to evaporate once the creature is killed and must be harvested quickly. The dust swirls with arcane energy.

Star Spawn Hulk.name: Star Spawn Hulk
Star Spawn Hulk.description: Star spawn hulks have a large humanoid form, with glistening, translucent skin. Under its skin are visible internal organs and dark skeletal frame. They have pale, lidless eyes on a face distorted by a mouth with too many teeth and a nose thats too small.

items.name: Star Spawn Dust (pouch)
items.description: The skin of star spawn is covered in a translucent dust. The dust begins to evaporate once the creature is killed and must be harvested quickly. The dust swirls with arcane energy.

items.name: Star Spawn Hulk Skin
items.description: The translucent epidermis of a star spawn hulk is a soft, thin, spongy material that sits over a hard crystal-like subdermis. The skin is extremely reflective, and is believed to reflect psychic damage.

Star Spawn Larva Mage.name: Star Spawn Larva Mage
Star Spawn Larva Mage.description: The larva mage is a nightmarish combination of a mortal body and otherworldly substance, often covered in a long, flowing robe. Much of it's body appears to be composed of worm-like creatures, constantly writhing about its form.

items.name: Star Spawn Worms (pouch)
items.description:
A star spawn larva mage has a body composed of a swirling mass of worms. When the creature is killed, the worms fall and begin to disperse. The worms can be harvested for their necrotic and alchemical properties.

Use: Using an action, the worms can be thrown at a target within 30 feet. That target must make a DC 15 saving throw or take [[/r 3d8]] necrotic damage. The worms disperse after the attack, and cannot be retrieved.

Star Spawn Mangler.name: Star Spawn Mangler
Star Spawn Mangler.description: Star spawn manglers are low-slung and creeping creatures with a horrific appearance. They resemble humanoids, with between four and eight gangly arms (most often six), each ending in bird-like talons. It has an elongated head with two slits instead of a nose, two beady eyes, and a mouth full of sharp teeth. Its long torso and hunched posture make them appear shorter than they actually are. The flanks of its torso often has several sharp insect-like appendages, similar to a centipede.

items.name: Star Spawn Dust (pouch)
items.description: The skin of star spawn is covered in a translucent dust. The dust begins to evaporate once the creature is killed and must be harvested quickly. The dust swirls with arcane energy.

items.name: Star Spawn Claws (pouch)
items.description: The black taloned claws of a star spawn resonate with psionic energy. The talons can be shaved down and used in potions and elixir.

Star Spawn Seer.name: Star Spawn Seer
Star Spawn Seer.description: Star spawn seers were once humanoid warlocks, whose body is riddled by a mass of tumorous growths, some sprouting purple worm-like protrusion. The hands have become bulky, flipper-like appendages and grasp a staff of flesh, bone and items from the star spawn's realm.

items.name: Star Spawn Dust (pouch)
items.description: The skin of star spawn is covered in a translucent dust. The dust begins to evaporate once the creature is killed and must be harvested quickly. The dust swirls with arcane energy.

items.name: Star Spawn Seer Pineal Gland
items.description: A star spawn seer's pineal gland expands to twice its size when the entity takes over. This gland is believed to control the creatures psychic power. The gland may be used to create potions and elixirs that enhance psychic power.

Starlight Apparition.name: Starlight Apparition
Starlight Apparition.description: This creature is a transparent projection of an unfortunate soul who perished in Wildspace or the Astral Sea.

items.name: Starlight Apparition Essence
items.description: When a starlight apparition is destroyed, it bursts into a harmless explosion of tiny motes of light. Before these tiny lights disappear, it may be possible to collect several in an enchanted container. It is believed that these lights may be useful to a holy person trying to communicate with a god. Requires an enchanted vial.

Steam Mephit.name: Steam Mephit
Steam Mephit.description: The creature is impish in appearance, about 4 feet tall, with wispy wings, long pointy ears, and an elongated nose. Its body appears to be made of white, hot steam, with wisps of heat constantly rising off of its form. It leaves a trail of hot water wherever it goes.

items.name: Dual Elemental Essence (vial)
items.description: When a mephit is killed, it's elemental form disperses, leaving behind trace remnants from two different elemental planes. If harvested quickly, a mote of residual energy can be found - an essence resulting from the mixture of two elemental powers. The essence is useful to elemental spellcasters and those that study the elemental planes. Requires an enchanted vial.

Steel Predator.name: Steel Predator
Steel Predator.description: Steel predators are large mechanical cats with muscles made of iron. Like a big cat, steel predators were strong and fast.

items.name: Steel Predator Scrap Metal
items.description: The iron used to create a steel predator is forged with arcane power, and can be reforged by a master smith.

items.name: Steel Predator Amplifier
items.description: Steel predators are capable of emitting a stunning roar. Inside the constructs throat is a small mechanical device that, when powered, amplifies their roar. The device becomes useless once the creature drops below 0 hit points, but is considered valuable among artificers, tinkerers and inventors.

items.name: Steel Predator Power Gem
items.description: Embedded in the chest of a steel predator is a large, glowing yellow gem. The gem is warm and radiates with arcane power. The core is useful to artificers and other spellcasters.

Stegosaurus.name: Stegosaurus
Stegosaurus.description: The large, heavily built, reptile is a quadruped with a rounded back, short fore limbs, long hind limbs, and tails held high in the air. It has distinctive upright plates along its back and spikes on its tail. The creature is about 30 feet long.

items.name: Stegosaurus Skin
items.description: The skin of a Stegosaurus is a highly durable reptilian hide, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, and more.

items.name: Stegosaurus Ridge (x4)
items.description: The stegosaurus has distinctive upright plates that line its back. These bony plates can be used to craft armor and other items.

items.name: Stegosaurus Tail Spike
items.description: The tail of a stegosaurus has several long, bone spikes. These spikes are hard as steel and can pierce most armor. The spike can be harvested and be used to various piercing weapons, spikes and pitons. Each spike can be several feet long.

Stench Kow.name: Stench Kow
Stench Kow.description: The stench kow is a misshapen bison native to the lower planes. It has humps over its shoulders, and a thick, furry, dull orange hide, with a matted greenish mane. It has a huge head with long horns that curve downward, large round eyes, and a lolling tongue.

items.name: Stench Kow Horns (x2)
items.description: Stench Kow horns can be used to create drinking horns, decorations, jewelry, weapon handles and simple tools (hoes, rakes,etc.).

items.name: Stench Kow Hide
items.description: Once it is cleaned, the hide of Stench Kow can be crafted into soft, supple leather, which is used to create armor and apparel.

Stirge.name: Stirge
Stirge.description: The creature resembles a monstrous cross between a large bat and an oversized mosquito. It is about a foot long with a short, furry, rusty-red body and membranous bat-like wings, interlaced with blood vessels. It has four legs that end in pincers and a long, sharp needle-like proboscis underneath two beady yellow eye.

items.name: Stirge Needle
items.description: A stirge has a long, needle-like proboscis that it uses to suck its victim's blood. These needles are often repurposed and used by healers.

items.name: Stirge Stomach Acid (vial)
items.description: A stirge's stomach acid is so exceptionally corrosive, that it can safely digest blood infected with diseases and bacteria that would be lethal to other creature. To harvest the item successfully, the stomach must be cut open carefully, without the acid flowing out. The stomach acid is useful to alchemist.

Stone Cursed.name: Stone Cursed
Stone Cursed.description: Stone cursed are spawned through a foul alchemical ritual performed on a humanoid that has been turned to stone. As such, they look like a stone statue of a humanoid.

items.name: Stone Cursed Dust
items.description: When the creature is slain, the statue shatters to pieces, scattering rocks debris and stone dust all over the area. The stone dust is an arcane powder, often used in potions and arcane rituals.

items.name: Stone Cursed Obsidian Skull
items.description:
When a stone cursed is created, a fist-sized obsidian skull forms within the torso. A faint echo of the original victim's memory resonates within the skull. A skilled magic-wielder can attempt to extract these memories from it to gain insight into the victim's past or find lore that otherwise would be lost.

Use: At the end of a short rest, a character can make a DC 20 Intelligence (Arcana) check to attempt to extract a memory from the skull that is a response to a verbal question posed to the skull by the characters. Once the check is made, whether it succeeds or fails, the skill can't be used in this way again.

Stone Defender.name: Stone Defender
Stone Defender.description: The stone defender is a robotic construct resembling a humanoid figure. It has massive stone slabs affixed to its forearms that serve as shields.

items.name: Clockwork Gears and Scrap Metal
items.description: When destroyed, a clockwork machine shuts down (usually releasing a cloud of steam) and falls to pieces. Among it's remains are several gears and pieces of scrap metal. These items can be used by artificers, tinkerers, inventors, smiths and jewelers.

items.name: Clockwork Oil (flask)
items.description: Some of the clockwork's interior gears and components are coated in a thin layer of slick, black oil. It may be possible to gather some of this oil and collect it in a flask. The oil is a useful lubricant that any merchant will buy.

Stone Giant.name: Stone Giant
Stone Giant.description: The giant has skin that resembles the surrounding rock, has no body hair and is bald. He/she has steel blue eyes. His/her sparse clothing, a loincloth, is a similar color to the nearby rocks. The giant stands about 18 feet tall and 1,700 pounds in weight.

items.name: Stone Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a stone giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Stone Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A stone giant's blood is a thick, viscous liquid, a slightly darker color than the stone giant's skin. The blood must be harvested quickly as it hardens into stone when exposed to air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Stone Giant Molar
items.description: A stone giant's teeth are covered in an enamel that is harder than steel. Stonemasons and blacksmiths can use the tooth to wrap and mold metal, similar to an anvil. The molar can also be used by weaponsmiths to make strong warhammers.

Stone Giant Dreamwalker.name: Stone Giant Dreamwalker
Stone Giant Dreamwalker.description: The giant has gray skin and steel blue eyes. Its sparse clothing, a loincloth, is a similar color to the nearby rocks. The giant stands about 18 feet tall and 1,700 pounds in weight.

items.name: Stone Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a stone giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Stone Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A stone giant's blood is a thick, viscous liquid, a slightly darker color than the stone giant's skin. The blood must be harvested quickly as it hardens into stone when exposed to air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Stone Giant Molar
items.description: A stone giant's teeth are covered in an enamel that is harder than steel. Stonemasons and blacksmiths can use the tooth to wrap and mold metal, similar to an anvil. The molar can also be used by weaponsmiths to make strong warhammers.

Stone Golem.name: Stone Golem
Stone Golem.description: This constructs has a bipedal, humanoid shape, and looks to have been carved from a single pieces of stone. It stands about 9 feet tall, weighing probaby over 2000 pounds.

items.name: Stone Golem Core
items.description: In the middle of a stone golem's chest is a stone core. When the creature is destroyed, its body crumbles to the floor, and this core can get lost among the stone remains. The core contains traces of magic from the Elemental Plane of Earth. Artificers and those that study the elemental planes have an interest in this item.

items.name: Stone Golem Stone
items.description: When a stone golem crumbles to pieces, much of the stone is nothing but useless rock. However, it may be possible to find a stone that retains some trace amounts of arcane energy. One of these such stones may be used to craft certain weapons.

items.name: Stone Golem Manual Ashes (vial, small pouch)
items.description: The final step of creating a new golem is to sprinkle the ashes of the manual of golem creation over the inanimate body. Harvesting these ashes can be difficult, as they are tiny and hard to find. The ashes don't retain the power they had prior to the golem's creation, but still have value in the arcane community.

Storm Giant.name: Storm Giant
Storm Giant.description: The enormous giant has light green skin with dark green hair and eyes a small number has violet skin, dark blue hair, and silver eyes. He/she wears a fine tunic, belted sandals and a suit of fine scale mail.

items.name: Lock of Storm Giant Hair
items.description: Long strands of strong hair, often green in color with a metallic sheen. The hair appears to be a conductor of electricity. Highly valued among tailors, weavers and textile makers. Artificers and tinkers will pay double for the hair.

items.name: Storm Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a storm giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Storm Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A storm giant's blood is a thick, dark red liquid, that crackles with a soft electrical current (which is numbing to the touch). It has many useful properties, including being a conductor of electricity. The blood must be harvested quickly as it disperses when exposed to air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Storm Giant Sternum
items.description: A storm giant's sternum (the long flat bone located in the central part of the chest) has a natural metal filling, making it an ideal conductor of electricity. The storm giant uses the sternum to focus its innate magical abilities. Smiths can use the bone to make weapons. Tinkerers and artificers use the item for its electrical properties.

Storm Giant Quintessent.name: Storm Giant Quintessent
Storm Giant Quintessent.description: The enormous giant has light green skin with dark green hair and eyes a small number has violet skin, dark blue hair, and silver eyes. He/she wears a fine tunic, belted sandals and a suit of fine scale mail.

items.name: Lock of Storm Giant Hair
items.description: Long strands of strong hair, often green in color with a metallic sheen. The hair appears to be a conductor of electricity. Highly valued among tailors, weavers and textile makers. Artificers and tinkers will pay double for the hair.

items.name: Storm Giant Toenails
items.description: The hard toenails of a storm giant. In order to retain their usefulness, the nails must be pulled out slowly and removed whole. Alchemists and healers use the toenails to create various concoctions.

items.name: Storm Giant Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A storm giant's blood is a thick, dark red liquid, that crackles with a soft electrical current (which is numbing to the touch). It has many useful properties, including being a conductor of electricity. The blood must be harvested quickly as it disperses when exposed to air. The blood has many alchemical and medicinal uses.

items.name: Storm Giant Sternum
items.description: A storm giant's sternum (the long flat bone located in the central part of the chest) has a natural metal filling, making it an ideal conductor of electricity. The storm giant uses the sternum to focus its innate magical abilities. Smiths can use the bone to make weapons. Tinkerers and artificers use the item for its electrical properties.

Succubus/Incubus.name: Succubus/Incubus
Succubus/Incubus.description: A stunningly beautiful woman with a statuesque build and a perfect figure. She has flawless skin, raven-black hair hair color varies, and two small horns on her forehead. Her fingers end in sharp claws and she has a pair of large dark, bat-like wings mounted on her backs. A long devil-like tail whips back and forth behind her. Her eyes smolder with sinister desire. Note: An incubus is a male version of a succubus

items.name: Succubus/Incubus Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A succubus/incubus has red blood swimming with dopamine and phenylethylamine, intoxicating chemicals often associated with love. The blood is often used by alchemists to create potions that stimulate the emotions.

items.name: Succubus/Incubus Saliva
items.description: The kiss of a Succubus/Incubus is known to be deadly. Their saliva isn't poisonous, but provides a strong telepathic connection to the Succubus/Incubus and allows it to drain a creature's life essence. The saliva is valued by alchemists and anyone studying telepathy.

items.name: Succubus/Incubus Horn (x2)
items.description: A succubus/incubus has two bony protrusions atop its head that tend to by only an inch or two long. The horns are used to focus the creature's powers of enchantment. The horns can be ground into a powder to be used as an aphrodisiac.

Summer Eladrin.name: Summer Eladrin
Summer Eladrin.description: Eladrin are a subrace of elves who adopted the Feywild as their home. After centuries of exposure to Feywild magic, they acquired supernatural abilities and were effectively transformed into fey. Summer Eladrin have golden skin, with golden yellow hair. Their pointy ears are slightly longer than their Prime Material kin.

items.name: Summer Eladrin Hair
items.description: The hair of a summer eladrin is golden yellow, silky, and smells like peaches. The hair retains magic from the Feywild, and is often used is potions and elixirs. The hair can also be used as decorations and trinkets.

items.name: Eladrin Ear (x2)
items.description: Eladrin ears are similar to elven ears, but slightly longer. Most people considering killing an eladrin an evil act, and are suspicious of those selling such items. However, some evil communities, or those having trouble with Eladrin (such as lumbermills), may pay a bounty for such ears.

Swarm of Campestris.name: Swarm of Campestris
Swarm of Campestris.description: Campestri are mushroom-like creatures, that vary widely in color, from white to tan to dark brown, but always have red or purple caps with spots. They have a face on the stem of the mushroom stalk, featuring two black beady eyes and mouth that is usually smiling.

items.name: Campestri Mushrooms Caps (pouch)
items.description: Campestri mushroom caps are edible, but are extremely salty and unpleasant to most creatures, though bullywugs consider them a delicacy. The caps have medicinal benefits that healers can use.

Swarm of Cranium Rats.name: Swarm of Cranium Rats
Swarm of Cranium Rats.description: A swarm of rats, each with an enlarged and exposed brain.

items.name: Cranium Rat Brain (x10)
items.description: Small rodent brains, that pulse with a dim glow of psionic energy. Artificers and magic users are often interested in these little orbs.

items.name: Swarm Mentality
items.description: Once destroyed, the latent psionic energy of a cranium rat swarm swirls around their corpses. If quickly harvested, this energy can be saved for future use. Using an enchanted vial allows the energy to be absorbed. Requires an enchanted vial.Use: This item has [[/r 1d4]]+2 doses. Using an action, a creature can inhale a small amount of the energy from the vial. For the next hour, this creature can use their reaction to nullify the effects of any divination spell, or any spell that would attempt to either read the creatures thoughts or sense their emotions. Once their reaction is used for this purpose, the ability is lost until another dose is inhaled.

Swarm of Hoard Scarabs.name: Swarm of Hoard Scarabs
Swarm of Hoard Scarabs.description: Beetle-like creatures that blend in perfectly among piles of gold coins.

items.name: Hoard Scarab Dust (pouch)
items.description:
Hoard scarabs produce a sticky, glittering metallic dust from their wings. The sticky glitter is difficult to collect, but a swarm of hoard scarabs may have enough dust to fill a pouch. The dust has arcane properties and is valued by alchemists, often aiding in the creation of potions and elixirs involving light and tracking.

Use: A pouch of this dust may be thrown up to 20 feet and the pouch explodes upon impact. Any creature within 10 feet of impact must roll a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be outlined in blue light for 10 minutes. While outlined in this way, a creature sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from being invisible.

Swarm of Poisonous Snakes.name: Swarm of Poisonous Snakes
Swarm of Poisonous Snakes.description: A swarm of reptilians with long, thin bodies but no legs. That have large mouths with sharp fangs and slithering tongues that lash about. Each creature is several feet long.

items.name: Poisonous Snake Skins ([[/r 1d8]])
items.description: A snake's skin can be used in the creation of boots, belts and other apparel. A single regular size snake only has enough harvestable skin to create a single belt.

items.name: Poisonous Snake Venom ([[/r 1d8]] vials)
items.description:
A skilled harvester can extract the venom from poisonous snakes. The poison is a clear fluid with a yellow tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 3 hours and 50gp worth of material to create Scorpion Poison (DC 10 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Snake Poison (Poison, Basic see PHB p153) (Injury): A creature can spend an action using a vial of this poison to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take [[/r 1d4]] poison damage.
