Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying. This poison usually sells for 100gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Sword Wraith Commander.name: Sword Wraith Commander
Sword Wraith Commander.description: The creature is an incorporeal form and appears as a swirling dark mist of negative energy, with the vague spectral form of a glory-obsessed warrior.

items.name: Wraith Dust
items.description: When a sword wraith is killed, its form disperses into a fine mist, often scattering tiny motes of dust. The dust is difficult to see, but resonates with dark necrotic energy. Spellcasters, especially necromancers, can use the dust in spells and rituals. The dust is also a useful alchemical ingredient.

Sword Wraith Warrior.name: Sword Wraith Warrior
Sword Wraith Warrior.description: The creature is an incorporeal form and appears as a swirling dark mist of negative energy, with the vague spectral form of a glory-obsessed warrior.

items.name: Wraith Dust
items.description: When a sword wraith is killed, its form disperses into a fine mist, often scattering tiny motes of dust. The dust is difficult to see, but resonates with dark necrotic energy. Spellcasters, especially necromancers, can use the dust in spells and rituals. The dust is also a useful alchemical ingredient.

Tanarukk.name: Tanarukk
Tanarukk.description: Tanarukks are created using a dark abyssal ritual, typical among orchish cults of Gruumsh and those that worship Baphomet. Tanarukks vaguely resemble the humanoid it was before being corrupted by the demonic influence, but grows is size and strength. It spouts two large horns on the side of its head and becomes extremely aggressive.

items.name: Tanarukk Blood (vial)
items.description:
The blood of this creature is a dark, viscous ichor swimming with abyssal magic. Alchemists, summoners and demonologists have uses for this blood.

Use: A creature may use an action to drink a vial of this blood. For the next minute, the creature deals an extra [[/r 1d10]] damage when it hits with a melee attack. This ability does not work for elves and half-elves.

items.name: Tanarukk Horn (x2)
items.description: A Tanarukk's horn is a long, sharp bone on the creature's skull. The horn is a beacon for abyssal energy, and retains some of the creature's power after death. Weaponsmiths can carve the bone into various weapons.

Tarrasque.name: Tarrasque
Tarrasque.description: An enormous abomination, roughly the size of an ancient dragon. It has two long horns extending from its forehead on a reptile-like face with two dark eyes and a toothy maw. It has a thick carapace covered in spikes, extending down to a mighty tail. It walks on two hinds legs, and has two arms ending in sharp, fearsome claws.

Thorny Vegepygmy.name: Thorny Vegepygmy
Thorny Vegepygmy.description: The plant-like creature stands around 3 feet tall average: 2​ to ​4.5 feet with a muscular frame covered in a soft wrinkled skin, similar to the texture of a mushroom. It has a moldy gray-green color although, coloration varies on its environment with thorn-like protrusions covering its body. Its eyes are milky white, lidless, and do not appear to have pupils. It has heavy wrinkles and lacks a nose. Lengthy lines of tendrils, similar to hair, covers the creature. These tendrils are constantly waving and flowing regardless of the presence of wind. Its hands end in thorn-like claws.

items.name: Vegepygmy Skin (pouch)
items.description: The skin of a vegepygmy varies in color, but looks like a soft, furry patch of mold. The skin has little use to leatherworkers, but healers, alchemists, and medicinal experts value the skin for its regenerative properties.

items.name: Vegepygmy Thorns (pouch)
items.description: Some vegepygmy are covered in sharp, hard thorny protrusions. These thorns can be broken off and used by alchemists in cultivation potions. Gardeners and botanists can use the thorns to make a rich fertilizer.

Thri-Kreen.name: Thri-Kreen
Thri-Kreen.description: The creature resembles a giant praying mantis, bipedal and standing around 6 feet tall. An exoskeletons covers its entire body. It has six limbs protruding from its thorax: two for walking and four it uses as arms, ending in four-fingered claw-like hands. Its insectoid head has two black, multi-faceted compound eyes; two small antennae sprouting from the top; and a complex jaw structure with large sharp mandibles.

items.name: Thri-kreen Carapace
items.description: A Thri-kreen has a hard chitinous shell. The shell has a thin translucent coating, which allows the creature to change its color slightly. Armorers often use the carapace to craft armor and shields.

items.name: Thri-kreen Venom (1 vial)
items.description:
A thri-kreens's mandibles contain a simple venom that is capable of paralyzing its victims. The venom is a clear fluid with a yellow tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests 1 vial of venom that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Thri-kreen Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Thri-kreen Poison (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Thri-kreen Poison (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Thri-kreen Pineal Gland
items.description: Some thri-kreens are known to be strong with psionic magic. The pineal gland is a pea-shaped, spongy ball of flesh, located at the center of the creature's brain, that helps focus the creature's psionic power. The gland has some healing properties, but also has value among psionic researchers.

Thri-Kreen Gladiator.name: Thri-Kreen Gladiator
Thri-Kreen Gladiator.description: The creature resembles a giant praying mantis, bipedal and standing around 6 feet tall. An exoskeletons covers its entire body. It has six limbs protruding from its thorax: two for walking and four it uses as arms, ending in four-fingered claw-like hands. Its insectoid head has two black, multi-faceted compound eyes; two small antennae sprouting from the top; and a complex jaw structure with large sharp mandibles.

items.name: Thri-kreen Carapace

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Thri-kreen Poison (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.description: Some thri-kreens are known to be strong with psionic magic. The pineal gland is a pea-shaped, spongy ball of flesh, located at the center of the creature's brain, that helps focus the creature's psionic power. The gland has some healing properties, but also has value among psionic researchers.

Thri-Kreen Hunter.name: Thri-Kreen Hunter
Thri-Kreen Hunter.description: The creature resembles a giant praying mantis, bipedal and standing around 6 feet tall. An exoskeletons covers its entire body. It has six limbs protruding from its thorax: two for walking and four it uses as arms, ending in four-fingered claw-like hands. Its insectoid head has two black, multi-faceted compound eyes; two small antennae sprouting from the top; and a complex jaw structure with large sharp mandibles.

items.name: Thri-kreen Carapace
items.description: A Thri-kreen has a hard chitinous shell. The shell has a thin translucent coating, which allows the creature to change its color slightly. Armorers often use the carapace to craft armor and shields.

items.name: Thri-kreen Venom (1 vial)
items.description:
A thri-kreens's mandibles contain a simple venom that is capable of paralyzing its victims. The venom is a clear fluid with a yellow tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests 1 vial of venom that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Thri-kreen Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Thri-kreen Poison (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Thri-kreen Poison (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Thri-kreen Pineal Gland
items.description: Some thri-kreens are known to be strong with psionic magic. The pineal gland is a pea-shaped, spongy ball of flesh, located at the center of the creature's brain, that helps focus the creature's psionic power. The gland has some healing properties, but also has value among psionic researchers.

Thri-Kreen Mystic.name: Thri-Kreen Mystic
Thri-Kreen Mystic.description: The creature resembles a giant praying mantis, bipedal and standing around 6 feet tall. An exoskeletons covers its entire body. It has six limbs protruding from its thorax: two for walking and four it uses as arms, ending in four-fingered claw-like hands. Its insectoid head has two black, multi-faceted compound eyes; two small antennae sprouting from the top; and a complex jaw structure with large sharp mandibles.

items.name: Thri-kreen Carapace
items.description: A Thri-kreen has a hard chitinous shell. The shell has a thin translucent coating, which allows the creature to change its color slightly. Armorers often use the carapace to craft armor and shields.

items.name: Thri-kreen Venom (1 vial)
items.description:
A thri-kreens's mandibles contain a simple venom that is capable of paralyzing its victims. The venom is a clear fluid with a yellow tint.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests 1 vial of venom that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Thri-kreen Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any venom. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Thri-kreen Poison (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Thri-kreen Poison (Injury): A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Thri-kreen Pineal Gland
items.description: Some thri-kreens are known to be strong with psionic magic. The pineal gland is a pea-shaped, spongy ball of flesh, located at the center of the creature's brain, that helps focus the creature's psionic power. The gland has some healing properties, but also has value among psionic researchers.

Tiger.name: Tiger
Tiger.description: The tiger has a muscular body with powerful forelimbs, a large head and a tail that is about half the length of its body. Its fur is dense and heavy, and a shade of orange-brown with white ventral areas with distinctive vertical black stripes.

items.name: Tiger's Hide
items.description: The tiger's hide varies from shades of orange and brown with white ventral areas and distinctive vertical black stripes. It is often used to make rugs and apparel.

Titivilus.name: Titivilus
Titivilus.description: Titivilus resembles a 5.5‑foot-tall humanoid with pale skin, bat-like wings, a bald head and two small devil horns protruding from his forehead. He's legs end in hooves and resemble those of a goat, similiar to a satyr. Titivilus is inferior in physical strength compared to other archdevils, but compensates for it with his cunning and is a shrewd politician.

items.name: Titivilus' Hooves (x2)
items.description: Titivilus' two legs end in hard gray hooves. These hooves contain a collagen that is used to make a strong adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be made into tools, bowls and other items.

items.name: Titivilus' Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Titivilus' blood is a dark red fluid with a strong metallic smell. Fiend blood has many uses to alchemists and conjurers. It is believed that Titivilus' blood can be used to create strong charm potions.

items.name: Titivilus' Horn (x2)
items.description: Titivilus has two small, iron-pointed devil horns on his forehead. The horns are difficult to remove without cracking. Once removed the horns can be used to craft jewelry and decorations, and can be shaved down and used as an ingredient in potions.

items.name: Titivilus' Tongue
items.description: Titivilus has a red, spongy tongue. It is rumored, falsely, that the tongue was made of silver because of Titivilus' persuasive ways. Despite his small stature, the archdevil was able to maneuver himself into a strong position in Hell. The tongue can be used to craft a powerful neck collar, allowing its wearing to charm and twist words.

Tlincalli.name: Tlincalli
Tlincalli.description: The creature has the upper body of a human and the lower body of a six-legged giant scorpion complete with a stinger at the end of a long tail. The creature is completely hairless, and wearing plates of salvaged armor. Its hands have two large fingers and a thumb.

items.name: Tlincalli Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A tlincalli has dark red blood with a greenish sheen. The blood is useful to healers, especially in desert communities. Other alchemists and spellcasters may be able to use the blood as well.

items.name: Tlincalli Chitin
items.description: The exoskeleton of a tlincalli is made of hard, durable chitinous plates. If harvesting fails, the harvester is just unable to pry the plates loose from the creature's large carcass. Armorers can use the plates to make useful pieces of armor.

items.name: Tlincalli Stinger
items.description:
The scorpion-like tail of a Tlincalli has a large stinger that contains a strong paralytic poison.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit can be used to harvest the stinger. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any stinger. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the stinger is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 250gp worth of material to create Tlincalli Poison (DC 15 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Tlincalli Poison: A creature can spend an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until it successfully affects a target. A creature hit with a weapon coated with this poison takes [[/r 4d6]] poison damage and must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If it fails the saving throw by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This poison usually sells for 500gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Toad, Giant.name: Toad, Giant
Toad, Giant.description: A giant, squat, rough-skinned frog, about 5 feet long. It has dry skin, warts and crests behind its eyes.

items.name: Giant Toad Slime (vial)
items.description: A giant toad's skin is covered by a thin layer of clear, viscous slime. The slime has a variety of medicinal properties. The slime on some toads can cause hallucinations.

items.name: Giant Toad Stomach Acid (vial)
items.description:
The stomach acid of a giant toad is highly corrosive, allowing the creature to digest large amounts of flesh in a short amount of time. The acid is useful to many craftsmen and alchemists. Failing the harvesting check by 5 or more results in the harvester getting burned by the acid, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) acid damage.

Use: A giant toad's stomach acid is the equivalent of a vial of acid (PHB). As an action, a creature can splash the contents of this vial onto a target within 5 feet or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, the creature makes a ranged attack against a target or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes [[/r 2d6]] acid damage.

Tortle.name: Tortle
Tortle.description: Tortles are omnivorous, turtle-like bipeds with shells that cover most of their body.

items.name: Tortle Shell
items.description: A tortle has a rock-like shell, covering most of the creature's body. This shell can be used to craft pieces of armor and protective equipment.

items.name: Tortle Fat (flask)
items.description: The fat of a tortle can be used to make a fine wax. The wax is used to make long-lasting candle and is sometimes used to temporarily fill gaps (and stop leaks).

Tortle Druid.name: Tortle Druid
Tortle Druid.description: Tortles are omnivorous, turtle-like bipeds with shells that cover most of their body.

items.name: Tortle Shell
items.description: A tortle has a rock-like shell, covering most of the creature's body. This shell can be used to craft pieces of armor and protective equipment.

items.name: Tortle Fat (flask)
items.description: The fat of a tortle can be used to make a fine wax. The wax is used to make long-lasting candle and is sometimes used to temporarily fill gaps (and stop leaks).

Trapper.name: Trapper
Trapper.description: A flat, manta-like creature with that skin that has a density and texture like stone.

items.name: Trapper Hide
items.description: A trapper has a thick hide covered in a thin mucus. The hide's color and texture is constantly shifting, but always close to the object it is resting on. The hide is difficult to harvest, as the skin seems to shift and move under a blade. It is valued by leatherworks and artificers.

Treant.name: Treant
Treant.description: A large, ancient tree, with face-like features on its bark. It has long branches that serve as arms and a division between its trunk that forms legs.

items.name: Treant Sap (3 vials)
items.description: A treant's sap is an extremely thick, highly viscous, reddish brown fluid filled with nutrients and minerals. The sap is edible, but farmers often use the sap to create rich fertilizer.

items.name: Treant Bark
items.description: The treant's bark is the hard, outer covering of its trunk and branches. The bark can be removed in large plates, which can then be crafted into wooden armor.

items.name: Treant Heart
items.description: Somewhere inside a treant's thick trunk is a mass of tangled roots, that bleed a thick reddish sap. This roundish ball of roots act as the creature's heart, and is prized by spellcasters and artificers.

Triceratops.name: Triceratops
Triceratops.description: The creature has a large plate with three horns on the skull, and a large four-legged body resembling that of a rhinoceros. The creature is 30 feet long and weighs about 12 tons.

items.name: Triceratops Skin
items.description: The skin of a Triceratops is a highly durable reptilian hide, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, tents and more.

items.name: Triceratops Skull
items.description: The large, armored skull of the Triceratops has three long piercing horns. The skull is a prized trophy, but can be fashioned into a shield by a skilled armorer.

Tridrone.name: Tridrone
Tridrone.description: A mechanical construct shaped like an upside-down tetrahedrons. Each of it's three vertical faces has a single eye, mouth, arm and two legs.

Troglodyte.name: Troglodyte
Troglodyte.description: The humanoid creature has a lizard-like head, with black beady eyes and rough, leathery scales covering its grayish brown skin. It has spindly but muscular arms, squat legs, and a long slender tail. It has long sharp claws and fangs, and pointy bone-like ridges running down its back.

items.name: Troglodyte Claws (pouch)
items.description: A troglodyte has long, sharp claws on their enormous hands, each several inches long. The claws can be used to make small weapons and tools.

Troll.name: Troll
Troll.description: A 9-foot tall humanoid, with a thin body and a mossy green, rubbery hide. It has long hanging arms that end in massive claws. Although it walks upright, it has a severe hunch, which causes the back of its hands to drag on the ground. Its head has a messy, black mess of oily hair, big pointy ears, a long bulbous nose, and a mouth full of sharp teeth.

items.name: Troll Skin Strips (pouch)
items.description: A troll's skin is often green and covered in warts, pustules and mold. Despite its appearance, the skin has amazing healing properties. Samples of the vile flesh can be harvested and sold to healers.

items.name: Troll Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Trolls have amazing regenerative properties. A troll's blood clots, scabs and heals the surrounding tissue extremely quickly. The blood is a common ingredient in many healing potions.

items.name: Troll Heart
items.description: A troll's heart is a large mass of red flesh that pumps the creature's regenerative blood throughout its body. The heart is used in arcane healing rituals and enchantments.

Twig Blight.name: Twig Blight
Twig Blight.description: A humanoid mass of plant matter, complete with limbs and a head.

items.name: Blight Seeds (x5)
items.description: These hard, dry, wrinkled seeds, about the size of a walnut, can often be found on dead blights. Once a seed is unnaturally plucked from a blight's body, the seed become sterile. Alchemists often use the seeds to create oils and potions. Some farmers can repurpose the seeds as a unique fertilizer.

items.name: Gulthias Sap (vial)
items.description: A dark red, thick and sticky sap can sometimes be found on a blight's body.

Tyrannosaurus Rex.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
Tyrannosaurus Rex.description: The creature is a giant, bipedal dinosaur about 40 feet long and 17 feet high.  It walks on its two hind legs, two little arms, has a long tail and a big head with sharp teeth. Tyrannosaurus rex comes from the Greek words tyranno ("tyrant") and saurus ("lizard") and the Latin word rex ("king")

items.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex Skin
items.description: The skin of a tyrannosaurus rex is a highly durable reptilian hide, making it desirable for heavy-duty items such as footwear and belts. It is also used in the production of other apparel, bags, upholstery, furniture, tents and more.

items.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex Teeth (x4)
items.description: The tyrannosaurus rex has serrated conical teeth. The largest can be as long as a foot. The teeth can be used to make small crafts and tools. Weaponsmiths can use the teeth to make sharp serrated dagger.

Ulitharid.name: Ulitharid
Ulitharid.description: The creature looks like a mind flayer, except its large, octopus-like head has six extremely long tentacles snaking from down from where it's nose should be. It has greenish-purple skin that excretes a thin film of slimy, glistening mucus and gives off a faint onion and garlic odor. It wears a long robe, and has thin, lengthy fingers ending in sharp talons.

items.name: Mind Flayer Mucus
items.description: The moist, rubbery mauve skin of a mind flayer is coated with a thin glaze of mucus that smells of formaldahyde. The mucus is valued by alchemists. Spellcasters value the mucus for its ability to enhance psionic powers.

items.name: Ulitharid Tentacle (x6)
items.description: An illithid's tentacles are writhing with psionic energy. Each tentacle is a long strand of moist purple flesh, oozing with a sticky, clear mucus. The tentacle's fluids are useful to alchemists, and artificers may be able to find a use for the tentacles themselves.

items.name: Mind Flayer Membrane
items.description: Many of the illithid's organs are wrapped in a thin, semi-translucent membrane. It can rip easily if removed incorrectly or too quickly. The membrane is believed to insulate the creature's internal organs, allowing psionic energy to flow around the area. The membrane is valued as a psionic conduit.

items.name: Ulitharid Brain
items.description: An illithid's brain is larger than a human brain, and contains many more ridges. The large pinkish organ secretes a translucent foggy yellow fluid, several days after death. The brain of an illithid are prized by the arcane community, and the fluid is highly valued by alchemists, healers and witches.

Ultraloth.name: Ultraloth
Ultraloth.description: A slender, gray-skinned humanoid with an elongated head. Its skin is smooth and hairless. Its face bears no features except for two ovoid eyes.

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Ultroloth Skin
items.description: The skin of an ultroloth is gray, smooth and hairless. The skin has little use as leather, but has many alchemical properties that an alchemist may be able to use. Harvesting doesn't require skinning the entire creature, but involved skinning a few of the larger areas.

items.name: Ultroloth Eye (x2)
items.description: An ultroloth has two large ovoid eyes, often yellow in color, with no iris or pupils. An ultroloth can make the eyes become sparkling pools of light that can transfix other creatures and leave them reeling and helpless. Artificers value the eyes for their arcane power.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Umber Hulk.name: Umber Hulk
Umber Hulk.description: The creature looks like a cross between a gorilla and a beetle, with a stout and highly muscular physique, standing just under 8 feet tall. The most prominent feature is the huge pair of mandibles, each roughly a foot long, flanking a mouth filled with many rows of sharp triangular teeth. The creature has two sets of evenly spaced eyes: compound eyes that sit on the sides of its head, and forehead eyes that are small and apelike.

items.name: Umber Hulk Blood (3 vials)
items.description: An umber hulk's blood flows like a thick, reddish mud. The blood is rich in minerals, which can be separated using various alchemical processes.

items.name: Umber Hulk Mandible (x2)
items.description: An umber hulk's mandibles are sharp, curved blades of hard chitin, several feet long. The blades can be fashioned into various tools and weapons.

items.name: Umber Hulk Carapace
items.description: An umber hulk's exoskeleton is made of extremely durable chitin, hard enough to withstand a great deal of pressure. This carapace keeps the umber hulk safe from being crushed under tons of rock. An expert armorsmith can use the chitin plates to create various pieces of armor.

items.name: Umber Hulk Eye (x4)
items.description: An umber hulk has 4 eyes. Together, the 4 eyes have a confusing gaze effect, which a spellcaster may be able to harness.

Unicorn.name: Unicorn
Unicorn.description: A majestic horse with a beautiful white coat, a lush mane of hair, and a flowing tail. Most distinguishable is the long ivory-colored spiraling horn protuding out from its forehead. One might also notice its white ivory hooves.

items.name: Unicorn Blood (5 vials)
items.description: A unicorn has silver blood with a rainbow sheen. The blood is used in numerous healing potions, salves and ointments.

items.name: Unicorn Hoof (x4)
items.description: A unicorn's hooves contains a collagen that is used to make a sticky adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Unicorn Hide
items.description: The pure white hide of a unicorn is soft to the touch, yet strong and durable. The hide is highly valued by leatherworkers and tailors.

items.name: Unicorn Horn
items.description: A unicorn has a long white horn that protrudes from it's forehead and spirals upward. The horn is highly valued in the arcane community, and the prime material for many wands.

Vampirate.name: Vampirate
Vampirate.description: Gaunt undead humanoid figures with milky-white eyes and skin as dry as parchment. They have fangs like vampires.

items.name: Vampirate Ash (pouch)
items.description: When a vampirate is reduced to 0 hit points, they explode in a cloud of ash. This ash can be collected. The ash has life-draining properties and can be used by alchemists and spellcasters. The ash may also be used in some dark rituals.

Vampirate Captain.name: Vampirate Captain
Vampirate Captain.description: Gaunt undead humanoid figures with milky-white eyes and skin as dry as parchment. They have fangs like vampires.

items.name: Vampirate Ash (pouch)
items.description: When a vampirate is reduced to 0 hit points, they explode in a cloud of ash. This ash can be collected. The ash has life-draining properties and can be used by alchemists and spellcasters. The ash may also be used in some dark rituals.

Vampirate Mage.name: Vampirate Mage
Vampirate Mage.description: Gaunt undead humanoid figures with milky-white eyes and skin as dry as parchment. They have fangs like vampires.

items.name: Vampirate Ash (pouch)
items.description: When a vampirate is reduced to 0 hit points, they explode in a cloud of ash. This ash can be collected. The ash has life-draining properties and can be used by alchemists and spellcasters. The ash may also be used in some dark rituals.

Vampire.name: Vampire
Vampire.description: A human figure any humanoid race: human, elf, dwarf, half-orc, etc. with pale skin and red eyes. It has hardened, feral features giving him/her a predatory aspect. The fingers end in sharp dark claws.

items.name: Vampire Dust (pouch)
items.description: Vampire dust is all that remains when a vampire dies in direct sunlight. This dust is highly valued among necromancers and alchemists.

items.name: Vampire Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Vampire blood is a thick, pure black liquid. The blood is swimming with cursed necrotic energy. The blood is valued by necromancers, and some alchemists claim it can be used to cure vampirism.

items.name: Vampire Hair (pouch)
items.description: The long strands of a vampire's hair are thin wisps of necrotic energy. The hair has uses in arcane rituals and potions.

items.name: Vampire Fang (x2)
items.description: A vampire has a prominent pair of long fangs protruding down from its upper jaw. The sharp teeth resonate with dark necrotic energy and can be used to power great objects of power.

items.name: Vampire Heart
items.description: The dark heart of a vampire is a black hole of necrotic power, slowly draining the life essence from everything around it. Harvesting requires extracting the heart and then performing a ritual to temporarily contain the heart's power. Spellcaster can use the heart to fuel powerful rituals and create magic items.

Vampire Spawn.name: Vampire Spawn
Vampire Spawn.description: A human figure any humanoid race: human, elf, dwarf, half-orc, etc. with extremely pale skin and a mouth full of sharp teeth, and two prominent fangs. It has a hardened, feral feature and look ravenously hungry. The fingers end in sharp dark claws.

items.name: Vampire Spawn Fang (x2)
items.description: A vampire spawn has a prominent pair of long fangs protruding down from its upper jaw. The sharp teeth are infused with dark necrotic energy, which can be harnessed by an adept spellcaster.

items.name: Vampire Spawn Heart
items.description: The dark gray heart of a vampire spawn is dry and desiccated, and looks like it will crumble to dust. However, the heart has an aura of necrotic energy. The heat can be used in dark rituals, or the energy can be released and used for other purposes.

Vampiric Mist.name: Vampiric Mist
Vampiric Mist.description: Often found in billowing clouds of fog, vampiric mist is indistinguishable from mist they lurk within.

items.name: Vampiric Mist Blood (flask)
items.description: A vampiric mist is a billowing cloud filled with watery droplets of blood. When the creature is slain, the mist disperses, and the blood of its victims falls to the ground. The mist's blood is extremely watery, spreads quickly, and is difficult to collect. The blood has life draining properties, and is filled with chaotic necrotic power.

Vargouille.name: Vargouille
Vargouille.description: The creature resembles a grotesquely deformed human-like head with two leathery, bat-like wings in place of ears. It has a wingspan under ​4 feet. Flailing tendrils crown and fringe its head, and an unnerving green glow could be seen in its eyes. It has a wicked sneer, with jagged teeth laid inside its distended, shrieking maw.

items.name: Vargouille Saliva (vial)
items.description:
A vargouille's saliva is a clear, viscous fluid that contains a toxic venom.

Refining the Poison: Once the saliva is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hours and 150gp worth of material to create Varg's Kiss (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Varg's Kiss (Contact):  A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ([[/r 3d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 300gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Vegepygmy.name: Vegepygmy
Vegepygmy.description: The plant-like creature stands around 3 feet tall average: 2​ to ​4.5 feet with a muscular frame covered in a soft wrinkled skin, similar to the texture of a mushroom. It has a moldy gray-green color although, coloration varies on its environment. Its eyes are milky white, lidless, and do not appear to have pupils. It has heavy wrinkles and lacks a nose. Lengthy lines of tendrils, similar to hair, covers the creature. These tendrils are constantly waving and flowing regardless of the presence of wind. Its hands end in thorn-like claws.

items.name: Vegepygmy Skin (pouch)
items.description: The skin of a vegepygmy varies in color, but looks like a soft, furry patch of mold. The skin has little use to leatherworkers, but healers, alchemists, and medicinal experts value the skin for its regenerative properties.

Vegepygmy Chief.name: Vegepygmy Chief
Vegepygmy Chief.description: The plant-like creature stands around 3 feet tall average: 2​ to ​4.5 feet with a muscular frame covered in a soft wrinkled skin, similar to the texture of a mushroom. It has a moldy gray-green color although, coloration varies on its environment, milky white eyes with no pupils and lacks a nose. Lengthy lines of tendrils, similar to hair, covers the creature's body. These tendrils are constantly waving and flowing regardless of the presence of wind. Its hands end in thorn-like claws. On it's back are round like orifices that occasionally spew little puffs of dust.

items.name: Vegepygmy Skin (pouch)
items.description: The skin of a vegepygmy varies in color, but looks like a soft, furry patch of mold. The skin has little use to leatherworkers, but healers, alchemists, and medicinal experts value the skin for its regenerative properties.

items.name: Vegepygmy Russet Mold Spores (pouch)
items.description:
A vegepygmy chief's back contains round-like orifices that spew out spores when it is alive. The spores are miniscule reddish-brown balls that grow russet mold. The spores are dangerous, and difficult to harvest (see below), but are valued by expert botanists and alchemists.

Harvesting Note: If the harvester fails the DC check by 5 or more, they must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the creature takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage at the start of each of its turns, sprouting mold as it takes damage. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any magic that neutralizes poison or cures disease kills the infestation. A creature reduced to O hit points by the mold's poison damage dies. If the dead creature is a beast, a giant, or a humanoid, one or more newborn vegepygmies emerge from its body 24 hours later: one newborn from a Small corpse; two from a Medium corpse, four from a Large corpse; eight from a Huge corpse, or sixteen from a Gargantuan corpse.

Velociraptor.name: Velociraptor
Velociraptor.description: The small reptile is about 6 feet long from head to tail, but only stands about 3 feet high. It is a bipedal reptile with a long tail, long back legs with sharp claws for ripping flesh, two small forearms, and a mouth full of sharp teeth.

items.name: Velociraptor Pheromones (vial)
items.description:
The velociraptor uses its pheromones to communicate with the rest of their pack. Other beasts have a strong reaction to these pheromones. Druids, healers and alchemists may find the pheromones useful.
Use: While you have this vial of pheromones open, you have advantage on any Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks made to convince an animal that is friendly to you, and within 5 feet, to attack another creature. Beasts that are not friendly to you, and within 30 feet, will move attack you on their turn. The vials effect stops working after 3 uses.

Venom Troll.name: Venom Troll
Venom Troll.description: A 9-foot tall humanoid, with a thin body and a mossy green, rubbery hide that drips with a green poisonous liquid. It has long hanging arms that end in massive claws. Although it walks upright, it has a severe hunch, which causes the back of its hands to drag on the ground. Its head has a messy, black mess of oily hair, big pointy ears, a long bulbous nose, and a mouth full of sharp teeth dripping with a green fluid.

items.name: Venom Troll Skin Strips (pouch)
items.description: A venom troll's skin is often covered in warts, pustules, mold and moist with poison. The skins regenerative properties are valued by healers, while the venom is often used by alchemists and poisoners.

items.name: Venom Troll Blood (5 vials)
items.description:
The blood of a venom troll contains a vile poison. The blood is a watery green fluid.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this venom. On a successful check, the character harvests enough venom for a single vial. On a failed check, the character is unable to extract any poison. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 12 hour and 100gp worth of material to create Troll Vemon (DC 12 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Troll Venom (Injury): A creature can use a vial of this poison to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Troll Heart
items.description: A troll's heart is a large mass of red flesh that pumps the creature's regenerative blood throughout its body. The heart is used in arcane healing rituals and enchantments.

Vine Blight.name: Vine Blight
Vine Blight.description: A vaguely humanoid-shaped mass of braided vines

items.name: Vines (small bundle)
items.description: Sturdier and more flexible than regular vines. These vines can be stripped down to their fibers to make 10' of rope (DC 14 Survival check).

items.name: Blight Pollen (small pouch)
items.description: Vine blight's use their pollen to communicate with other blights and plants. As such, alchemists and druids often use the pollen for potions that aid in talking to plants.

items.name: Blight Seeds (x5)
items.description: These hard, dry, wrinkled seeds, about the size of a walnut, can often be found on dead blights. Once a seed is unnaturally plucked from a blight's body, the seed become sterile. Alchemists often use the seeds to create oils and potions. Some farmers can repurpose the seeds as a unique fertilizer.

items.name: Gulthias Sap (vial)
items.description: A dark red, thick and sticky sap can sometimes be found on a blight's body.

Violet Fungus.name: Violet Fungus
Violet Fungus.description: A purplish mushroom with root-like feelers growing across the cavern floors. The four stalks protrude from a mushrooms central mass.

items.name: Violet Fungus Cap
items.description: The purple cap of a violet fungus is prized by both alchemists and poisoners.

Void Scavver.name: Void Scavver
Void Scavver.description: A shark-like scavengers, with a single large eye on the leading edge of its head. The eye glows while the creature is awake. Its mouth is full of razor sharp teeth. Brown scavvers are 10 feet long and range in color from sun-dappled brownish gold to dark amber. Void scavvers are 20 feet long with pitch black skin.

items.name: Void Scavver Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A void scavver's teeth are extremely sharp, triangular pieces of dentin covered in a hard coating of enamel. The teeth are used in jewelry and decoration, but can also be used to make serrate blades and saws.

items.name: Void Scavver Skin
items.description: A void scavver's skin is covered in small, rough, hard scales. Leatherworkers dry and treat the leather, then grind down the scales to make the leather smoother and easier to handle, giving it a pebbled appearance.

Vrock.name: Vrock
Vrock.description: The creature stands over 8 feet tall and weighs over 500 pounds. It is a cross between a vulture and a human. It has a long neck, a vultures head, and a twisted body with long sinuous limbs. Much of it's body, especially their broad wings, is coated with small gray feathers. Its arms end in three long, razor sharp talons.

items.name: Vrock Feathers (small bundle)
items.description: The dark gray feathers of a vrock can be used as decorations and in apparel. Fletches also use the feathers to make arrows.

items.name: Vrock Talon (x2)
items.description: A vrock's talons are razor sharp and about a foot long. Weaponsmiths may find the talons useful.

items.name: Vrock Vocal Cords
items.description: Vrocks have the ability to emit a powerful screech that is capable of stunning their enemies. Skilled artificers and magic users may be able to use the vocal cords in their crafting.

items.name: Vrock Spores (vial)
items.description:
A vrock has the ability to release a cloud of toxic spores. These spores can be harvested quickly after a vrock's death.

Use: The spores can be used to coat up to 5 pieces of ammunition or one slashing/piercing weapon. Applying the spores takes 1 action. The coated item is considered magical and any creature successfully hit by this weapon must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a target takes [[/r 1d10]] poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Emptying a vial of holy water on the target also ends the effect.

Vulture.name: Vulture
Vulture.description: This large bird has a hunched, greasy, dark blue feathered body with a long bare neck and a pink bald head. It has a beak ending in a curved tip, two round eyes and feet with sharp talons. Two large wings extend from its back. The bird is under 3 feet long, with an 8-foot wingspan.

items.name: Vulture Feathers (pouch)
items.description: Vulture feathers are dark decorative plumage, that help the bird soar through the sky. The feathers are used in decorations, dusters, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

items.name: Vulture Stomach Acid (vial)
items.description: A vulture's stomach acid is so exceptionally corrosive, that it can safely digest putrid carcasses infected with diseases and bacteria that would be lethal to other scavengers. To harvest the item successfully, the stomach must be cut open without flooding it with blood. The stomach acid is useful to alchemist.

Vulture, Giant.name: Vulture, Giant
Vulture, Giant.description: This giant bird has a hunched, greasy, dark blue feathered body with a long bare neck and a pink bald head. It has a beak ending in a curved tip, two round eyes and feet with sharp talons. Two large wings extend from its back. The bird is under 7 feet long, with an 18-foot wingspan.

items.name: Giant Vulture Feathers (large pouch)
items.description: Vulture feathers are dark decorative plumage, that help the bird soar through the sky. The feathers are used in decorations, dusters, apparel and creating arrows and bolts.

items.name: Giant Vulture Talons (pouch)
items.description: A giant vulture's talons are sharp and curved, used for grasping and clawing at prey. They are several inches long. Most are used in jewelry and decorations. The longer talons can make hooked daggers.

items.name: Vulture Stomach Acid (3 vials)
items.description: A vulture's stomach acid is so exceptionally corrosive, that it can safely digest putrid carcasses infected with diseases and bacteria that would be lethal to other scavengers. To harvest the item successfully, the stomach must be cut open without flooding it with blood. The stomach acid is useful to alchemist.

Warhorse.name: Warhorse
Warhorse.description: A horse is a large hoofed, four-legged mammal with short hair, long slender legs, muscular and deep torso build, a long tail, long thick necks, and large elongated heads.

items.name: Horse Hoof (x4)
items.description: A horse's hooves contains a collagen that is used to make a sticky adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

items.name: Horse Hide
items.description: A horse's hide is known for its durability and resistance to moisture absorption.  The hide is primarily used to make harnesses, bags, shoes and rugs.

items.name: Horse Mane/Tail
items.description: Long, thick, strong strands of hair. Craftsmen often use the hair to make wigs, painting brushes, and fishing line. Weavers can also create coarse fabrics and apparel.

Warhorse Skeleton.name: Warhorse Skeleton
Warhorse Skeleton.description: An undead animated corpse of a warhorse, completely devoid of any flesh. Its loose bones and joints are held together by some unseen necromatic energy.

items.name: Bone Dust (pouch)
items.description: When destroyed, the bones of a skeleton collapse to the ground. Shifting through the remains, it may be possible to find bone dust coated with dark necrotic energy. The dust is commonly used in many necromantic spells and rituals.

items.name: Horse Hoof (x4)
items.description: A horse's hooves contains a collagen that is used to make a sticky adhesive. The glue is used by all kinds of craftsmen. The hooves can also be used to make tools (bowls, small shovels) and decorations.

Wasp, Giant.name: Wasp, Giant
Wasp, Giant.description: This giant insect looks like a cross between a bee and an ant. It has a slender, smooth body and six legs with relatively few hairs. Its segmented body has a large bulbous abdomen with a huge stinger at the end. It has two thin, translucent round wings on its back. Its insect head has two large black compound eyes, and a mouth with two large mandibles and three pairs of oral appendages. The insect is under 4 feet longs although, some can be as big as 6 feet

items.name: Giant Wasp Wing (x2)
items.description: A giant wasp has two long, gossamer wings. The translucent material is thin enough to act as a filter for certain alchemical processes.

items.name: Giant Wasp Stinger
items.description:
The giant wasp has a long stinger in its abdomen that contains a potent poison. A skilled harvester can attempt to remove the stinger intact.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this stinger. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's stinger that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Stinger Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the stinger. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the stinger is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend  12 hours and 100gp worth of material to create Stinger Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Stinger Poison (Injury): Stinger Poison is similar to Serpent Venom (DMG p258). The poison can coat up to 3 pieces of ammunition or 1 melee weapon for 1 minute. Applying the poison takes 1 action. Any creature successfully hit must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking [[/r 3d6]] poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Wastrilith.name: Wastrilith
Wastrilith.description: Wastriliths are 10-foot long creatures resembling segmented eels with a powerful tail attached to their humanoid upper body.

items.name: Wastrilith Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A wastrilith's has a mouth full of steel-like shark teeth. The teeth can be fashioned into crafts, jewelry and small tools.

items.name: Wastrilith Fins
items.description: A wastrilith's eel-like body is flowing with several long, silk-like fins that help the creature move through water. These fins can be treated by leatherworkers and weavers to produce a unique waterproof fabric.

items.name: Wastrilith Gills
items.description: The wastrilith's gills help the creature breath in watery environments. The gills are a powerful filter and is prize by anyone that makes potions, and is often used in potions of water breathing.

items.name: Wastrilith Pearl
items.description: At times, small objects get caught in a wastrilith's digestive system. Over time, the wastrilith's natural enzymes coat the item, which hardens. This process happens over-and-over again, layer-after-layer. In rare cases, a shiny white pearl forms. The pearl can be found lodged inside the creature's stomach.

Water Elemental.name: Water Elemental
Water Elemental.description: The creature resembles a crest of water, sometimes taking a vaguely humanoid form.

items.name: Elemental Water Essence (vial)
items.description:
When a water elemental disperses, the water it leaves behind can contain traces amounts of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the water elemental disperses in a body of water larger than 10 feet in diameter.

Water Elemental Myrmidon.name: Water Elemental Myrmidon
Water Elemental Myrmidon.description: A water elemental, composed of clear-blue water, bound by magic into a ritually created suit of plate armor.

items.name: Elemental Water Essence (vial)
items.description:
When a water elemental myrmidon disperses, the water it leaves behind can contain traces amounts of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the water elemental disperses in a body of water larger than 10 feet in diameter.

items.name: Myymidon Armor Plates
items.description: The magical armor that binds the elemental Mymidon may be salvageable and retain some of its arcane power. These magically infused plates can sold to blacksmiths for the soft glowing metal. Alternatively, spellcasters, especially conjurers and elemental wizards, seek the plates for the residual binding magic.

Water Weird.name: Water Weird
Water Weird.description: A translucent, serpentine column of water rising from a pool. It map appear to have a vague snake-like head, or even have a loose humanoid form.

items.name: Water Weird Fluid (vial)
items.description:
When a water weird disperses, it loses its form and gravity pulls the water downward. It may be possible to collect some of this water, which alchemists can use to lower the viscosity of certain substances.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the water weird disperses into a pool of water over 10 ft in diameter.

Use: If a character has proficiency with alchemy supplies or a poisoner kit, they can make a DC 15 check to use the vial of water weird fluid to create a second vial of poison from one they have (while retaining the poison's potency). On a successful roll, the vial of water weird fluid is used to create two vials of poison, from a single vial. Failure ruins both the poison and the water weird fluid, making both useless. The water weird fluid is completely used up in this process.

items.name: Elemental Water Essence (vial)
items.description:
When a water weird disperses, the water it leaves behind can contain traces amounts of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container. Requires an enchanted vial.

Harvesting note: 20 DC if the water elemental disperses in a body of water larger than 10 feet in diameter.

Weasel.name: Weasel
Weasel.description: The small animal has a slim, elongated body with a small, flattish, triangular head. It has small rounded ears, dark beady eyes and a pointy snout with long whiskers. Its back is brown or gray, black with a white chin and belly.

items.name: Weasel Pelt
items.description: Weasel fur, sometimes called ermine fur, is a thin strip of fur. It can be used as trim on parkas and on other clothing. It can also be used on scabbards and small pouches.

Weasel, Giant.name: Weasel, Giant
Weasel, Giant.description: The large animal has a slim, elongated body with a small, flattish, triangular head. It has small rounded ears, dark beady eyes and a pointy snout with long whiskers. Its back is brown or gray, black with a white chin and belly. Its long body can stretch out to about 7 feet long.

items.name: Giant Weasel Pelt
items.description: A giant weasel's pelt is a good amount of fur. The fur can be used to create leather armor, apparel and bags or sacks.

Were Bat.name: Were Bat
Were Bat.description: A werebat is a humanoid afflicted with a rare form of lycanthropy that enables it to transform into a giant bat or a bat-humanoid hybrid.

items.name: Lycanthrope Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The cursed blood is red, dark, and flows easily. Even after death, the blood retains the ability to pass on the curse of lycanthropy to others. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in many transmutation potions. Some claim that the blood is an ingredient to remove the curse.

Werebear.name: Werebear
Werebear.description: A large, muscular, human-bear hybrid covered in fur. It has a long snout and two round ears on the top of its head.

items.name: Lycanthrope Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The cursed blood is red, dark, and flows easily. Even after death, the blood retains the ability to pass on the curse of lycanthropy to others. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in many transmutation potions. Some claim that the blood is an ingredient to remove the curse.

Wereboar.name: Wereboar
Wereboar.description: A stocky, muscular, human-boar hybrid with short, stiff hair and two tusks protruding from its mouth.

items.name: Lycanthrope Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The cursed blood is red, dark, and flows easily. Even after death, the blood retains the ability to pass on the curse of lycanthropy to others. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in many transmutation potions. Some claim that the blood is an ingredient to remove the curse.

Wererat.name: Wererat
Wererat.description: A wiry, twitchy human-rat hybrid with thin hair and darting eyes. It has short gray hair, a triangular pointed snout, long whiskers and two large buck teeth protruding from it's upper lip.

items.name: Lycanthrope Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The cursed blood is red, dark, and flows easily. Even after death, the blood retains the ability to pass on the curse of lycanthropy to others. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in many transmutation potions. Some claim that the blood is an ingredient to remove the curse.

Weretiger.name: Weretiger
Weretiger.description: A lithe, sleek, muscular human-tiger hybrid. The humanoid walks on its hind legs, has long arms ending in clawed hands, and a tiger's head. It has yellow-orange fur with white on its belly. A long tail extends from its backside.

items.name: Lycanthrope Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The cursed blood is red, dark, and flows easily. Even after death, the blood retains the ability to pass on the curse of lycanthropy to others. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in many transmutation potions. Some claim that the blood is an ingredient to remove the curse.

Werewolf.name: Werewolf
Werewolf.description: The human-wolf hybrid has a well-muscled humanoid body covered in fur and topped by a ravenous wolf's head.

items.name: Lycanthrope Blood (3 vials)
items.description: The cursed blood is red, dark, and flows easily. Even after death, the blood retains the ability to pass on the curse of lycanthropy to others. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in many transmutation potions. Some claim that the blood is an ingredient to remove the curse.

White Abishai.name: White Abishai
White Abishai.description: Draconic humanoids, with scaled white skin, large wings on their back and a long tail.

items.name: White Abishai Scales
items.description: The scales of an abishai are tough and immediately become brittle once the creature dies. As such, each scale must be carefully extracted one-by-one, and then treated with special oils in order to strengthen them again. The scales are highly decorative, and often used in jewelry. Smiths prize the scales for use in scale armor (the scales from 4 abishai are required to create a single set of scale mail).

items.name: White Abishai Wing (x2)
items.description: The wings of an abishai produce a durable scaly leather. Once the creature is killed, the wings can rip easily, and must be removed with care. The leather can be used in tents, backpacks, clothing and other items.

Wight.name: Wight
Wight.description: A humanoid figure typically a human, elf, dwarf with pale, mummified flesh covering a twisted skeleton. It has white glowing eyes, hands ending in deadly claws, and needle-like jagged teeth.

items.name: Wight Blood (3 vials)
items.description: A wight's blood is a viscous black fluid. The blood has motes of necrotic energy, which can be harnessed by adept spellcasters.

items.name: Wight Nails (pouch)
items.description: The hard yellowed nails of a wight channel the creature's life draining ability. The nails can used by necromancers in dark rituals, or repurposed by alchemists to create rejuvenation potions.

Will-o'-Wisp.name: Will-o'-Wisp
Will-o'-Wisp.description: A hazy ball of yellow light other colors: white, blue, violet, green, yellow, glowing as brightly as a flaming torch.

items.name: Will-o'-Wisp Essence
items.description: When a will-o'-wisp disperses, the ball of light spreads out into a glowing mist that quickly fades. A skilled harvester can perform a simple ritual to attempt to reform the necrotic energy into a small ball of power that can be collected. Requires an enchanted vial.

Winged Kobold.name: Winged Kobold
Winged Kobold.description: A reptilian humanoid standing under 3 feet tall with reddish brown scaled skin and burnt orange eyes kobolds were also known to have black skin. Its two legs are sinewy and digitigrade (walking on its long toes and not touching the ground with its heels, like a dog or cat). It has long, clawed fingers and a jaw like a crocodile.

items.name: Kobold's Tail
items.description: A kobold's tail has little value, but it can be used to collect any bounties on the creatures.

items.name: Kobold Wing (x2)
items.description: Kobold wings have a thin but durable skin, which can be useful to many leatherworkers. They are often used to make small pieces of apparel and accessories.

Winter Eladrin.name: Winter Eladrin
Winter Eladrin.description: Eladrin are a subrace of elves who adopted the Feywild as their home. After centuries of exposure to Feywild magic, they acquired supernatural abilities and were effectively transformed into fey. Winter Eladrin have blue-hued skin, with blue-white hair. Their pointy ears are slightly longer than their Prime Material kin.

items.name: Winter Eladrin Hair
items.description: The hair of a winter eladrin is white-blue, silky, and smells like fresh spring water. The hair retains magic from the Feywild, and is often used is potions and elixirs. The hair can also be used as decorations and trinkets.

items.name: Eladrin Ear (x2)
items.description: Eladrin ears are similar to elven ears, but slightly longer. Most people considering killing an eladrin an evil act, and are suspicious of those selling such items. However, some evil communities, or those having trouble with Eladrin (such as lumbermills), may pay a bounty for such ears.

Wolf.name: Wolf
Wolf.description: A canine with a thick, gray fur and a bushy tail. It has a high body, long legs, and a broad skull tapering to a narrow muzzle. It has a mouth full of sharp teeth and hungry looking eyes.

items.name: Wolf Pelt
items.description: A wolf has a hairy hide that can be used to make apparel, bedding and other items.

Wolf, Winter.name: Wolf, Winter
Wolf, Winter.description: A large canine about 8 feet long, standing over 4 feet tall at its shoulder. It has thick, white fur and a bushy tail. It has a high body, long legs, and a broad skull tapering to a narrow muzzle. It has a mouth full of sharp teeth and hungry looking silver-blue eyes.

items.name: Winter Wolf Pelt
items.description: The pelt of the winter wolf is a hide of thick white fur. The pelt can be treated and turned into all kinds of apparel and bedding.

Wood Woad.name: Wood Woad
Wood Woad.description: A plant-like humanoid with tough bark skin, branches for arms, gnarled wood hands, and stump-like tree legs. It bearing a crude wooded club and shield of twisted wood.

items.name: Wood Woad Lichen (pouch)
items.description: The lichen on a wood woad is a crusty green, plant-like substance that grows on its bark. The lichen has a great deal of regenerative properties which are valued by healers and medical experts. It can be difficult to harvest, as it flakes off easily and immediately loses its healing power.

items.name: Wood Woad Bark
items.description: A wood woad's bark resembles the bark of an oak tree, but writhes with an ancient arcane energy. The bark is as strong as iron, and can be crafted into armor.

items.name: Wood Woad Seed
items.description:
A wood woad's seed resembles an acorn, but slightly smaller. The seed does not grow another wood woad (as is commonly believed), but is swimming with magical potential. The seeds are sought after by druids, healers and elven societies.

Use: If this seed is planted within a forested area, and cultivated for the next year, it will become a fully grown tree. It will resemble the other trees in the area, but much larger. This magical tree acts as a protector of the surrounding forest. If a creature attempts to harm any tree within 1 mile of this magical protector, they must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or find themselves unable to willingly harm any vegetation for the next 24 hours. During this time, vegetation that grows within a mile of the magical tree becomes noticeably stronger and grows at twice its normal rate.

Worg.name: Worg
Worg.description: The creature looks like an large wolf, bearing an intelligent, wicked gleam in its eyes. It has gray-black fur, sharp teeth and its mouth drips hungrily with saliva. It stands around 3 feet high and is about 5 feet long.

items.name: Worg Pelt
items.description: The pelt of a worg is a hide of thick, dirty gray fur. The pelt can be treated and turned into all kinds of apparel and bedding.

Wraith.name: Wraith
Wraith.description: The creature is an incorporeal form and appears as a swirling dark mist of negative energy, with a vague skeletal human form that has wispy claw-like hands.

items.name: Wraith Dust
items.description: When a wraith is killed, its form disperses into a fine mist, often scattering tiny motes of dust. The dust is difficult to see, but resonates with dark necrotic energy. Spellcasters, especially necromancers, can use the dust in spells and rituals. The dust is also a useful alchemical ingredient.

Wretched Sorrowsworn.name: Wretched Sorrowsworn
Wretched Sorrowsworn.description: These sorrowsworn are small, squat two-legged creatures, with no arms. They have a short torso, no neck and a head with two round eyes on the side, and a maw full of lamprey-like teeth.

items.name: Sorrowsworn Saliva (vial)
items.description: The saliva of sorrowsworn is a thick, sticky, transparent fluid. The saliva is believed to be an ingredient in elixirs that treat depression. It is also studied by anyone interested in the Shadowfell.

Wyvern.name: Wyvern
Wyvern.description: This creature resembles a dragon, except is only has a pair of hind legs instead of a set of four. It is covered in dark brown scales sometimes gray, has red-orange eyes and a jaw filled with long and sharp teeth. It has a long tail with a stinger at the end, similar to a scorpion. The creature is about 20 feet long average: 15-35 feet with a 50 foot wingspan.

items.name: Wyvern Claws/Teeth (pouch)
items.description: A wyvern has sharp, dark, bone-like claws, and pointy, triangular teeth. Both are valued hunting trophies, often used to make jewelry and decorations. Alchemists can grind the items down to make a fine powder, useful in some potions.

items.name: Wyvern Skin
items.description: The tough reptilian skin of a wyvern is covered in pointy scales. The hide is valued among armorsmiths, but can be used in cloaks and other apparel.

items.name: Wyvern Stinger
items.description:
A wyvern has a long tail with a poisonous stinger on the end. The poison is difficult to remove, and the poison is extremely potent.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this stinger. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's stinger that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Stinger Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the stinger. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the creature's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the stinger is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend  6 days and 600gp worth of material to create Wyvern Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Wyvern Poison (Injury): A vial of Wyvern Poison (DMG p258) can coat up to 3 pieces of ammunition or 1 melee weapon for 1 minute. Applying the poison takes 1 action. Any creature successfully hit must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ([[/r 7d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 1,200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Xorn.name: Xorn
Xorn.description: The creature has a radially symmetrical body with a large mouth at the top surrounded by three long arms interspersed with its three eyes. Its wide, pebbly, and rocky body rests upon three stumpy legs. It has talons at the end of its arms Xorns range from 3-5 feet tall.

items.name: Xorn Tooth (pouch)
items.description: Since a xorn has a diet of gemstones and precious metals, it's teeth are capable of slicing through stone with ease. Expert blacksmiths can create superb tools with these teeth. Adept weaponsmiths can use the teeth to create deadly serrated weapons.

items.name: Xorn Stomach Acid (3 vials)
items.description:
The stomach acid of a xorn is highly corrosive, allowing the creature to digest precious gems and hard metals. The acid is useful to many craftsmen and alchemists. Failing the harvesting check by 5 or more results in the harvester getting burned by the acid, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) acid damage.

Use: A xorn's stomach acid is the equivalent of a vial of acid (PHB). As an action, a creature can splash the contents of this vial onto a target within 5 feet or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, the creature makes a ranged attack against a target or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes [[/r 2d6]] acid damage.

items.name: Xorn Skin
items.description: A xorn's skin is a hard-leathery hide, with rocks protruding all about the surface. The rock-like hide provides the creature with ample protection, but is also flowing with elemental energy. The rocks appear to meld into the ground and shifts color to match the surrounding rock. Armorers may be able to craft a set of heavy armor from the hide, which may take enchantments fairly easily.

items.name: Xorn Olfactory Bulb (vial)
items.description: Xorns are capable of pinpointing, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones. This "treasure sense" is tied to the creature's olfactory bulb, a tiny flesh-like ball located in the center of the brain. Spellcasters may be able to use magic to tap into this item's unique ability.

Xvart.name: Xvart
Xvart.description: A small, 3-foot tall humanoid with blue skin, a tall head with a dark receding hairline (taking up about a third of it's height), long gangly arms and short stumpy legs. It has beady, vivid orange eyes, a flat bulbous nose and dark lips.

items.name: Xvart Hair (pouch)
items.description: An xvart has a receding hairline of dark, greasy hair. As xvarts are all spawned by the greedy demigod Raxivort, every strand has a touch of his dark energy. Spellcasters, artificers and some alchemists can make use of the hair.

Xvart Warlock of Raxivort.name: Xvart Warlock of Raxivort
Xvart Warlock of Raxivort.description: A small, 3-foot tall humanoid with blue skin, a tall head with a dark receding hairline (taking up about a third of it's height), long gangly arms and short stumpy legs. It has beady, vivid orange eyes, a flat bulbous nose and dark lips.

items.name: Xvart Hair (pouch)
items.description: An xvart has a receding hairline of dark, greasy hair. As xvarts are all spawned by the greedy demigod Raxivort, every strand has a touch of his dark energy. Spellcasters, artificers and some alchemists can make use of the hair.

items.name: Mark of Raxivort (vial)
items.description: The demigod Raxivort imbues worthy xvarts with magical abilities, and each is given a splotchy dark blue birthmark of a blue hand. The birthmark is hard to find, as all xvarts have dark blue splotches all over their blue skin. The mark can scrapped off, similar to removing a mole, and placed in a vial. The mark has several alchemical uses, but spellcasters may be able to tap into the demigod's power.

Yagnoloth.name: Yagnoloth
Yagnoloth.description: Yagnoloths have a large, muscular humanoid frame, covered in red scales. It has a small head with sunken eyes and large ears that look like the wings of a bat. They have a monstrously sized left arm, better fit for a giant than a creature of their size. Their other arm seems puny and weak in comparison but is just as powerful as that of a regular human. Many times, they wear a cape to cover either one of their limbs

items.name: Yugoloth Ichor (vial)
items.description:
A yugoloth that dies on the prime material plane melts into a black bubbling ichor, that quickly dissolves if it is not harvested quickly. The ichor can be used in summoning rituals, but can also be turned into ink with alchemist supplies.

Use: A wizard can use the ink, with other ingredients, to copy a spell scroll into their spell book. Using this ink allows for the spell to be copied twice as fast, at half the cost. Note: 5% a vial is used to copy 1 spell level (so, an 8th level scroll would use 40% of an ink bottle).

items.name: Yagnoloth Claws (pouch)
items.description: The claws of a yagnoloth are highly conductible and capable of delivering an electrified touch. The claws can be used by artificers as an electrical conductor, but can also be shaved-down into a powder to create a concoction that can deliver an electrical explosion.

items.name: Yagnoloth Humerus Bone
items.description: A yagnoloth has one massive, oversized arm. The humerus bone of this arm is a long, thick slab of steel-hard bone. Master weaponsmiths can carved the bone into a variety of weapons.

items.name: Yugoloth Heart
items.description: A Yugoloth's heart is a red ball of flesh strewn with dark veins. The heart has strong ties to the yogoloth's home plane of Gehenna, and is valued among summoners and anyone that studies the Outer Planes. The heart is rumored to have the ability to teleport creatures to Gehenna.

Yeenoghu.name: Yeenoghu
Yeenoghu.description: The Beast of Butchery appears as a great scarred gnoll, towering 14 feet tall. The Gnoll Lord is covered in matted fur and leathery hide, and his face resembles a grinning predator's skull. He wields a tripple headed flail called the Butcher, which he can summon into his hand at will.

items.name: Yeenoghu Saliva (9 vials)
items.description:
The sticky, yellow saliva of Yeenoghu is believed to cause disease, making creatures go rabid and mad. The saliva also causes corrosive damage, and can eat through steel.

Use: A creature can use an action to pour 1 vial of this corrosive saliva onto 3 pieces of magical ammunition or 1 magical melee weapon (the weapon must be magical to withstand the acid). The saliva lasts for 1 minute, or until a creature is exposed to the acid. Any creature successfully hit suffers an additional [[/r 2d10]] acid damage.

items.name: Yeenoghu Teeth (sack)
items.description:
Harvesting this item results in [[/r 1d10]]+4 teeth. The sharp teeth of Yeenoghu are as strong as steel. The teeth are dull-yellow bone, with redish stains. The strong bone can be used in decorations and jewelry.

Use: While holding one of Yeenoghu's teeth, you can use an action to cast Conjure Animals, with the following restrictions: you can only conjure 2 giant hyenas. The tooth is consumed when the spell is cast.

items.name: Yeenoghu Canine (x2)
items.description: Yeenoghu has two long and sharp canines. The canines are pointy, dull-yellow bone, with redish stains. The strong bone can be used in decorations and jewelry. These large teeth can also be used to craft small piercing weapons. Alternatively, Yeenoghu's canine is a require material to create a powerful magic item, the Fang of Yeenoghu.

items.name: Yeenoghu Hide
items.description: The hide of Yeenoghu is a tough leather covered in matted fur, and dried blood. The hide is difficult to harvest, but can be used to make a variety of leather armor.

items.name: Yeenoghu Amygdala
items.description: The amygdala is a dark red, almond–shaped piece of spongy flesh in the Yeenoghu's brain, that is associated with rage and anger. Finding the amygdala in Yeenoghu's skull may be difficult, and it often ruptures when separated from the rest of the brain. Alchemists and spellcasters value this item. The amygdala can also be used to craft a powerful magic item, the Fang of Yeenoghu.

Yeth Hound.name: Yeth Hound
Yeth Hound.description: The creature resembles a large dog, standing under 5-feet tall. It has short, dull, non-reflective black fur, and appears to blending into the darkness. It has fearsome, glowing, cherry-red eyes and smells of chilled smoke. It possesses an oddly human-like visage, with a protruding nose in place of a muzzle and a more flexible neck than other canines. Its ears are short and pointed, curving upward and away from the rest of the head in such a way that they resembled horns.

items.name: Yeth Hound Hide
items.description: A yeth hound has a coat of short, dull, nonreflective black fur. The hide can be harvested for its leather, but also has an arcane connection to the fey that created it. Spellcaster and artificers may be able to tap into the hide's power.

items.name: Yeth Hound Teeth (large pouch)
items.description: A yeth hound has a mouth full of large, sharp, canine teeth. The teeth are fused with arcane energy, giving them a psychically charged bite.
