The teeth can be used to make small weapons, like punching daggers, and simple tools. They can also line blades and be used as decorations.

items.name: Yeth Hound Pineal Gland
items.description:
A yeth hound's pineal gland is the source of their telepathic power, connecting them to their pack and their master. The pineal gland is useful to spellcasters and anyone studying telepathy. 

Use: A spellcaster can spend an uninterrupted hour and use the pineal gland to perform an arcane ritual. Upon completion, the caster will know the exact direction and approximate location of something the yeth beast has a connection to (typically the beast's current master, or pack leader, whichever is more dominant). The caster will not know any details about this source of power. Once the ritual is complete, the spellcaster will not know if this source moves, unless they perform the ritual again. For example, the spellcaster may learn the following: "the yeth hound has a strong connection to something about a mile and a half to the northeast."

Yeti.name: Yeti
Yeti.description: The creature resembles a large upright polar bear, with a dark ape-like face and a mouth full of sharp teeth. It has monstrous, dark leathery, clawed hands and a pair of wavy gray horns stretching out from its forehead. Two triangular, fur-covered ears stick out on the side of its face.

items.name: Yeti Hide
items.description: The thick hide of a yeti is covered in a heavy coat of white fur. The fur provide exceptional warmth and makes fantastic cold weather gear.

items.name: Yeti Horn (x2)
items.description: A yeti has two pointy, curved, dark blue horns that extend backward from the sides of its forehead, just above its ears. The horns always seem to be cold, even after they are removed from the yeti. Some weaponssmiths can carve the horns into curved daggers. Others value the item because they make ideal drinking horns in warmer climates, keeping liquid contents at a cool temperature.

items.name: Yeti Eye (x2)
items.description: A yeti's eyeball is a soft white orb with a light, vivid blue iris. It has the power to focus the surrounding air into a frigid surge of arcane energy. If an eyeball is harvested intact, an adept spellcaster or alchemist may be able to harness that energy into something useful.

items.name: Yeti Claws (pouch)
items.description: A yeti's dark blue claws are frigid to the touch, and fused with an arcane energy. The claws can be harvested and used by artificers that may be able to capture this energy and repurpose it toward enchantments. Some upscale taverns carve the claws into small cubes, and use them to keep drinks cold.

Yeti, Abominable.name: Yeti, Abominable
Yeti, Abominable.description: An enormous beast, standing over 20 feet tall. It resembles an upright polar bear, with a dark ape-like face and a mouth full of sharp teeth. It has monstrous, dark leathery, clawed hands and a pair of wavy gray horns stretching out from its forehead. Two triangular, fur-covered ears stick out on the side of its face.

items.name: Abominable Yeti Hide
items.description: The thick hide of an abominable yeti is covered in a heavy coat of white fur. The fur provide exceptional warmth and makes fantastic cold weather gear.

items.name: Abominable Yeti Horn (x2)
items.description: An abominable yeti has two pointy, curved, dark blue horns that extend backward from the sides of its forehead, just above its ears. The horns always seem to be cold, even after they are removed from the yeti. Some weaponsmiths can carve the horns into curved swords. Others value the item because they can be fashioned into small kegs that keep liquids cool.

items.name: Abominable Yeti Eye (x2)
items.description: A abominable yeti's eyeball is a soft white orb with a light, vivid blue iris. It has the power to focus the surrounding air into a frigid surge of arcane energy. If an eyeball is harvested intact, an adept spellcaster or alchemist may be able to harness that energy into something useful.

items.name: Abominable Yeti Claws (pouch)
items.description: A yeti's dark blue claws are frigid to the touch, and fused with an arcane energy. The claws can be harvested and used by artificers that may be able to capture this energy and repurpose it toward enchantments. Some upscale taverns carve the claws into small cubes, and use them to keep drinks cold.

items.name: Abominable Yeti Lung (x2)
items.description: An abominable yeti's lungs are two large, air-filled sacs of light-pink tissue. Each sac is under 3 feet long and a foot wide, but only around 3 to 6 inches deep. The sacs can be enchanted to line containers that will keep meat and harvestable material cool.

Yochlol.name: Yochlol
Yochlol.description: Ooze natural form: The creature is 6‒7 feet tall and weighs about 250 lbs. Its yellow, oozy, bodies seems to be constantly melting and piling back up like a living candle. The creature constantly emits a foul stench. It is visually akin to ropers, with eight writhing, powerful tentacles and a pillar-like main body with a single, sinister, scarlet eye in the middle.

items.name: Demon Pearl
items.description: Certain items eaten by a Yochlol never get fully digested. They sit in the Yochlol's stomach where they gather layer-after-layer of enzymes and ooze. The layers harden and smooth over time, resulting in a rough yellowish pearl with a red sheen.

items.name: Yochlol Ooze (vial)
items.description:
A yochlol's yellowish ooze is a vile, poisonous substance. The ooze can be harvested and turned into Yochlol Poison.

Proficiency with the poisoner kit may be used for harvesting this ooze. On a successful check, the character harvests the creature's ooze that must be refined before producing 1 dose of Yochlol Poison (see below). On a failed check, the character is unable to extract the ooze. If the character fails the check by 5 or more, the character is subjected to the ooze's poison.

Refining the Poison: Once the ooze is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend an 2 days and 400gp worth of material to create Yochlol Poison (DC 17 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Yochlol Poison: A creature successfully hit with Yochlol Poison must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking [[/r 6d6]] poison damage on a failed save, or half that on a successful saving throw. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying, or until a target is successfully hit. This poison usually sells for 1,000gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Raw Dragon Meat
items.description:
Dragon meat is a delicacy and is considered one of the finest meats you can eat. The meat spoils fast, but gourmet chefs will pay dearly for the meat.

Dragon Jerky: If the meat is dried and smoked, a young dragon can yield about [[/r 2d6]] days worth of dragon jerky. Dragon jerky is extremely filling, and a days worth weighs only a quarter of a regular ration (0.5 lbs.). It costs 2gp per ration.

items.name: Young Dragon Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Dragon blood is a valued commodity, used by spellcasters, alchemists and others. It can be used as a spell reagent and an ingredient for potions.

items.name: Young Dragon Tooth (10x)
items.description: A young dragon's tooth is just under a foot long. They are long, conical and have a serrated edge. A dragon's tooth has a degree of elemental protection, after constant exposure to the dragon's breath. The tooth can be used to make small weapons, crafts and are prized trophies.

items.name: Young Dragon Bone (x6)
items.description: Dragon bones are infused with arcane and elemental magic, and tend to get harder as the dragon ages. Armorers and weaponsmiths that know how to work dragon bone tend to be masters of their craft.

items.name: Young Type Dragon Horn
items.description:
Harvested from: Black, Blue, Red, Bronze, Copper, and Gold Dragons

Depending on the type of dragon, a horn or a prominent protrusion may adorn their head. These horns often retain a piece of the dragon's power, and make wonderful conduits for arcane magic. The horns make great trophies and can be crafted into various instruments and items, which tend to absorb magic enchantments fairly easily. Magic users create staves using the horns, as they make a perfect arcane focus.

items.name: Young Type Dragon Scales
items.description: A young dragon's scales are hard, yet malleable. Compared to an adult dragon's scales, there are easier to manipulate by an expert armorer.

items.name: Young Type Dragon Breath Pouch
items.description:
The dragon's breath weapon is caused by two glands secreting a mix of chemicals together as the dragon exhales. The two glands are wrapped together in a thin membrane or pouch, which can be harvested if careful. Alchemists prize the membrane for the unique mix of chemicals it contains. Magic users prize it for the magic it holds. Artificers prize it for what they can make from it.

Use: The membrane may be thrown up to 20 feet and the pouch explodes upon impact. Any creature within 15 feet of impact must roll a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or suffer 16 ([[/r 4d8]]) damage (damage type depends on the dragon the membrane was harvested from).

items.name: Young Type Dragon Wing (x2)
items.description: The wings of a young dragon are prized for their leather, which still retains some of the dragon's magical essence.

Young Kruthik.name: Young Kruthik
Young Kruthik.description: The kruthik vaguely resembles a repilian canine, with insect-like features. Its body is covered in plates of thick, purple chitin, with bristles of thick hair growing in patches. It has six limbs composed of bone, chitin, and steely scales; all ending in long scythes that can hew through stone. Its reptilian head has two black beady eyes and a large mouth filled with sharp teeth, and flanked by serrated mandibles.

items.name: Kruthik Blood (vial)
items.description: Kruthik blood is a warm, red fluid. Alchemists and healers can use the blood in potions and elixirs.

Young Remorhaz.name: Young Remorhaz
Young Remorhaz.description: A large beast resembling a cross between a worm and a centipede. It has tough, leathery wings fanning off the side of its body, an insect-like head with razor sharp teeth, and a 25-foot long scaly body with dozens of legs. It is ice-blue in color, but its back glows red with an inner fire that radiates extreme heat. Sharp horns run along its back, glowing red hot.

items.name: Remorhaz Blood (5 vials)
items.description: A remorhaz has blood that burns as hot as lava, and flows just as thick. The blood must be harvested before it cools. The blood in often used in potions that protect against the elements.

items.name: Young Remorhaz Chitin Plates
items.description: A young remorhaz has a segmented exoskeleton of large chitinous plates. The chitin can be cut, treated and repurposed as armor or shields.

items.name: Young Remorhaz Heart
items.description: A young remorhaz's heart is a hot ball of hard, course flesh, and looks like a burning coal. The heart continues to burn several weeks after the young remorhaz is killed (not as long as an adult remorhaz). Arctic communities prize the heart for the heat it generates. Artificers value the heart for the power they can harness.

Young Sea Serpent.name: Young Sea Serpent
Young Sea Serpent.description: Sea serpents are characterized by long serpentine bodies with strong, webbed fins that propel them through water at an impressive speed.

items.name: Sea Serpent Blood (7 vials)
items.description: A sea serpent's blood is reddish-purple, and smells like salt water. The blood has some alchemical properties, but is often used to flavor certain seafood dishes.

items.name: Young Sea Serpent Scales (sack)
items.description: A young sea serpent's scales are thin and flexible, with a slightly metallic shine. The scales can be used to make armor, apparel and jewelry.

items.name: Young Sea Serpent Teeth (sack)
items.description: A sea serpent has rows of sharp, shark-like teeth. The teeth can be used to make jewelry, but also make good arrowheads. A sack of young sea serpent teeth contains [[/r 1d20]]+20 teeth.

items.name: Sea Serpent Fins (x6)
items.description: The fins of a young sea serpent have a variety of uses. Expert leatherworkers can create waterproof tarps, sails and clothing from the large fins. The fins are also used as an ingredient in various dishes, especially in oceanside villages and sea communities. The fins are also coated in a waxy substance that alchemists can use in potions and elixirs.

items.name: Sea Serpent Blubber (x4)
items.description: Similar to whales, sea serpent blubber has value. The blubber requires cutting out long strips of fat from the creature's belly. Failure occurs when the strips are cut too thin, or the fat is spoiled by hitting a major artery or organ. Sea serpent blubber is primarily used to make oil and soap by boiling the fat for several hours. Alchemists and healers often use the fat in various concoctions as well.

Yuan-Ti Abomination.name: Yuan-Ti Abomination
Yuan-Ti Abomination.description: The creature has an almost completely serpentine form, with a snake's head leading into a pair of broad shoulders with two muscular humanoid arms, and a torso flowing down into a serpent's long tail.

items.name: Yuan-ti Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Yuan-ti's were originally created through foul sorcery and ritualist sacrifice, and that dark magic runs thick in their blood. The blood is used by spellcasters specializing in transmutation and alchemists creating polymorph potions.

items.name: Yuan-ti Venom (vial)
items.description:
The vemon of yuan-ti are all the same, but some are able to inject more of their poison than others, causing more damage. When the poison is extracted, it quickly loses its potency, but can be refined to last longer. 

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 100gp worth of material to create Yuan-ti Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Yuan-ti Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Yuan-ti Abomination Skin
items.description: A yuan-ti abomination has a long snake-like tail which can yield large scaly skin. The skin is valued by leatherworkers because of its size.

items.name: Yuan-ti Abomination Heart
items.description: The heart of a yuan-ti is imbued with a dark arcane power, and the center of the creature's innate magical abilities. Sorcerers, summoners and other spellcasters can use to the heart to enchant and enhance abilities.

Yuan-Ti Anathema.name: Yuan-Ti Anathema
Yuan-Ti Anathema.description: The creature looks like a multi-headed snake with two arms. The creature has six giant snake heads that converge into a pair of broad shoulders with two muscular humanoid arms, and a torso flowing down into a serpent's long tail. The fingers on the creature's hand have monstrously long claws.

items.name: Yuan-ti Blood (7 vials)
items.description: Yuan-ti's were originally created through foul sorcery and ritualist sacrifice, and that dark magic runs thick in their blood. The blood is used by spellcasters specializing in transmutation and alchemists creating polymorph potions.

items.name: Yuan-ti Venom (3 vials)
items.description:
The vemon of yuan-ti are all the same, but some are able to inject more of their poison than others, causing more damage. When the poison is extracted, it quickly loses its potency, but can be refined to last longer. 

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 100gp worth of material to create Yuan-ti Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Yuan-ti Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Yuan-ti Anathema Heart
items.description: An anathema's heart beats with a dark arcane energy, and is the source of its ophidiophobia aura. The heart is a red bulbous mass of flesh and veins, surging with invisible arcane energy. Sorcerers, transmutation specialist, and artificers have an interest in this creature's organ.

items.name: Anathema Spine
items.description: The long spine of an anathema is made of hundreds of vertebrae. Each vertebrae contains trace amounts of arcane power, making the entire spine a valuable commodity among spellcasters.

Yuan-Ti Broodguard.name: Yuan-Ti Broodguard
Yuan-Ti Broodguard.description: The creature is a scaly humanoid figure, that looks more reptilian than man. It has two digitigrade, scaly legs and long arms ending in sharp, black claws. The creature walks slightly hunched over, with a long neck and a snake-like head with a mouth full of sharp, fanged teeth. Its long forked tongue lashes out, again and again.

items.name: Yuan-ti Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Yuan-ti's were originally created through foul sorcery and ritualist sacrifice, and that dark magic runs thick in their blood. The blood is used by spellcasters specializing in transmutation and alchemists creating polymorph potions.

Yuan-Ti Malison.name: Yuan-Ti Malison
Yuan-Ti Malison.description: The creature has a muscular human's body with tan skin skin tone varies, but topped with a snake's scaly head.

items.name: Yuan-ti Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Yuan-ti's were originally created through foul sorcery and ritualist sacrifice, and that dark magic runs thick in their blood. The blood is used by spellcasters specializing in transmutation and alchemists creating polymorph potions.

items.name: Yuan-ti Venom (vial)
items.description:
The vemon of yuan-ti are all the same, but some are able to inject more of their poison than others, causing more damage. When the poison is extracted, it quickly loses its potency, but can be refined to last longer. 

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 100gp worth of material to create Yuan-ti Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Yuan-ti Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

Yuan-Ti Mind Whisperer.name: Yuan-Ti Mind Whisperer
Yuan-Ti Mind Whisperer.description: The creature has a muscular human's body with scaled skin, but topped with a cobra's winged head.

items.name: Yuan-ti Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Yuan-ti's were originally created through foul sorcery and ritualist sacrifice, and that dark magic runs thick in their blood. The blood is used by spellcasters specializing in transmutation and alchemists creating polymorph potions.

items.name: Yuan-ti Venom (vial)
items.description:
The vemon of yuan-ti are all the same, but some are able to inject more of their poison than others, causing more damage. When the poison is extracted, it quickly loses its potency, but can be refined to last longer. 

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 100gp worth of material to create Yuan-ti Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Yuan-ti Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Yuan-ti Mind Whisperer's Hood
items.description: The cobra-like hood of a yuan-ti mind whisperer enhances their innate magical abilities. The hood's skin must be harvested intact, or it loses its amplification power. Leatherworkers and craftsmen can create simple hoods and garments using the skin, which can then be enchanted by artificers and other spellcasters to enhance their own abilities.

Yuan-Ti Nightmare Speaker.name: Yuan-Ti Nightmare Speaker
Yuan-Ti Nightmare Speaker.description: The creature has the upper torso and head of a human female, but a snake's long body and tail from the waist down.

items.name: Yuan-ti Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Yuan-ti's were originally created through foul sorcery and ritualist sacrifice, and that dark magic runs thick in their blood. The blood is used by spellcasters specializing in transmutation and alchemists creating polymorph potions.

items.name: Yuan-ti Venom (vial)
items.description:
The vemon of yuan-ti are all the same, but some are able to inject more of their poison than others, causing more damage. When the poison is extracted, it quickly loses its potency, but can be refined to last longer. 

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 100gp worth of material to create Yuan-ti Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Yuan-ti Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Yuan-ti Nightmare Speaker Fang (x2)
items.description: The fangs of a yuan-ti are imbued by Dendar the Night Serpent with a necrotic energy. The fangs must be harvested carefully or they lose their connection with Dendar. The fangs resonate with arcane energy, which may be harnessed by artificers and spellcasters.

Yuan-Ti Pit Master.name: Yuan-Ti Pit Master
Yuan-Ti Pit Master.description: The creature has a human's head and body, but instead of arms, it has a collection of long, scaly, snake-like tendrils.

items.name: Yuan-ti Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Yuan-ti's were originally created through foul sorcery and ritualist sacrifice, and that dark magic runs thick in their blood. The blood is used by spellcasters specializing in transmutation and alchemists creating polymorph potions.

items.name: Yuan-ti Venom (vial)
items.description:
The vemon of yuan-ti are all the same, but some are able to inject more of their poison than others, causing more damage. When the poison is extracted, it quickly loses its potency, but can be refined to last longer. 

Refining the Poison: Once the venom is extracted, an alchemist (or someone proficient in the poisoner's kit) can spend 1 day and 100gp worth of material to create Yuan-ti Poison (DC 14 Poisoner Kit or Alchemist Supplies check).

Yuan-ti Poison (Injury): A creature can use an action to coat 1 melee weapon, or 3 pieces of ammunition with this poison. The poison lasts for 1 minute, or until the poison successfully affects a target. A creature successfully hit must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This poison usually sells for 200gp, but the poison is often considered an illicit good (and may not be sold to normal vendors).

items.name: Yuan-ti Pit Master Tendrils (sack)
items.description: A yuan-ti pit master has arms made of snake-like tendrils, the result of a pact with Merrshaulk. The skin and meat of these tendrils are useless, but the flesh does contain magical energy that can be harnessed by adept spellcasters and artificers.

Yuan-Ti Pureblood.name: Yuan-Ti Pureblood
Yuan-Ti Pureblood.description: This creature looks like a human. Upon closer inspection, it has scaly patched of skin, serpentine eyes, pointed teeth and a forked tongue.

items.name: Yuan-ti Blood (3 vials)
items.description: Yuan-ti's were originally created through foul sorcery and ritualist sacrifice, and that dark magic runs thick in their blood. The blood is used by spellcasters specializing in transmutation and alchemists creating polymorph potions.

Zaratan.name: Zaratan
Zaratan.description: Zaratan is a gargantuan, hulking, reptile, often described as a gigantic turtle with an mountain on its back. Zaratan's skin resembles stone, and is just as tough. The shell on its back is often covered in grass, trees and other greenery. The creature often floats in the ocean, and is often mistaken for an island.

items.name: Zaratan Elemental Essence (9 vials)
items.description: When zaratan is slain, the gargantuan creature breaks apart, crumbling to pieces, often causing a landslide of rock and earth. Some of this debris contains traces of elemental energy that can be harnessed using a magical container (if they can be found). Requires an enchanted vial.

items.name: Zaratan Rare Plants, Herbs and Fungi (3x sacks)
items.description: Zaratan's body, especially its shell, is covered in a variety of lush greenery, roots, herbs and fungi. Once the creature's large form crumbles, it may be difficult to find these items.

items.name: Zaratan Heart Gem
items.description: Somewhere inside zaratan's large body is an enormous, uncut, yellow tourmaline, the size of a basketball. The gem has a soft glow, and resonates with elemental energy. An expert jeweler can break the gem into [[/r 1d8]]+2 Elemental Gems. Alternatively, the large gem can be magically altered to create a Ring of Earth Elemental Command.

Zariel.name: Zariel
Zariel.description: Zariel is a fallen solar with scorched ashen skin and flame-blackened angelic wings. A halo of fire burns atop her bald head and her eyes glow with white-hot rage. One of her hands is replaced with a long, black iron flail.

items.name: Zariel Blood (5 vials)
items.description: Archdevil blood is difficult to obtain, and used in powerful spells and concoctions.

items.name: Zariel Feather
items.description:
Zariel's blacked angel wings are scorched and battered, and most of the feathers are fused together into a dark leathery mass. However, it may be possible to recover a charred feather. Archdevil parts fetch a high price, and often contain powerful magic.

Use: When this feather is held in one's hand, it acts as a Ring of Feather Falling.

items.name: Zariel Flail Head
items.description: The striking head of Zariel's flail was forged in flames of the Nine Hells, and is wreathed in arcane energy. If the flail is not too damages, the item may be recovered. A master smith, working with a powerful spellcaster, may be able to reforge the flail.

Zodar.name: Zodar
Zodar.description: A zodar is a bipedal entity whose body is encased in an obsidian exoskeleton. It has no facial features aside from two narrow, vertical slits that resemble eyes.

Zombie.name: Zombie
Zombie.description: A pale, emaciated figure with decaying gray skin. It shambles about on unsteady legs, as if not under its own control. It has milky white eyes that stare ahead blankly if it has eyes at all and its mouth hangs open.

items.name: Zombie Fluid
items.description: A zombie's saliva and blood are both a thick, black fluid that smells of rotting meat. The fluid is a disease-ridden substance that necromancers often use in dark rituals and spells. Alchemists may be able to repurpose the blood for use in certain potions.

Zuggtmoy.name: Zuggtmoy
Zuggtmoy.description: Zuggtmoy is utterly inhuman, but she can mold her fungoid form into an approximation of a bipedal shape, including the skeletal-thin female figure draped in mycelia and luchen — often depicted in grimoires and ancient art.

items.name: Zyggtmoy Fungus (sack)
items.description: Zyggtmoy is a creature made of, and covered in, various kinds of fungi. When the creature is destroyed, much of these fungi are left behind. Many adventurers would rather be safe and burn everything, but it is possible to harvest some of the rarer fungi to sell to healers and alchemists.

items.name: Zyggtmoy Infestation Puffball ([[/r 1d6]] balls)
items.description:
Among the many lichen and molds that cover Zuggtmoy are several spores. Some of these spore are extremely dangerous, causing disease and poison. Zuggtmoy's Infestation Puffballs are small, puffy red balls that contain a collection of spores. These spores are prized by horticulturists and mycologists.

Use: Using an action, you can throw one of these puffballs at a creature you can see within 30 feet. If the target is hit, the small ball explodes into a cloud of spores, and the target must make a DC 17 saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies.

items.name: Zyggtmoy Mind Control Puffball ([[/r 1d6]] balls)
items.description:
Zuggtmoy's Mind Control Puffballs are small, puffy green balls that contain a collection of spores. These spores are prized by horticulturists and mycologists.

Use: Using an action, you can throw one of these puffballs at a creature you can see within 30 feet. If the target is hit, the small ball explodes into a cloud of spores, and the target must make a DC 17 saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is under the effects of the charmed condition.

items.name: Zyggtmoy Yellow Puffball
items.description:
When Zuggtmoy is slain, there is a chance that it drops a soft, furry yellow ball, the size of a baseball. When placed on a surface for more than an hour, mold begins to form and spread out from the seed (this includes the interior of a backpack or other storage contain). The spore's purpose is unknown, and an identify spell will not reveal its true nature.

The puffball is capable of giving rise to another Zuggtmoy. Only a powerful wizard or master horticultors/mycologist will know what the puffball is. The puffball has 100 hitpoints, and has a damage threshold of 30 (An object with a damage threshold has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage from a single attack or effect equal to or greater than its damage threshold).

In d20 + 30 days, the puffball explodes, releasing a cloud of dust, that quickly disperses in the air. The dust contains millions of spores, one of which will give rise to another Zuggtmoy somewhere in the world.
